description: There arent too many perfect days in Sault Ste. Marie.

title: Is the Blue-Collar Shirt Still Blue Collar?
description: A work shirt is a dress shirt with a job to do. Accordingly, it is designed with buttonholes on its double pockets, stitched with an emphasis on strength and constructed from a sturdy material like khaki or covert or, most classically, a cotton called chambray. You can have a chambray shirt in any color you want, and if that color is blue, you also have a social construct and a rhetorical device: The shirts blue collar is a mass-produced idea as durable and versatile as the garment itself. With blue-collar identity now more a matter of cultural style than of occupational history, the term is perfectly slippery, such that the assertions that Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin has blue-collar appeal and an anti-union agenda are not fundamentally incompatible. The phrase blue collar has flourished precisely because it is concrete in its imagery and vague in its connotations, vividly conjuring a labor-class scene while sidestepping such a nasty word as class.

title: Alton Brown Has Had It With Foodies
description: Ten or so years ago, you said that food in this country was like what sex was in the 70s: our last decadent act. Are we out of the 70s yet? I think weve moved into the 80s. The decadence is being replaced by a potentially appropriate austerity. The orgy of the unfamiliar and new has given way to something more focused and thoughtful.

title: Theres More to Cremona Than Violins
description: Cremona is a small, pretty, well-kept, bourgeois, mercantile city in the fertile Po Valley of Italy. There is no local wine region. There is no city university. There are no grandiose must-see sights. The chef Mario Batali once wrote that Cremona is famous for its quiet, pious belief in commerce and order.

title: Michigan State: Fifth in the Nation, Yet Still Second Fiddle to Michigan
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.  After its come-from-behind win over Baylor in the Cotton Bowl in January, Michigan States football team, as tradition dictates, was presented with commemorative rings. The walnut-size mementos celebrated the 42-41 victory as well as the teams 11-2 record. But one small section of each rings limited real estate displayed something else: the score of a blowout over a team that wound up 5-7.

title: Why Fund-Raising Is Important, Even if You Are Trump
description: Im using my own money, Donald Trump declared when he announced he was running for president. Im not using the lobbyists. Im not using donors. And of course, he added, Im really rich.

title: Otto Prez Molina of Guatemala Is Jailed Hours After Resigning Presidency
description: GUATEMALA CITY  Just hours after tendering his resignation as president of Guatemala, Otto Prez Molina was sent to jail to await the conclusion of a hearing examining his role in a multimillion-dollar customs fraud case that has shaken the nation and sent reverberations throughout the region.

title: Today in Politics: A Pledge for Republican Togetherness, on Donald Trumps Terms
description: Good Thursday morning. While President Obama celebrates the success of his strategy to secure enough votes to put the Iran nuclear agreement in place, the head of the Republican National Committee was seemingly engaging in some strategy of his own, calling for all 17 candidates to make a promise meant to ease concerns about one candidates intentions.

title: Former Hillary Clinton Aide to Testify at House Benghazi Committee
description: One of Hillary Rodham Clintons longtime advisers is scheduled to appear on Thursday before the House committee investigating the Benghazi attacks for an interview under oath.

title: Chinese Rail Firm Makes Inroads with U.S. Factory and Boston Transit Deal
description: Chinas biggest rail manufacturing company is setting its sights on the United States. It broke ground on Thursday for a $60 million plant in Springfield, Mass., that will assemble new cars for Bostons subway system.

title: Skills and Strategies | Exit Slips
description: As the new school year begins, were reintroducing a lesson plan format Skills and Strategies  that weve experimented with in the past but have further streamlined for 2015-16.

title: Tamil Lawmaker to Lead Opposition in Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  An ethnic Tamil lawmaker was officially selected to lead the opposition in Sri Lankas Parliament on Thursday, becoming the first member of the island nations largest minority to hold the post in more than three decades.

title: Draghi Says E.C.B. Is Ready to Expand Stimulus, but Not Yet
description: FRANKFURT  Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, pledged on Thursday to intervene by increasing economic stimulus spending if the turmoil in the global economy continues.

title: Imagining the Migrant Experience
description: A German group crammed 71 volunteers into the back of a small truck to highlight the plight of those who turn to smugglers in the hope of reaching richer countries in Europe.

title: Why Natalie Massenets Departure From Net-a-Porter Matters
description: So Natalie Massenet, founder of the online luxury retailer Net-a-Porter, is going offline.

title: Jesse Eisenberg: By the Book
description: The actor and author, most recently, of the story collection Bream Gives Me Hiccups says Uta Hagen offers some excellent stage advice: If you have to act stoned, imagine a helium balloon inflating inside your skull.

description: New interactive books feature a tumble of dogs, a crazy dancing menagerie, a house being built and more.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  Whoa, Baby!
Irans Supreme Leader Orders Parliament to Vote on Nuclear Deal
description: TEHRAN  A day after President Obama secured enough votes to ensure approval of the Iranian nuclear deal in the United States Congress, Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, on Thursday ordered Parliament to vote on the agreement and threatened to cancel the pact entirely if the West merely suspended, rather than canceled, economic sanctions, state news media reported.

description: Meet the father of two with the power to determine the cut and finer details of your clothes.

title: Military Parade in China Gives Xi Jinping a Platform to Show Grip on Power
description: HONG KONG  Thousands of troops stood arrayed at perfect, hushed attention around Tiananmen Square. Hundreds of Communist Party elders, foreign dignitaries and diplomats looked on. It was then, on live television, that President Xi Jinping stepped forward to announce that the Chinese military, on proud display to mark 70 years since the end of World War II, would lose more than a 10th of its personnel.

title: Why Buyout Barons Like a Blank Check
description: Buyout barons are jumping on the blank-check bandwagon.

title: An Arms Deal Is Aimed at Saudis Iran Worries
description: WASHINGTON  In a move meant to reassure a vital Persian Gulf ally about the Iran nuclear deal, the Pentagon is finalizing a $1 billion arms agreement with Saudi Arabia that will provide weapons for the Saudi war effort against the Islamic State and Yemen, senior administration officials said Thursday.

title: How To | Style Plants
description: Satoshi Kawamoto shares tips for styling a small space with ample greenery.

title: Migrants Try to Board Trains in Budapest
description: Hundreds of people at Keleti station scrambled to get on trains after the police retreated from the buildings gates on Thursday morning.

title: Combat-Inspired Timepieces
description: New practical-utility watches convey a capable power, even when handling the most menial of tasks.

title: Cheryl Mills, Adviser to Hillary Clinton, Testifies on Benghazi and Email Practices
description: WASHINGTON  Cheryl D. Mills, a longtime lawyer and adviser to Hillary Rodham Clinton, testified for eight hours before a congressional committee on Thursday about Mrs. Clintons personal email account and the 2012 attacks in Benghazi, Libya.

title: Daily Report: In Search of the Right Phone Plan
description: Wanted: a Rosetta stone for smartphone plans.

title: B&G Foods Agrees to Buy Green Giant and Le Sueur Brands
description: B&G Foods said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire the Green Giant and Le Sueur brands for frozen and canned vegetables from General Mills for $765 million in cash.

title: The Swedish Museum That BabyBjrn Built
description: STOCKHOLM  Fourteen miles east of Swedens capital, amid the piney woods and rocky outcroppings of the Stockholm archipelago, an 8-by-11-foot photograph of the North Atlantic Ocean as viewed from space greets visitors to one of Scandinavias most ambitious new arts institutions. The picture, digitally constructed by the German photographer Andreas Gursky from multiple satellite images, suggests vastness, emptiness, power and fragility. It also reverses our customary perspective on the world, with an immense expanse of midnight-blue ocean occupying almost the entirety of the frame while familiar land masses  Newfoundland, Labrador, Greenland, Iceland, the coast of West Africa, the Caribbean islands  are relegated to a fringe around the edges. A similar desire to change our outlook animates the photography show this image introduces, as well as the space thats hosting it.

title: Highlights of Chinas Victory Day Parade
description: China held a military parade featuring some 12,000 troops in Beijing on Thursday to commemorate 70 years since the end of World War II.

title: Inside the Mind of a Japanese Master Plant Stylist
description: You could say its growing season for Satoshi Kawamoto, the Japanese plant artist and creative director behind lush installations for brands like Filson, Gant Rugger and Mr Porter. In March, he relocated the New York outpost of his Green Fingers empire (five locations in Tokyo, two in Yokohama) from the East Village to a larger  but still modest  location on the Lower East Side. At a glance, the storefront reads like a plant nursery; but its also a boutique, and not just of botanicals. Unruly houseplants and tiny, prim succulents grow among clothes, accessories, lighting (some flea-market-sourced and some designed by Kawamoto himself) and Japanese-made housewares  all for sale. People who are not interested in plants but who are interested in looking for plates, handbags or clothes  may end up buying plants, he explains of the renewed interest in foliage as a home accent, among people who subscribe to a certain (Brooklynized) aesthetic. And on the flip side, people who are looking for plants may end up buying some beautiful vintage clothes.

title: 1915: German Admiral Resigns
description: LONDON  According to a despatch from Amsterdam, Grand Admiral von Tirpitz, the German Minister of Marine, has handed in his resignation [Sept. 3] and will be succeeded by Admiral von Pohl. The Berlin report that Von Tirpitz is taking a prolonged holiday for his health is regarded in New York, says a cablegram to the Daily Chronicle, as an indication that there is a break in the relations of that illustrious sailor with the Kaiser. America is naturally elated over Germanys climb-down, which is generally declared to be a triumph for the Presidents diplomacy.  The New York Herald, European Edition, September 4, 1915

title: Twyla Tharps Troupe Prepares for a Milestone Tour
description: Nothing Twyla Tharp does is casual, especially when it comes to the cultivation of a dancer. We have to establish our own identity together, she said in an interview, in advance of her 50th-anniversary tour. That takes time.

title: Lucas Hnaths The Christians Tackles a Schism Among the Flock
description: Lucas Hnath grew up in an evangelical church. His mother became a minister, and he thought he might do the same. Instead, he became a playwright, and now hes written a knowing script about congregational tremors set off by a doctrinal dispute inside a megachurch.

title: Texas Abortion Providers Ask Supreme Court to Reverse Ruling on Clinics
description: WASHINGTON  Abortion providers in Texas asked the Supreme Court on Wednesday to reverse an appeals court ruling that would leave the state with 10 abortion clinics, down from more than 40. Should the court agree to hear the case, as appears likely, it could issue its first major abortion ruling since 2007 before its next term ends in June.

title: Think Like a Doctor: The Quarterbacks Headache
description: The Challenge: Can you figure out what is giving this 15-year-old boy the worst headache of his life?

title: Frank Sinatra Turns 100, and the Party Goes Beyond Hoboken
description: The centennial celebration for Frank Sinatra looks as if it will be quite the soiree.

title: Image of Drowned Syrian, Aylan Kurdi, 3, Brings Migrant Crisis Into Focus
description: ISTANBUL  The smugglers had promised Abdullah Kurdi a motorboat for the trip from Turkey to Greece, a step on the way to a new life in Canada. Instead, they showed up with a 15-foot rubber raft that flipped in high waves, dumping Mr. Kurdi, his wife and their two small sons into the sea.

title: Judge Erases Tom Bradys Suspension; N.F.L. Says It Will Appeal
description: In Roger Goodells nearly decade-long zeal to establish order in the National Football League, he has handed down penalties for everything from domestic violence to dogfighting to deflating footballs.

title: The Timeless Allure of the Art of Knots
description: Last year, I wrote an article for T about, of all things, knots. To report the piece, I traveled to the Museum of Knots and Sailors Ropework in Ipswich, England. I also spent hours leafing though The Ashley Book of Knots, a doorstop reference work published in 1944. A year later, Im still reading it. Its an unusual thing: a how-to guide thats also an eccentric literary classic.

title: Obama Visits Alaska School
description: President Obama on Wednesday said that the effects of global warming already seen in Kotzebue, Alaska, where he was speaking, should be the worlds wake-up call.

title: Citing Improvements, Glaad Ends Annual TV Report
description: LOS ANGELES  For nearly a decade, Glaad has held the television industrys feet to the fire with an annual report that grades how lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people are represented on small screens. On Thursday, in part because networks have dramatically improved their scores, that report was retired.

title: For His Unconventional Campaign, Donald Trump Looks to an Unorthodox Manager
description: He was a lobbyist who represented one client who sought funds from the federal stimulus program and then another, a group backed by the Koch brothers, who opposed it. He was a political operative who once debated a cardboard cutout of the Democratic governor of New Hampshire to protest tax rates.

title: Obama Dances With Alaskan Children
description: The presidents Alaska trip took him to Dillingham on Wednesday, where he joined children in a dance at a school event.

title: Refugees Plead With Police in Hungary
description: A family of distraught Syrian refugees, including a small child, begged police for help on train tracks outside Bicske after Hungarian authorities blocked their journey to western Europe.

title: Glacier National Park, Through Foreign Eyes
description: When in Glacier National Park, whats better: Navigating the hairpin turns of Going-to-the-Sun Road in an unfamiliar rental? Or sitting in the passenger seat, free to gawk at Americas greatest scenery, an Ansel Adams exhibition colorized and brought to life?

title: Save the Last Dance
description: Night after night they spun across New York Citys summer swing dancing floors. Then one evening he stopped suddenly, said, I need to talk to you, and swept her off her feet.

title: Too Much in Love to Say Good Night
description: It was a Thursday night at Frim Fram Jam, right in the middle of the Tranky Doo.

description: Looking for something fun to do?

description: Judge Richard M. Berman of Federal District Court in Manhattan listed a number of faults in the N.F.L.s handling of Tom Bradys suspension.

description: Talk about a casting coup: a little-known playwright from Altoona, Pa., has landed Kathleen Turner and Deborah Cox to perform in the first production of his Off Broadway play this fall.

title: Children Sprayed at the Hungarian Border
description: As a group of Syrian refugees approached the Hungarian border, hoping to cross over from Serbia, they were met by Hungarian police who sprayed them with something that burned their eyes.

title: As Dodgers Zero In on Playoffs, a $300 Million Payroll Is Out of Mind
description: LOS ANGELES  Start with the premise that a team spending roughly $300 million on baseball players ought to finish in first place. That figure, unequaled in baseball history, is so striking that it underscores everything about the Los Angeles Dodgers. Yet to focus too much on it is to miss the beauty of the pursuit. Nothing is preordained.

title: American Pharoah Isnt Done: Farewell Will Come at Breeders Cup
description: American Pharoah, the Triple Crown champion, will race at least one more time, in October at the Breeders Cup Classic in Kentucky, his owner Ahmed Zayat confirmed Thursday.

title: 1965: Russia Wont Trade Exhibitions
description: MOSCOW  Russia has called off a planned exchange of exhibitions with the United States, apparently because of tension over Vietnam, U.S. officials said today [Sept. 3]. They said the Soviet Union had asked for an American hand-tools exhibition and a Soviet space-achievement display to be suspended under present circumstances. American officials disclosed yesterday that Russia had withdrawn an invitation for the American musical Hello Dolly to stage a five-week run here in October. The cancellations are seen by the Americans as first direct results of a tougher public posture by Russia over Vietnam.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 4, 1965

title: Turkey Frees Two British Journalists With Vice News
description: Two British journalists who were arrested by Turkish authorities last week have been released, a lawyer representing the men said on Thursday, but a local journalist who was assisting them remained in jail.

description: The fuzzy layer gets an alt-preppy makeover, worn over turtlenecks and striped shirts, and tucked into trousers.

title: Guatemalans on Presidents Resignation
description: People in Guatemala City reacted early Thursday morning to the resignation of President Otto Prez Molina. Mr. Prez is facing charges in a customs fraud scandal.

title: Who Gets to Play the Transgender Part?
description: LOS ANGELES  More than at any time in its history, Hollywood is under enormous pressure to find performers who match the racial and ethnic traits of characters.

title: Ben Carson Shows More Strength in National Poll
description: A national poll released Thursday gives more confirmation that Ben Carson has developed a head of steam in the Republican field, showing that only Mr. Carson, the retired brain surgeon, outperforms Donald J. Trump in a head-to-head matchup.

title: Babu Ji
description: Indian food with Bollywood color in the East Village.

title: Babu Ji in the East Village Asserts Its Authority
description: Babu Ji stands a half-mile from the East Villages declining Curry Row, where Indian restaurants once huddled shoulder to shoulder, epauletted in twinkle lights and nearly indistinguishable.

title: Numbering of Migrants by Czechs Brings Outcry
description: LONDON  Human rights advocates and Jewish groups expressed outrage on Thursday after the authorities in the Czech Republic wrote numbers on the skin of migrants who were pulled off trains this week, a move they said summoned memories of the Nazi era.

title: This Was to Be the Year of Bigger Wage Gains. Its Not.
description: The unemployment rate is low by any historical standard at 5.1 percent. Businesses are complaining of worker shortages in industries like health care, construction and trucking. Household-name companies like Walmart and McDonalds have announced increases to their pay for low-wage workers.

title: A Song Inspired by a Bizarre Love Triangle
description: The initial concept for the psych-rock trio Unknown Mortal Orchestras third full-length album, Multi-Love, began with the title. When I first wrote down the term multi-love, I didnt really know what it meant or why it resonated with me, frontman Ruban Nielson explains. But the meaning of it became more complex as the year went on. Nielson set out to make a happy record  a seemingly painless undertaking. But when an unlikely friendship blossomed with a young woman on the road, it evolved into a love triangle between Nielson, his wife and Woman X  and complications set in.

title: Legion of Tech Volunteers Lead a Charge for Bernie Sanders
description: Dawn crept into Daniela Perdomos Brooklyn apartment, her bleary eyes still focused on her bright computer screen. The founder of a nearly three-year-old communications start-up, she had been up all night again, orchestrating the work of more than 100 other developers, web designers, researchers and writers.

title: 1991 Suspension of Reggie Langhorne Plays Into Tom Brady Decision
description: Reggie Langhorne, who retired from the N.F.L. more than 20 years ago, was on a golf course Thursday afternoon when he learned that he was making news in the league again.

title: Patriots and N.F.L. Players React to Tom Brady Suspension Ruling
description: Judge Richard M. Bermans decision to overturn Tom Bradys four-game suspension from the N.F.L. drew an immediate response on social media, with fans, players and even teams weighing in on the issue.

title: Pomp and Power at China Military Parade
description: In Beijing, 12,000 troops staged a celebration of the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II.

title: Protesters Outside Kentucky Courthouse
description: Demonstrators expressed support for gay marriage and religious liberty outside a courthouse in Ashland, Ky., on Thursday, where the Rowan County clerk of courts, Kim Davis, was ordered to jail.

title: Chailly to Leave Leipzig Orchestra Early
description: The recent game of musical chairs among the worlds top conductors is continuing: Riccardo Chailly plans to step down as music director of the Leipzig Gewandhaus Orchestra in June, several years ahead of schedule, the orchestra announced on Thursday.

title: Biden Again Expresses Uncertainty About 2016
description: DAVIE, Fla.  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said on Thursday night that he was unsure whether he and his family had the emotional energy for a presidential bid, telling an audience at an Atlanta synagogue that I cant look you straight in the eye and say now, I know I can do it.

title: Hakeem Jeffries for New York Mayor? Some Democrats Say Yes, but He Hesitates
description: The calls have come in a steady stream: from political donors, community leaders and members of the clergy, urging Representative Hakeem Jeffries to consider running against Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York.

title: Problems With Supreme Courts Ruling on Fees
description: Imagine a situation where a client refuses to pay a lawyers bill, claiming that the bill is too high or the quality of the work was poor. The normal rule is that the lawyer eats the cost of defending the bill, even if the lawyer eventually prevails against the client.

title: In Paris, a Famed Department Store Goes Brooklyn
description: They call it Le Brook-leen, and for the French, or Parisians at least, it is an exotic land far, far away. But there is something je ne sais quoi about Brooklyn that seduces the French  that intellectual approach to life and style, which, at its core, perhaps, is as franais as Sartre and Beauvoir. So beginning this week, the Left Bank department store Le Bon March Rive Gauche will spotlight Brooklyn as its annual autumn cultural theme  a focus running throughout the store and its sister gourmet grocery, La Grande Epicerie. Items from more than 100 different Brooklyn purveyors will be for sale, including Catbird jewelry, Kinfolk mens wear and Mast Brothers chocolates. The stores commitment to the Brooklyn aesthetic is so complete as to border on caricature  theyll even hawk Lynn & Lawrence woolen beanies and Ball mason jars (which happen to be made in Indiana).

title: Father of Drowned Syrian Boys Speaks About Loss
description: Abdullah Kurdi, the father of Aylan, 3, and Galip, 5, who both drowned attempting to flee from Syria, tells the story of their harrowing journey and the moment he lost his family.

title: Clerk in Kentucky Chooses Jail Over Deal on Same-Sex Marriage
description: ASHLAND, Ky.  A Kentucky county clerk who has become a symbol of religious opposition to same-sex marriage was jailed Thursday after defying a federal court order to issue licenses to gay couples.

title: This Week, Sizing Up Smartphone Plans
description: Phone carriers enjoy marketing their plans as simple and transparent  but in reality, comparing phone plans between carriers is complicated enough to make your head explode.

title: Getty Images Announces 2015 Grant Winners
description: Photographers doing personal projects on social issues that often go overlooked received $10,000 each today from the 2015 Getty Images Grants for Editorial Photography.

title: The E.U. Reacts to Images of a Drowned Syrian Boy
description: Photographs of the body of a young child drowned off Turkey circulated online yesterday.

title: Analysis Confirms Plane Debris Came From Malaysia Airlines Flight 370
description: PARIS  French prosecutors said on Thursday that further analysis of a piece of an airplane wing that washed up on a remote Indian Ocean island had allowed investigators here to determine with certitude that it came from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, which disappeared in March 2014 with 239 people on board.

title: In Britain, Top Artists Sell Affordable Work Straight From Their Cars
description: This weekend, the British artists Tracey Emin, Sir Peter Blake, Keith Coventry, Matt Collishaw, Polly Morgan and Jeremy Deller convened to raise money for charity. But it was a scene unlike any they tend to participate in: instead of the usual blue-chip auction, they took part in Vauxhalls annual Art Car Boot Fair, selling special editions of their works from stalls and the trunks of their cars. What makes this kind of event exceptional is that you are selling affordable art from different people at different points in their careers, Emin told T as she took a brief break from selling her work, which included signed posters and limited editions of her drawings that ranged from 50-500. And that makes it accessible to the public.

title: Letters: Another Path to Peace
description: To the Editor:

title: Biden Calls Iran Pact A Good Deal
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. spoke to Jewish leaders in Florida on Thursday in an effort to generate support for the Iran nuclear deal.

title: First Draft Focus: House Panel Ponders Benghazi
description: Cheryl Mills, Adviser to Hillary Clinton, Testifies on Benghazi and Email Practices

title: Prosecutors to Seek Death Penalty for Dylann Roof in Charleston Shootings
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  After what she described as intense and emotional discussions with family members and survivors, one of the states top prosecutors said Thursday that she would seek the death penalty for Dylann S. Roof, who is charged with committing racially motivated murder against nine members of a storied church here.

title: A New Name and Height for Mount McKinley
description: Last week, the tallest mountain in North America not only was renamed, but also lost a bit of stature  10 feet. The United States Geological Survey announced Wednesday that the official height of Denali, the Alaskan mountain formerly known as Mount McKinley, is 20,310 feet. Previously, it was listed at 20,320 feet.

title: Study Reveals Consistent Predator-Prey Pattern
description: Predators may depend on prey for food, but an increase in the number of prey animals does not bring a proportional increase in the number of predators, a new study has found.

title: South Africas Naspers Backs Smartphone Start-Up Letgo
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The world of online marketplaces may already seem crowded with the likes of Amazon.com and the Alibaba Group.

title: A West Village Space Thats Part Store, Part Light Installation
description: When the brothers Tull and Josh Price set out to design the second New York store for their shoe brand, Feit, they had a goal in mind: to, as Tull puts it, push the boundaries of what a retail space could look and feel like. The result is just that: a stark, cleanly geometric space  that feels simultaneously industrial and natural  opening in the West Village this week.

title: Slave Trade Video Game Developer Alters Scene After Outcry
description: After facing mounting criticism on social media, a Danish video game developer has excised a scene from an educational game that depicts the 18th-century slave trade.

title: Thorsten Brinkmanns La Vie en Rose Rock
description: The photographer creates portraits and still lifes that echo noble, aristocratic techniques  with an absurdist twist.

title: Donald Trump Signs Loyalty Pledge to Republican Party
description: He said yes.

title: Witty Photos That Play With Centuries-Old Artistic Tradition
description: The photographer Thorsten Brinkmanns portraits marry the traditional with the absurd: His subjects stand in regal poses, wearing thrift-store fabric scraps, plus vases or cloth-covered wastepaper baskets over their heads that render them genderless and ageless. Brinkmann often poses for the portraits himself; wearing a cape made of a pleated skirt or masking his face with a broken flower pot, he provides a witty take on the gestures of European aristocrats.

title: Warming Oceans Putting Marine Life In a Blender
description: Up in Maine, lobsters are thriving. The Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission reported last month that stocks there reached a record high.

title: Editorial Page Editor Andrew Rosenthal on Trump Campaign
description: Is Donald Trump deliberately using offensive rhetoric to fan fury from the far right?

title: Chelsea Clintons Spokesman, Kamyl Bazbaz, Leaves Clinton Foundation
description: Chelsea Clintons spokesman of the last two years, Kamyl Bazbaz, is leaving the Clinton Foundation for the private sector.

title: An Expedition Reveals Stunning Biological Wealth in a Bolivian Park That May Be Opened to Drilling
description: I focus a lot on hotspots for social or environmental troubles in the tropics, so its worth stepping back once in awhile to point to areas where the great tapestry of life is still dizzyingly rich  at least for now.

title: Donald Trump Signs Republican Pledge
description: Mr. Trump, a Republican presidential candidate, vowed to back the partys choice if he failed to win the nomination, ruling out an independent or third-party bid.

title: Five Rutgers Football Players Suspended After Criminal Charges
description: Rutgerss embattled football program came under further scrutiny Thursday after it was reported that five of the teams players had been charged with assault. They are accused of surrounding at least four people and inflicting what the authorities called an unprovoked attack that broke one victims jaw.

title: Some Nail Salon Owners in New York Push Back Against Increased Regulation
description: Kenny Yeh acquired J & J Fine Nail on the Upper West Side of Manhattan about three years ago. It is a tidy, narrow space that smells only faintly of polish, and where gentle piano music plays in the background.

title: California Heat Puts Farm Workers at Risk
description: Californias drought has forced cities to cut back on water and (some) farmers to let their fields go fallow. But increasingly hot, dry weather in the state may have its most dire effect on some of the people who plant and pick its crops.

title: Aunt of Drowned Syrian Boys Comments
description: Tima Kurdi, the aunt of two Syrian boys who drowned off the coast of Turkey, said that their mother told her she didnt know how to swim before the family attempted to cross the Mediterranean.

title: College Football Kickoff: A Primer on the Playoff System
description: The college football season kicks off Thursday night with an extended weekend of games that includes prominent matchups like Michigan-Utah (Thursday), Notre Dame-Texas and Alabama-Wisconsin (Saturday) and Virginia Tech-Ohio State (Monday). Marc Tracy takes a quick look at what all the teams are playing for: a chance to be a part of the College Football Playoff at the end of the season.

title: Defense to Rest in Trial of 3 Ex-Dewey & LeBoeuf Leaders
description: The lawyers for three former executives of Dewey & LeBoeuf must feel confident that prosecutors have failed to prove that the men used accounting gimmicks to defraud lenders and creditors of the once-prominent New York law firm.

title: Migrant Children in Need Raise Questions at Home
description: Summer vacation is almost officially over. By the Tuesday after Labor Day, even the last of the public schools will have started their calendars. The holdout preschools should finally start easing their young charges into classroom life by mid-September; soon, the ordinary ritual of family life  the constructing of the house of cards that is child care and car pool, the setting aside the work email for homework help, the parent-teacher conferences, the calls from the school nurse  should be in full swing.

title: Ayatollah Says Sanctions Must Be Lifted
description: Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, told an influential clerical council on Thursday that there would be no nuclear deal if sanctions were suspended rather than lifted.

title: Art for the Workers Sake
description: Museums like the Met and the Whitney are filled with examples of pieces depicting labor.

title: Take a Labor Day Tour of Blue-Collar Art
description: Poor art for poor people.

title: Philippe Parrenos Larger-than-Life Year
description: The artist, who staged an ambitious exhibition at New Yorks Park Avenue Armory this summer, will be honored by Sculpture Center in November and has several international projects on the horizon.

title: For Philippe Parreno, a Big Honor and an Even Bigger Year
description: The artist Philippe Parreno has never been to the Rainbow Room, where hell be honored this year at Sculpture Centers annual gala on Nov. 4. In fact, its not even clear whether hes heard of the landmarked Art Deco event space, which has at some point hosted almost every philanthropic endeavor in New York from its 65th floor vantage point  a world away from the nonprofits gritty Long Island City location. Parreno Googles the Rainbow Room and asks, laughing, Can I come in a T-shirt, or do I have to get a tie?

title: Donald Trumps Empty Promise to the Republican Party
description: Donald Trump made a big show today out of the latest in the series of meaningless gestures and self-promotional stunts that make up his political career. He signed a piece of paper saying that if he doesnt win the Republican nominating contest, he will endorse the winner and will not mount a third-party run.

title: Yoox Exuberance Over an Exit May Wear Thin
description: Yoox is losing Net-a-Porter know-how at an important time.

title: Review: In Blind, Perception and Fantasy Converge in a Writers Mind
description: Blindness and sight: Distinctions between the two blur, then converge in the Norwegian filmmaker Eskil Vogts haunting debut feature, Blind, whose narrator and main character, Ingrid (Ellen Dorrit Petersen), has recently lost her sight.

title: Pictures of the Day: Hungary and Elsewhere
description: Hungary and More  Pictures of the Day

title: September 3, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Hungary, Italy, Ivory Coast and India.

title: Chef Michael White Closes Summer by Opening Vaucluse
description: I worked for quite some time in Italy, says Altamarea Groups executive chef Michael White, but most of those restaurants are quiet in the summertime, so I would go to France and I would work for the summer in Grasse. The chef, who rose to fame on the strength of his Italian cuisine at Marea and Ai Fiori, finally has a chance to draw inspiration from those French summers at his new uptown brasserie Vaucluse.

title: American Yeshiva Students Escape Attack in West Bank Town
description: JERUSALEM  Five American Jewish seminary students who strayed into a Palestinian-controlled area of Hebron in their car on Thursday were attacked by Palestinians hurling stones and a firebomb, according to the Israeli police and the military.

title: Getty Images Announces 2015 Grant Winners
description: PERPIGNAN, France  Photographers doing personal projects on social issues that often go overlooked, if not unreported, received $10,000 each today from the 2015 Getty Images Grants for Editorial Photography. The awards were announced at the Visa pour lImage festival.

title: Hungarian Leader Rebuked for Saying Muslim Migrants Must Be Blocked to Keep Europe Christian
description: Hungarys prime minister, Viktor Orban, was criticized online and in person on Thursday for writing in a German newspaper that it was important to secure his nations borders from mainly Muslim migrants to keep Europe Christian.

title: Afghans See a Collapse of Tradition in a Spate of Devious Attacks
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Abdul Latif of northern Kunduz Province vowed he would get even with the Taliban who killed his father, so he volunteered to join one of their units and spent two months trying to win their confidence. A few days ago he and a friend shot 13 of them to death, mostly while they slept, he and the police said.

title: Justice Dept. to Require Warrants for Some Cellphone Tracking
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department will regularly require federal agents to seek warrants before using secretive equipment that can locate and track cellphones, the agency announced Thursday, the first regulations on an increasingly controversial technology.

title: Review: Jaimie Warren, at American Medium, Mashes Up Freddie Mercury and Saints
description: JAIMIE WARREN

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Dylann Roof Accused of Ultimate Crime
description: The South Carolina state solicitor, Scarlett A. Wilson, will seek the death penalty for Mr. Roof, who is charged with the killing of nine people at a Charleston church in June.

title: Review: Hand of God, on Amazon, Is a California Neo-Noir Thriller
description: The pilot of Hand of God, Amazons second original hourlong drama, was posted just over a year ago. So weve known all this time that the series begins with Ron Perlman  an actor of formidable size who has played characters called Hellboy and the Beast  standing naked in a public fountain, speaking in tongues.

title: Odysseus Epic Journey, This Time in Central Park
description: Summer isnt over yet, and neither are the Public Theaters free shows in Central Park.

title: Lineup Set for Telluride Film Festival
description: LOS ANGELES  Is the coming Suffragette a political movie? At first glance, it looks period and foreign, the story of Britains early feminist movement, with Carey Mulligan in the lead role. On second glance, it could resonate in a presidential contest that finds a woman within reaching distance of the presidency. Maybe?

title: Review: Gilbert & George in the Early Days, Sending Up a Religion Called Art
description: GILBERT & GEORGE

title: My Fathers Last Romance
No Judge of Character
description: I was in a deli, and a man may have cut in front of me in line. When asked if he had, I said: I dont argue over such things. He can go ahead. The man replied: You dont argue over such things? Thats why youre fat. I said, Youll end up in a courtroom. He replied: Good! Im a lawyer. I said, Well, I am a judge. The conversation devolved until he accused me of racism. Apparently, he was Hispanic; I hadnt noticed. But when did it become O.K. to pick on someones physical imperfections but not sexual orientation or race?

title: Arizona News Anchor Is Drawn Into Debate on Her Accent and the Use of Spanish
description: PHOENIX  An Arizona news anchor defended her pronunciation of Spanish words during English broadcasts, saying she delivers them the way the language is intended to be spoken.

title: Review: In Contracted: Phase II Misfortune Multiples an Encounter at a Time
description: CONTRACTED: PHASE II

title: Review: Chloe & Theo, a Climate-Change Movie With Rising Levels of Simplicity
description: CHLOE & THEO

title: Silicon Valley, Seeking Diversity, Focuses on Blacks
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  More than a decade before diversity became a hot issue in Silicon Valley, Jason Young came home on winter break from Harvard to discover that his family was being evicted.

title: Review: In Chris Evanss Before We Go, a Chance Encounter With Staying Power
description: BEFORE WE GO

title: Cory Booker, New Jersey Senator, Backs Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Senator Cory A. Booker, Democrat of New Jersey, endorsed President Obamas nuclear agreement with Iran on Thursday, padding support for the accord, which already has enough votes in the Senate to thwart a Republican-backed resolution of disapproval.

title: Fighting the Tank Car Invasion
description: It seemed to happen overnight for people living along the commercial rail lines from North Dakota to New York and beyond. Instead of sleepy Amtrak passenger trains or a string of relatively harmless boxcars, the railways have been overtaken in the last year or so by thousands of matte black tank cars. These bullet-shaped tankers are mostly filled with Bakken crude oil, a combustible substance that has been responsible for numerous explosions and 47 deaths in recent years.

title: Review: Dragon Blade Features Jackie Chan, Romans and a Lot of Mayhem
description: All fighting, all grimacing  though sometimes all smiling, weeping and singing  Dragon Blade is the kind of nutsy maximalist entertainment that isnt content merely to tap a handful of influences. Instead, it stuffs an entire encyclopedia of dicey ideas (visual, narrative, political) into a blender to create a wacky, eyeball-popping and -glazing extravaganza that suggests a Cecil B. DeMille Bible epic, a Chinese military parade and a Busby Berkeley musical, at times all at once. And while it can be tough to find the human pulse amid the spectacle noise, Jackie Chan, John Cusack, Adrien Brody and a trillion horse-riding extras are also part of the very big picture.

title: Review: Capturing Frida Kahlo Through a Series of Portraits
description: FRIDA KAHLO

title: Review: In La Jaula de Oro, Riding the Rails to Reach New Lives
description: In the opening moments of La Jaula de Oro, three impoverished Guatemalan teenagers prepare to make the perilous journey north in hopes of slipping across the United States border into the land of opportunity. There, one boy exclaims wishfully, everything is much better. In a ramshackle public lavatory, Sara (Karen Martnez), the lone girl of the three, chops off her hair, tapes her breasts, and dons a T-shirt and baseball cap to pose as a boy named Osvaldo.

title: Outside Courthouse, Kim Davis Is Seen as a Villain and a Hero
description: Outside a federal courthouse in Ashland, Ky., on Thursday, dozens of people gathered in two cacophonous groups to debate what both sides felt was history in the making, but for different reasons.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, Sept. 6 to 13, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Hedge Funds Faced a Test in August, and Faltered
description: A surge in volatility. Plunging global stock markets. A surprise Chinese currency devaluation.

title: Sesame Street When It Started
description: 46 YEARS AGO

title: Review: At Bargemusic, a Surprise Competition With Live Bluegrass
description: An element of surprise is built into any performance during Bargemusics Here and Now Labor Day festival. This four-day celebration of contemporary music takes a catholic approach to styles and instrumentation, and with virtually every work a New York or world premiere, theres no telling what youll hear.

title: Review: Donald Blumberg Photographs, Observing America on the Streets and From the Sofa
description: NEW HAVEN  Theres real life, and theres media; there are the spaces outside we inhabit together, and there is the screen we gaze at alone. Yet the photographs of Donald Blumberg, subject of a large retrospective at the Yale University Art Gallery here, make the distinction between reality and image feel overdrawn. Mr. Blumberg began his career shooting on the streets of New York, but by the late 1960s he had turned his lens away from real spaces, preferring to shoot the television in his living room. As the nearly 200 images here attest, the gap between one and the other is smaller than youd think. Outside or inside, photographing or rephotographing, Mr. Blumberg observes an America in transition and in crisis, via a medium whose assumed veracity he never stopped questioning.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, Sept. 6 to 13, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, Sept. 6 to 13, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Review: Charene Wade Performs Gil Scott-Heron Works
description: The defining act of alchemy on Offering: The Music of Gil Scott-Heron and Brian Jackson (Motma), a persuasive new album by the jazz singer Charene Wade, is her version of Song of the Wind. In its original incarnation, released in 1977, the tune has a funk-reggae lilt and an obbligato of tropical birdsong, played on a synthesizer. Ms. Wade sings it with a graver air, slow and brooding and serious.

title: Prez Art Museum Miami Names Franklin Sirmans as New Director
description: Aspen has a growing reputation among South Floridas art world heavies as the perfect spot to escape the summers ceaseless humidity  call it a Rocky Mountain answer to the Hamptons. Turns out its also a good place to pick a new museum director.

title: China Shows Off Its Military
description: China staged a military parade in Beijing on the 70th anniversary of Japans defeat in World War II.

title: Things to Do in the Hudson Valley, Sept. 6 to 13, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Review: Dirty Weekend, Neil LaButes Tale of an Unexpected Layover
description: The comedy of sexual identity Dirty Weekend might not be the kind of thing youd expect to see from the director and playwright Neil LaBute. Despite a reputation for slashing at the jugular, Mr. LaBute has done the equivalent of rolling over and letting his belly be rubbed with this tale of an especially eventful layover in Albuquerque.

title: In A Sinner in Mecca, a Gay Director Ponders His Sexuality and Islamic Faith
description: There is no doubting the courage and conviction of the New York documentarian Parvez Sharma. In A Jihad for Love, from 2008, he interviewed devout gay Muslims worldwide. In A Sinner in Mecca, Mr. Sharma, who is also gay and Muslim, takes viewers on his 2011 hajj, or pilgrimage, to Islams most sacred sites. The journey is fraught with risks: In Saudi Arabia, being gay can mean execution, public lashings or imprisonment. And yet Mr. Sharma has created a swirling, fascinating travelogue and a stirring celebration of devotion.

title: Treasures and Talismans, at the Cloisters, Puts Rings on a Pedestal
description: Why do people wear rings on their fingers? For personal adornment, of course, but as often as not because of the social meanings they bear and communicate. Perhaps the worlds oldest form of jewelry, rings symbolize love, betrothal and marriage. They represent the wearers status, group affiliation and ancestry. They express religious, superstitious and moral beliefs. They may be trophies, memorials and, as in the case of the signet ring, a device for sealing and authenticating letters and documents.

title: Migrant Smuggling in Europe Is Now Worth Billions
description: BUDAPEST  With thousands of migrants pouring out of Afghanistan and the Middle East, the business of smuggling them across the Balkans into the European Union has grown even larger than the illicit trade in drugs and weapons, law enforcement officials said.

title: Previewing New Jerseys Fall Theater Schedule
description: Social media cannot be blamed entirely for the worlds obsessive fascination with the latest thing.

title: Becoming a Vampire, or Almost Anything Else, in Live Action Role Playing
description: In late July, nearly 60 men and women from around the country pitched their tents in the campground at Croton Point Park in Croton-on-Hudson. They had come to inhabit the World of Darkness as players in the game Vampire: The Masquerade. From Friday till Sunday, they enacted their individual roles as members of a complex society of vampires  and participants in a LARP.

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: In Bedroom Farce, Love and Other Jokes
description: Once youve heard Freddie Mercurys voice belting out Queens Crazy Little Thing Called Love a few times in the Westport Country Playhouse, youll have caught the splendid sense of glee that the theater is selling with its production of Alan Ayckbourns Bedroom Farce.

title: Review: Saturday Night Fever: The Musical at Gateway Is Old but New
description: The stage version of Saturday Night Fever now at the Gateway Playhouse in Bellport is not the same adaptation that opened on Broadway in 1999. Ben Brantley called that earlier musical based on the hit 1977 film dreary, and most other critics agreed. Nevertheless, it ran for 501 performances.

title: BB-8 Droid Offers Hint of Coming Crush of Star Wars Toys
description: One of the first toys to emerge from a tightly held cache of merchandise tied to the next Star Wars movie is already the target of a viral crush online: Its the BB-8 droid, a small, round robot that rolls along the floor at the touch of a smartphone.

title: Gerry Hayden, Who Took Farm-to-Table Dining to Long Island, Dies at 50
description: Gerry Hayden, a chef who brought a refined style of farm-to-table dining to the East End of Long Island with his restaurant the North Fork Table and Inn, died on Wednesday at his home in Southold, N.Y. He was 50.

title: Bounding Across Space and Time, via DVD
description: Alastair Macaulay

title: The Top Tennis Player in the World Started Here
description: Long before he found his way to the top of the sport, where did Novak Djokovic learn to swing a racket? We visit the childhood courts of some of the worlds tennis greats.

title: Lining Up (Early) for Boutique Pastries in Connecticut
description: At 7:49 on a recent Sunday morning, six people had already lined up in the sweltering heat outside Hen & Heifer, a small pastry shop near the Guilford Town Green. The doors would not open until 8 a.m.

title: Review: Finca Offers Tapas, Though Not Strictly From Spain
description: Finca, in downtown Ridgewood, is a prime example of how the Spanish tapas trend has inspired small plates at restaurants not exclusively dedicated to the cuisine of Spain. The choices here feature more general Mediterranean  and some Latin-American  influences.

title: Sothebys to Auction A. Alfred Taubmans $500 Million Trove
description: The chairmans art collection is coming to Sothebys.

title: Review: Momi Ramen in East Hampton Defies Expectations
description: If you were to make a list of the things you were least likely to want to eat after a day at the beach, a big steaming bowl of ramen noodles would probably be near the top. Anita Chen, owner and manager of Momi Ramen in East Hampton, however, would beg to differ. After several members of Ms. Chens family opened the original Momi Ramen in downtown Miami in 2012 to much acclaim, she said, she was inspired to try her luck in another coastal community. Judging by the crowds this summer at the new branch, which opened in June, Ms. Chens counterintuitive thinking has paid off.

title: A Review of Apptit Bistro in Port Chester, N.Y.
description: At the north end of Willett Avenue in Port Chester, Apptit Bistro shares a strip mall with the Nail Palace, the Super Primo Grocery and an Irish pub known for its karaoke night. From arms length, the name and the setting do little to set a diners heart aflutter, but close up, the sparkling plate-glass facade and two exuberant coleus plants (along with a flurry of five-star reviews on Yelp) raise an expectation or two.

title: 2015 U.S. Open: As Favorites Are Upended, Many Players Are Wobbly
description: As her second-round match against Garbie Muguruza on a sweat-soaked Thursday afternoon dragged on, Johanna Konta caught herself glancing at the courtside clock.

title: The Eerie Mating Sound
description: A male Attwaters prairie chicken emits its signature cry during the courtship process.

title: A Stained-Glass Artist Enjoys a Renaissance
description: Last month the stained-glass artist Robert Pinart revisited two windows he designed that had been installed in the 1980s at the New City Jewish Center in Rockland County, N.Y.

title: The Jemima Code Spotlights Forgotten Black Cooks
description: When the food writer Toni Tipton-Martin lectures about her private collection of recipe books by African-Americans, she said, the back stories have brought audiences to tears. They reveal the lives of maltreated slaves who served meals with European and African culinary roots to plantation owners, and they expose 20th-century white chefs who won acclaim for recipes developed by black colleagues, whom they never properly credited.

title: Christies Puts Chinese Pedestals on the Auction Block
description: An unnamed consignor to a Christies sale in New York on Sept. 17 had stocked his home with empty pedestals.

title: Scenes From Judge Diments Courtroom
description: In Bowdon, Ga., Richard A. Diment, a municipal court judge, told traffic violators that they had to immediately pay down fines in his courtroom, or go to jail.

title: Times Square Topless Woman Is Arrested; 2 Others Are Assaulted, Police Say
description: A topless woman, painted on her torso and soliciting tips for photographs in Times Square, was arrested Wednesday night by undercover officers along with her boyfriend on drug and prostitution charges. Two other topless women with painted torsos were attacked by a visitor from North Carolina who accused them of robbing him, the police said.

title: Legal Questions Aside, Much Remains Unanswered in the Tom Brady Case
description: In hitting Roger Goodell with a blow that shakes his already wobbly legacy, Judge Richard M. Berman summarized pent-up criticism of the N.F.L. commissioner when he said Goodell had administered his own brand of industrial justice to a player he felt had crossed a line.

title: Review: The Transporter Refueled Has a New Guy Behind the Wheel
description: THE TRANSPORTER REFUELED

title: Spare Times for Sept. 4-10
description: Labor Day Weekend

title: A Glass for Enjoying a Sip of Whisky While Floating in Space
description: When space tourism finally takes off and the rich and famous head off for a holiday in orbit as easily as on the Riviera, they may want to sip something stronger than Tang as they gaze down at Earth.

title: Review: Different Thinking About Steve Jobs, the Man Behind Apple
description: The transformative impact Steve Jobs has had on culture and society has become an article of faith since his much-mourned death in 2011. The secular canonization of Mr. Jobs, the mastermind behind Apple, is the starting point for Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine, Alex Gibneys trenchant new documentary, which asks with sincere curiosity: Whats the fuss about? And more to the point: Whats wrong with this picture?

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Time Out of Mind
description: Oren Moverman narrates a sequence from his film Time Out of Mind, starring Richard Gere.

title: Time Out of Mind (With Movie Trailer): Oren Moverman Narrates a Scene
description: Hes played a gigolo, an officer, a lawyer and many other roles over the years. But for the first time in his career, Richard Gere is playing a homeless man. He stars as a down-on-his-luck character in Time Out of Mind, from the director Oren Moverman. In this scene, the character is panhandling on the streets of New York.

title: Movie Review: The Black Panthers
description: The Times critic A.O. Scott reviews The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution.

title: Spare Times for Children for Sept. 4-10
description: New York City Unicycle Festival

title: An Ad for the Star Wars BB-8 Droid Toy
description: With a smartphone as a controller, users can steer the little bot along paths, smash it into walls, feet and chairs, and watch as it angrily lights up if its head comes loose.

title: Movie Review: A Walk in the Woods
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews A Walk in the Woods.

description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

description: The Times critic Nicolas Rapold reviews Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine.

description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.
