description: Cow Country, a 540-page satirical novel about a dysfunctional community college, landed with a thud when it came out in April. It has amassed all of two reviews on Amazon in the months since its publication, and has been largely overlooked by critics.

title: Review: Israeli Chamber Project Offers an Emotive Mix of Old and New
description: A new chamber ensemble can make its mark in several ways. A high level of refined and exciting playing is a good start. Interesting programs, including overlooked historical gems and terrific new works, help. So does outreach driven by an appetite for developing new audiences in out-of-the-way places. And having a budding superstar in your lineup never hurts.

title: Threes a Trend: Sculptural Earrings
description: By the second day of fashion week, there had already been bucket hats, fishnets and furry shoes on the runways. But one accessory that stood out among the rest were the big statement earrings at a handful of shows. At Creatures of Comfort, elegant tiered white discs came down the runway; at Tome, models wore two different pairs  one in the shape of silver fish, the other in the shape of fish bones. Rounding out the trio was Rosie Assoulin, who collaborated with her mother-in-law, Roxanne Assoulin of Lee Angel, on a series of large-scale sculptural baubles in blue, pink, white and metallic.

title: Times Was Right to Change Insensitive Graphic
description: Many Times readers wrote to me Thursday about a graphic that appeared online and in print accompanying a story about the Iran nuclear deal. They protested a column in the graphic that identified whether lawmakers were Jewish, with a one-word heading: Jewish?

title: Grilled Rib-Eye Steak
description: Melissa Clark grills rib-eye steak, and tops it off with blue cheese, butter and chives.

title: Grilling Thick Steaks, a Leisurely Approach
description: For our close family friend Dr. Ruby, cooking steak was a meditative and ritualistic act. As a child visiting the Ruby familys country house, about an hour north of Manhattan, Id watch him stand over an enormous porterhouse on the charcoal grill, icy martini in one hand, tongs in the other, staring at his watch.

title: For Widows, Social Security System Can Provide Rude Shocks
description: WITHIN weeks after her 78-year-old husband, James, died last year, Jo Etta Brown, 75, came face to face with the financial realities of being a widow living on Social Security.

title: Shiite Militia Releases Video of Turkish Workers Kidnapped in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  A previously unknown Shiite militia released a video Friday that shows more than a dozen Turkish construction workers who were kidnapped in Baghdad recently and demands that Turkey stop the flow of jihadists into Iraq and lift a siege of several Shiite-dominated villages in Syria.

title: Popcast: Jon Batiste and The Late Show With Stephen Colbert
description: Jon Batiste, the 28-year-old musical director of The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, is a serious people-pleaser: as our guest Nate Chinen attests, his gigs can have the same effect on small children that it does on grown adults. They often involve parading through the audience and other kinds of interaction; hes from New Orleans, and understands music as a nourishing, everyday social function. But he has intensified the social aspect of performing into a modern virtuosic act, using the dynamics of flash mobs and viral videos.

title: How David Oliver Cohen, Co-Creator of @WhiteGrlProblem on Twitter, Spends His Sundays
description: In 2010, the writer David Oliver Cohen and two collaborators created the Twitter account White Girl Problems, which chronicled the musings of the fictional Babe Walker. It was meant to be a tongue-in-cheek platform for our grievances, said Mr. Cohen, 35. Since then, Babe and her issues (Why do I always feel fat after I eat a banana?) have inspired two books and yielded a movie deal (a third book is to be published next year). A wine, White Girl Ros, was introduced over the summer, and about 120,000 bottles have been sold since July. Mr. Cohen lives with his wife, Cristi Andrews, 35, an actress, and their children, Penelope, 5, and Hal, 3, in the West Village.

title: The 38-Year-Old Frat Boy
description: WERE you in the Army or something? a tall kid in khakis and a polo shirt asked as I refilled my Solo cup for the fifth time that night. You look old for an undergrad.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 1
description: Rihannas block party at the New York Edition hotel, Moncler hosts a dinner for amfAR, Marc Jacobs brings back the Tunnel Club, and more.

title: Arro, a Ride-Hailing App, Connects Directly With Yellow Taxis
description: Uber is a behemoth in New York City. The shared-ride service has more than 20,000 drivers in the city who can be summoned with the tap of a smartphone. Taxi medallion owners have seen the value of their licenses drop precipitously, largely because of Ubers rapid spread.

title: Giants and Eli Manning Agree on Four-Year, $84 Million Extension
description: Rushing to prevent Eli Manning from entering this season in the final year of his contract, which would raise the prospect of Mannings becoming a free agent in 2016, the Giants agreed on Friday to make him one of the highest-paid players in the N.F.L., with a four-year, $84 million contract extension.

title: Jason Wu Spring/Summer 2016
description: Sculptural silhouettes were balanced out by safe colors.

title: The New Jersey Jackals Trumpet Guy
description: Scott Freier is not on the New Jersey Jackals roster, but he does play for the team.

title: 1968 | The Washington Bureau Chief Who Wasnt
description: Abe, do me a favor, James L. Greenfield said to A. M. Rosenthal, the assistant managing editor, as they huddled in a windowless office just outside The Timess main newsroom.

title: Baltimore Mayor Wont Seek Re-election
description: Stephanie Rawlings-Blake said she would not seek re-election, nearly five months after the city erupted in rioting following the death of a man injured in police custody, Freddie Gray.

title: Future-Proofing, With Beer, at Crown Victoria
description: Some pessimists might argue that summer is over. But literalists, pointing to the calendar, can counter that the season doesnt really end for another week and a half. It certainly seemed summery enough one night last week at Crown Victoria, on South Second Street in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, where, in the record-breaking heat, dozens of late-season al fresco diners were breathing in the balmy air while seated around picnic tables in the beer garden. Though September had arrived, the atmosphere seemed more mid-July, with plenty of cold drinks and fried food, a hot breeze blowing off the river and a carefree crowd of revelers.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks homes include a three-bedroom in Mount Kisco, N.Y., and a four-bedroom in Westport, Conn.

title: Homes for Sale in New York andConnecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: New York Comptroller Clashes With Mayor de Blasio Over Shelter Contracts
description: Millions of dollars in payments to dozens of nonprofits that shelter homeless people in New York are being held up by the city comptroller, who said the city was potentially placing shelter residents in unsafe conditions under existing contracts.

title: Penny Arcade is Still a Force in Edinburgh
description: EDINBURGH  In certain ways, Penny Arcade is a quintessential New Yorker. Shes a pink-haired former Warhol superstar who can say been there, done that about a great many things (and does).

title: Hungarians Say Images of Harshness Toward Migrants Are Unfair
description: BUDAPEST  More than 170,000 migrants have crossed the border of Hungary so far this year, taxing its police, transportation system, commerce and finances. With all that, the image that is likely to linger is that of a Hungarian camerawoman sticking out her foot to trip a migrant carrying his young daughter as they ran from the police.

title: Artisanal Satire Straight Out of Brooklyn
description: Two entrepreneurs say theyre trying to build adventures, one stick at a time.

title: A Yankees Speedster With a Surprising Tutor
description: With three weeks left in the regular season, a tight playoff race, like the one between the Yankees and the Toronto Blue Jays, can turn on the most trifling plays, ones that might easily be overlooked on a weeknight in May: a groundout that advances a runner, a bobble that kills a chance to turn a double play, or an outfielders hitting (or missing) the cutoff man.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
Officer Who Arrested James Blake Has History of Force Complaints
description: In 2012, a Queens man said, Officer James Frascatore pulled him over for a broken taillight, opened his car door and punched him three times in the mouth, unprovoked.

title: Catalans Campaigning for Independence March in Barcelona
description: BARCELONA, Spain  More than half a million pro-independence Catalans on Friday took over one of Barcelonas main avenues, as their separatist leaders began their latest attempt to break loose from Spain.

title: What I Love | Kenneth Richard
description: The fashion-designer-turned-publisher lives and works in a modernist house in Connecticut.

title: A Midcentury Retreat for aFashion-Designer-Turned-Publisher
description: Standing by the pool behind his midcentury house in the backwoods of Weston, Conn., Kenneth Richard was taking a breather from preparing for another New York Fashion Week. Its been 18 years since his last runway show, when he was a designer with his own label who showed in the Bryant Park tents and sold his collection to stores like Barneys New York.

title: Kathy Savitt, Yahoos Head of Media, Leaves for Movie Studio
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The executive who expanded Yahoos ambitious efforts to make itself a digital media force is leaving the company after some of its recent projects have struggled to gain attention from viewers and advertisers.

title: Historically Black Colleges and Universities
description: Fall enrollment in 2013 at historically black colleges and universities.

title: Surveillance Video of James Blake Arrest
description: Video footage released by the New York Police Department shows Officer James Frascatores rough handling of the retired tennis star while mistakenly arresting him on Sept. 9.

title: Obama Plans to Host Meeting With Netanyahu
description: Washington  President Obama plans to host Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel for a meeting in November, the White House said on Friday, marking the start of efforts to repair a troubled relationship between the United States and Israel badly frayed over the nuclear agreement with Iran.

title: Gabriela Hearsts Art-Filled Presentation
description: Gabriela Hearsts presentation was as good a way as any to ease into the second official day of fashion week. Held this morning in the designer Lindsey Adelmans SoHo studio, Hearsts models walked around a room filled with an impressive lineup of works by Sol Lewitt, Ad Reinhardt, Robert Ryman, Jasper Johns  and under Adelmans constellation of branching bubble chandeliers.

title: Rosie Assoulins Colorful Pool Party
description: Plenty of maxi skirts to go around for spring/summer 2016.

title: The 9/11 Anniversary Gets Fashion Week Off to a Somber Start
description: New Yorkers huddled in front of their TV screens Friday morning were greeted by a haunting sight: a wrenching replay of the Today show live coverage of the 9/11 terror attacks, broadcast in the post-dawn hours on MSNBC.

title: A Military Base in Brooklyn, Still Active, Has an Unparalleled View
description: Short of removing your shoes, negotiating the checkpoint at Fort Hamilton is a bit like passing through airport security. A photo ID must be presented, followed by a brief background check. The payoff for this minor hassle is admittance to the only active-duty military base in New York City and the Harbor Defense Museum, not to mention an unparalleled view of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.

title: High-Tech Lights to Help Baby Sleep, or Students Stay Alert
description: Like many expecting parents, Tracy Mizraki Kraft in Portola Valley, Calif., worried about how her newborn would sleep. So she paid attention when her doctor handed her a light bulb that he said would help her son do just that.

title: College Football Games to Watch This Weekend
description: Saturday

title: Islamic State Ordnance Shows Traces of Chemical Agents, U.S. Says
description: The United States has confirmed the presence of traces of sulfur mustard, a chemical warfare agent, on fragments of ordnance recently used by the Islamic State in attacks in Syria and Iraq, according to two American officials familiar with the results of laboratory analysis of the samples.

title: Serena Williams Lost, and Her Fans Got Very Mad at Drake
description: After Serena Williamss hopes for a Grand Slam were dashed by an unseeded player at the United States Open on Friday, her fans decided to take their frustration out on Drake.

title: The Political Crisis in Northern Ireland
description: DUBLIN  Northern Ireland was thrown into turmoil this week when the provinces pro-British first minister resigned from the executive branch, taking his partys ministers with him and leaving the government unable to function. Here are answers to some questions about the developments:

title: Officer in Biden Motorcade Is Hurt When Motorcycle Falls in Queens
description: A New York police officer traveling with Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.s motorcade was injured on Friday when the motorcycle he was on fell as the caravan entered Queens, the police said.

title: Garbo, Gloss and Hir
description: In the new dark comedy Hir, a soldier returns stateside after fighting in the Middle East to find a maelstrom back home, including a transgender brother and mother on a radically feminist mission. This being a play by Taylor Mac, the downtown writer and performer known for his flamboyant club-kid-meets-drag-mother persona, neither the patriarchy nor gender norms stand a chance.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: New York and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Rick Perry Ends His Run for President
description: Former Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, his campaign effectively out of money, withdrew from the presidential race Friday afternoon, becoming the first Republican to quit the 2016 contest.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 1
description: Rihannas block party at the New York Edition hotel, Moncler hosts a dinner for amfAR, Marc Jacobs brings back the Tunnel Club, and more. See the photos.

title: Scenario in the Shade
description: A sample from the soundtrack to Scenario in the Shade.

title: September 11, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from New York, Serbia, India and Japan.

title: U.S. Drops Charges That Professor Shared Technology With China
description: WASHINGTON  When the Justice Department arrested the chairman of Temple Universitys physics department this spring and accused him of sharing sensitive American-made technology with China, prosecutors had what seemed like a damning piece of evidence: schematics of sophisticated laboratory equipment sent by the professor, Xi Xiaoxing, to scientists in China.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Off The Runway: Day 2
description: Scenes from the second day of New York Fashion Week

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Lesbian Love Blossoms in New Screen Dramas
description: TORONTO  Loud and proud, Freeheld wears its politics on its working-class sleeve. Subtle and sophisticated, Carol wraps its message in meticulous period costumes and clouds of cigarette smoke.

title: Two Weeks in New York
description: The path to a Grand Slam had been weed-whacked of obstacles, and Serena Williams, maybe the greatest womens tennis player in history having her greatest season, needed to do nothing more than win two matches against two aging Italian players ranked outside the top 20.

title: The Complicated World of Luxury Watches
description: With the rise of digital devices that tell time, track your steps and even pay the dinner bill, it would seem that the demise of the mechanical watch would be fast approaching. But in fact, high-end timepieces are doing just fine. Last year, Switzerland exported a record $24.3 billion worth of them (which says nothing of the equally booming vintage business). And while the Apple watch, which launched in April and sold an estimated 2.5 million units in its first quarter, is likely to affect those numbers, most traditional producers are taking their smart competition in stride. After all, they survived the ravages of the 1970s, when quartz technology made 60,000 watchmakers obsolete. Indeed, the Swiss are in the midst of a horological renaissance in which dedicated collectors wait years  and pay millions  for timepieces that make up for their lack of digital functionality with analog elegance and a promise: Given regular servicing, theyll run in perpetuity.

title: A Promising New Policy for Transgender Inmates
description: Prisons and jails across the country have typically moved to protect the rights and safety of transgender inmates only in response to lawsuits. But the San Francisco Sheriffs Department has taken a proactive step: On Thursday, it unveiled a new policy that will ultimately allow transgender jail inmates to be housed according to their gender identity.

title: For an Immersive Installation, an All-Star Soundtrack
description: When the artist duo Jonah Freeman and Justin Lowe decided they wanted a sound installation to accompany their newest immersive environment, they called on their friend Jennifer Herrema, the frontwoman of the Black Bananas, formerly of Royal Trux. Herrema assembled an impressive group of musicians for the soundtrack, reaching out to her network rather than taking the formal route of going through managers and agents. I kind of just wanted to go at it alone, Herrema says. Just get people that I knew who were fans of Justin and Jonahs work that were predisposed to wanting to be part of it anyway.

title: Blue Jays Rattle Yankees; Mark Teixeira Is Out for the Year
description: If this is how the Yankees began what they acknowledged was their biggest series in three years, they might want to cover their ears and close their eyes for the rest of the weekend.

title: Trumps Campaign Hat Becomes an Ironic Summer Accessory
description: An old-school, wide-brimmed rope hat  some in white and navy, others in red and white  has seemingly become the ironic must-have fashion accessory of the summer.

title: Review: The Resonant Bodies Festival Completes Its Third Year
description: Yeah, were going there, said Amanda DeBoer Bartlett, just before she gave the premiere of Jonathan Sokols Basic Lands on Thursday at the Abrons Arts Center.

title: Report Finds Vulnerabilities in Guardrails Lining U.S. Roads
description: Thousands of guardrails on American roads, made under an old safety standard, may experience problems if hit by vehicles at certain angles or if they were improperly installed, according to federal and state transportation officials.

title: Review: BEAT Festival Opens With a Potpourri
description: It can be hard to follow the BEAT  or at least it was on Thursday, when that annual festival, whose name stands for Brooklyn Emerging Artists in Theater, opened at the Brooklyn Museum with an array of brief performances in comedy, dance, opera, theater and the spoken word. Artists appeared in various museum spaces, but what was the point of it all? Ostensibly meant as a primer for the festival, now in its fourth year, the opening-night presentation came off more like a haphazard trade show.

title: Berlin Airport Used in Cold War Airlift Gets a New Humanitarian Mission
description: BERLIN  The planes touched down every five minutes for months, often cutting through a thick fog to bring food, coal and other supplies to those marooned on an island in a red sea of communism, as the grim joke went.

title: Review: In The Perfect Guy, a Stalker Is Stirred
description: Michael Ealy has a very ominous stare and Sanaa Lathan sells her inconsistent character pretty well, but The Perfect Guy is still just a boilerplate stalker story that proceeds more or less as you suspect it will.

title: Donald Trump Says Ukraine Crisis Reflects Obamas Weakness
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Donald J. Trump made a brief, unusual foray into foreign affairs on Friday, appearing at a conference here via a video link to suggest that the Ukraine crisis was rooted in weakness on the part of President Obama.

title: Amid Violence, Journalists in Turkey Vow to Remain Resilient
description: Journalists covering Turkeys latest military campaign against Kurdish rebels have been been detained, deported and maligned. This week, mobs vandalized the headquarters of Hrriyet, one of the countrys largest newspapers, two days in a row.

title: Book Review Podcast: Fates and Furies
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Robin Black reviews Lauren Groffs third novel, Fates and Furies. Ms. Black writes:

title: Model-Morphosis: Mica Arganaraz at Jason Wu
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in New York.

title: Rick Perrys Campaign: High Points and Low Points
description: Rick Perrys second presidential bid lasted a little more than three months, and while he never reclaimed the top-tier status that he briefly held four years ago, the former Texas governor did have his moments.

title: Russia Fined $44 Million for Refusing to Hand Over Jewish Books
description: In a decision likely to prolong a Russian ban on lending art to American museums, a federal judge on Thursday ordered Russia to pay a fine of $43.7 million for refusing to return a collection of Jewish books and documents to the Hasidic Chabad-Lubavitch group.

title: 4 Pentagon Labs Face Inquiry on Handling of Deadly Germs
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is investigating four Defense Department labs for mishandling deadly germs used in bioterrorism research, a spokesman said Friday.

title: Review: Koosil-ja Embraces Revolution in I Am Capitalism
description: Near the end of the first section of I Am Capitalism, the choreographer Koosil-ja explains the works quixotic aim. Capitalism, she says, is a delirium from which she wishes to awake. She was born into capitalism; it is in her body. But she wants to exorcise it, to erase herself entirely to discover within herself a new type of revolutionary potential.

title: Review: All Beethoven, All Evening, on Period Instruments
description: Critical acclaim for the vital performances and typically adventurous programming of the period-instrument American Classical Orchestra, founded and directed by Thomas Crawford, often comes with a sensible suggestion: It is high time that the ensemble scrap its longstanding motto, Music as the masters heard it. Past time, in fact.

title: Picturing Men
description: HISTORICALLY, images of the male form project strength and power, from heroes in the military and politics to titans of industry. But there is very little imagery depicting men simply going about their lives as men. What of the rich and varied moments that make up real life? Are these not fodder for art?

title: Ex-Officer Seeks Bond in Shooting Death of Walter Scott
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Saying that he hoped to spend time with his young son, a former police officer asked a judge on Friday to release him on bond while he awaits trial in the shooting death of an unarmed black man after a traffic stop in April.

title: Patrick JanelleIs Better at Instagram Than You
California Legislature Approves Assisted Suicide
description: SACRAMENTO  In a landmark victory for supporters of assisted suicide, the California State Legislature on Friday gave its final approval to a bill that would allow doctors to help terminally ill people end their lives.

title: Making Order From Anguish
description: PASTORALFor Ts ongoing series, the poet David Baker and the artist Soo Sunny Park make punctuated order of boundless grief.

title: Blast Kills 7 at Nigerian Camp for People Fleeing Boko Haram
description: A bomb hidden in a tent exploded on Friday at Nigerias largest camp for people who have been displaced by the Boko Haram insurgency, killing at least seven residents, including five children, emergency officials and witnesses said.

title: T Fall Men's Style Issue
description: The latest issue from T focuses on the rich and varied moments that make up the lives of real men  in all their complexity.

title: Alexander McQueens Turbulent Life
description: Lee Alexander McQueen chose to kill himself, with perhaps unintentional resonance, on Thursday, Feb. 11, 2010.

title: Burning Man Ends, and an Event for Law Enforcement Begins
description: BLACK ROCK DESERT, Nev.  The flaming poi sticks, faux-fur leg warmers and silt-caked tents are all gone; the art cars shaped like beasts or boats have driven off, now that yet another Burning Man, the eclectic art party held last week in the Black Rock Desert, has wrapped up for the year.

title: Corporate Accountability
description: To the Editor:

title: An Irony in Jerusalem
description: To the Editor:

title: At Home with Designer Todd Oldham
description: An intimate look at Todd Oldhams home life after leaving the garment trade industry behind.

title: Campus Justice
description: To the Editor:

title: Ohio: Report Says Killing by Officer Was Preventable
description: A University of Cincinnati police officer was not justified in using deadly force in a July 19 traffic stop in which he fatally shot a driver, a consultant hired by the university reported Friday. The security firm Kroll reported that video shot by Officer Raymond Tensings body camera contradicts his central claim, that his arm was caught in Samuel DuBoses car, and he was being dragged. It said Officer Tensing, who has been charged with murder, appeared to have his arm free, and the car had not moved, or had barely moved, when he fired at Mr. DuBose. Calling the shooting entirely preventable, the report faulted both men for needlessly escalating the situation before that point  Mr. DuBose by disobeying the officers instructions and restarting his car, as if to drive off. Kroll also said the university police were unsuited to street-level policing, especially off campus, and should consider narrowing their mission.

title: Germanys Moral Example
description: To the Editor:

title: Cable TV Regulations
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trumps Military Gambit
Djokovic Reaches Fourth Major Final of Year and Will Face Federer
description: The womens final of the United States Open will be an all-Italian matchup that very few people had dared to predict. The mens final, however, is a more predictable matchup of heavyweights.

title: Births to Undocumented Parents Decline
description: About 295,000 babies were born in 2013 to undocumented parents, about 8 percent of all births in the United States that year, according to a study by the Pew Research Center. The number of babies with at least one parent in the United States illegally declined from a peak of about 370,000 in 2007, Pew found. In all, at least 4.5 million children who are American citizens because they were born in the United States have an undocumented immigrant parent. Donald J. Trump, a contender for the Republican presidential nomination, recently stirred debate by calling for a repeal of the constitutional right to birthright citizenship. He said he would deport the 11 million undocumented immigrants in the country and their children, even if they are citizens.

title: 9 Men on Why They Love Their Man Buns
description: The hairstyle is now mainstream, and it can be spotted adorning the crowns of fashion kids, Park Slope stroller dads and Wall Street finance bros.

title: Center to Give Trauma Care on South Side of Chicago
description: CHICAGO  The citys South Side will become home to a medical center able to handle adult patients with some of the most urgent, traumatic health problems, officials announced on Friday, answering what has been a yearslong fight over inequities in health care and the dearth of nearby care for people living in some Chicago neighborhoods.

title: Banks to Settle With Investors in Suit Over Financial Crisis
description: Large banks are preparing to pay $1.865 billion to settle accusations that they conspired unfairly to control a derivatives market that stood at the center of the financial crisis, a lawyer suing the banks said in court on Friday.

title: U.N., Facing Abuse Scandal, to Withhold Pay of Peacekeepers Accused of Misconduct
description: UNITED NATIONS  In his most extensive public remarks since a string of sexual abuse allegations against peacekeepers in the Central African Republic, Herv Ladsous, the United Nations under secretary of peacekeeping affairs, said Friday that he had taken the unprecedented step of suspending the salaries of troops accused of misconduct and had proposed sending soldiers on rest and recreation breaks every few months to relieve stress.

title: In New York, a Win and a Loss on Health
description: The New York City Board of Health reached two important decisions on Wednesday, one decent and one that could have dreadful consequences for some infants.

title: Russias Risky Military Moves in Syria
description: Over the last few months a series of diplomatic meetings from Moscow to Washington raised hopes for a serious new push toward a political solution to the vicious war in Syria that has killed more than 250,000 people and forced thousands more to flee to Europe. That optimistic idea has been put in doubt by Russias recent moves to significantly bolster military support for Syrias ruthless dictator, Bashar al-Assad, whose hold on his country is weakening.

title: Oklahoma Inmate the Focus of Renewed Attention as Execution Date Nears
description: Richard E. Glossip was at the center of a major Supreme Court case this year, arguing along with two other men on Oklahomas death row that the states choice of lethal injection drugs could cause unconstitutional suffering.

title: Save Fetal Tissue Research, and Save Lives
description: The scurrilous attacks on Planned Parenthood  based on hidden-camera videos falsely purporting to show that it illegally sells fetal issue  have turned into attacks on fetal tissue research in Congress and in several state legislatures.

title: Hawking CDs on the Street, Swindlers Find Being Pushy and Persistent Pays
description: Do you like hip-hop?

title: Ryan Roche: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Roches latest collection.

title: Automakers Will Make Automatic Braking Systems Standard in New Cars
description: DETROIT  Federal regulators said on Friday that 10 automakers had agreed to install automatic braking systems, which use sensors to detect potential collisions, as standard equipment in new vehicles.

title: A Mojave Solar Project in the Bighorns Way
description: TWO important environmental imperatives, ecosystem protection and renewable energy development, are squared off against each other in the Soda Mountains of Californias Mojave Desert.

title: Obama Talk With Troops Covers Syria and China
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  President Obama said Friday that the presence of Russian military advisers and equipment in Syria would not change American military strategy in the region, but that Russian support for the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad, could make political reconciliation impossible.

title: Givenchy Show, spring 2016
description: Exquisite variations on a tuxedo dressing theme.

title: Google, Twitter and Publishers Seek Faster Web
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In a world where many people read everything on mobile phones, a few seconds of load time can mean the gain or loss of millions of readers and advertising dollars.

title: Nuclear Deal Sealed, Obama Must Now Make It Work, and Mend Fences
description: WASHINGTON  Having beaten back a congressional campaign to derail his nuclear agreement with Iran, President Obama now faces a panoply of challenges that may be just as daunting: making the deal actually work while repairing relations with disaffected allies and constraining Tehrans regional ambitions.

title: Cheerleaders, Until They See Their N.F.L. Paychecks
description: AS the National Football League starts a new season, millions of Americans will settle in for the next five months to enjoy the thrill of pro football. Forty-five percent of those fans are female, and the league has spent millions of dollars in recent years trying to increase its appeal among women.

title: What a Compelling Blood Pressure Finding Means for Patients
description: A large blood pressure study, funded exclusively by the federal government and using almost entirely generic drugs, ended abruptly more than a year ahead of schedule because the accumulating data were so compelling. Participants who got their systolic blood pressure below 120 had a markedly lower death rate and fewer heart attacks and strokes than those whose goal was a blood pressure below 140.

title: Obama Addresses Troops About 9/11
description: The president, speaking at Fort Meade, reflected on the 14th anniversary of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.

title: Police Officer Beaten to Death in Nepal Amid Protests Over Draft Constitution
description: DHULIKHEL, Nepal  An injured riot police officer was dragged from an ambulance in southern Nepal on Friday and beaten to death, officials said, the latest flash of violence in several weeks of protests over a draft constitution.

title: With an Invitation, a Gender Barrier at Harvard Falls
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  As exclusive all-male clubs at Harvard go, the Spee Club may have seemed relatively progressive. The 163-year-old organization admitted Catholics at the turn of the 20th century, Jews in the 1930s and blacks in the 1960s.

title: Opposition in Venezuela Is Unsettled by Leaders Sentence
description: CARACAS  A year ago Leopoldo Lpez, a Venezuelan opposition leader, walked at the head of rallies of tens of thousands of people, calling for the exit of President Nicols Maduro and setting off a wave of demonstrations and unrest as the country boiled with discontent. But on Friday, only a few hundred people showed up at a demonstration to support him, a day after he was convicted and sentenced to nearly 14 years in jail for his role in leading last years protests.

title: All-Italian Open Final Is an Unlikely First
description: Flavia Pennetta sat in the main interview room at the United States Open an hour after her stunning semifinal romp over No. 2-seeded Simona Halep, as Serena Williams smoothly won the first set of her semifinal match against 43rd-ranked Roberta Vinci.

title: Hometown Salute for 3 Boyhood Friends Who Thwarted Train Attack in France
description: SACRAMENTO  In bursts of fluttering ticker tape and amid peals of cheers on Friday, this city reclaimed the somber date of Sept. 11 as a day of celebration. Under the blazing California sun, an exuberant parade unfurled through the streets in honor of the three young natives who last month tackled a would-be terrorist on a speeding train in France, likely preventing untold casualties.

title: Notre Dames Big Bluff
description: Has there ever been a university whose success was more dependent on football than Notre Dame?

title: New Orleans Mayor Avoids House Arrest in Labor Dispute
description: NEW ORLEANS  Mayor Mitch Landrieu narrowly avoided being placed on house arrest after the Louisiana Supreme Court granted a stay late Friday on a court order that would have sanctioned him for the citys failure to come up with a plan to pay New Orleans firefighters $75 million in back pay.

title: Rick Perry Meets His Alamo
description: Rick Perry  out!

title: Lack of Respect for Obama Emboldened Putin, Donald Trump Tells Ukrainians
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Donald J. Trump, the Republican presidential candidate, made a brief, unusual foray into foreign affairs on Friday, appearing at a conference here via video link to suggest that the Ukraine crisis was rooted in what he called weakness by President Obama.

title: Justice Dept. Says Hillary Clinton Had Authority to Delete Certain Emails
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department said in a court filing this week that Hillary Rodham Clinton had the authority to delete emails that she did not believe were government records from the personal account that she exclusively used while secretary of state.

title: Three the Hard Way
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Philosophical question: Are you willing to set aside less-than-desirable fill in a crossword puzzle if there are some absolutely stunning long entries screaming at you from the grid? And does that stunning fill make up for the less-than-desirable fill, or do you see it as merely a distraction from things that are wrong with it?

title: Newark Boy, 3, Is Fatally Struck by Suspects Car in Police Chase
description: NEWARK  A 3-year-old boy, carrying his new Spider-Man book bag, stopped with his mother at an intersection here Friday morning as they were walking to his day care center. He was excited and wore a blue-and-yellow uniform, his family members said.

title: William H. Grier, Psychiatrist Who Delved Into Black Rage in 1960s, Dies at 89
description: William H. Grier, a psychiatrist whose book Black Rage, written with his colleague Price M. Cobbs, drew widespread attention to the psychic damage inflicted by racism and the causes of black anger, a topic of intense interest in the aftermath of the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., died on Sept. 3 at a hospice in Carlsbad, Calif. He was 89.

title: Bill Cunningham | Fashion Kaleidoscope
description: Four important ideas from the past spring and summer.

title: Givenchy: Spring 2016 RTW
description: See the first Riccardo Tisci collection shown at New York Fashion Week.

title: Bill Cunningham | Fashion Kaleidoscope
description: An army of promoters and press agents are determined to turn New York Fashion Week into entertainment and build their own power base in the money-making industry. But the simple fact remains: Fashion is about commerce, not entertainment. Once the show is over, and the celebrities have left in their borrowed (or free) clothes, its the private women who pay for their own clothes who are the final arbitrators of fashion. Shown here are four important ideas from the past spring and summer.

title: Queen Betrays No Relief in Defeat
description: After losing in the United States Open semifinal to Roberta Vinci, an unseeded Italian, Serena Williams should have exhaled with such force that the grandstands surrounding her rumbled.

title: Chromat: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Designs from Becca McCharen, focusing on swimwear, lingerie and architectural cages.

title: Evening Hours | Summers Sunset
description: The party season begins in earnest.

title: Kyle Busch Overcomes Injury and Missed Races to Be a Favorite in the Chase for the Sprint Cup
description: The final Sprint Cup race of Nascars regular season, to be run Saturday night at Richmond International Raceway in Virginia, will set the field for the 10-race playoff that begins next week. But it is not hard to pick the favorites and the long shots for this years championship.

title: Obama Wont Stay at Waldorf Astoria for U.N. Event; Security Concerns Are Cited
description: WASHINGTON  With Chinese spies rummaging through White House emails, President Obama has decided not to risk making their spying any easier: He will break with tradition and abandon the Waldorf Astoria, which was bought last year by Chinese investors with deep ties to Beijings ruling elite, when he attends the United Nations General Assembly next week.

title: Steven Matz Struggles, but His Mets Teammates Pick Him Up
description: ATLANTA  As soon as Steven Matz saw his sinker miss the strike zone for Ball 4, he turned and grimaced. He had loaded the bases with two outs in the fourth inning of a one-run game. He stomped around the mound, picked up the rosin bag for a moment and immediately hurled it down. He looked upset, as if he knew that he knew better.

title: After Lottery in New York to See Pope Francis, Some Winners Scalp Tickets Online
description: About 40,000 New York area residents learned on Thursday that they had won two tickets in a city-sponsored lottery to watch Pope Francis procession through Central Park on Sept. 25.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 10 P.M. (HBO) FERRELL TAKES THE FIELD On Sept. 8, 1965, the shortstop Bert Campaneris of the Kansas City Athletics became the first person to play every position in a single major league game as part of a stunt to draw crowds during a losing season. On March 12, Will Ferrell recreated the feat by visiting five Arizona ballparks during spring training and playing every position for 10 teams on the same day. Mr. Campaneris joins Mr. Ferrell in this special, a collaboration between Funny or Die and Major League Baseball to benefit organizations dedicated to fighting cancer. (Image: Mr. Ferrell taking the field.)

title: Quotation of the Day
description: But today is my day. Sorry, guys.

title: Editors Note: September 12, 2015
description: A chart published on Thursday about Democrats in Congress who opposed the nuclear agreement with Iran oversimplified a complex aspect of the debate  the views of Jewish members of Congress and the divisions among American Jews over the deal.

title: Bwahahahaha
A Look Back and A Nod to Others
description: While writing my farewell piece, I had a good time revisiting some of my favorite columns from over the years:

title: Man Buns Are Holding On in Brooklyn
description: Initially popularized by Brooklyn bartenders, professional athletes and, of course, Jared Leto, the man bun bestowed its wearer with a certain cachet: He was stylish, comfortable with his masculinity and needed to keep his mane out of harms way while changing Marconi light bulbs.

title: Todd Oldhams Life After Fashion
description: Todd Oldham can recall the precise moment he lost interest in fashion. It was back in 1997, and he was working on an emerald green silk satin shift that Cindy Crawford would wear in his spring runway show. The dress looked sweet and simple, but its construction was anything but. With ribbon straps made in France and fabric woven in South Korea, the piece was silk-screened with a print of a cherry tree made by Mr. Oldham on acetate, over which the designer painted a spray of cherry blossoms that were embroidered with freshwater pearls back in Texas, where his clothes were put together in his familys factory.

title: Karlie Kloss and Christy Turlington: Supermodels Then and Now
description: Technically, the term supermodel predates the 1980s, but that is when we civilians first knew who they were: Linda, Naomi and Christy. (Evangelista, Campbell and Turlington.) Famously called the Trinity, they were the first fashion models to challenge the celebrity of movie stars. And they were everywhere: not only modeling, but also appearing in music videos, on talk shows, and palling around together in the pages of celebrity magazines.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted by @nytimes took Instagram followers from Lower Manhattan to the hilltop village of Civita di Bagnoregio.

title: With Jeremy Corbyn Elected as New Leader, Britains Labour Party Takes a Hard Left Turn
description: LONDON  After three decades as a political outsider and clarion of the left, Jeremy Corbyn on Saturday won the leadership of Britains opposition Labour Party with an emphatic victory and a program that includes expanding the economy, scrapping nuclear missiles and dismantling the centrist policies of his predecessors, including former Prime Minister Tony Blair.

title: A Decline in the Nutritional Value of Crops
description: Q. Is todays food less nutritious than it was in the past because agricultural soil is being depleted of minerals?

title: Sailing Was More Than Respite for Roosevelt and Kennedy
description: Politicians who sail may be vulnerable to complaints that the sport seems expensive and elitist. But there were two presidents in the last century who were serious sailors, and both succeeded in weaving the pastime into their political identities.

title: Warm, Cozy Knits at Ryan Roche
description: Pretty in a palette of pinks, beige and pale taupe for spring/summer 2016.

title: Explosion in India Town Kills Dozens
description: NEW DELHI  A powerful explosion ripped through a shop in a town in central India on Saturday, causing the collapse of nearby buildings, including a restaurant, and killing at least 89 people, police and medical officials said Saturday.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Android Pay and Apple Products
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the industry.

title: Restricting Access to a Roof Deck
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: The Daily Shoe: Givenchy
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Givenchys Bejeweled Masks and (Almost) Bare Faces
description: Givenchys spring/summer 2016 show last night was every bit the spectacle, and the makeup was no exception  most notably on the faces of four models, who wore elaborate bejeweled masks that were applied directly onto their skin. If Tiscis tuxedo-inspired black-and-white collection suggested a night at the opera, then these were his take on the four horsemen of the apocalypse. A painstaking process comprising gold, pearl and white beading, pieces of fabric, and professional adhesive, the entire undertaking required nearly seven hours to complete makeup artist Pat McGraths vision.

title: Why the Fed Raised Interest Rates
description: Officials said the economy was strong enough to keep growing with a little less help from the central bank. They said rates would rise slowly, but borrowing costs already have started to climb.

title: The Feds Policy Mechanics Retool for a Rise in Interest Rates
description: Its easy to take for granted the Federal Reserves ability to raise interest rates. Even among the legions who doubt that Fed officials will pick the ideal moment to start increasing rates for the first time since 2008, few question the Feds technical competence. The central bank has a long history. The engine is known to work.

title: Eastern Blocs Resistance to Refugees Highlights Europes Cultural and Political Divisions
description: WARSAW  Even though the former Communist countries of Central and Eastern Europe have been asked to accept just a tiny fraction of the refugees that Germany and other nations are taking, their fierce resistance now stands as the main impediment to a unified European response to the crisis.

title: Variety: Spiral Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Its tough to call, but these Spiral puzzles by Will Shortz rank pretty highly on my list of favorite variety puzzles. I really like watching the words and phrases come together as I toggle back and forth between the Inward and Outward clues.

title: Scenes from Givenchys New York Spectacle
description: Last nights show on Pier 26 brought out beaded face masks, a 9/11 tribute and Nicki Minaj.

title: Givenchys Giant New York Spectacle
description: Guests were told to bring government-issued identification to the Givenchy show, which was held last night on Manhattans Pier 26  an enormous space jutting into the Hudson River and in the shadow of the Freedom Tower. They were greeted by a set of recycled industrial materials crafted into giant pillars where performance artists (under the direction of Marina Abramovic) stood. Atop one pillar, a couple moved in different stages of embrace; under another, a woman in a white dress shirt stood quietly under a running shower. A monk chanted through the loudspeakers. The 11th of September is the most sad day in recent American history, wrote Abramovic in her notes for the show. As the artistic director, I want to create something respectful and humble.

title: Special Offer, Time Machine Not Included
description: In this episode, a small rebate debacle, one that the Haggler idiotically assumed would be resolved with a polite nudge. To this, dear reader, you are no doubt muttering, Rebates are always complicated, Haggler. You are an idiot. Yes, concurs the Haggler. That is why he used the word idiotically in the first sentence.

title: The Daily Do: Zimmermann
description: Nicki and Simone Zimmermann, the sisters behind the romantic and always-pretty line Zimmermann, complemented their Victorian-inspired collection yesterday with a rebellious twist: messy updos with purposeful flyaways. The careless knots beautifully offset the collection and were framed on both sides with metallic gold-and-silver-leaf barrettes created by Brent Lawler.

title: Patty Stonesifer of Marthas Table: Zigzag Your Way to the Top
description: This interview with Patty Stonesifer, chief executive of Marthas Table, a provider of food and clothing for low-income people, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: With Website to Research Colleges, Obama Abandons Ranking System
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Saturday abandoned his two-year effort to have the government create a system that explicitly rates the quality of the nations colleges and universities, a plan that was bitterly opposed by presidents at many of those institutions.

title: Lacoste: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Lacoste spring 2016 collection.

title: Serena Williams Legacy Extends Beyond Grand Slam Bid
description: Richard Williams had just turned off his daughters match against Roberta Vinci when he picked up my call.

title: Kim Suozzis Last Wishes
description: Kim knew she was dying, but she believed that cryonic preservation had a 1 or 2 percent chance of offering her another shot at life. And for that, it was worth trying.

title: The Neuroscience of Immortality
description: New efforts to understand the brain are generating methods that make mind uploading seem at least a bit more plausible. Here is a look at how close, and far, we are to each requirement for keeping the brain alive after death.

title: The Fashion News to Know Today
description: Live from New York, it was Givenchy

title: A Dying Young Womans Hope in Cryonics and a Future
description: In the moments just before Kim Suozzi died of cancer at age 23, it fell to her boyfriend, Josh Schisler, to follow through with the plan to freeze her brain.

title: Lacostes Seasonal Take on the Sporty
description: Models wore mesh, tailored seersucker and backpacks for spring/summer 2016.

title: Different Tones on the State of America
description: A look at the language some Republican candidates are using to describe the country as they seek their partys nomination for president.

title: Gloomy Republican Campaigns Leave Behind Reagan Cheer
description: To listen to the way some Republicans tell it, America is a pretty awful place these days.

title: Scenes From Givenchys Raucous After-Party
description: After the show, revelers including Kim Kardashian and Steven Tyler celebrated long into the night.

title: Investigations Stymied in Malaysia, Critics of Najib Razak Take Their Case Global
description: PENANG, Malaysia  Since reports first surfaced alleging that hundreds of millions of dollars had been transferred into the personal accounts of the Malaysian prime minister, investigations into the scandal have met stiff government resistance.

title: Phillies G.M. Exits on Down Note
description: In his last act as the general manager of the Philadelphia Phillies, Ruben Amaro Jr. was left to dismantle the decaying team he had helped build. A year ago, the Phillies were still stocked with stalwarts from their championship teams, like Chase Utley, Cole Hamels and Jimmy Rollins. But Amaro traded them all  plus Jonathan Papelbon, Ben Revere and others  before the team fired him on Thursday.

title: At Michigan State, Thriving on Saturdays With Help of Sundaes
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.  For years, the most popular flavor at the Michigan State Dairy Store was Blueberry Pie: vanilla ice cream, blueberry swirl and pie flakes. Then, 10 years ago, the store introduced Sesquicentennial Swirl in recognition of Michigan States founding in 1855 and began concocting flavors to represent the other Big Ten colleges.

title: Walt Disney, a Visionary Who Was Crazy Like a Mouse
description: Here is something that might surprise you: Walt Disney, that icon of American ingenuity, was in financial straits through most of his career. You probably thought he would have been a business genius  a model for others to study. But Disney was an atrocious businessman, constantly running his company into the ground. At the same time, though, he was a corporate visionary whose aversion to typical business practices led to the colossus that the Walt Disney Company became.

title: Playing the Confidence Game
Jenna Miller: Demystifier of Genetic Disorders
description: Jenna Miller, 25, is a genetic counselor with Recombine, a genetic testing company in New York.

title: Body of U.S. Tourist in Spain Is Found, and Arrest Is Made
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The Spanish police on Saturday identified a body found on a farm in northern Spain as that of an American tourist who disappeared  five months ago as she walkedalong the Camino de Santiago, an ancient Catholic pilgrimage route.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: The Golden Age for Women in TV Is Actually a Rerun
description: Los Angeles  NOT long ago, I recommended a young woman for a job in late-night TV and when we met face to face to celebrate her getting hired, we made a charming discovery: She was born in 1987, the same year that I got my first job on a late night show.

title: G.O.P. Anti-Gay Bigotry Threatens First Amendment
description: This past June, in the heat of their outrage over gay rights, congressional Republicans revived a nasty bit of business they call the First Amendment Defense Act. It would do many things, but one thing it would not do is defend the First Amendment. To the contrary, it would deliberately warp the bedrock principle of religious freedom under the Constitution.

title: Miss America, My Guilty Pleasure
description: Sunday night, I will do what Ive done ever since I was a girl. Ill turn on the TV, settle into the couch and then, with the remote at my side, guilt in my heart and, possibly, an actual scorecard in my hand, I will judge other women as I watch Miss America.

title: The Popes Marriage Endgame
description: ITS been 18 months since Pope Francis invited Cardinal Walter Kasper to raise anew the argument that divorced and remarried Catholics should be allowed to receive communion. That invitation touched off a civil war within the churchs hierarchy, pitting cardinal against cardinal, theologian against theologian; the conflict has reverberated across books, speeches, and op-ed pages, and its dominated the churchs synod on the family, whose second meeting looms this fall.

title: Northern Ireland Must Resist Pull of the Past
description: Ending the power-sharing provincial government in Northern Ireland will serve no good purpose, either for Protestant unionists or Catholic nationalists. The only ones who gain are the dark forces on both sides who remain consumed by sectarian hatred and violence, nearly two decades after the Good Friday peace agreement promised a better future.

title: Candidates Afloat on a Sluice of Money
description: When the Republican presidential candidates debate this week, it would help if voters could hear them offer detailed proposals for dealing with the 800-pound fat cat in the room  superrich donors who are making enormous, often untraceable contributions that undoubtedly tie candidates to special-interest agendas.

title: A Farewell
description: THIS is my last regular opinion column on food for The Times. Im leaving to take a central role in a year-old food company, to do what Ive been writing about these many years: to make it easier for people to eat more plants. (Oh, say my friends, you move to California and join a start-up. Yup. Corny as can be.) I see it as putting philosophy into action and will talk about details soon.

title: How to Measure a Colleges Value
description: WE know all too well which colleges are the hardest to get into. The news media swoons over and trumpets this information, which is advertised as well by the most selective schools themselves.

title: The Next Genocide
description: New Haven  BEFORE he fired the shot, the Einsatzgruppe commander lifted the Jewish child in the air and said, You must die so that we can live. As the killing proceeded, other Germans rationalized the murder of Jewish children in the same way: them or us.

title: Tovah Klein
description: Tovah Klein is the director of the Barnard Center for Toddler Development. Her research focuses on how toddlers as well as their parents develop and thrive.

title: Are College Lectures Unfair?
description: DOES the college lecture discriminate? Is it biased against undergraduates who are not white, male and affluent?

title: What the Privileged Poor Can Teach Us
description: SELECTIVE colleges look nothing like they did 20 years ago. In the late 1990s, they began adopting no-loan policies to promote socioeconomic diversity. Princeton kicked things off in 1998. Amherst College followed in 1999 and has been a leader in creating diverse classes ever since. Spurred by a combination of blistering reports that documented the loss in human capital caused by financial barriers to college attendance and by politicians like Senator Charles E. Grassley, Republican of Iowa, who admonished colleges for not spending more of their endowments on access, 48 schools adopted similar policies in 2007 and 2008. Many people celebrated the opening of college doors to a broader array of students. I benefited myself from these new policies.

title: There Is No Theory of Everything
description: Over the years, I have had the good fortune to teach a lot of graduate students, mostly in philosophy, and have noticed a recurring fact. Behind every new graduate student stands an undergraduate teacher. This is someone who opened the students eyes and ears to the possibility of the life of the mind that they had perhaps imagined but scarcely believed was within their reach. Someone who, through the force of their example, animated a desire to read more, study more and know more. Someone in whom the student heard something fascinating or funny or just downright strange. Someone who heard something significant in what the student said in a way that gave them confidence and self-belief. Such teachers are the often unknown and usually unacknowledged (and underpaid) heroes of the world of higher education.

title: U.S.T.A.s Dabble in Blue Becomes a Tidal Wave
description: Tennis has spent the last decade in a blue period that even Picasso would have marveled at.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 2
description: Kim Kardashian, Courtney Love and other stars party with Riccardo Tisci at Givenchys downtown rave.

title: Writings Offer Encyclopedic Insight on Winners of Grand Slams
description: When Don Budge scored the first grand slam sweep in 1938, Allison Danzig of The New York Times attributed Budges victories to his murderous backhand and volcanic serve.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 2
description: Kim Kardashian, Courtney Love and other stars party with Riccardo Tisci at Givenchys downtown rave. See the photos.

title: Scott Walker Cancels Stops to Focus on Iowa and South Carolina
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is refocusing his Republican presidential campaign on Iowa and South Carolina, where his early popularity in opinion polls has crumbled with the ascent of Donald J. Trump, and he has taken the unusual step of canceling major speeches in Michigan and California this coming week to spend time in those two crucial states.

title: A Journeywoman Hopes to Lead a Protge Beyond Her Footsteps
description: There was a time, only a few years ago, when Ann Grossman had to buy tickets to the United States Open. If she had advanced one round further in 1994, to the quarterfinals, she would have earned a lifetime pass to the grounds for the tournament.

title: With Words at Play, Tom Coughlin Motivates the Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  It was just before 8 a.m. Wednesday in the auditorium at the Giants training complex. Somewhat sleepily, more than 50 players were assembled in wide rows and cozy seats as Coach Tom Coughlin marched briskly across the stage to a lectern in front of a 20-foot-wide projection screen.

title: From Somaliland to Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  OF the millions of young men and women settling into college dorms this month, one of the most unlikely is Abdisamad Adan, a 21-year-old beginning his freshman year at Harvard. Some of his 18 siblings are illiterate and never went even to first grade, and he was raised without electricity or indoor plumbing by an illiterate grandmother in a country that doesnt officially exist.

title: The Google Art Heist
description: PARIS  JUST seeing the Crayola colors painted on the tall iron fence of the 18th-century hotel particulier made me shiver. The big panda in flip flops in the lobby, arms up in greeting, scared me. And the petite ham sandwiches getting wheeled around to Google staffers looked positively menacing.

title: Giants at Cowboys Matchup
description: 8:30 p.m., NBC

title: Unorthodox Candidates
description: Readers discuss the appeal of those running without strong ties to political parties.

title: Browns at Jets Matchup
description: 1 p.m., CBS

title: Flavia Pennetta Defeats Roberta Vinci for U.S. Open Title
description: Storm clouds were gathering overhead and the wind was kicking up as Flavia Pennetta and Roberta Vinci walked off the court together, having played the first all-Italian womens final in the history of the United States Open. While they sat in their chairs waiting for the trophy ceremony to begin, Pennetta leaned over to whisper a secret to Vinci, her friend of more than 20 years.

title: Rosie Assoulin: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The latest collection from this years winner of the CFDA Swarovski Award for Womenswear.

title: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer, the Best Rivalry Going, Take Center Stage Again
description: The golden age of mens tennis has been all about rivalries: about fans playing favorites and making long-term commitments; about the same establishment figures colliding again and again with major trophies at stake.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Notre Dame Should Look To Ivy League For an Ideal

title: Are Western Values Losing Their Sway?
description: London  THE West is suddenly suffused with self-doubt.

title: Mod Touches at Rebecca Minkoff
description: The designer showed mini skirts, stacked heels and fringed bags for spring/summer 2016.

title: Bernie Sanders and the Black Vote
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Democratic presidential hopeful Senator Bernie Sanders spoke Saturday to a half-empty gymnasium at Benedict College in South Carolina. The school is historically black, but the crowd appeared to be largely white.

title: To Put It Differently
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  There does not appear to be an official name for the type of puzzle Im thinking about, but Joe DiPietros crossword reminded me of the puzzles I solved as a kid, in which words were configured in unusual ways and were meant to convey an entirely different word or phrase. I loved those, and todays puzzle took me back to that fun time.

title: Why Russians Hate America. Again.
description: MOSCOW  ON a warm August evening, I found myself sitting with three educated young Russians at the Beverly Hills Diner, a chain restaurant whose gaudy dcor includes human-size figures of Porky Pig and Marilyn Monroe.

title: Brooks Brothers: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The first collection designed for Brooks Brothers by Zac Posen.

title: Blue Jays Counter Yankees Every Move in an Emphatic Doubleheader Sweep
description: It took 4 hours 32 minutes to complete Game 1 of a single-admission doubleheader at Yankee Stadium on Saturday, and by the end of it, the Yankees looked exhausted and deflated. They had expended six relievers, two pinch-runners and a pinch-hitter. The Toronto Blue Jays had answered every strategic move.

title: Review: The Broad Is an Old-Fashioned Museum for a New Gilded Age
description: LOS ANGELES  Traditional art museums are some of the most conservative and controlling institutions on earth. They are built as vaults to preserve the past, and as monuments to edited histories. In the Gilded Age America of a century or so ago, many new museums were also monuments to private collectors  Henry Clay Frick, J. P. Morgan, Isabella Stewart Gardner  who strove to shape and fix an image that history would have of them, as enlightened power brokers of their day and benefactors to the future.

title: Body Blow on Texas Referee Shakes School and Sport
description: SAN ANTONIO  In a state where football rules the sports world, where Friday night lights blaze over hundreds of high school stadiums at the start of every autumn weekend, the John Jay Mustangs have seldom been on center stage.

title: In Pakistan, U.S. Aid Agencys Efforts Face Skepticism
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  The ads are a staple of Pakistani television: footage of water gushing through dams, farmers standing in green fields, a girl using a computer. At the end, the red, white and blue logo of an aid organization flashes on the screen with its slogan, from the American people.

title: Justice Breyer Sees Value in a Global View of Law
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Justice Stephen G. Breyers modest study in his home here is nothing like his grand chambers at the Supreme Court. Cluttered and lived in, it bears signs of a restless intellect and a doting grandfather. The bookshelves are stuffed with volumes of law and literature, and a large dollhouse sits on the floor.

title: Christian Siriano: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Sirianos spring 2016 collection.

title: A Hunting Ban Saps a Villages Livelihood
description: SANKUYO, Botswana  Lions have been coming out of the surrounding bush, prowling around homes and a small health clinic, to snatch goats and donkeys from the heart of this village on the edge of one of Africas great inland deltas. Elephants, too, are becoming frequent, unwelcome visitors, gobbling up the beans, maize and watermelons that took farmers months to grow.

title: Premier Quits With Cabinet, Roiling Egypt
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, accepted the resignation of his prime minister and cabinet on Saturday after a series of high-profile accusations of corruption.

title: Baja East: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The latest collection from Scott Studenberg and John Targon.

title: Altuzarra: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Joseph Altuzarras spring 2016 show.

title: Yemen Air Campaigns Heavy Toll
description: Of the many perils Yemens civilians have faced during six months of war, none has been as deadly as the airstrikes by a Saudi-led military coalition.

title: Airstrikes Take Toll on Civilians in Yemen War
description: HAJJA, Yemen  The airstrike slammed into Al-Sham water-bottling plant at the end of the night shift, killing 13 workers who were minutes away from heading home.

title: James Blake Says Officer Who Arrested Him Should Be Fired, for a Start
description: James Blake stepped into a car on his way to the United States Open this week, his body a bit sore and his credit cards having just been taken from him and rifled through. During the 10 minutes the retired tennis star recalled spending in handcuffs, Mr. Blake said, the words N.Y.P.D. officer, law, or policeman had never been spoken.

title: Flavia Pennetta Wins U.S. Open Final
description: With the surprise announcement on the court that she would retire at the end of the year, Flavia Pennettas first major title will also be her last.

title: Donald Trump Gets Rock Star Greeting in Iowa
description: AMES, Iowa  It probably made sense on paper: invite presidential candidates to visit the Iowa Republican Partys tent in the parking lot before the big Iowa vs. Iowa State football game on Saturday.

title: Calibrating the Shock Value of Serena Williamss Monumental U.S. Open Loss
description: Serena Williamss loss to Roberta Vinci was, beyond any reasonable doubt, a gargantuan upset.

title: Leaders of Moreland Commission Panel Felt Cuomo Intervened, Prosecutors Say
description: Senior officials of a state anticorruption commission shut down last year by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo have told federal prosecutors that they believed he and his staff intervened in its operations in a manner that, at times, led them to question the independence of the panel, the prosecutors said in a recent letter.

title: Nashvilles Mayor-Elect Finds Path Between Liberalism and Commerce
description: NASHVILLE  In her acceptance speech on Thursday, Mayor-elect Megan Barry, a candidate characterized as a purveyor of extreme leftist views in a bruising runoff here, mentioned the various residents who would write the next chapter for this fast-growing Southern city. In a notably nonextreme move, she spoke first of the citys business community.

title: 2015 Heisman Trophy Watch
description: A look at the top players in contention for college footballs highest honor.

title: Labor Parade Marches Along Fifth Avenue in Manhattan
description: Scenes from the annual Labor Day Parade

title: After Body Blow in Eighth, the Mets Rally and Fatten Their Lead by Another Game
description: ATLANTA  When the ball left Adonis Garcias bat, everyone on the field knew it was gone. Garcia emphatically flipped his bat. Tyler Clippard, the Mets otherwise dominant setup man, watched the ball for a second and then hung his head. Yoenis Cespedes, the left fielder, turned and just watched the three-run home run go.

title: Three Inmates Killed as Violence Breaks Out at Oklahoma Prison
description: A prison in central Oklahoma was rocked by violence for the second time in four months on Saturday when rioting broke out, killing three inmates and injuring five others, officials said.

title: In Case You Missed It: Top Articles of the Week
description: Catch up with the most-read sports stories in The New York Times from Sept. 4 to Sept. 10.
