Maier and Mr. Maier II of Reading, Pa. The Rev. Daniel O'Reilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel in New York.

title: Alyshia Ledlie, Sumedh Joshi
description: Alyshia Marcus Ledlie and Sumedh Mohan Joshi were married Saturday at the Paniolo Ranch in Boerne, Tex. Pandit Achala C. Bapat, a Hindu priest, officiated. Later that day, the couple had a second ceremony that was led by Matthew G. Ledlie, a brother of the bride, who incorporated Christian traditions, and Sarang Joshi, the grooms brother, who assisted in leading the bride and groom in an exchange of vows and rings.

title: Katherine Abbey, Derek Prill
description: Katherine Taylor Abbey, the daughter of Nancy R. Abbey and Douglas D. Abbey of San Francisco, was married Saturday to Derek Collins Prill, a son of Janet C. Prill and David A. Prill of New Canaan, Conn., at St. Pauls Episcopal Church on Nantucket, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Gale Davis, the interim rector at the church, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Frannie Hall Kieschnick, an Episcopal priest from San Francisco, delivering the homily.

title: Elisa Li, Karl Lubin
description: Elisa Li, the daughter of Suet Ping Li of Brooklyn, was married Saturday to Karl Gustaf Lubin, the son of Elizabeth Warner Lubin and David M. Lubin of Winston-Salem, N.C. Catherine M. Ballone, a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Farm at Pond Lily, an events space in Elizaville, N.Y.

title: Alexander Wang: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Wangs spring 2016 show.

title: At Alexander Wang, Athleisure Meets 90s Grunge
description: For his 10th-anniversary collection, the designer brought out crop tops, overalls and bucket hats.

title: Altuzarras Play on Luxe Fabrics
description: For his spring/summer 2016 collection, the designer showed everything from beaded dresses to crocodile-skin coats.

title: Michigan State Survives Oregon With Late Defensive Stand
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.  This was the early-season college football equivalent of a blockbuster movie sequel, with No. 5 Michigan State and No. 7 Oregon hoping the new edition would be as good as the original.

title: Floyd Mayweather Finishes Bout, and Maybe His Career, With Lopsided Win Over Andre Berto
description: LAS VEGAS  Even as he said that Saturday night was his boxing swan song, Floyd Mayweather Jr. continued to show the swagger and the skill that have been the hallmarks of his 19-year career.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (13) ARTHUR & GEORGE Arthur Conan Doyle (Martin Clunes) puts his reputation and that of his creation, Sherlock Holmes, on the line as he continues his efforts to exonerate George Edalji (Arsher Ali), an Anglo-Indian lawyer imprisoned for mutilating livestock  and threatening schoolgirls with worse  in 1903 Staffordshire. Charles Edwards plays Conan Doyles secretary, Alfred Wood  that is, his Dr. Watson  in this adaptation of Julian Barness novel. In Sherlock, Series III: The Sign of Three, at 9, Holmes (Benedict Cumberbatch), the best man at the wedding of Watson (Martin Freeman) to Mary Morstan (Amanda Abbington), finds his attention diverted as a murder is plotted. (Image: Mr. Freeman, left, and Mr. Cumberbatch.)

title: Corrections: September 13, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Here I am, driving on a road that was built with European Union money. It was built with money taken from taxpayers in Italy and Germany and France. Now we refuse to do our part?

title: Labour Partys Jeremy Corbyn May Help Tories in Next British Elections
description: Jeremy Corbyn, the new leader of the opposition Labour Party, has stopped wearing T-shirts in public and now favors blue shirts and darker jackets. But even with his more prime ministerial attire, it is difficult to imagine a British electorate that just handed Conservatives a parliamentary majority turning to a party that has lurched so far to the left.

title: TV Bundles Challenge Apple to Make a Deal
description: Never let it be said that Apple releases products quietly. In an event on Wednesday that lasted more than two hours, the Silicon Valley giant unveiled new iPhones, a really large new iPad and  for the fashionable among us  nice, new watchbands.

title: Why You Shouldnt Pay Children for Grades
description: My kids job is school. So why shouldnt I pay her for good grades? After all, I get paid for the work I do.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your week.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Dallas Cowboys vs. New York Giants Matchup
description: Giants at Cowboys

title: Denver Broncos vs. Baltimore Ravens Matchup
description: Ravens at Broncos

title: Seattle Seahawks vs. St. Louis Rams Matchup
description: Seahawks at Rams

title: Green Bay Packers vs. Chicago Bears Matchup
description: Packers at Bears

title: Houston Texans vs. Kansas City Chiefs Matchup
description: Chiefs at Texans

title: Oakland Raiders vs. Cincinnati Bengals Matchup
description: Bengals at Raiders

title: San Diego Chargers vs. Detroit Lions Matchup
description: Lions at Chargers

title: Arizona Cardinals vs. New Orleans Saints Matchup
description: Saints at Cardinals

title: Buffalo Bills vs. Indianapolis Colts Matchup
description: Colts at Bills

title: Jacksonville Jaguars vs. Carolina Panthers Matchup
description: Panthers at Jaguars

title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers vs. Tennessee Titans Matchup
description: Titans at Buccaneers

title: New York Jets vs. Cleveland Browns Matchup
description: Browns at Jets

title: Washington Redskins vs. Miami Dolphins Matchup
description: Dolphins at Redskins

title: A Smooth Recovery
description: A model takes a tumble at Givenchy and rises with aplomb.

title: Gaps in Earnings Stand Out in Release of College Data
description: Colleges give prospective students very little information about how much money they can expect to earn in the job market. In part thats because colleges may not want people to know, and in part its because such information is difficult and expensive to gather. Colleges are good at tracking down rich alumni to hit up for donations, but people who make little or no money are harder and less lucrative to find.

title: Stacy Martin Follows Her Nose
description: As a rule, the French-British actress Stacy Martin eschews wearing fragrance while on set: I try to leave myself behind. Im not going into a role to show myself, she says of her technique. The same for my jewelry: I will only bring certain things on set with me, like a book Im reading, to kill time between takes. On the power of a scent, she says, It influences me when I dont realize it. Almost every smell makes me stop and think about the past, a person or an event.

title: 1890: Switzerlands Unexpected Revolt
description: BELLINZONA  The following are the leading facts about yesterdays revolution [Sept. 11] in Ticino, as gathered on the spot. The movement was commenced by a band of Radicals entering the arsenal and arresting the manager. All the bells in the town were immediately set ringing, shops and cafs were closed and the gendarmes scattered about the place were surprised, disarmed and locked up. The Prefect was arrested.

title: At Alexander Wang, Its Back to the Natural Look
description: Alex said he wanted to get back to his roots. Go back to a natural look, said lead makeup artist Diane Kendal backstage at the Alexander Wang spring/summer 2016 show. With the exception of a little concealer here and there, the models faces were completely devoid of makeup. The starring product on the makeup tables: Nars Luminous Moisture Cream, which lent a fresh, dewy finish to complexions. Theres no real one definition of beauty these days, Kendal later said, another reason why she chose to let the models individual features shine through.

title: The Daily Do: Baja East
description: Brunette, spiky mullets came down the runway at the psychedelic Baja East show yesterday. The designers, Scott Studenberg and John Targon, said they were inspired by three-day raves for their spring/summer 2016 collection  which translated into psychedelic prints, flowing tunics and fanny packs worn over parachute pants. Models kept their faces bare, with only a few coming down the runway in remnants of glittering eye shadow. The effect, indeed, felt like the remains of a desert party  like models had just woken up the day after Burning Man.

title: Subway Station for 7 Line Opens on Far West Side
description: In a West Side neighborhood long isolated from the rest of Manhattan, crowds gathered on Sunday for a truly rare sight in New York City: the opening of a new subway station. Train aficionados and local families streamed in, squealing in delight and snapping photos of the citys first new subway station in a quarter century.

title: The Daily Shoe: Alexander Wang
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Germany Orders Curbs at Border in Migrant Crisis
description: BERLIN  With record numbers of migrants pouring across the Hungarian border and rushing west, Germany, the country that had been the most welcoming in Europe, suddenly ordered temporary border restrictions on Sunday that cut off rail travel from Austria and instituted spot checks on cars.

title: On Eve of Holiday, Israeli Police and Palestinians Clash at Al Aqsa Mosque
description: JERUSALEM  Palestinian youths, some of them masked, clashed with Israeli police officers who entered Jerusalems Al Aqsa Mosque compound early Sunday in what has become an increasingly familiar occurrence on the eve of Jewish holidays.

title: Moses Malone, 76ers Chairman of the Boards, Dies at 60
description: Moses Malone, the N.B.A. center known as the Chairman of the Boards for prodigious rebounding that propelled him to the Basketball Hall of Fame and acclaim as one of the top 50 players in the leagues first half-century, died during the weekend in Norfolk, Va. He was 60.

title: A Watch With Lifetime Access to Ebbets Field Has Mysterious Origins
description: On Thanksgiving Day in 1990, a customer sat down in a restaurant on the East Side of Manhattan and plopped a gold watch on the table.

title: The Perfect Guy Tops the Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  For the fifth consecutive weekend, a movie with a predominantly black cast topped the North American box office. And, the horror film The Visit overperformed, ending a prolonged cold streak for M. Night Shyamalan.

title: Alexander Wang Show, Spring 2016
description: Alexander Wangs 10th anniversary show finale.

title: Guarded Optimism as Cease-Fire Holds in East Ukraine
description: BERLIN  Buoyed somewhat by the relative success of a two-week-old cease-fire in eastern Ukraine, the foreign ministers of Germany, France, Russia and Ukraine have urged fighters and mediators to build on that progress and withdraw weapons and remove land mines as well as prepare for local elections later this year.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 3
description: Alexander Wang celebrates his 10th anniversary at strip-club-themed party with Lady Gaga, ASAP Rocky, Lil Wayne and others.

title: Jeb Bushs Debating Style
description: Highlights from political debates featuring Jeb Bush, the cerebral, halting former governor of Florida with an aversion to sound bites.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 3
description: Alexander Wang celebrates his 10th anniversary at strip-club-themed party with Lady Gaga, ASAP Rocky, Lil Wayne and others. See the photos.

title: Jeb Bushs Cerebral Debate Style Faces a Test: Donald Trump
description: On the debate stage, Jeb Bush has committed the sin of over-explanation, answering a pithy 1994 attack on his business career with so many details about leases and debts that a baffled crowd erupted into boos.

title: Alexander Wangs Raucous After-Party
description: The designer hosted a mega-fete in honor of his 10th anniversary.

title: Scenes From Alexander Wangs All-Night Rager
description: As soon as the lights had dimmed on Alexander Wangs 10th-anniversary show on Pier 94 last night, a wall pulled back to reveal a party: a cavernous space filled with ice luges, pink-neon lights and six acrobatic dancers gyrating up and down poles. The room was littered with fake currency emblazoned with Wangs likeness  $10 bills bearing the unofficial signature of Treasurer Spend Lyka Dem in honor of his clothing lines first decade in business. The currency was scattered on the concrete of a roped-off VIP section, where Lady Gaga, Kanye West, Nicki Minaj, Mary J. Blige, Kylie Jenner, Tyga, Miguel, the Weeknd and the Fat Jew mingled and danced on banquettes. Waitstaff from Hooters served chicken wings and sliders while an ice sculpture spelled Wang10. A DJ mixed together an irregular-heartbeat-inducing medley that included Missy Elliotts Lose Control, David Banners Play  until early in the morning, Tinashe, Lil Wayne and Ludacris took the stage for a surprise set.

title: Victoria Beckham: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Beckhams spring 2016 designs.

title: Ben Carson and Bernie Sanders, on the Rise and on the Talk Shows
description: Summer might be over, but the summer of Hillary Rodham Clintons discontent continued on the Sunday talk shows, as the political class continued to chew on the challenges facing her candidacy  including the continuing investigation into her private email, the rise of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont in Iowa and New Hampshire, and the potential threat of a candidacy from Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: At Derek Lam, I Dont Care Hair
description: There has been no shortage of minimalist, stripped-down makeup on the runways this season, but for Derek Lams spring/summer 2016 collection, makeup artist Tom Pecheux gave us effortless-looking beauty that required at least a little bit of effort. The key word was natural, he said, but with something twisted.

title: 1940: Nazi Government Bills Vichy 8 Million a Day
description: The Nazi government has decreed that France must pay 20,000,000 marks daily ($8,000,000 at the official rate of exchange) for the upkeep of the German army of occupation, it was revealed tonight. This figure was disclosed by the French Ministry of Finance, which stated that the Journal Officiel would publish tomorrow a law opening a special account to be called Expenses of Maintaining the Army of Occupation. This law approves an agreement concluded between the French state and the Bank of France, putting at the disposal of the former an advance of 50,000,000,000 francs (nominally $1,000,000,000) to cover this charge.

title: Moving Fast, Fire Scorches Community in California
description: LOS ANGELES  The fire moved fast, faster than even veteran firefighters had seen. As it ripped down a hill toward Middletown, two hours north of San Francisco, some residents hardly had time to dress before they fled.

title: This Weeks Movies | September 11, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review Time Out of Mind, Sleeping with Other People and The Visit.

title: Public School: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Dao-Yi Chow and Maxwell Osbornes latest collection.

title: Review: In Genet Porno, Yvan Greenberg Leaves Little to the Imagination
description: If you have ever longed for a play starring a pair of fake penises, I have a show for you. These outsized appendages are easily the most credible and intriguing performers in Genet Porno, a misbegotten mash-up of Jean Genets novel Our Lady of the Flowers and a pornography stars YouTube diary.

title: Fashion Weeks Opening-Day Star Is Jason Wu
description: Pity the poor designer who shows at the beginning of New York Fashion Week. Theres so much competing action around  in culture (the Venice International Film Festival), sports (the United States Open, the start of football season) and national memory (Sept. 11)  that a label has to work very hard for attention.

title: Shinzo Abe Is Re-elected as Leader of Japans Liberal Democrats
description: Abenomics is still halfway through, Mr. Abe said.

title: Elie Tahari: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection from Mr. Tahari.

title: 7 Train Extension Opens
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio was among the first riders to enter the 7 line station at 34th Street and 11th Avenue.

title: Ad Contrasts Ronald Reagans Views With Republicans Words on Immigration
description: Timed to this weeks Republican presidential debate, a pro-immigration group will run a television ad that juxtaposes Ronald Reagans upbeat tone in welcoming people to the United States against the words of the current party candidates.

title: A Look Back at the Sixth Avenue Subway Line Opening
description: The Sixth Avenue line was the last subway line in Manhattan to be built and one of the most challenging ones. It opened in 1940.

title: Review: In Judy, Societal Regression, Circa 2040
description: The title is a tease in the new play Judy, by Max Posner. We never meet a woman by that name, but thats the least of the oddities in this ponderous puzzle, set in 2040. Generally dramas taking place in the future push hard on the futurism, but Mr. Posners 25 years ahead doesnt seem wildly more exotic than today, except that everyone apparently lives in basements, most people have forsworn profanity (fat chance) and Internet connections are worse (a disturbing thought).

title: Rivalry Builds Off the Field as Talent Agencies Turn to Sports
description: LOS ANGELES  As the National Football League begins another season, almost a third of its starting quarterbacks  including Peyton Manning and Drew Brees  will be represented by Creative Artists Agency. And as Novak Djokovic won the U.S. Open on Sunday, his team from William Morris Endeavor was in the stands cheering him on.

title: From Givenchy and Alexander Wang, Competing Visions of New York
description: On Sept. 11, as the sun set over the Hudson and bathed 1 World Trade Center in silver and rose, Givenchy held a fashion show on Pier 26, on the far western edges of TriBeCa, in the shadows of the skyline.

title: Shear Madness Opening in New York for the First Time
description: After 36 years of performances in Boston, Washington, and all around the globe, the play Shear Madness is coming to New York for the first time. The long-running farce about a murder in a beauty parlor will begin performances Off Broadway on Oct. 22nd at Stage 4 at New World Stages, with an official opening of Nov. 11.

title: Tracy Reese: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection from Ms. Reese.

title: Rodriguez Screams, Blue Jays Fall Silent, and Yankees Rebound
description: It was not a particularly deep fly ball, but this was not a particularly normal game for Alex Rodriguez, who steadied himself at third base, poised to pounce toward home. His body, after 2,698 career regular-season games, could still cover plenty of ground.

title: Big Win but Bigger Worries for Jets
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets wanted to celebrate but could not, at least not the way they wanted. They wanted to smile but did not, at least not as wide. They wanted to crow about all the touchdowns they scored and all the turnovers they forced, their second-half dominance in a 31-10 season-opening victory against Cleveland, but they did not, at least not much.

title: Derek Lams Play on Texture
description: The designers spring/summer 2016 collection featured eyelet, fur and suede.

title: Derek Lam: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Lams spring 2016 collection.

title: Thakoon: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Thakoon Panichguls spring 2016 collection.

title: Zippered Denim and Chunky Platforms at Hood by Air
description: The designer Shayne Oliver introduced large-scale sunglasses, padlock necklaces and miniature backpacks in his spring/summer 2016 collection.

title: The Concert Hall as Refuge in a Restless, Web-Driven World
description: For all the wonders of the web, it threatens habits of deeper inquiry, Ian Leslie argues in Curious: The Desire to Know and Why Your Future Depends on It. This book is among a growing number exploring what might be lost as we lean on search engines and offload our memories to cloud storage, to quote a review of four contributions to the topic last year by Jacob Silverman in The New York Times.

title: Joshua Roth Takes United Talent Agency Into the Art World
description: LOS ANGELES  The office of Joshua Roth, a lawyer-turned-agent at the United Talent Agency headquarters here, has all the trappings of a Hollywood player: the expensive swivel chair, the big flat-screen TV. It also boasts the outward signs of an art dealer. Issues of Artforum and Art in America are fanned out on his desk, alongside entertainment industry publications. On the wall hangs an 80s-pink portrait by the Los Angeles artist Alex Israel. Works by the painter Jonas Wood and the ceramist Shio Kusaka line the space. And Mr. Roths assistant is busy planning his trips to scout talent  not just at Cannes and Sundance, but at Art Basel Hong Kong and the Frieze Art Fair in New York.

title: Review: Carlos Henriquez Radiates Gratitude in a South Bronx Homecoming
description: Nearly every note from Carlos Henriquez, the bassist for the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra, is cool, clear, judicious, full of body and intent. His sound doesnt grasp or rush; informed by the economy of Afro-Latin tumbao bass patterns, it connects and assists. It has its moral priorities straight.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Sept. 14
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Cantata Profana Revives a Henze Cycle Inspired by German Poems
description: A penchant for dramatizing chamber music is central to the mission of Cantata Profana, a group of adventurous young instrumentalists and singers whose core members met as students at the Yale School of Music. The ensemble opened its fourth season on Friday night at St. Peters Church in Midtown with an imaginative new semi-staged version of Hans Werne Henzes Kammermusik 1958. This piece is an hourlong song cycle for tenor, guitar and eight other instruments that alternates vocal settings of six feverish, strangely haunting German poems by Friedrich Hlderlin with seven instrumental interludes.

title: Review: Jeanine Durnings To Being, a Dance Premiere in Queens
description: How will they get themselves out of this? I kept wondering that during Jeanine Durnings To Being, which had its premiere on Wednesday at the Chocolate Factory in Queens, and not because I wanted it to end. This marathon of a dance enmeshes the dancers so wholly in doing, doing, doing that you cant imagine them being done. Its like watching people live, right in the thick of passing time.

title: Basilica Soundscape: A Festival of Pop, Punk and So Much Else
description: HUDSON, N.Y.  I always wanted to be less subculturally lonely, declared Jenny Hval, the Norwegian avant-pop polymath, at Basilica Soundscape on Saturday night. But here I see no subculture.

title: Review: Arvo Prt and 9/11, Paired at the Metropolitan Museum
description: Sept. 11 was, of course, many things before it became 9/11. For one, it was the birthday of the Estonian composer Arvo Prt.

title: Royal Topper
description: Administrivial Merl Reagle Memorial Alert! If you live in or plan to be in the Tampa, Florida area on Sunday, September 27, Marie Reagle will be hosting a memorial for Merl from 5:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. at the University of Tampa in the Vaughn Center (9th floor). The event is open to the public.

title: Review: In Black Man in a White Coat, a Doctor Navigates Bruising Terrain
description: As a student at Duke University Medical School in the mid-1990s, Damon Tweedy once treated a black teenager who was hysterical and having a late-stage miscarriage. He made a flailing attempt to take her history  she denied being pregnant and said she had no bad habits  whereupon his supervisor barreled in and barked, When is the last time you smoked crack?

title: Review: Melanie Martinez Performs Cry Baby and Other Songs From Her Debut Album
description: Melanie Martinez, a 20-year-old songwriter who performed on Friday night at the Highline Ballroom, could teach career politicians how to stay on message. She single-mindedly and thoroughly explores one scenario: What happens when childhood illusions give way to bitter adult realities.

title: Review: Available Light Takes Over an Armory at Philadelphias Fringe Festival
description: In the midst of an extensive European tour, Available Light, a 1983 collaboration among the choreographer Lucinda Childs, the composer John Adams and the architect Frank Gehry, made an American stop over the weekend. Presented by FringeArts in Philadelphia as part of the 2015 Fringe Festival, the work took over the Drexel University Armory, a space vast enough to accommodate its grand if minimalist proportions. Ms. Childs was among the revolutionaries of Judson Dance Theater in the 1960s, and like some of her fellow postmodernists she has found a more ardent audience  and more funding, presumably  in Europe than in the United States. But as the writer Suzanne Carbonneau notes in a program essay, Philadelphia has been good to her, with the Pew Center for Arts & Heritage supporting the reconstruction of her early works and giving them a handsome online platform, the exemplary archival project A Steady Pulse: Restaging Lucinda Childs, 1963-78. You can enjoy that from anywhere.

title: A Rabbi From Uber
description: Dear Diary:

title: Selected Works of David Carr
description: 15 memorable articles, columns and video clips from Mr. Carr, a prolific media columnist for The New York Times, including his last piece that was published the day before he died.

title: Discovering Shaken Baby Syndrome
description: The pediatric neurosurgeon who first identified shaken baby syndrome has a surprising take on the very syndrome hes credited with discovering.

title: The Nanny Murder Trial
description: In 1997, a young British nanny charged with murder brought shaken baby syndrome into the national spotlight, and raised a scientific debate that continues to shape child abuse cases today.

title: The Anatomy of a Murder Case
description: The anatomy of a shaken baby case from the perspective of defense attorney Adele Bernhard.

title: Shaken Baby Syndrome: A Diagnosis That Divides the Medical World
description: Perhaps no crime staggers the mind, or turns the stomach, more than the murder of a baby, and so it is not a surprise when law enforcement comes down hard on the presumed killers. Often enough, these are men and women accused of having succumbed to sudden rage or simmering frustration and literally shaken the life out of a helpless infant who would not stop crying or would not fall asleep.

title: The New Mets: They Finish a Sweep, Then Grumble About Their Miscues
description: ATLANTA  Daniel Murphy shook his head, muttered something to himself and kicked the dirt near second base, perhaps trying to forget the last play. Freddie Freeman had driven a hard-hit ball that took a high bounce just in front of him, and Murphy had turned and held out his glove backhanded, trying to snatch the ball out of the air. But it screamed by him.

title: Cities United, de Blasios Immigration Coalition, Has Big Goals but Modest Start
description: The coalition of the nations mayors was envisioned as a powerful advocacy machine, banding together to put President Obamas executive actions on immigration into effect and to amplify the progressive vision by pushing for wholesale immigration reform.

title: Frank D. Gilroy, Who Had Smash Debut With Subject Was Roses, Dies at 89
description: Frank D. Gilroy, whose 1964 Broadway debut, The Subject Was Roses, won the theaters triple crown  a Pulitzer Prize, a Tony and a Drama Critics Circle Award  but proved to be the high note in his life as a playwright and television and Hollywood dramatist, died on Saturday at his home in Monroe, N.Y. He was 89.

title: Diane von Furstenberg: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Ms.von Furstenbergs latest spring designs.

title: U.S. Wants Former Salvadoran Ally to Face Justice in 1989 Massacre
description: Early in the morning on Nov. 16, 1989, soldiers from an elite battalion of the Salvadoran Army walked into the religious center of a Jesuit university and killed everyone they found inside.

title: Nicopanda: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Nicola Formichettis spring 2016 collection for his label.

title: Details on Bowe Bergdahl, Soldier Freed by Taliban, May Emerge at Hearing
description: In the 15 months since American commandos whisked Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl from an Afghanistan hilltop in a trade with the Taliban, he has been portrayed as both a traitor and a hero, even as most facts uncovered about what happened when he left his outpost six years ago have remained officially under wraps.

title: Consumers and Lawmakers Take Steps to End Forced Labor in Fishing
description: WASHINGTON  Federal lawmakers, State Department officials, fishing and pet food companies, and class-action lawyers are stepping up efforts to combat forced labor at sea.

title: 4th Inmate Dies After Oklahoma Prison Brawl
description: An inmate hospitalized after a weekend outburst of violence at a prison in Oklahoma died of his injuries, the company that owns and operates the prison said on Sunday, bringing the number of dead from the episode to four.

title: Etsy Welcomes Manufacturers to Artisanal Fold
description: Molly Goodalls store on Etsy, the online crafts marketplace, started as a creative solution to a parenting problem.

title: Stanley Hoffmann, Who Brought Passion to Foreign Policy Analysis, Dies at 86
description: Stanley Hoffmann, a French-educated political scientist and foreign-affairs analyst who perceptively interpreted France and the United States to each other, and who, in a series of influential books, explored the forces that govern the relations between states, died over the weekend at his home in Cambridge, Mass. He was 86.

title: Ben Carson Works His Way Up the Donation Ladder
description: First came the grass-roots support. Now Ben Carson, the retired neurosurgeon who has quietly arrived near the front of the Republican presidential field, is scooping up $100,000 a night from wealthy donors in Texas and California  evidence that he is fast transforming from a novelty candidate into one to be taken seriously by rivals and party leaders alike.

title: Edun: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The labels spring collection.

title: East Villages Birdman Abandoning His Nest of CDs and Cassettes
description: Hello, this is Rainbow Music, said the stooped man in the rumpled clothes, as he answered the phone in the middle of what could safely be described as a Grand Canyon of CDs.

title: Jonathan Simkhai: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection from Mr. Simkhai.

title: Feds Decision on Interest Rates, Autoworkers Contract Talks and a Greek Election
description: Airbus, the European airplane maker, will formally open a jet assembly plant in Mobile, Ala., on Monday, its first such factory in the United States. The move into the heart of Boeings home turf is part of a long-term strategy by Airbus aimed at doubling its share of the American market for 150-seat airplanes, which is currently dominated by Boeings top-selling 737. Airbus plans to build as many as 36 of its competing A320 and A321 models a year by 2018 and says the Mobile plant has the capacity to double that production. All of the aircraft produced at the site are destined for delivery to American carriers, which are expected to need as many as 4,700 new single-aisle planes over the next 20 years. Nicola Clark

title: William Becker, Who Transformed Janus Films, Dies at 88
description: William Becker, a theater critic and financier who acquired Janus Films with a partner in 1965, expanded its catalog of art-house and Hollywood classics and broadened their distribution to university audiences and home viewers on DVD, died on Saturday at his country home in Southampton, N.Y. He was 88.

title: Russian Local Elections Draw Charges of Fraud
description: MOSCOW  As Russians voted in local and regional elections on Sunday, democracy advocates in the only region where they were allowed to run accused the authorities of fraud and said the police had blockaded an apartment where opposition activists were tracking the vote.

title: U.S. and Iran Both Conflict and Converge
description: BAGHDAD  American troops advising Iraqi security forces in restive Anbar Province are sharing a base with odd bedfellows: an Iranian-backed militia that once killed United States soldiers. Both are fighting the militants of the Islamic State.

title: Martina Hingiss Doubles Comeback Yields Fifth Major Title of Year
description: Martina Hingis won the Grand Slam in womens doubles in 1998, part of a remarkable year when she also won the Australian Open singles title and the WTA Tour championship. She did not accomplish all that this year, but what she did was still quite impressive.

title: Early College Season Holds No Sway? Some Hope It Does
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  Walking through the quad here Saturday an hour before Alabamas kickoff was practically as good as listening to a radio play-by-play of the Auburn games closing minutes. Cheers indicated good news for Jacksonville State, which plays in the second-tier Football Championship Subdivision and was shockingly leading the Tigers with minutes to go. Disapproving murmurs indicated plays made by Alabamas archrival.

title: Baidu and CloudFlare Boost Users Over Chinas Great Firewall
description: HONG KONG  It is one of the best-guarded borders in the world, and one of the most time-consuming to cross. Yet in the past few months, a new agreement has let people speed over it billions of times.

title: Boston Enlivens City Hall Plaza by Rolling Out Green Carpet
description: BOSTON  A new terroir has emerged atop the downtown badlands known as City Hall Plaza: an enormous carpet of fake grass, affixed with tape to a section of the barren brick that stretches for almost an entire city block in front of this citys dystopian-looking municipal nerve center.

title: One Symptom in New Medical Codes: Doctor Anxiety
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind.  The nations health care providers are under orders to start using a new system of medical codes to describe illnesses and injuries in more detail than ever before. The codes will cover common ailments: Did a diabetic also have kidney disease? But also included are some that are far less common: whether the patient was crushed by a crocodile or sucked into a jet engine.

description: Several lawmakers joined Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan on Sunday in condemning the scalping of tickets to a procession by Pope Francis during his stop in New York City on a national tour, calling it contrary to the spirit of the pontiffs visit.

description: How a parasitic wasp larva turns an orb weaver spider into a slave that builds a web to host the larvas cocoon.

title: A Wasp That Turns a Spider Into the Walking Dead
description: If spiders had nightmares, the larvae of ichneumonid wasps would have to star in them. The wasp lays an egg on the back of an orb weaver spider, where it grows fat and bossy, and occupies itself with turning the spider into a zombie. As Keizo Takasuka and his colleagues point out in The Journal of Experimental Biology, this is a classic case of host manipulation. Using more colorful language, he described the larva turning the spider into a drugged navvy.

title: Which Fed Leaders Fear Inflation? Look at When They Grew Up
description: If you are an 18-year-old college freshman in the United States, inflation in your lifetime has averaged less than 2 percent. If you are a 30-year-old millennial, you experienced inflation above 5 percent for only one year  when you were in kindergarten, perhaps in the form of the coins in a piggy bank buying fewer pieces of candy the longer they sat unspent.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 6:20 P.M. (Starz Cinema) THE SKIN I LIVE IN (2011) Robert Ledgard (Antonio Banderas), a Spanish plastic surgeon whose wife has died of burns, experiments on a patient named Vera (Elena Anaya, above, with Mr. Banderas), whom he keeps locked in his isolated mansion, in what Manohla Dargis, writing in The New York Times, called Pedro Almodvars intoxicating, lush mystery. But how did Vera get there, and why? The subplots involve a rapist (Roberto lamo), the doctors housekeeper (Marisa Paredes), his daughter (Blanca Suarez) and a young man she has met (Jan Cornet). Despite all these moving, spinning parts, Ms. Dargis added, Mr. Almodvars control remains virtuosic and the film hangs together completely.

title: On Verge of Inspiring Win, Giants Defense Collapses Against Cowboys

title: Austerity Success Stories
description: One thing you encounter a lot in Europe these days are assertions that the success of Spain and Portugal proves that the critics of austerity were all wrong. To make this sort of claim, however, you have to do two things. First, you need to define success way, way down. Second, you have to willfully misread what Keynesians have been saying from the beginning about about the process of internal devaluation.

Unlike prior proposals, which focused solely on restructuring Puerto Ricos debt or cutting its spending, the new plan recognizes the urgent need for both. It could actually work, but only with a major assist from Congress.

title: Labours Dead Center
description: Jeremy Corbyn, a long-time leftist dissident, has won a stunning victory in the contest for leadership of Britains Labour Party. Political pundits say that this means doom for Labours electoral prospects; they could be right, although Im not the only person wondering why commentators who completely failed to predict the Corbyn phenomenon have so much confidence in their analyses of what it means.

title: A Helping Hand for the Homeless Helps a Luxury Developer, Too
description: When she found herself on the subway on a sweltering August night two years ago, her two young children and their few belongings squeezed onto the hard plastic seats beside her, Nichelle Way had no idea where they were going. Her abusive ex-boyfriend had just thrown them out of his apartment, where they had been living for three months. When she called her family in York, Pa., they offered no help, only scolding.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called an emergency meeting to discuss rock-throwing, mostly by Palestinian youths.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Sept. 14, 2015
description: Updated: Sept. 18, 2015

title: Stephen Breyers The Court and the World
description: In all the fanfare surrounding the Supreme Courts end-of-term rulings this past June, a little-noticed passage in an opinion by Justice Stephen Breyer quietly revisited a debate that has roiled American law for nearly two decades. Dissenting on the final day of the term from a decision to uphold Oklahomas new lethal injection protocol, Breyer (joined by Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg) observed that 137 countries  a full 70 percent of member states in the United Nations  have abolished the death penalty either formally or in practice. Breyer noted further that in 2013 the United States was one of only 22 countries in the world to carry out any executions at all.

title: Wil Haygoods Showdown
description: Thurgood Marshall sits in Room 2228 of the New Senate Office Building on July 13, 1967, a month after Lyndon Johnson has named him to the United States Supreme Court. Facing him are, among others, four arch-segregationist Southerners on the Senate Judiciary Committee: John McClellan, Sam Ervin, Strom Thurmond and its chairman, James Eastland. Marshall is determined to become the first black man ever to sit on the nations highest court. The senators are equally determined to block him.

title: Sisters in Law Looks at Sandra Day OConnor and Ruth Bader Ginsburg
description: Two young women, near age-mates, grow up in very different corners of the country, one in near isolation on a vast Southwestern cattle ranch and the other on the crowded streets of Brooklyn. They obtain superb educations, enter into early marriage and motherhood, and set out to make their way in a mans world. Decades later, we find them, having broken through more than a few glass ceilings, sitting together on the United States Supreme Court.

title: Malcolm Turnbull Defeats Tony Abbott to Become Prime Minister of Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Malcolm Turnbull, a former investment banker and lawyer, was sworn in as prime minister of Australia on Tuesday, after defeating Tony Abbott in a vote of Liberal Party lawmakers.

title: Morning Agenda: Pitfalls on the Frontiers of Banking
description: PITFALLS ON THE FRONTIERS OF BANKING | Upstart online lenders have taken on big, lumbering banks with outdated branches and skittish risk departments. But she couldnt save her husband, Stuart, when a piece of pastry lodged deep in his trachea last month. Neither could a bystander.

title: Plants That Are Predators
description: As a refined Victorian gentleman, Charles Darwin naturally gravitated toward the macabre, and few things fascinated him like those floral flouters of the conventional food chain: carnivorous plants. He experimented with them and wrote a major treatise about them. He called the Venus flytrap, with its elaborate hair-trigger snap trap and its lethal brew of digestive juices, one of the most wonderful plants in the world.

title: Marcus Mariotas Strong N.F.L. Debut Answers the Skeptics

On the teams next drive, Mariota threw a short pass to running back Bishop Sankey for a 12-yard touchdown. Before the half ended, he threw two more touchdowns, one each to Harry Douglas and Delanie Walker. It was a record-setting day for Mariota, the number two overall selection in the 2015 N.F.L. Draft.

title: Broncos Top Ravens on Bad Day for Offenses; Terrell Suggs Is Out

title: 1940: Buckingham Palace Bombed
description: LONDON  The belief that the German air attack on Buckingham Palace was a deliberate attempt on the lives of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth was great in force today as expressions of horror and disgust poured in from all over the empire. The rails and stone lamp pillars in front of the palace were hurled down when a time bomb dropped in a recent raid exploded this morning with terrific force, hurling debris over the forecourt and the memorial to Queen Victoria, and gouging a deep crater in the sidewalk.  New York Herald Tribune, September 15, 1940

title: Turnbull on Ousting Abbott as Premier

title: Older Children More Likely to Be Injured in a Car, Less Likely to Have Car Seats Checked for Safety
description: Booster seat-aged children  that is, children in forward-facing child seats, including those who use the car safety belt and those who have built-in harnesses  are twice as likely to suffer serious injury or death in a car crash than younger children, but a new study shows they may be less likely to have car seats inspected for safety. Researchers from the University of Michigan found that although only 1 in 10 of the car seat inspections performed free at inspection stations in Michigan covered booster seat-aged children, ages 4 to 7, 30 percent of those children were in what they called a sub-optimal restraint.

title: Apple Says iPhone Pre-Orders Are Beating Last Years Pace
description: Apple said Monday that global pre-orders for its latest iPhones were on track to beat last years sales of 10 million devices in the first weekend, which was a record for the company.

title: Carolina Herreras Rosy Outlook (and Makeup)

Thats not to say clients above the age of, say, 30, were excluded from Carolina Herreras vision for her spring/summer 2016 collection, but the beauty looks created by the hairstylist Orlando Pita and the makeup artist Diane Kendal did convey a distinct air of youthfulness. The clothes are very light and airy, and the colors of flowers, so hair is kinda young  infantile, explained Pita backstage. The room behind him revealed several diaphanous gowns in variations of ballet pink; and rose sculptures and bouquets installed throughout the Frick Collection set the scene for the show.

The House of Atreus, world literatures most enduring home of horrors, is now receiving visitors on both sides of the Thames in this city, in different, retrofitted versions of Aeschyluss The Oresteia, the revenge-driven trilogy in which the bloody lair for a damned family figures so oppressively.

description: As a number of migrants use the Balkans as a route to pursue a better life in Europe, one photographer captures what many leave behind.

title: The Luxury Industry Embraces Virtual Reality
description: Once solely the obsession of gamers and tech geeks, virtual reality has found sexy new bedfellows in the worlds of high-end cosmetics, cars and air travel. Dior Eyes, an in-the-works VR device with hi-def video and immersive surround sound, will take prospective consumers on a trip backstage at one of the houses runway shows. From the outside, the wraparound goggles evoke Darth Vader; from within, the wearer finds herself amid the fizzy whirl of makeup artists, photographers and models in various states of undress  all the while being seduced into buying beauty products. Similarly, Lexus has a new device that sends you careening down Spains mega-exclusive Ascari race track in a Lexus RC F, and on certain Qantas flights, first-class passengers can go snorkeling in the Great Barrier Reef from 40,000 feet.

title: 1965: Planning for the Apollo Mission
description: ATHENS  Today in the Athens Hilton Hotel where the 16th International Astronautical Congress is meeting, Wernher von Braun, director of the Marshall Space Flight Center at Huntsville, Ala., said the U.S. Apollo program was more than 50 percent completed and should achieve its goal of landing a man on the moon before 1970. Mr. Braun said three men would go to the moon in the Apollo spacecraft, consisting of a command module, a service module, a lunar excursion module and a launch escape system.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 15, 1965

title: The Artistry in Jill Bialoskys Pastry Brush
description: Jill Bialoskys kitchen was immaculate, but still she could not find her little wooden pastry brush.

title: The Daily Do: Edun
description: Natural beauty has appeared at several shows this week  in the form of natural faces and un-fussed-with hair. Eduns show yesterday continued that trend: Models wore their faces bare and many had elegant updos. There were low, half-up styles (tied in the back as a bun) and simple ponytails. A few models even wore their hair in natural waves. The effect played up the movement of the collection (which featured fringe and flowing silhouettes)  and yet felt completely laid back.

title: Lynch Says More Soccer Arrests Expected
description: Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch, speaking in Zurich on Monday, said that she anticipated pursuing additional charges in the continuing investigation into corruption in international soccer.

title: Facts & Figures: 43 Percent of Republicans Think Obama Is Muslim
description: Twenty-nine percent of Americans and 43 percent of Republicans believe President Obama is a Muslim, according to a CNN/ORC poll released on Sunday. And 20 percent of Americans think he was born outside the United States.

title: Study Finds Snowpack in Californias Sierra Nevada to Be Lowest in 500 Years
description: The snow that blanketed the Sierra Nevada in California last winter, and that was supposed to serve as an essential source of fresh water for the drought-stricken state, was at its lowest levels in the last 500 years, according to a new study.

title: Visually Arresting New Tables, Mirrors and Lamps
description: Complex geometry makes these five pieces look good from every angle.

title: Matt Enlows Bag-Stuffing Problem
description: This weeks puzzle is an original suggested by Matt Enlow, a math teacher at the Dana Hall School in Wellesley, Mass. Weve seen Matt before  hes the brain behindMarking the Ruler and Dividing a Rectangle. As with his previous challenges, this weeks is a bit more challenging than it seems at first. Lets try

title: Athens Democracy Forum
description: The Athens Democracy Forum (September 13-15) explores the state of liberal democracy across the world. The event features diplomats, scholars, corporate executives, politicians and intellectuals from around the world. Contributors include the Op-Ed columnists, Paul Krugman (Tuesday at 10:15 AM and 7:30 PM, local time) and Roger Cohen (Tuesday at 12:15 PM and 7:30 PM), and the contributing op-ed writer Nikos Konstandaras (Monday, 12:45 PM).

title: Ceress Bright Spots of Mystery
description: New images captured by NASAs Dawn spacecraft provide the best view to date of bright spots on the dwarf planet Ceres  though nobody yet knows what they are. Ceres is thought to hold water beneath its surface. The bright spots, spangled across the bottom of the Occator crater, may be ice formed by water leaking from below, or perhaps salt left after the water evaporated. Mission scientists also produced a 3-D topographic map of the crater, finding that in places, the rim rises almost vertically for one mile.

title: Cond Nast Names Robert Sauerberg New C.E.O.
description: Cond Nast announced an executive shake-up Monday, appointing its president, Robert A. Sauerberg Jr., as its chief executive, and moving Charles H. Townsend from C.E.O. to chairman of Cond Nast U.S.

title: Dear Parent: If Your Child Left It Home, Dont Bring It In
description: A school in Seminole County, Fla., has a rule, clearly posted in the front office: Attention students and parents: We do not accept items for dropoff such as lunches, backpacks, homework, sports equipment. Please plan accordingly.

title: Glencore Model Is Battered, but Not Broken
description: Glencores chief executive, Ivan Glasenberg, has been wrong-footed. His reputation has taken a hit by the slump in minerals prices and Chinas slowing appetite for commodities. Most painfully, he has had to adjust to shareholder worries about debt. Yet he was  and is  right to insist that Glencores unusual mix of mining with trading makes sense.

title: Djokovic Comments on His U.S. Open Win
description: The winner of the mens competition at the 2015 U.S. Open, Novak Djokovic of Serbia, posed in New York with his trophy on Monday and said winning it felt amazing.

title: Egyptian Military Fires on Mexican Tourists During Picnic
description: CAIRO  The convoy of four sport utility vehicles full of Mexican tourists was about three hours southwest of Cairo on a typical adventure trip through the White Desert, an otherworldly landscape of monumental chalk-rock formations. Around midday on Sunday, a diabetic passenger complained that she needed to eat.

title: A First Look at Design Miamis 2015 Entry Pavilion
description: As designers know all too well, for every finished project  what gets walked down a runway or stocked on a shelf  there are dozens, if not hundreds, of unrealized ideas that never make it out of the studio. This work, often frustrating and messy, is so central to the design process, yet so often goes unseen  until this December, when it will be presented front and center at Design Miamis entry pavilion.

title: George Zimmer Takes On Mens Wearhouse With Tuxedo Start-Up
description: Last year, George Zimmer was ousted from Mens Wearhouse, the company he founded. His latest start-up, an online tailoring platform, is not doing so well. But now, Mr. Zimmer is sure he has a winner.

title: Nomas Former Pastry Chef Is on a Taco Mission
description: COPENHAGEN  Rosio Sanchez gets a lot of questions as she cranks out tortillas by hand here in the heart of the Torvehallerne market. Danes, it seems, arent exactly up to speed on the whole concept of tacos.

title: Ren Redzepi Plans to Close Noma and Reopen It as an Urban Farm
description: COPENHAGEN  Welcome to the new Noma, the chef Ren Redzepi said on a bright summer day. This is it.

title: Carolina Herrera and the Softer Side of Spring
description: The designers latest collection included full, textured skirts and sandals with laces.

title: Review: In The Bastard Executioner, a Warrior Switches Blades
description: A sampling of prominent images in the first three hours of The Bastard Executioner: a spear slowly penetrating a throat; a dagger entering the back of a head and exiting, dripping, through the mouth; a finger with its nail pulled off; a disemboweled woman; a severed nose, and the severing thereof; a bird feasting on a corpses innards; sundry slit throats; a soiled chamber pot rag.

title: Joyce Mitchell, Who Helped Prisoners Escape, Says She Was Driven by Fear and Depression
description: Joyce E. Mitchell, a former prison employee who is set to be sentenced this month for helping two killers escape from a unit in northern New York, has given a national television interview in which she apologizes for her actions but asks for understanding, saying she was driven by depression and fear that the men would hurt her family.

title: Jerry Lewis Archive Goes to Library of Congress
description: The Nutty Professor has moved a few steps closer to academic respectability with the announcement that the Library of Congress has acquired the personal archives of Jerry Lewis.

title: Carly Fiorina Ad Digs at Donald Trumps Focus on Her Looks
description: The super PAC supporting Carly Fiorina, the lone woman running for the Republican presidential nomination, has put out a web ad ahead of this weeks debate that seeks to turn the tables on Donald J. Trump for appearing to poke fun at her looks.

title: The Fashion News to Know Today
description: Listen to the kids, bro

title: 3 Major California Wildfires Remain Largely Out of Control
description: CALISTOGA, Calif.  Despite the efforts of 8,800 firefighters, three major blazes whipping through Californias tinder-dry forests and brush had consumed a combined 270,000 acres and remained largely out of control, state officials said on Monday, forcing thousands of people to flee and destroying up to 1,000 buildings.

title: In Midst of Migrant Crisis, Cruises Change Course in Greece
description: At least three cruise lines have changed their itineraries in Greece to avoid the island of Lesbos, where some 20,000 migrants from the Middle East and Africa are living in camps.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 4
description: Michael Kors promotes a new fragrance, Opening Ceremony parties with Jessica Alba, Purple Fashion dines at Narcissa, and Public School goes burlesque at the Box.

title: Carolina Herrera: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Herreras spring collection.

title: Officials on Death of Mexican Tourists
description: Mexicos foreign minister, Claudia Ruiz Massieu, and Prime Minister Ibrahim Mahlab of Egypt responded to the accidental killing of tourists in the Egyptian desert, including two Mexicans.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Is New Host of The Celebrity Apprentice
description: NBC had said it wanted the new host of The Celebrity Apprentice to make noise and possess a similarly outsize personality like the shows previous host, Donald Trump.

title: John Podesta, Head of Hillary Clintons Campaign, to Speak at Super PAC Event
description: The chairman of Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign will meet with a group of prospective donors to the super PAC supporting her in New York City this week, according to an invitation to the event.

title: TheProspects for Pursuing Corporate Executives
description: The Justice Department wants the message to go out that federal prosecutors will be taking aim at executives over their role in corporate misconduct by issuing a new policy that requires companies to identify every wrongdoer within the organization, regardless of rank, or be considered uncooperative.

title: Taliban Storm Prison and Free Hundreds
description: Taliban insurgents attacked the main prison in Ghazni, Afghanistan, killing police guards and releasing more than 300 inmates.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 4
description: Michael Kors fetes new fragrance, Opening Ceremony parties with Jessica Alba, Purple Fashion dines at Narcissa, Public School goes burlesque at the Box. See the photos.

title: Democrats Lay Groundwork to Expand Use of Super PACs
description: Democrats are laying the groundwork for an ambitious reorganization of their struggling network of super PACs that would exploit the loopholes and legal gray areas that Republicans have already used to raise hundreds of millions of dollars for the 2016 campaign through such groups.

title: Trump Sells Miss Universe Organization to WME-IMG Talent Agency
description: Donald J. Trump has sold the Miss Universe Organization to the talent agency WME-IMG, the company announced on Monday.

title: New Leader Turns British Labour Party to the Left
description: LONDON  After three decades on the far-left fringes of British politics, the new leader of the Labour Party in Britain, Jeremy Corbyn, confronted several unfamiliar problems on Monday, including whether to give top jobs to internal opponents and whether to kiss the hand of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Scott Walker Details Plan to Curb the Power of Labor Unions
description: Returning to his political roots as his campaign struggles, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin called on Monday for anti-union measures that, if carried out, would greatly reduce the influence of organized labor in public and private workplaces.

title: Measles Outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo Kills 400
description: More than 23,000 people, mostly children, have been infected with measles in the Katanga region of the Democratic Republic of Congo. More than 400 have died, according to United Nations agencies and Doctors Without Borders.

title: N.B.A. Stars Carry Their Countries Hopes at EuroBasket 2015
description: It is only September, but for some N.B.A. players, the meaningful games have already begun. A lot is at stake in the EuroBasket tournament in Lille, France, as the two finalists will qualify for the 12-team field in the Olympics.

title: Inside Eckhaus Lattas Casting
description: The designers Mike Eckhaus and Zoe Latta filled their spring show with friends.

title: The Cool Kids of Eckhaus Lattas Spring Show
description: Zoe Latta and Mike Eckhaus, the designers behind Eckhaus Latta, have been known to stage unconventional runway shows. (Last season, for example, their show featured a model knocking down a sheetrock wall with a hammer.) For their spring/summer 2016 collection, which shows today, they have enlisted several friends and nonmodels to walk alongside professional faces. The designers shot Polaroids at their casting last week and shared the images exclusively with T. From Grace Dunham to the artist Bjarne Melgaard, click through the slideshow to see the faces of todays Eckhaus Latta show.

title: Celebrity-Filled Show to Precede Pope Francis Mass at Madison Square Garden
description: To persuade the thousands of Roman Catholics who will attend Pope Francis Mass at Madison Square Garden next week to arrive early, the Archdiocese of New York announced on Monday that the Mass would be preceded by a two-hour show with prayer and devotional music performed by stars including Harry Connick Jr., Gloria Estefan and Jennifer Hudson.

title: Wall Street Banks Reach Deal With Regulators on Data Retention
description: Four of Wall Streets biggest banks on Monday agreed to cooperate with New York regulators and retain copies of communications sent through the messaging platform known as Symphony.

title: Sanders Speaks at Liberty University
description: The Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders, in Virginia on Monday, acknowledged differences on abortion and gay marriage in a speech to conservative Christian students at Liberty University.

title: Shannon Lamb, Suspect in 2 Mississippi Killings, Kills Himself
description: A professor at Delta State University who was suspected of fatally shooting his companion and then another professor at the school was found dead Monday night, apparently with a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Tommy Hilfiger: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The latest collection from Mr. Hilfiger.

title: Injuries to Two Jets Are Not as Devastating as First Feared
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  One day after the Jets 31-10 rout of the Cleveland Browns at MetLife Stadium had been dampened by injuries to the rookie linebacker Lorenzo Mauldin and cornerback Antonio Cromartie, the teams overriding emotion was relief after it received encouraging news about both players.

title: A Report Card the Doctor Doesnt Want to Take Home
description: I got my report card the other week, and I must say I didnt do very well. Im pulling around a B, better than average but not by much. My parents would be appalled.

title: Street Style: Dressing For the Weekend Frenzy
description: A round-up of street style photos from the whirlwind weekend of New York Fashion Week.

title: Dine Like Plato, Try Buffalo Jerky, Celebrate Mexican Independence
description: For an idea of what may have been on Platos table, Maria Benardis, the owner of a food company called Greekalicious, is teaching about the foods of ancient Greece in sessions that include dinner. Among the dishes will be barley and pomegranate salad with herbs and walnuts, and lamb Myma-style with a feta crust. Ms. Benardis incorporates some New World items like quinoa and chocolate into her recipes to show students how to use modern foods in the dishes: Ancient Greek class, $130, Sept. 23 from 6:30 to 9 p.m. at Coco-Mat, 49 Mercer Street (Broome Street); ancient Greek dinner and demonstration, $140, Sept. 29 from 6:30 to 9 p.m. at Natural Gourmet Institute, 48 West 21st Street; greekalicious.com.au.

title: Bernie Sanders Makes Rare Appeal to Evangelicals at Liberty University
description: LYNCHBURG, Va.  Senator Bernie Sanders took his message of confronting inequality to unfamiliar ground on Monday at Liberty University, a leading evangelical Christian college, where he sought to build what he called common ground with students, beginning with the foundations of Christianity itself: the Bible.

title: Kathleen Turner to Multitask as Director and Star
description: Kathleen Turner will both direct and act in a new transgender-themed Off Broadway play after the shows director and one of its stars left the production.

title: Democratic Lawyers Seek Clearer Rules on 'Super PACs'
description: In requesting an advisory opinion from the Federal Election Commission, the Democrats' leading election lawyers say they believe that much of the collaboration between Republican candidates and their super PACs is illegal, but that if the F.E.C. rules otherwise, their party will follow the Republicans' lead.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 10:55 A.M. (Encore) SAVING MR. BANKS (2013) Tom Hanks stars as Walt Disney in this Disney movie directed by John Lee Hancock about the making of Mary Poppins, which at the time of its creation in the early 1960s was the most expensive live-action film the studio had produced. It eventually became one of the most beloved, too, and one of the biggest moneymakers. Emma Thompson is the author P. L. Travers, who conjured the magical nanny and is something of a crank. I wont have her turned into one of your silly cartoons, she says of her creation, lips pursed. Theres a back story, too, in which Travers is a little girl (Annie Rose Buckley) in a dusty Australian town, where her hopelessly alcoholic father (Colin Farrell) can barely hold on to his bank job. Writing in The New York Times, A. O. Scott called this movie part of the Disney brand, of course: fun for everyone, with a spoonful of therapeutic medicine to help the sugar seem nutritious. (Image: From left, Lily Bigham, Ms. Buckley, Ruth Wilson and Mr. Farrell.)

title: $30 Million Settlement in Insider Trading Ring Linked to Hacking
description: Jaspen Capital Partners and its chief executive, Andriy Supranonok, have agreed to pay $30 million to settle allegations by the Securities and Exchange Commission that they illegally profited from stolen corporate information that was stolen from newswire services.

title: 90s Icons Share What They Miss the Most
description: It was a decade of neon, Pauly Shore, Coolio and no cellphones. On Saturday it was recreated at a one-day music festival in Williamsburg.

title: Clintons Celebrate Church Anniversary
description: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton and Chelsea Clinton attended a service to celebrate the 200th anniversary of their church, Foundry United Methodist Church, in Washington.

title: On Social Media, Portraits of Life Amid a Fast-Moving Fire
description: After a wildfire rolled down a hill and swallowed much of the town of Middletown, Calif., residents of the area, known for its farmlands and hot springs, remained under a state of emergency on Monday.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: Get out your maps, everyone. Time to refresh your memories on just where exactly to find places like Wolfsburg and Eindhoven, Piraeus and Ghent. Its Champions League time again.

title: Expanding Cruise Options Through the Galpagos Islands
description: The small-ship cruise operator Ecoventura, known for its expedition cruising through the Galpagos Islands, is expanding into a higher level of luxury service with the introduction of its fourth ship, the MV Origin.

title: Do Humans Have a Future in Deep Sea Exploration?
description: HONOLULU  Entering the Hawaii Undersea Research Laboratory hangar is akin to stepping onto the set of a Spielberg film. The dull metal shell, perched on the Makai pier along the Windward Coast of Oahu, is nondescript, but the inside bristles with Zodiac boats and a dizzying assortment of hoists and tools, and the walls are festooned with 30 years of snapshots. At the center of it all, two 20-foot-long Pisces submarines sit atop skids like alien spacecraft, their robotic arms outstretched, beckoning for another mission.

title: Stripe Introduces New Tools to Simplify Mobile Shopping
description: Since the early days of the dot-com era, people have been buying more stuff  from pet food to diapers  on the Internet. The process was straightforward: Fire up your web browser, fill out your shipping and payment information, and receive your products in a week or two.

title: Model-Morphosis: Vanessa Moody at Public School
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in New York.

title: North Korea Plans Rocket Launch That Could Lead to Missile
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea indicated on Monday that it was preparing to put a new satellite into orbit using a rocket that is widely seen as an intercontinental ballistic missile in the making.

title: Russian Authorities Rule Google Broke Antitrust Regulations
description: Russian antitrust authorities ruled on Monday that Google broke the countrys competition rules, adding to the regulatory headaches the search giant is facing worldwide.

title: Popes Visit Poses a Security Test for New York
description: For hours on Monday morning, scores of law enforcement officials, police commanders and representatives from at least 48 agencies sat in a room on the second floor of Police Headquarters in Lower Manhattan and imagined the worst.

title: When Did Jeb Bush Become the Smarter Brother?
description: Jeb Bushs presidential campaign has brought with it a resurgence of the idea that hes the smarter of the two political Bush brothers. Experts on the Bush family say its an old idea, but it may not be correct.

title: Algerian President Fires Intelligence Chief in a Shake-Up of Security Forces
description: TUNIS  In a move that has surprised and enthralled many Algerians, the ailing President Abdelaziz Bouteflika has replaced his powerful intelligence chief in a shake-up of the security forces.

title: In Bushwick, a Live-In Gallery Thats an Art Bellwether
description: Four years ago, real estate dictated fate for friends Kyle Clairmont Jacques, 27, and Alexander Johns, 28, when a search for an affordable joint studio turned into the opening of Signal  an independently minded art gallery in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Four or five years ago, everything around here felt slapdash. Sometime during our search for a space, it became very clear that we could present things in this area at a level that was more professional and respectful, says Clairmont Jacques, an artist-turned-designer who has recently added gallerist to his rsum. There was nowhere showing art that fit in with the mature contemporary discourse that was happening elsewhere in the city. Opportunity came in the form of a vaulted industrial space that had been previously used for rug storage, and the duo seized the moment  transforming the warehouse into a live-in gallery space with a coat of white paint and elbow grease.

title: Hispanics in Congress Ask Treasury to Prevent Catastrophe in Puerto Rico
description: A group of Hispanic members of Congress called on the Treasury secretary, Jacob J. Lew, to take a more muscular role in Puerto Ricos debt crisis and prevent what they said could become an economic catastrophe on the island.

title: 732,000: American Lives Saved by Vaccination
description: The vaccination of children from 1994 to 2013 will prevent 732,000 early deaths in the United States, according to a recent estimate by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Hillary Clinton Vows to Confront Sex Assault Issue on Campuses
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton pledged on Monday to take extra steps to end sexual assaults on college campuses, saying during a trip to Iowa that she would try to ensure a fair process in such cases and increase support for victims.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: In a First, Aspirin Is Recommended to Fight a Form of Cancer
description: For years, doctors have recommended daily aspirin to lower cardiovascular risk in certain men and women. Now, for the first time, an expert panel is recommending aspirin therapy to prevent heart attacks and colorectal cancer.

title: A Vinyl LP Frenzy
description: Six decades-old presses are being refurbished at a plant in New Jersey to meet the exploding demand for vinyl records.

title: The Rocky Revival of Vinyl Records
description: The owners of Independent Record Pressing expect to churn out up to 1.5 million records a year. Their challenge wont be finding business, it will be keeping the antiquated machinery running.

title: Hedwig Broadway Run Closes on a Box-Office Upswing
description: Fans of Hedwig and the Angry Inch gave the show a nice box-office bump in its final week, boosting its grosses as the show ended a 76-week run on Broadway and prepared to start a tour in San Francisco.

title: Listening to the Book Review
description: Inside The New York Times Book Review is the oldest and most popular podcast at The New York Times. The debut episode aired on April 30, 2006, (first guest: Gary Shteyngart) and the show has been recorded weekly ever since.

title: Californias Gavin Newsom Chides Donald Trump on Immigration Plan (and Comb-Over)
description: Donald J. Trump is getting a chilly welcome to California from Gavin Newsom, the states lieutenant governor.

title: Vinyl LP Frenzy Brings Record-Pressing Machines Back to Life
description: BORDENTOWN, N.J.  The machines at Independent Record Pressing whirred and hissed as they stamped out a test record. The businesss owners waited anxiously for Dave Miller, the plant manager, to inspect the still-warm slab of vinyl.

title: A Sense of Instability Settles Over Turkey as Conflict With Kurds Flares
description: ISTANBUL  Nationalist and pro-government throngs filled the streets of Istanbul and Ankara for two nights last week, chanting God is great as they stormed a prominent newspaper and set fire to the offices of a Kurdish political party.

title: Review: In Pas de Detour, Cornfield Dance Plays With Obstacles
description: Ellen Cornfield has been choreographing since at least 1982, when she left Merce Cunninghams company. The 25th anniversary of her own troupe, Cornfield Dance, came and went last year without much fanfare. What inspires her to keep making works? One answer can surely be found in the dancers she is able to recruit.

title: Review: Sonia Olla Flamenco Company, Passionately Blending Cultures
description: Its all too easy for a flamenco dance troupe that believes in tradition but wishes to explore new directions to go astray. There was a moment in Por los Caminos, a program presented at the Theater at the 14th Street Y over the weekend, when the Sonia Olla Flamenco Dance Company, performing in front of projected images of paths through dark woods, seemed on the verge of getting lost. But this troupe knows its way home.

title: Review: In Takehisa Kosugi: Music Expanded, Violinist Uses More Than Strings and a Bow
description: For the final piece of his performance on Sunday at the Whitney Museum of American Art, Takehisa Kosugi picked up a bow and an electric violin and proceeded to play. It was the last thing I expected him to do at that point, the end of the museums two-day retrospective of his work, Takehisa Kosugi: Music Expanded. His biography may identify him as a composer, violinist and improviser, but during the weekends two shows he had mostly used everyday objects: bicycle spokes, for instance, an inflatable ball, a sheet of paper, or a bag of Japanese soup mix. Some of his compositions unfolded in almost complete silence.

title: Turtle Maternity Ward
description: The Ostional Wildlife Refuge in Costa Rica is a crucial nesting site for the olive ridley turtle.

title: Brandy Clark and Shane McAnally on Moonshine: That Hee Haw Musical
description: DALLAS  Brandy Clark and Shane McAnally sat across from each other at one end of a long conference table in a long conference room on a high-up floor at the Wyly Theater here. It was an early September morning, and they were tired.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Stop Deflating Grades
description: To the Editor:

title: Tom Hanks Joins Panel Trying to Build Eisenhower Memorial
description: The proposed memorial to Dwight D. Eisenhower got a boost of star power when the commission in charge of the project announced on Monday that the Hollywood heavyweight Tom Hanks would be joining its ranks.

description: Greece and More  Pictures of the Day

description: The spring 2016 collection from Mr. Lim.

description: Photos from Greece, Hungary, Ukraine and Brazil.

title: Review: In Photograph 51, Nicole Kidman Is a Steely DNA Scientist
description: LONDON  When Nicole Kidman steps out of the shadows, breaking off from a wall of men, and onto the edge of the stage at the Nol Coward Theater, where Anna Zieglers Photograph 51 opened here on Monday night, her eyes beam undiluted willpower. It is a gaze that both chills and warms, radiating and demanding trust in this singularly self-possessed presence. Ms. Kidman makes it clear that she is in charge here, and woe unto those of us who doubt it.

title: Chelsea Clintons Its Your World
description: One of the most striking moments in Hillary Clintons newly released State Department emails was not something written by Hillary but by her daughter, Chelsea, who had just returned from a fact-gathering trip to post-earthquake Haiti. The email starts:

title: Review: Once in a Great City Chronicles Detroits Glory Days
description: Detroit in the early 1960s was a symbol not of urban decline and Rust Belt blight, but of high hopes and youthful dreams. Coveted cars didnt have model numbers then but names that spoke of flight and fantasy and raw animal power  the Ford Galaxie, Thunderbird and Mustang, the Plymouth Barracuda, the Chevrolet Impala  and they were rolling off the Detroit assembly lines at a record pace. The country was dancing to the beat of Motowns irresistible pop-soul groove, and with hit after hit by Stevie Wonder, Smokey Robinson, Marvin Gaye, the Temptations and the Four Tops rolling off his assembly line, Berry Gordy would proudly proclaim Motown the sound of young America.

title: Jeremy Scott: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Scotts spring collection.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New, Starring Thom Browne and Tyler, the Creator
description: Thom Browne and Tyler, the Creator rub anti-aging ice cubes around their eyes while considering a fancy chicken coop and an encyclopedia of tacos.

title: Off The Runway: Day 5
description: Scenes from the fifth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Breakthrough Video Contest Seeks Young Scientists
description: Enterprising young scientists looking to become the next big name in STEM have a new contest in which to test their grit.

description: On the occasion of his womens wear show today, the designer talks about the difference in designing for men and women, the influence of his mother, and the freedom of wearing your own uniform.

title: United Airlines Customer Dissatisfaction Festers, 5 Years After Merger
description: The merger of Continental Airlines and United Airlines in 2010 was supposed to combine Continentals reputation for solid customer service with the broader reach of Uniteds domestic and international network.

title: Burberry Creates a Channel for Apple Music
description: Apple Music is getting a little bit of luxury.

title: Toronto International Film Festival Red Carpet
description: Looks from the event, featuring Natalie Portman, Helen Mirren, Kiernan Shipka and more.

title: Debating Style, Courtesy of Jeremy Scott and Carolina Herrera
description: Is Jeremy Scott the Donald Trump of American fashion? Not in terms of politics  definitely not in terms of politics  but in terms of positioning? Mr. Scott, after all, is an oft-dismissed polarizing outsider who built his brand beyond the system by mocking fashions orthodoxies. He has been categorized as an entertainer and a disrupter, with emphasis on show rather than substance. Yet his approach  Instagram-ready, direct to pop culture consumers  has resulted in a documentary The Peoples Designer; a stint redesigning the Video Music Awards Moonman statuette, and a second job as creative director of the global brand Moschino. Plus, this week: Mr. Scotts largest show to date, in front of the singer Rita Ora and the actress Lucy Hale and a chunk of the cast of the TV show Empire, including Bryshere Gray.
