title: Stanford Business School Dean to Resign Over a Lawsuit
description: Garth Saloner, the dean of the Stanford Graduate School of Business, announced his resignation on Monday, saying he did not want a baseless and protracted lawsuit related to a contentious divorce to hurt the schools reputation. The divorce involves two Stanford professors. Mr. Saloner began a relationship with the wife shortly after the couple separated, Stanford acknowledged on Monday. The husband is suing the university, saying he was discriminated against. Stanford said he was treated fairly and equitably. Mr. Saloner, who has been dean since 2009, told the Stanford community he had become increasingly concerned that the ongoing litigation and growing media interest will distract all of you. After Mr. Saloner steps down at the end of the current academic year, he will return to teaching. He did not respond to a request for an interview. U.S. News & World Report rated Stanfords business school the best in the nation last spring.

title: Trauma Needs a Witness

He was anchored well enough in the present, with his marriage and friends, his career and daily obligations, but when he spoke of the past, it was with such cool composure that he gave the impression that it wasnt his history he was talking about. He was only in his mid-30s when he first came to see me, so the remoteness of his childhood was striking. This quality, along with his air of culture and sophistication, made it seem as if he had entered the world fully grown, sprung from the head of Zeus.

title: Margo Jeffersons Negroland: A Memoir
description: The phrase Black Lives Matter, which emerged as a rallying cry during a year of frequent deadly showdowns between police officers and unarmed black citizens, has almost always been pointed at whites. Its a way of saying, Stop discounting us. Stop mowing us down with your hatred, fear and disregard. But Black Lives Matter might just as easily have been the mantra of Americas black elite who, as far back as before the abolition of slavery, sought to establish themselves in communities characterized by privilege and extreme class consciousness. Of course for them, the phrase would have been transmitted insularly, from one to another, as a reminder of how much was riding upon their success at not merely performing gentility but also believing in the inviolable dignity that gentility has always been thought to confer. Why? Because believing a thing like that will make you less susceptible to everything America has concocted to turn you right back into chattel.

title: Who Qualifies for Asylum?
description: Its an ancient promise: When outsiders flee to a new place in desperate need, they will not be turned away. The Hebrew Bible speaks of six cities of refuge where someone who caused a death unwittingly would be protected from being killed in revenge. The Greeks allowed slaves who ran away from abusive masters and even some criminals to seek sanctuary in certain temples; asylum comes from their word for inviolable. According to legend, Romulus, the founder of Rome, extended asylum to people we would call migrants, choosing a spot between two groves on Capitoline Hill for his citys temple of asylum. A crowd of commoners, both free and enslaved, poured in from the neighboring territories, eager for new conditions, the historian Livy wrote. This was the first step towards the strength Romulus envisioned for Rome.

title: Will Crime Return as an Election Strategy for Republicans?

Trump in an effort to weaken him among the voters who have made him an unlikely but powerful force in the Republican presidential race.

title: Microbeads: The Very Tiny Troublemakers
description: The Great Lakes are being threatened by an invasion of tiny plastic orbs called microbeads, but lawmakers for one state that depends on this huge freshwater ecosystem have failed to do anything about it. That state is, of course, New York, where lawmakers this year sat on a good bill to ban these unnecessary bits of plastic.

title: Bringing Seafood Charcuterie to the Table
description: Across the country, chefs are expanding the definition of the traditional meat plate, swapping out fatty pork for the catch of the day. At Cure in Pittsburgh, Justin Severino has reimagined classics like nduja (a spreadable spicy pork sausage) with sockeye salmon, and finocchiona (a fennel-seed salami) with swordfish. At Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. in Brooklyn and at Seamores in Manhattan, diners can smear rich pts of smoked bluefish onto crusty bread. Matt Jennings, the owner of Townsman in Boston, delivers a clever spin on mortadella by substituting scallops for pork. And when Norah in West Hollywood opens next month, Angelenos can dig into smoked trout rillettes and shrimp boudin.

title: Republicans Vow to Erase Obamas Record, but Such Promises Are Rarely Kept
description: LOS ANGELES  For all the talk of Republican fractiousness, the partys 2016 presidential field has united around one principle: erasing President Obamas record.

title: French Economists Protest Hollandes Nomination of Central Bank Chief
description: PARIS  Nearly 150 leading economists on Tuesday criticized President Franois Hollandes plan to appoint a former executive of Frances largest lender to head the countrys central bank by calling on legislators to block the appointment over concerns about potential conflicts of interest.

title: Next Test for Guatemalas Protest Movement: Improving Citizens Lives
description: GUATEMALA CITY  Shortly after 5 a.m. one day last week, a security guard opened the entrance of Roosevelt Hospital here to patients who had been lining up in the dark mountain chill for more than an hour.

title: China Building Airstrip on 3rd Artificial Island, Images Show
description: BEIJING  New satellite images show that China has started construction of an airstrip on a third artificial island in the South China Sea that will strengthen Beijings military capacity in the contested waters, Western analysts say.

title: CNN Hopes to Capture Candidates Combative Spirit in G.O.P. Debate
description: SIMI VALLEY, Calif.  The leading Republican presidential hopefuls have spent the weeks since their first debate provoking one another, with distant taunts and tweeted insults.

title: Ahead of Pope Francis Visit, Survivors of Sexual Abuse Take Stock
description: Dan Ogrodowski stayed silent into middle age. He expected to go to the grave, he said, without speaking out about the Milwaukee priest who had raped him as a child.

title: 1940: Vichy Arrests Former Premier Leon Blum
description: VICHY  Leon Blum, twice Premier of France and leader of the French Socialist party, was arrested today [Sept. 15] and administratively interned, as an official communique put it, in Chateau Chazeron. There he joined the distinguished company of two other former French Premiers, a former generalissimo of the Allied armies, and a former French Minister of Interior who believed in making war on the Germans to the bitter end, Georges Mandel. Of the five eminent Frenchmen now under guarded residence, only one  Mandel  so far has been indicted. He was charged with plotting against the security of the state.  New York Herald Tribune, September 16, 1940

title: What to Do Before Deployment? Theres No Crying at Disneyland
description: My husband, finally finished with the year of work-ups (short deployments preparing for the big one) and about to deploy, sat with me on the curb at Disneyland, watching our two children gape in awe at the Paint the Night Parade. Lightning McQueen revved his engine and the Princesses twirled before us, and the air was filled with the musics repeating refrain: When can we do this again? I never want this to end.

title: Putin Defends Russian Stance on Syria
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Tuesday defended Russias continued military support of the Syrian government, saying that without it, the refugee crisis in Europe would be worse.

title: Rodartes Poetic, Less-Is-More Beauty Look
description: Unlike past seasons, when models sported eyebrow piercings and rhinestone-dappled lids, there were no arresting beauty looks in Rodartes spring/summer 2016 show. Or as the lead makeup artist James Kaliardos put it, Its not tricky. Instead, styles skewed neutral with sandy, monochromatic makeup, which, from Rodarte, felt quite revelatory  not to mention pretty.

title: F.D.A. Bans Sales of 4 Cigarette Products by R.J. Reynolds
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration halted the sale of four types of R. J. Reynolds cigarettes on Tuesday, saying the company failed to prove that they were not more harmful than products already on the market.

title: Migrants Protest Hungarys Border Fence
description: Hundreds of migrants staged a sit-in on a Serbian motorway to protest a new wire barrier that is preventing them from crossing into Hungary.

title: Casa Mono
description: Mario Batali and Joe Bastianichs Spanish tapas restaurant near Union Square.

title: Restaurant Review: Casa Mono in Gramercy Park
description: Casa Mono has a lot to answer for. Founded by Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich in 2003, it was among the earliest and most influential restaurants to twist the Spanish tapas idiom into what New Yorkers learned to call small-plates dining. The Casa Mono style has spread far and wide, leaving in its wake a trail of cluttered tables, unpredictably sequenced dishes, and diners reduced to asking pathetically, Will that be enough food?

title: Uber Case Highlights Outdated Worker Protection Laws
description: A dispute in California over whether Ubers drivers are employees or contractors shows that labor laws that were passed decades ago just dont work in the smartphone world.

title: Nina Tassler, CBSs Head of Entertainment, Is Stepping Down
description: Nina Tassler, the longtime head of entertainment programming at CBS, is stepping down at the end of the year, the network said on Tuesday.

title: The Dtente That Wasnt: Putins Call to Elton John
description: LONDON  It was a story that seemed almost too good to be true. Russias president, Vladimir V. Putin, celebrated for his macho bravura, and the pop star Elton John, known for his elaborate costumes, ballads and gay activism, coming together in a phone conversation that the singer said had been initiated by the Kremlin.

title: Head of Mental Health Institute Leaving for Google Life Sciences
description: Dr. Thomas R. Insel, the director of the National Institute of Mental Health, announced on Tuesday that he planned to step down in November, ending his 13-year tenure at the helm of the worlds leading funder of behavioral-health research to join Google Life Sciences, which seeks to develop technologies for early detection and treatment of health problems.

title: The Roots of Organic Farming on Campus
description: Mark Bittman learns about an innovative apprenticeship program that is aiming to improve the way we eat, farm and garden.

title: Eastern Europes Short Memory
description: Even as Europes greatest refugee emergency since World War II grew more acute, prompting Germany and some other nations to temporarily shut their borders, European Union interior ministers failed on Monday to agree on even a limited mandatory distribution of refugees for resettlement among member states.

title: The Roots of Organic Farming on Campus
description: This is the seventh in a series of videos about sustainable agriculture and healthy eating. The series was produced in collaboration with the Global Food Initiative at the University of California.

title: Trump Addresses Cheering Crowd in Dallas
description: The Republican presidential candidate, Donald J. Trump, spoke at a campaign rally in Dallas on Monday and shared his thoughts on womens health care, climate change and other issues.

title: Brother of Jason Rezaian, the Reporter Held in Iran, Appeals to U.N. Panel
description: GENEVA  The brother of a Washington Post journalist imprisoned in Iran for more than a year appealed to a United Nations human rights panel on Tuesday to intercede with the Iranian authorities to obtain his release.

title: Neo-Classical Pieces, Reinterpreted
description: Modern designers rethink the languid luxury of daybeds, candlesticks and more.

title: Malcolm Turnbull Takes Helm as Australian Prime Minister
description: SYDNEY, Australia  When Malcolm Turnbull was sworn in on Tuesday, he did not only become Australias 29th prime minister  he also became its fourth in just over two years. His three immediate predecessors were ousted by their own parties, including Tony Abbott, who was forced out Monday in a leadership challenge led by Mr. Turnbull.

title: 1965: Americans Flee to Iran
description: TEHRAN  More than 600 American women and children were evacuated to here today [Sept. 15] in a massive airlift from war-torn West Pakistan. Seven giant C-130 planes airlifted them from Lahore. In Washington, the State Department said a similar airlift of Americans from the Dacca area of East Pakistan would begin shortly, possibly tomorrow. There are about 900 Americans in the Dacca area but a State Department spokesman said he did not know how many would leave. The spokesman said another airlift may be made from West Pakistan.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 16, 1965

title: Changes in Credit Default Swap Market Bode Well for Transparency
description: The credit default swap market is the latest bank activity to encounter Libor-style market abuse shame. Twelve banks on Friday agreed to a $1.9 billion settlement in the United States after investor accusations that they had abused their market-making position in credit default swaps, which enable investors to protect themselves against losses. Even so, the market is mending itself.

title: Bulls Gory Killing at Spanish Festival Draws Protest
description: LONDON  Bullfighting has a long history in Spain, but there seems to be something especially grim about the Toro de la Vega in Tordesillas.

title: Study Says Women Are Still Underrepresented on TV in Front of the Cameras and Behind the Scenes
description: While the television industry now counts producers like Shonda Rhimes, Jenji Kohan (Orange Is the New Black) and Jill Soloway (Transparent) among its most celebrated showrunners, progress has stalled overall when it comes to equal representation for women both on screen and behind the scenes.

title: Washingtons Plan to Lampoon Cuban Politicians Is a Joke
description: The American government is looking for a comedy troupe to produce a uniquely funny variety show lampooning Cuban politicians and other public figures.

title: A View From the Top on Preventing Financial Valleys
description: I love climbing in the mountains and try to do it as often as possible. Four hours north of my home sits one of my favorite places to climb, the Teton Range. Its a beautiful area, one of the most striking mountain ranges in the continental United States.

title: Rodarte: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection from Kate and Laura Mulleavy.

title: Banjo Innovator Wins Steve Martin Bluegrass Award
description: As if dedicating your life to an instrument like the banjo wasnt sufficiently avant-garde, the winner of this years Steve Martin Prize for Excellence in Banjo and Bluegrass is a musician recognized for his experimental approach to that seemingly quaint stringed instrument. Danny Barnes, the Texas-based banjo player and a founder of Bad Livers, the nonconformist roots-music group, has been named the recipient of the Steve Martin Prize, its organizers said; in a news release, they hailed Mr. Barnes as one of bluegrass musics most distinctive and innovative performers, and for the raw and unpolished musical breadth of his compositions that have propelled him across the industry today.

title: Fred DeLuca, Hands-on Co-Founder of Subway Sandwich Chain, Dies at 67
description: Fred DeLuca, who in 1965, at 17, borrowed $1,000 to open a sandwich shop in Bridgeport, Conn., to help pay college expenses and parlayed that experience into building Subway, the worlds largest chain of fast-food franchises, died on Monday. He was 67.

title: Tory Burchs Day at the Beach
description: For spring/summer 2016, the designer included tunics, fringe detailing and strapless dresses.

title: At Rodarte, Romance With a Touch of Darkness
description: The spring/summer 2016 collection featured soft hues and fabrics spiked with a glam-rock edge.

title: The Fashion News to Know Today
description: A Kate Spade ad without a bicycle

title: Reaching Europe
description: Huge numbers of people continue to arrive at Europes borders.

title: Defiant Baruch Fraternity Pledge Fought Back in Fatal Hazing, Report Says
description: POCONO SUMMIT, Pa.  The fraternity brothers decided that Chun Hsien Deng had a bad attitude.

title: Cheesy Ice Cream, Please
description: A Parmigiano Reggiano base gets amped up with balsamic vinegar, olive oil and sea salt.

title: China Releases Guo Yushan, Scholar Who Helped Activist Gain Asylum in U.S.
description: BEIJING  The Chinese authorities on Tuesday released a founder of a research institute who was instrumental in helping the legal activist Chen Guangcheng gain asylum in the United States after he escaped house arrest three years ago.

title: Ruth Reichl Recharges in the Kitchen
description: SPENCERTOWN, N.Y.  Ruth Reichl was in the kitchen she designed as both command center and comfort station, making a salami sandwich for her husband, Michael Singer, 75, a former CBS News producer who has been recovering from back surgery.

title: What Can Airline Passengers Do About Bad Behavior?
description: On Friday, CNN reported that a JetBlue passenger en route from Anchorage to Portland, Ore., stood up and urinated on passengers sitting in front of him and others around him. When the plane landed, he was arrested by Portland police, charged with criminal mischief and offensive littering, two misdemeanors, and later released.

title: Rodarte Show, Spring 2015
description: Sound and light at the Rodarte New York Fashion Week runway show.

title: Raising Rates Too Soon: The Mistake Central Banks Keep Making
description: Central banks, to boil their job down to its simplest level, face this perpetual dilemma: Should they push for easier money, to try to support a nations economic growth, or for tighter money, to try to head off inflation?

title: Celebrating the Flavors of Eataly With Ice Cream (Not Gelato)
description: Five years ago, Eataly opened its doors on Fifth Avenue and 23rd Street, and ushered in the era of the high-end, themed, culinary mega-store. Since then, massive shrines to all things Italian have popped up around the globe, in places like Chicago, Dubai and, as of late last month, Seoul.

title: Disney-ABC Names Cindy Davis and John Frelinghuysen to Senior Posts
description: LOS ANGELES  As it works to shore up its non-ESPN television division in a time of tremendous industrywide challenges  perhaps with the eventual introduction of a direct-to-consumer streaming service  the Walt Disney Company on Tuesday named a former Walmart executive and a former AOL leader to senior posts.

title: Interview: Ellen Page
description: The actress discusses her roles in two films showing at the 40th Toronto International Film Festival, Freeheld and Into the Forest.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 5
description: Mariah Carey shows up at W magazines dance; the Kardashian/Jenner sisters party with Galore; and Karolina Kurkova celebrates the Slowear opening.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 5
description: Mariah Carey shows up at W magazines dance; the Kardashian/Jenner sisters party with Galore; and Karolina Kurkova celebrates the Slowear opening.

title: When the Mission Is to Be an Outcast
description: On a stifling day last month, the designer Rio Uribe sat in his basement-level, midtown studio wearing shorts, Reeboks, and a yellow basketball jersey emblazoned with a planetary Haturn logo that has become the emblem of his three-year-old label, Gypsy Sport. The studio is a physical manifestation of the brand: exploding with color and pattern, every surface is covered in red and gold paper lanterns, bamboo plants and the vibrant remnants from past collections. Over the past five seasons, Uribes vividly eccentric designs have made the brand famous for its irreverent, gender-fluid take on mens wear.

title: Egypt Rejects Criticism Over Airstrike That Killed Mexican Tourists
description: CAIRO  Mexicos foreign minister traveled to Egypt on Tuesday to demand answers about a mistaken military airstrike over the weekend that hit a picnic full of Mexican tourists, killing a dozen people, while her Egyptian counterpart defended the professionalism and sacrifice of the Egyptian security forces.

title: Vera Wang: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The latest spring designs from Ms. Wang.

title: House Vote Said to Be Near on Repeal of Oil Export Ban
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Kevin McCarthy, Republican of California and majority leader, said on Tuesday that the House was preparing to vote later this month to repeal a 40-year-old ban on the export of crude oil. The plan was immediately celebrated by the oil industry but is already drawing fire from environmental groups.

title: Timeline: Democracy in Recession
description: Charting the rise, and stall, of democracy in the last 40 years.

title: Tough Going for Health Co-ops
description: Late last month, the Nevada Health Co-op became the third casualty among 23 insurance start-ups created under the federal health care law to inject competition for coverage in certain parts of the country.

title: Model-Morphosis: Frederikke Sofie at Vera Wang
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in New York.

title: Blue Origin, Jeff Bezos Rocket Company, to Launch From Florida
description: Blue Origin, a secretive rocket company started by Jeffrey P. Bezos, the chief executive of Amazon, made a splashy public announcement on Tuesday, saying it will build rockets and send them into orbit from Florida.

title: Bruce Springsteen and Jon Stewart to Perform at Stand Up for Heroes Event
description: Bruce Springsteen and Jon Stewart will return to Madison Square Garden to headline the ninth annual Stand Up for Heroes performance on Nov. 10. Presented by the Bob Woodruff Foundation and the New York Comedy Festival, the performance also stars Seth Meyers, John Oliver and Ray Romano and will raise money to support wounded veterans and their families.

title: London Fields Premiere in Toronto Troubled by Creative Rift
description: TORONTO  It has not been hard to spot Johnny Depp at the giant film festival here. Monday night, he walked the red carpet with his wife, Amber Heard, to celebrate a showing of his movie Black Mass. Two days earlier, it was Mr. Depp on Ms. Heards arm, at a screening of The Danish Girl, of which she is a star.

title: Brooklyn Man Sought in Similar Deaths of 2 Women at Hotels
description: It was July 23 when the first woman was discovered dead in Room 3 of a Brooklyn hotel, her body bearing the telltale signs of strangulation, the police said. On Sept. 8, a second woman was found dead, this time at a hotel in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Street Style: A Colorful Mix
description: The style on the street during New York Fashion Week is a changeable as the weather.

title: David Chang Opens Fuku+ in Midtown
description: Fuku+ Across the street from Harry Winstons rocks, you can now get a heaping bowl of crisp chicken nuggets with jade-green hot sauce for just $6. Its one of the items at the new Midtown edition of Fuku, the fried-chicken-sandwich cubbyhole that David Chang recently opened in the East Village. Crunchy salt-and-pepper head-on shrimp, several salads and flatbread slathered with nubbly Sichuan pork are served along with beer, wine and cocktails. The space, inside the Chambers Hotel, is at street level, behind the Milk Bar stand and overlooking M Pche below. Set menu packages, serving up to eight people, can be ordered ahead online. The little restaurant has some unexpected extras, like waiter service and Bob Dylan and Waylon Jennings on the playlist to ramp up the energy of the crowd at the counter and high-top tables: 15 West 56th Street, momofuku.com.

title: Russia Resisting Europe Request for Tough U.N. Anti-Smuggling Step
description: UNITED NATIONS  A European bid to obtain Security Council approval for a military operation against boats suspected of human smuggling on the Mediterranean Sea is running into opposition from Russia, which wants to ensure that it cannot be used to justify a broader military intervention, diplomats here said.

title: Fantasy Football Week 2: Waiver Wire Picks
description: The N.F.L. had a fair number of injuries in Week 1, some more significant than others. Injuries are a main contributor to the emergence of waiver wire darlings, and because nobody wins a fantasy football league on draft day, it is crucial to be on top of the free-agent pool. Here are the best waiver wire picks after the first week (ownership percentages based on Yahoo leagues).

title: Extreme Downhill Biking
description: The mountain biker Primoz Ravnik rode down a steep 200-foot dam spillway in Zirovnica, Slovenia.

title: The Fixers Who Rescue Dye Jobs Gone Wrong
description: Jennifer Humphrey sat rigidly on a couch at the Sally Hershberger Downtown salon, her eyes darting across the waiting area.

title: New High-Shine Lip Glosses for Fall
description: This fall, a handful of companies are offering alternatives to the stainlike matte lipsticks that have been popular for the last few seasons: shiny lip glosses, some in highly pigmented formulas that add a surprisingly vivid swipe of color.

title: Coming Soon to Facebook: A Dislike Button
description: Facebooks famous like button, with its silhouette of an upturned thumb, will soon be accompanied by an alternative: a way to dislike a post.

title: Ted Cruz Ad Uses Scorpion to Depict Threat of Islamic Terror
description: For aficionados of political ads, the line Theres a bear in the woods still brings a shivery memory of a 1984 spot for Ronald Reagan that helped define his foreign policy of peace through strength.

title: Cuomo and Christie Say States Can Pay Half of Hudson Rail Tunnel Project
description: The governors of New York and New Jersey sent a letter to President Obama on Tuesday offering to line up funding for half of the costs of new Hudson River rail tunnels if the federal government pledges grants for the other half.

title: Protests at Annual Bull-Killing Festival
description: Demonstrators attended the annual Toro de la Vega festival in the Spanish town of Tordesillas last year to protest the traditional bull-spearing event.

title: Charlie Hebdo Mocks Europes Response to Migrant Crisis With Cartoons of Dead Syrian Boy
description: French illustrators have been denounced on social networks in recent days for publishing editorial cartoons inspired by photographs of Aylan Kurdi, a 3-year-old Syrian boy whose drowning in the waters off Greece this month prompted an outpouring of sympathy for refugees.

title: Looking for Conventions, Cities Add Hotel Rooms
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  When Kansas City failed to make the cut for the 2016 Republican National Convention, some officials chalked it up to politics.

title: Online Ad for Jeb Bush Paints Dark Picture of Donald Trump
description: [Video: Watch on YouTube.]

title: Reactions Vary to News of New Mary Poppins Film
description: LOS ANGELES  Disney is developing a new Mary Poppins film. Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious? Or something quite atrocious?

title: The Nightly Show With Larry Wilmore Renewed Through End of 2016
description: Larry Wilmore and his staff at The Nightly Show now have certainty that they will be keeping it 100 through the end of next year and for the duration of the presidential election: Comedy Central said on Tuesday that it had renewed the news-satire series through the end of 2016, confirming a report that first appeared on CNN.com.

title: Police Discuss Charges in Baruch Hazing
description: Chief Chris Wagner of the Pocono Mountain Regional Police Department said Tuesday that a grand jury had recommended that fraternity members face charges in the death of a Baruch College freshman.

title: Rand Paul to Run Ad During Debate Calling Himself a Real Conservative
description: Senator Rand Paul is not betting that his time on the stage during the Republican presidential debate on Wednesday night will be enough to get his message out and re-energize his campaign. So he is buying time on CNN, the network hosting the debate, so he can run an ad during the commercial breaks.

title: Diesel Black Gold: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The latest collection from the label.

title: Legislators in Missouri Take Aim at Union Dues
description: AFFTON, Mo.  During a recent visit to this working-class suburb of St. Louis, Gov. Jay Nixon told cheering union workers that he would fight to preserve a bedrock of labor organizing: the right to require workers, including those who opt out of joining a union, to pay dues or their equivalent.

title: Chinese-American Cleared of Spying Charges Now Faces Firing
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Government officials say they intend to fire a Chinese-American hydrologist who was prosecuted but eventually cleared of espionage-related charges.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Review: Comedy Centrals Moonbeam City Recalls the World of Miami Vice
description: If you were a graphic artist, a Duran Duran fan or, really, just someone with eyes during the late 1970s and early 80s, you know the work of Patrick Nagel. His flat, Art Deco-ish illustrations of women, their features reduced to pouting lips and dramatic eyes, were ubiquitous for a time, gracing the pages of Playboy, the cover of Duran Durans Rio album and, as the art critic Peter Plagens wrote in The New York Times, hairdressing salons and white-shag-carpet condos from Coral Gables to La Jolla.

title: Review: Peace Officer Explores Military-Style Raids by Law Enforcement
description: Peace Officer, a documentary about the militarization of law enforcement, is nothing if not timely, though its focus is mostly confined to one state.

title: Review: Tree of Codes, an Explosion of Energy in a Sea of More
description: Arrive early to Tree of Codes, the dance spectacle at the Park Avenue Armory, and you can spend some time observing your shadow, psychedelically multiplied, along the walls of the 55,000-square-foot Wade Thompson Drill Hall. Audience members lingered there, Instagramming, at the New York premiere on Monday. That installation, by the Danish-Icelandic visual artist Olafur Eliasson, turns out to be one of the more subtle elements in this high-profile collaboration, which features Mr. Eliassons visual design, a score by the English composer Jamie xx and choreography  lots of it  by Wayne McGregor.

title: New Website Aims to Provide Guidance to Theater Fans
description: There are web sites that aggregate film reviews, and those that compare prices for all kinds of products. But the theater business has traditionally been seen as too small, and the shelf life of shows too short, to sustain such technology for Broadway.

title: A Migration Juggernaut Is Headed for Europe
description: European leaders probably dont want to hear this now, as they frantically try to close their borders to stop hundreds of thousands of desperate migrants and asylum seekers escaping hunger and violence in Africa and the Middle East. But they are dealing with the unstoppable force of demography.

title: Threes a Trend: Surfer Vibes on the Runway
description: Memories of the beach are, evidently, still lingering in the minds of New Yorkers: So far this season, several designers have included nods to surf culture in their spring/summer shows. At Altuzarra, an acid-green tie-dyed dress came down the runway, unbuttoned to expose a bra underneath. At Victoria Beckham, the inspiration was more literal: abstract drawings of surfers appeared on zip jackets, low-cut dresses and skirts. And at Tommy Hilfiger, the island-themed runway featured colorful, striped Baja pullover sweaters  a tried and true surfer staple.

title: Bezos Announces Rocket Launch Site
description: Jeffrey P. Bezos, the founder of Amazon and the chief executive of Blue Origin, revealed plans to build a rocket manufacturing plant and use a launch site in Florida.

title: Democrats Move to Beef Up Fund-Raising With Staff Overhaul
description: The Democratic National Committee is moving to drastically beef up its fund-raising arm, adding a finance co-chairman to the current one, who has at times prompted controversy, and announcing six others to leadership positions to help raise money for the 2016 presidential race.

title: G.O.P. Discord Over Ex-Im Bank Intensifies, as G.E. Shifts Jobs Abroad
description: WASHINGTON  General Electric announced plans on Tuesday to move 500 jobs overseas, and Boeing said it had lost a second foreign satellite contract in weeks, developments that both corporate giants blamed on the Republican-led Congresss failure to keep the federal Export-Import Bank open to help finance new deals.

title: The GoPro That Fell to Earth
description: In June 2013, members of the Grand Canyon Stratospheric Balloon Team launched a balloon with a camera into the stratosphere, where it burst. It was found by a hiker two years later.

title: Milly: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection.

title: Review: Circuit des Yeux, With Haley Fohrs Deep Vocals, Seeks an Essential Truth
description: A full-band Circuit des Yeux show these days is a forceful and elegant process with resonance and harmony and drones, a gathering force around its deep-voiced pressure center, the singer, guitarist and songwriter Haley Fohr. Ive seen two over the last month. I could see another right now.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Sale of Twombly Work to Help Fund Expansion of Wilshire Boulevard Temple in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  Its become something of an art-market trope to say that for the price of a single painting by a blue-chip artist you could pay for an entire building by a well-known architect.

title: Review: Making Connections at Istanbuls Biennial
description: ISTANBUL  Three years ago, the American-Italian curator Carolyn Christov-Bakargiev garnered ecstatic reviews for her edition of Documenta, the superexhibition that takes place every five years in Kassel, Germany. Challenging and disorderly, it dissolved borders among art, history and science, placing contemporary art alongside Afghan antiquities, objects from Hitlers apartment and meteorites.

title: Martin McDonaghs Hangmen, a Mordant Stage Homecoming in London
description: LONDON  In 2000, the bad-boy playwright Martin McDonagh accused the Royal Court Theater here of cowardice for declining to stage his ultraviolent Irish Republican Army-themed play, The Lieutenant of Inishmore.

title: Review: Pawn Sacrifice, Another Take on the Royal Game
description: It was a challenge to play Bobby Fischer in chess, and its a challenge for an actor to play him on the screen. Anyone taking on the task needs to be careful not to get carried away with the mans eccentricities, to make sure to retain the pathos beneath the sideshow.

title: Review: Storm, Still, a Riff on King Lear in a Brooklyn Backyard
description: The playwright Gabrielle Reisman has taken that All the worlds a stage business to heart. And she has taken it home: Her tumbledown backyard in the wilds of Bushwick is the setting for her minor but likable Storm, Still.

title: Nicolas Berggruen Wants to Bridge the East-West Gap
description: Western universities and private philanthropists have poured resources into China in recent years, funding scholarships, campuses and other initiatives to bridge the gap between East and West.

title: Coach: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The labels latest looks.

title: Where Gay Love Is Illegal
description: The photographer Robin Hammond traveled to seven countries to make portraits of L.G.B.T. individuals who had been attacked because of their sexual orientation.

title: Video Retrieved From GoPro Balloon That Soared to Nearly 100,000 Feet
description: Strapped to a weather balloon bound for space, this GoPro camera soared almost 100,000 feet, into the stratosphere, to capture high-resolution footage of the Grand Canyon in 2013. An hour and a half into its flight the balloon burst and the camera plummeted back to earth.

title: Pictures of the Day: Germany and Elsewhere
description: Germany and More  Pictures of the Day

title: September 15, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Germany, Serbia, Hungary and North Korea.

title: Hewlett-Packard to Cut About 10 Percent of Work Force
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  A year ago, Meg Whitman announced she was cutting Hewlett-Packard in two. On Tuesday, she detailed job cuts expected at the company.

title: Paul Taylor American Modern Dance Announces New Season
description: The reinvented Paul Taylor American Modern Dance, which had its inaugural season at Lincoln Center earlier this year, will return next spring to present the fruits of its latest venture, Taylor Company Commissions.

title: Review: The Fool Is Yuri Bykovs Look at Corruption
description: The dreary unidentified Russian town that is the setting of Yuri Bykovs devastating film, The Fool, is an outpost of hell. If you can bear to look at it, I recommend you pay a visit and study it from behind bulletproof glass, because similar places arent all that uncommon.

title: How the New York Times/CBS News Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted Sept. 9 to 13 with 1,261 adults throughout the United States. Of those, 1,021 said they were registered to vote.

title: More Republicans See Donald Trump as a Winner, Poll Finds
description: Republicans increasingly think that Donald J. Trump has the best chance of winning the 2016 presidential election as their nominee as confidence fades in traditional politicians like Jeb Bush and Scott Walker, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll.

title: A Conversation With Steven Rutter
description: Mr. Rutter, 56, is the director of Stribling Marketing Associates, a division of the Stribling & Associates boutique brokerage firm, which focuses on new residential developments in New York City. Among the projects currently being marketed are 252 East 57th Street, 210 West 77th Street and the Philip House at 141 East 88th Street.

title: Champions League Comes Before Domestic Ones for Some Top Clubs
description: PARIS  One of the great, if occasionally confusing, aspects of European soccer is the sheer number of opportunities that exist for someone  anyone  to win something. It has not gotten so bad that associations are handing out participation trophies (yet), but in many of the big soccer countries, so many competitions run concurrently in any given season that it can sometimes feel like an exercise in memorization to simply keep track of them all.

title: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on the State of the Presidential Race
description: Republicans increasingly think that Donald J. Trump has the best chance of winning the 2016 election as their nominee, but support for Ben Carson is up since August, according to a New York Times/CBS News nationwide poll.

title: De Blasio to Announce 10-Year Deadline to Offer Computer Science to All Students
description: To ensure that every child can learn the skills required to work in New York Citys fast-growing technology sector, Mayor Bill de Blasio will announce on Wednesday that within 10 years all of the citys public schools will be required to offer computer science to all students.

title: Why Is That Dog Looking at Me?
description: Among the deep and intriguing phenomena that attract intense scientific interest are the birth and death of the universe, the intricacies of the human brain and the way dogs look at humans.

title: London Theater Journal: Getting Giddy
description: LONDON  There was a time when caper, used as an adjective, signaled an especially sprightly form of entertainment. It usually meant a movie or play that involved a heist or a theft, or some sort of illicit deception, and bristled with lively counterplots and sexual intrigue. Caper is now an anachronistic word, and the light-handed, light-fingered genre it once stood for has been largely eclipsed, at least on screen, by more adrenalized, special-effects-heavy fare.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: A Chinese Social Media Star Comes to Fashion Week
description: With a name like Leaf Greener (a literal translation of her Chinese name, Ye Zi) and clothing that ranges from a  yolk-yellow Rosie Assoulin pantsuit at noon to a lacy Ronald van der Kemp evening gown after dark, surely you can make an impression during New York Fashion Week.

title: Norman L. Farberow Is Dead at 97; Took Study of Suicide to Academic Fore
description: Norman L. Farberow, a psychologist who was a founder of the nations first comprehensive suicide prevention center and helped bring the study of suicide into the academic mainstream, died on Thursday in Los Angeles. He was 97.

title: Sophie Theallet: Spring 206 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection.

title: Analysts Detail Claims That Reports on ISIS Were Distorted
description: WASHINGTON  A group of intelligence analysts have provided investigators with documents they say show that senior military officers manipulated the conclusions of reports on the war against the Islamic State, according to several government officials, as lawmakers from both parties voiced growing anger that they may have received a distorted picture about the military campaigns progress.

title: David Feherty Moves From CBS to NBC and Golf Channel
description: Golf announcers do not often defect from one network to another, so David Fehertys move from CBS Sports to NBC and Golf Channel is unusual.

title: Dentsply to Acquire Sirona Dental for $5.5 Billion
description: Two of the biggest makers of dental products said on Tuesday that they had agreed to combine, betting on bigger scale to take advantage of growing demand for dentistry work.

title: How to Use a Standing Desk Without Annoying Your Co-Workers
description: As with any new piece of automated equipment, navigating the proper etiquette of standing desks can involve a bit of a learning curve.

title: What to Wear at a Standing Desk
description: Lisa Raphael, who leads the editorial team at the website Brit & Co, tried out a standing desk in the hope it would help her scoliosis and back pain. Its been a big health trend readers are responding to, she said. And Ive read all the studies that sitting is the new smoking for our generation.

title: BTG Pactual Is Cleared to Acquire Swiss Private Bank BSI
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Brazilian investment bank BTG Pactual has received approval from the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority to acquire the Swiss private bank BSI, and in doing so concluded the transaction, the firm, based in So Paulo, said on Tuesday.

title: Off The Runway: Day 6
description: Scenes from the sixth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Back to School With Thom Browne and Rodarte
description: One of the weirder coincidences of New York Fashion Week is that it starts, almost exactly, on the first day of school in most of the city. The parallels of children going back to class and fashion going back to shows are hard to ignore. Theres something about the beginning of the season that feels like a continuing education course: The subjects, broadly, are the same, but the curriculum has been updated. Its a week of cramming.

title: Closing the Back Door to Europe
description: In recent months European nations have worked to block the main route taken by migrants fleeing war and upheaval.

title: Senate Democrats Again Block Vote to Reject Iran Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats on Tuesday blocked another vote on a resolution disapproving of the Iran nuclear deal, reprising the result of a vote last week.

title: Grim Search in the Aftermath of a Flood
description: Residents of Hildale, Utah, looked for the victims of Mondays flash fooding.

title: Msgr. Mark Miles, Popes English Translator, Braces for the U.S. Spotlight
description: ROME  On a blustery day in January this year, Pope Francis appeared before thousands of worshipers in Tacloban City, the Philippines, and asked for permission to give his address in Spanish.

title: Misidentified and Tackled by the New York Police, but No Tennis Star Treatment
description: It was February and the streets were crusted with winter, not a September day steeped in high-noon mugginess. The scene was the street outside a barber shop on Teller Avenue in the Bronx, not the entrance to the Grand Hyatt New York hotel on East 42nd Street in Manhattan. And the person taken to the ground was an 11-year-old girl, not an internationally known former tennis star.

title: Oscar de la Renta: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Peter Coppings spring collection.

title: Cardiologist Nominated to Be Head of F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Tuesday nominated Dr. Robert Califf, a cardiologist and clinical researcher long affiliated with Duke University, to be the commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Autoworkers Union Reaches Tentative Deal With Fiat Chrysler
description: DETROIT  Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and the United Automobile Workers union reached a tentative agreement on Tuesday on a new contract that could establish a pattern for labor deals at the other two American carmakers, General Motors and Ford.

title: Oklahoma: Governor Refuses Request to Delay Execution
description: Gov. Mary Fallin said Tuesday that she would not delay the execution of Richard Glossip, who is to die on Wednesday for arranging a murder in 1997. Mr. Glossips defense lawyers, the anti-death penalty campaigner Sister Helen Prejean, the Innocence Project and others had publicized what they call significant new evidence casting doubt on his guilt. His conviction rested largely on the testimony of the admitted killer, who was spared the death penalty in return for testifying that Mr. Glossip was the mastermind. But Ms. Fallin said she had seen no credible evidence of Richard Glossips innocence. Late Tuesday, his lawyers filed a new request for a stay of execution with the Oklahoma Court of Criminal Appeals, arguing that in view of the new evidence, he would be acquitted at trial today.

title: Charities Say U.S. Should Take Tens of Thousands of Syrians
description: Executives from leading American aid groups, watching the muddled international response to the migrant crisis with dismay, called on the United States government on Tuesday to multiply many times over its recent commitment to take 10,000 displaced Syrians in the next year.

title: Suit Accusing Dakota Co-op Board of Bias Against Blacks and Hispanics Fails
description: A judge in Manhattan has dismissed a lawsuit brought by the financier Alphonse Fletcher Jr. against the Dakota building, ruling that Mr. Fletcher had failed to provide evidence that the celebrated buildings co-op board had discriminated against him because he is black.

title: Patrick Kanes Status Is Shrouded in Silence
description: Patrick Kane skates with grace, a raw-boned little man with a preternatural feel for the game and an asps bite of a backhand shot. He has hoisted the Stanley Cup over his head three times, most recently when the Chicago Blackhawks won the championship in June.

title: Attitudes Shift on Paid Leave: Dads Sue, Too
description: WASHINGTON  For decades, women who believed their employers had punished them with lower wages and missed promotions after they had become mothers have been filing gender discrimination complaints and bringing lawsuits.

title: Frantic Evacuation in California Left Animals to Face Wildfire Alone
description: MIDDLETOWN, Calif.  When the Valley Fire blew up in this rural area 100 miles north of San Francisco last weekend, many residents fled with only the clothes they were wearing. The suddenness of the fires surge  half an hour from warning to life-threatening conflagration in many parts of Lake County  sent people scattering, their homes undefended and possessions left to fate or luck.

title: Obama Weighing Talks With Putin on Syrian Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  For more than a year, President Obama has resisted meeting one on one with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and only reluctantly taken a phone call, freezing out the Kremlin leader over his intervention in Ukraine in their own personal cold war.

title: In Search for Athletic Directors, Women Are Neglected in Texas and Beyond
description: Now that the front door has slammed on Steve Patterson, who had been Texas athletic director for nearly two years before he and the university decided to part ways on Tuesday, it should have been simple for Greg Fenves, the universitys president, to find an immediate replacement.

title: Striking Seattle Teachers Poised to Return to Classroom
description: Teachers in Seattle public schools suspended a nearly weeklong strike on Tuesday, announcing that they had agreed on a new contract with the citys school board. Classes are to resume on Thursday.

title: Adam Purple, Eccentric Environmentalist and Gardener in New York, Dies at 84
description: The man with the flowing white beard was a familiar presence for decades on the streets of the Lower East Side of Manhattan where he squatted in an abandoned building, created an elaborate, renowned garden and often wore royal-hued clothes that reflected the best known of his many adopted names: Adam Purple.

title: Retribution Increases Against Those Aiding Human Rights Inquiries
description: GENEVA  Those who give evidence to United Nations human rights investigators are facing increasingly severe reprisals, the United Nations Human Rights Council said Tuesday in a report naming 20 countries that took action against rights defenders and activists in the past year.

title: U.S. Judge Upholds Right to Scrawl Nasty Note on Speeding Ticket Payment
description: It began with a speeding ticket given in upstate New York to a man whose response was, to put it mildly, less than polite. He sent back a payment form with a scribbled five-word expression of vulgarity, and crossed out the towns name.

title: Marlins Rock Jacob deGrom, and the Mets Playoff Express Stalls for a Night
description: The Mets gathered in center field dressed in their pearly white pinstriped uniforms for their annual team picture Tuesday afternoon. They took their places, with their hands behind their backs  the young pitchers, the midseason acquisitions and the veterans who had posed for several of these before. This group would be commemorated, at the least, as the team that ended the Mets streak of six consecutive losing seasons.

title: Melvin Bernhardt, Tony-Winning Director Who Helped Stars Shine, Dies at 84
description: Melvin Bernhardt, who directed two Pulitzer Prize-winning dramas and won a Tony himself for Hugh Leonards Tony-winning play Da, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 84.

description: History suggests that each partys eventual nominee will emerge from 2015 in one of the top two or three positions, as measured by endorsements, fund-raising and polling.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (TCM) BREATHLESS (1961) Turner Classic Movies pays tribute to the director Jean-Luc Godard, starting with this New Wave classic about two erratic days in the lives of star-crossed young lovers  Jean-Paul Belmondo, as a French hoodlum on the lam after killing a cop, and Jean Seberg, as an American expatriate newspaper vendor  living in Paris. As sordid as the film is, and sordid is really a mild word for its pile-up of gross indecencies, Bosley Crowther wrote in The New York Times, it is no clich  rather more a chunk of raw drama, graphically and artfully torn with appropriately ragged edges out of the tough underbelly of modern metropolitan life. The evening continues with Pierrot le Fou (1968), featuring Mr. Belmondo as an unhappily married man who abandons his bourgeois life for a crime spree with an ex-girlfriend (Anna Karina), at 10:15; Masculin Fminin (1966), about an aspiring writer (Jean-Pierre Laud) who becomes involved with a rising pop star (Chantal Goya) and her roommates, at 12:15 a.m.; Alphaville (1965), in which a private investigator (Eddie Constantine) is sent to rescue a scientist from a future world ruled by computers, at 2:15; and A Woman Is a Woman (1964), about an exotic dancer (Ms. Karina) intent on finding a man to father a child, at 4. (Image: Ms. Seberg and Mr. Belmondo.)

title: A Very Unusual Subway Stop in New York
description: New York Citys long-suffering commuters might be wise to avoid a glittering new subway stop on the No. 7 line that opened Sunday at Hudson Yards on the West Side of Manhattan. After seeing the $2.4 billion station that has ignited a burst of development in this once-grim industrial area, riders may find it hard to return to the grime so typical of New York Citys vast 660-mile public transit system. And while no single station can be as sleek, efficient and air tempered as this one, commuters will almost certainly find themselves asking why the system as a whole cannot be greatly improved.

title: Iran Deal Players Report Cards
description: The Iran nuclear deal is now sealed  from Washingtons end. But since this has been one of Americas most important foreign policy shifts in the last four decades, its worth looking back and grading the performance of the key players.

title: Constitutionally, Slavery Is No National Institution
description: THE Civil War began over a simple question: Did the Constitution of the United States recognize slavery  property in humans  in national law? Southern slaveholders, inspired by Senator John C. Calhoun of South Carolina, charged that it did and that the Constitution was proslavery; Northern Republicans, led by Abraham Lincoln, and joined by abolitionists including Frederick Douglass, resolutely denied it. After Lincolns election to the presidency, 11 Southern states seceded to protect what the South Carolina secessionists called their constitutional right of property in slaves.

title: Can Anything Be Done About All the Money in Politics?
description: Nearly everyone in America agrees that there is too much influence-seeking money in politics, except for the people who benefit from it. Public concern over the potential for corruption in this flood of cash has resulted, over the past half century, in five separate approaches to the regulation of campaign finance.

title: In Yemen, Death From Above, Grief Below
description: SANA, Yemen  LEWZA was my sister-in-law. She was a good person, one of the kindest I have ever known.

title: With Possible Shutdown Nearing, Obama Looks to Take Budget Fight to G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Congress hurtled toward a government shutdown on Tuesday, with Republicans threatening to block a budget deal if it includes financing for Planned Parenthood, as President Obama prepared to join the fight by pushing Republicans to scrap a multibillion-dollar tax advantage for private equity managers.

title: Should Fraternities and Sororities Be Coed?
My Silver Hair
description: In this short animation, a New Yorker explains why she wears her hair in its natural color.

title: My Silver Hair
description: When I was in college, I met a beautiful woman in her early 20s who had a full head of gray hair. At first, I pitied her for being so radiant and yet cursed with such a glaring blemish. But after talking with her for just a few seconds I realized it wasnt her appearance that I was attracted to  gray hair or not  but her confidence and poise. Her clear self-acceptance, regardless of how others might view her, impressed me so deeply that 30 years later, I still remember the chance meeting. Today, all I remember about her was her hair color and her confidence.

title: News Qs | Instead of Arrests, Subway Dancers Are Getting a Stage Above Ground
description: In Instead of Arrests, Subway Dancers Are Getting a Stage Above Ground, J. David Goodman and Matt Flegenheimer write about a new police strategy.

title: Migrants Clash With Police in Hungary, as Others Enter Croatia
description: HORGOS, Serbia  In one of the worst bursts of violence that this tense refugee summer has seen, Hungarian riot police responded on Wednesday to rocks, taunts and small fires set by agitated migrants at the border crossing here with water cannons, head-cracking batons and both tear gas and pepper spray.

title: Living in Midwood, Brooklyn
description: Families are attracted to Midwood, Brooklyn, which offers relatively inexpensive homes and tree-lined streets.

title: Midwood, Brooklyn, Where Urban and Suburban Meet
description: The tree-lined streets of Midwood, with many single- and multifamily houses at prices that are relatively inexpensive for Brooklyn, naturally attract plenty of families. In fact, the basketball hoops dotting the driveways, and the Cozy Coupes and tricycles scattered along the sidewalks, might make visitors wonder if they were still in New York City.

title: The Travel Jacket Geeks Adore
description: I hate my kettle.

description: Donald J. Trump, once a great improviser, has started relying on prepared notes when he gives speeches.

description: Imagine a coarse chunk of gray salt 69 feet high.

title: Clive Owen, Suave and Roguish, on Making His Broadway Debut in Old Times
description: Clive Owen has chosen Fanelli Cafe in SoHo as the place to submit to an interview, and theres a logic to that. Hes the star of The Knick  a television series set in Lower Manhattan at the turn of the 20th century that has featured opium dens and race riots  and Fanelli sits in a 168-year-old building that at various times served as brothel, African-American boardinghouse and speakeasy.

title: Which 2016 Presidential Candidates Interest You Most?
description: More than a dozen Republicans and a handful of Democrats have announced that they are running for their partys 2016 presidential nomination, and the second Republican presidential debate airs on Sept. 16.

title: U.N. Urges Sri Lanka to Establish Court to Investigate War Abuses
description: GENEVA  Rejecting Sri Lankas offer to set up a truth and reconciliation commission to address grievances from its 26-year civil war, the United Nations on Wednesday called for it to set up a special court, including international judges and lawyers, to investigate what it called horrific abuses committed by both sides.

title: Elizabeth Gilberts Big Magic
description: Elizabeth Gilberts memoir Eat, Pray, Love sold 10 million copies and became the kind of cultural touchstone that makes its author famous, wealthy and controversial. To the books fans, including Oprah Winfrey and Julia Roberts (who starred in the movie adaptation), Gilberts tale of overcoming a bad divorce and deep depression by traveling to Italy, India and Indonesia in search of pleasure, devotion and balance felt like an authentic and moving search for happiness and enlightenment. To her critics, many of whom never even read it, Eat, Pray, Love was a cannily constructed narrative with a pat happy ending that preached personal satisfaction as the highest goal, one you could attain by throwing money around, especially in the third world.

title: Finale, by Thomas Mallon
description: Readers of Finale, Thomas Mallons sly and penetrating ninth novel, are well aware that the books protagonist, the nations 40th president, is destined to be revered as the Republican Partys patron saint, his very name synonymous with conservative virtue. However, none of the novels characters know this in real time. Finale takes place primarily in 1986, two years after Ronald Reagans final triumphant campaign and two years before he vacates the White House for good. His presidential legacy is on the line, and the events of 1986  a fateful nuclear arms meeting in Reykjavik with Mikhail Gorbachev and the brewing Iran-contra scandal  threaten to undo it. The sense of foreboding, bordering at times on panic, that pervades this work of historical fiction stands as an arresting contrast to todays notion of the unassailable Teflon president.

title: A Sprained Ankle May Have Lifelong Consequences
description: Tens of thousands of Americans sprain an ankle every year. But ankle sprains get little respect, with most of us shrugging off the injury as inconsequential and soon returning to normal activities.

description: CORFU, Greece  In the running debate over how to revive the Greek economy, there is one thing that locals and foreigners can agree on: The airport on this resort island, like many others in tourist-dependent Greece, does not befit a eurozone country.

description: At a time when investors are nervous and antitrust regulators are suspicious, the prospect of a $100 billion-plus merger on the horizon may seem remote.

title: The Rituals of Modern Death
description: Before I was an intern standing in the middle of the night over a pale, motionless woman about to certify her death, I had a very different vision of what a persons final moment would be like. Like many young people, my exposure to death was confined to stories others had told me or depictions of deaths on television. I didnt see the true face of death until I was the one filling out the death certificate.

title: Today in Politics: Republicans Are Set to Grapple Again Under Reagans Wing
description: Good Debate Day morning. As the Republican candidates prepare for their second showdown,a New York Times/CBS pollshowsthat the partys primary and caucus voters increasingly thinkthatDonald J. Trumphas the best chance of winning the general election. The poll results could give the other candidates further reason to direct their attack plans toward him, starting, perhaps, tonight.

title: Watching the Planet Burn
description: Unearthly images of fire in the West.

title: Kate McKinnon Hates Letting Her Hair Down
description: You spent your summer filming the new Ghostbusters movie in Boston. Do you believe in ghosts? Absolutely not.

title: Netromancy
description: When Bri Luna started her website, the Hoodwitch, she intended to carry on the legacy of her grandmother, who was a curandera: a traditional spiritual healer from Mexico. Luna, a beautician in her 20s who lives in Seattle, uses the site to publish tutorials on topics like how to cleanse a new home by burning sage and how the lunar cycles affect your daily life. What started out as a hobby became so popular that Luna turned it into a business, opening an online shop where she sells crystal clusters, bundles of dried herbs and vintage tarot guides.

title: Should I Help a Classmate Who Sexually Harassed My Friend Get a Job?
description: At work, we fill a lot of vacant positions through word of mouth. I recently posted a job on my colleges career network and received a rsum from someone in my graduating class. Ive never met this person, and I know him to have been a diligent student who won a prestigious fellowship during senior year. He would probably be a leading candidate, and by passing his rsum on, I would be implicitly giving my stamp of approval. The problem is that freshman year he sexually harassed and attempted to sexually assault a good friend of mine. A third party intervened before it escalated and brought her to me and another friend. She decided not to take the incident to any authority, and she eventually worked through the experience. The thought of working with the man who brought so much pain to a good friend is hard to swallow, but I do not know what the ethical thing to do is. It is not my story to share, and I do not want to bring the question to my friend for fear of opening old wounds. Am I allowed to share this information with the head of human resources? Can I take an act committed five years ago by somebody I never met and use it to determine his future job status? Is there a way to bring up my discomfort without outing him? NAME WITHHELD

title: Barbie Wants to Get to Know Your Child
description: It looked like a childs playroom: toys in cubbies, a little desk for doing homework, a whimsical painting of a tree on the wall. A woman and a girl entered and sat down in plump papasan chairs, facing a low table that was partly covered by a pink tarp. The wall opposite them was mirrored from floor to ceiling, and behind it, unseen in a darkened room, a half-dozen employees of the toy company Mattel sat watching through one-way glass. The girl, who looked about 7, wore a turquoise sweatshirt and had her dark hair pulled back in a ponytail. The woman, a Mattel child-testing specialist named Lindsey Lawson, had sleek dark hair and the singsong voice of a kindergarten teacher. Microphones hidden in the room transmitted what Lawson said next. You are going to have a chance to play with a brand-new toy, she told the girl, who leaned forward with her hands on her knees. Removing the pink tarp, Lawson revealed Hello Barbie.

description: Wildfires continued to simmer in bone-dry acres in Northern California on Wednesday, but firefighters said they were gaining control in some areas. The state Department of Forestry and Fire Protection, known as Cal Fire, estimated Wednesday that the Valley Fire, which had torn through more than 67,000 acres in Lake, Napa and Sonoma counties, was about 30 percent contained, with 585 homes destroyed.

title: Handcuffed for Making Clock,Ahmed Mohamed, 14, Wins Time With Obama

By Wednesday, it had brought him an invitation to the White House, support from Hillary Rodham Clinton and Mark Zuckerberg, and a moment of head-spinning attention as questions arose whether he had been targeted because of his name and his religion.
