title: Explaining the Rules for Migrants: Borders and Asylum
description: The migrant crisis in Europe has been greatly complicated by the Continents incomplete integration, as national interests and political attitudes toward the newcomers have clashed with Europewide policies and initiatives that have been among the Continents most significant political achievements.

title: Palestinian Is Rearrested and Resumes Hunger Strike
description: JERUSALEM  Israel rearrested a Palestinian man on Wednesday whose detention was suspended last month because of failing health after a two-month hunger strike to protest his incarceration without known charges or a trial.

title: What You Get for .... $999,000
description: Mountain views in Utah, a Spanish colonial in San Diego and a contemporary in Massachusetts

title: $999,000 Homes in San Diego, Massachusetts and Utah
description: EMIGRATION CANYON, UTAH

title: The Rolled Rs of Vanessa Ruiz
description: AMHERST, Mass.  RATHER than simply delivering the news, Vanessa Ruiz, an anchor for 12 News in Arizona, recently became news herself when her pronunciation of Spanish words drew complaints. The feeling was that, in an English-language TV newscast, she ought to be pronouncing these words the way a majority of English speakers do  and not as Spanish speakers would.

title: Key Suspects in Bangkok Shrine Bombing
description: A look at wanted and arrested suspects in the deadliest bombing in Thailands recent history.

title: The Pilots Fighting ISIS
description: In the year since the American air offensive against the Islamic State began, fighter pilots have assumed a huge bulk of the war effort. Here are some of the American pilots carrying out those operations.

title: For U.S. Pilots, the Real War on ISIS Is a Far Cry From Top Gun
description: ABOARD THE U.S.S. THEODORE ROOSEVELT, in the Persian Gulf  Soon after this aircraft carrier arrived here for its Middle East deployment, two F/A-18 Super Hornets catapulted off its deck for a six-and-a-half-hour bombing run toward Islamic State targets in Iraq. In one of the fighter jets was Navy Lt. Michael Smallwood, 28, call sign Bones, and in the other was his friend and roommate, Navy Lt. Nick Smith, also 28, call sign Yip Yip.

title: Mexico Presses Egypt for Inquiry Into Deadly Attack on Tourists
description: CAIRO  Mexicos foreign minister pressed Egypts leaders on Wednesday for a full investigation of an attack by the security forces on picnicking tourists last Sunday that killed a dozen people, including eight Mexicans.

title: White Eye Makeup, an Art Unto Itself
description: White clothing adds inches to the hips; it gets along with neither public transportation nor lunch. To wear it is to telegraph confidence. You either believe yourself to be thin enough, rich enough and neat enough to pull it off, or you simply dont deign to care.

title: A Victorian Townhouse in Southwest London
description: The six-bedroom house, with seven fireplaces, a conservatory and a backyard, is on the market for $3.62 million.

title: House Hunting in ... London
description: A WELL-MAINTAINED SIX-BEDROOM VICTORIAN HOUSE IN SOUTHWEST LONDON

title: Coates and Mann Are Among National Book Award Nonfiction Nominees
description: The journalist Ta-Nehisi Coates, the photographer Sally Mann and the poet Tracy K. Smith were among the 10 writers nominated for the National Book Awards nonfiction prize.

title: How to Talk to Microsofts Cortana
1915: New York Gasps in Heat Wave
description: NEW YORK  To-day [Sept. 16] is a sizzler. The streets in the lower part of Manhattan between the towering skyscrapers of steel and masonry are stifling with the heat reflected from all sides as well as poured down from above. Despite the busy whirring of thousands of electric fans, offices are like stokeholds, and work is subordinated to the effort to keep cool. Caf bars and soda-water fountains are besieged by crowds clamoring for cool drinks, and all pretence at correct dress has been given up in the attempt to reduce discomfort. The Herald is continuing its free distribution of ice and will keep it up indefinitely as long as the hot spell lasts.  The New York Herald, European Edition, September 17, 1915

title: A Deep Dive into What Exxon Knew About Global Warming and When (1978) it Knew It
description: InsideClimate News, showing the value of focused and sustained investigative reporting, has published the first piece in an illuminating review of what Exxon Mobil Corp. (and its earlier incarnations) learned through its own research from the 1970s onward about the potential climate impacts of rising emissions of carbon dioxide from fossil fuel use.

title: Mexican Minister Seeks Answers in Cairo
description: Claudia Ruiz Massieu, the foreign minister of Mexico, traveled to Cairo on Wednesday to demand that an investigation be established into the incident in which 12 Mexican tourists were killed.

title: Government Shutdown Could Harm Anti-Abortion Cause, Campaigner Says
description: As the Capitol braces for a fiscal showdown tied to abortion issues, the head of the nations leading anti-abortion group said a government shutdown could be counterproductive to the groups cause.

title: At Oscar de la Renta, a Spring Gown Refresher
description: The designer Peter Copping played with draped lace, mesh necklines and embellished bodices for spring/summer 2016.

title: Daily Report: Fast Reaction to Facebook Adding a New Button
description: Minutes after Mark Zuckerberg of Facebook announced that the company would soon begin testing a button to express negative emotions on the social network, reaction started pouring in.

title: The Brazilians Behind the Consolidation in Beer
description: Even before the approach to SABMiller, it was clear that the Brazilian deal makers who helped put together Anheuser-Busch InBev had sprawling ambitions.

title: Labours New Leader, Jeremy Corbyn, Crowd-Sources Questions for British Premier
description: LONDON  Chastised for failing to sing the national anthem, and contradicted by several senior colleagues, the new and left-wing leader of Britains opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, has had the briefest of political honeymoons.

title: Vigil Held For Murdered Professor
description: About 900 people attended a vigil at Delta State University in Cleveland, Miss., on Tuesday for Professor Ethan A. Schmidt, who the police believe was killed by a colleague on Monday.

title: The 911 Call From Shannon Lamb
description: Shannon Lamb, suspected of killing Amy Prentiss, his girlfriend, and an educator at Delta State University, alerted authorities to where they could find Ms. Prentiss.

title: Police, Still Seeking Motive, Find Note in Delta State University Murder-Suicide
description: The day after thousands of people gathered for a candlelight vigil memorializing a professor killed by a colleague, investigators continue to search for a motive.

title: As Conflicts Multiply, Peacekeeping Confronts an Identity Crisis
description: UNITED NATIONS  In Darfur, United Nations peacekeepers have covered up evidence of government-led attacks against civilians and, on occasion, even attacks on themselves.

title: Works Sighted: Suicide in Texas Jails
description: Over a hundred people have committed suicide in Texas county jails since 2010, and the states jails arent adequately screening inmates for mental health problems, according to a report by Erica Hellerstein at ThinkProgress.

title: 1965: Russians to Shift Space Crews
description: ATHENS  A Soviet cosmonaut who walked in space said today [Sept. 16] that his country plans to try a midspace exchange of crews on a permanent satellite before landing a man on the moon. This disclosure by Alexei Leonov indicates that the Soviet Union is attaching a different priority than the United States to the goals of putting a man on the moon. It also opens the possibility that the Russians are thinking of sending a much bigger ship to the moon than the U.S. three-man Apollo vehicle.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 17, 1965

title: New Labour Leader Changes Debating Style
description: The leader of Britains opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, adopted an unusually polite style in his first appearance at the normally confrontational Prime Ministers Questions in Parliament.

title: Udacity Says It Can Teach Tech Skills to Millions, and Fast
description: Im the least experienced person on my engineering team at Google, Kelly Marchisio, a 25-year-old computer programmer, told me recently. I frankly might be one of the least experienced engineers at Google, period.

title: Health Care Gains, but Income Remains Stagnant, the White House Reports
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly nine million people gained health insurance last year, lowering the ranks of the uninsured to 10.4 percent of the population. But there was no statistically significant change in income for the typical American household in 2014, the Obama administration said on Wednesday.

title: After Nepal Quakes, Worries in the Water
description: The 2015 Nepal earthquakes threatened to exacerbate the ongoing struggle with waterborne diseases by damaging already fragile sewer systems that leak pathogens into the water supply.

title: Earthquakes Compound Nepals Water Worries
description: Nepal may be infamous for its dangerous peaks, but in its valleys lies a far greater threat to human life: contaminated water.

title: SABMiller Takeover Would Shake Up Beer Industry
description: After years of speculation, Anheuser-Busch InBev has at last approached its rival SABMiller about a takeover that would create the worlds largest beer company. A deal would crown years of global consolidation of the brewing industry and incite a climactic round of regional disposals, spins and amalgamations.

title: Promoting Inclusiveness Over Cattiness
description: For 32 years, the Peridance Capezio Center in Manhattan has welcomed everyone from Broadway professionals to absolute beginners to pursue their love of movement.

title: A School With Room for Everyone at the Barre
description: Inside Peridance Capezio Center, a 32-year-old dance school near Union Square, things can get a little crowded. The space was once a horse-auction market, and the lobby and hallways are often sardined with dancers stretching before class or catching up over blueberry chia muffins baked in the small on-site cafe. The floor-to-ceiling mirrors in each of the six dance studios reflect a constant blur of legs and leotards.

title: Review: Best Time Ever With Neil Patrick Harris Tries to Reinvent the Variety Show
description: An improv class, an automobile crash test and your cousins home videos somehow interbred, and on Tuesday night the result turned up on NBC in the form of Best Time Ever With Neil Patrick Harris, a live variety show. How can three things interbreed? Hey, if you really want to reinvent something, you have to think outside the box.

title: 10 Charged in Crackdown on Synthetic Marijuana Ring
description: Citing a surge in the use of K2, a popular synthetic drug, federal and city authorities said on Wednesday that they had begun a sweeping crackdown, with charges against an international trafficking ring and a warning that more arrests were on the way.

title: Jaimie Alexander on a Job Where the Tattoos Are Fake but the Training Is Real
description: When Jaimie Alexander, a. k. a. Jane Doe in NBCs Blindspot, crawls out of a duffel bag in the middle of Times Square, you cant help but gawk. Virtually every inch of her body is inked in images, symbols and words, like an otherworldly treasure map.

title: Why Americans Still Think the Economy Is Terrible
description: If your entire understanding of the economy comes from headlines about the latest economic data, you would be forgiven for thinking these are the best of times. The unemployment rate is down to 5.1 percent, after all!

title: Two Refreshing, Cool Cocktails From Fashion Week
description: Its more of a party, said the designer Jake Sargent about this seasons Simon Miller presentation. It was late last week, and he and his co-designer Daniel Corrigan were finalizing the one remaining detail of their spring/summer 2016 show: the drinks. This season were heading back to the Southwest  but bringing in this Southwest Modernist vibe, so drawing a lot of inspiration from artists communities like Marfa and Santa Fe. Were going to be offering a mezcal-based cocktail that really plays on that, and were also going to be offering a sake-based cocktail to speak to our Japanese side.

title: Big | Brave, Alexis Spight and Others Show Growth in New Albums
description: Big | Brave

title: Hungarian Police Block Migrants
description: There were chaotic scenes on Wednesday in Horgos, a Serbian town bordering Hungary, as Hungarian police used water cannons and tear gas to stop migrants from entering the country.

title: France Says It Will Join Air Campaign Against ISIS in Syria
description: PARIS  France will join the coalition of Western and Middle Eastern countries carrying out airstrikes against the Islamic State in Syria, the countrys defense minister said on Wednesday, with the first strikes likely to come in the next couple of weeks.

title: Erroll Garners Concert by the Sea Gets a New Sound
description: Theres no way Erroll Garner could have foretold, from his perch at the piano on a Monday evening almost exactly 60 years ago, that he was creating one of the most popular albums in jazz history. He probably didnt even know tape was rolling.

title: Panel Urges More Time on Train Safety Technology
description: WASHINGTON  Congress should extend the deadline for freight and passenger railroads to install technology that could prevent deadly train accidents like the Amtrak derailment in May that killed eight people and injured more than 200, according to a report released on Wednesday.

title: The Daily Shoe: Oscar de la Renta
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Gossip: The Best Gift Your Teenager Can Give You
description: Hey Mom, you know Josh, the junior I played basketball with last summer? Hes selling Adderall to ninth graders.

title: Apple Delays Release of New Apple Watch Software
description: Apple postponed the release of a software update to the Apple Watch, the smartwatch it released to much fanfare, and skepticism, earlier this year.

title: At Michael Kors, Windswept Desert Hair and Makeup
description: Fashion has always had the ability to transport its wearer, but the dusty makeup and messy, windswept hair in the Michael Kors spring/summer 2016 show conveyed a distinct sense of place all on its own  even without the garments. Here was a woman fully immersed in the American Southwest.

title: Silent on Priorities, Yellen Makes Fed Choice a Cliffhanger
description: WASHINGTON  Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, faces a crucial moment on Thursday when the Feds policy-making committee announces whether the time has come to start raising interest rates.

title: Interview: Emily Blunt
description: The actress discusses her film Sicaro at the Toronto International Film Festival.

title: Camille A. Brown and Jaamil Olawale Kosoko Present Meditations on Black Identity
description: In Between the World and Me, widely considered one of the most important books of the year, Ta-Nehisi Coates analyzes the physicality of being black in America, and the burden and symbolism of the black body historically and today. Dance, the voice of the body, is in a distinctive position to contribute to this conversation, and that is especially true this week. Beginning on Tuesday, Sept. 22, at the Joyce Theater, Camille A. Brown presents Black Girl: Linguistic Play, which explores the broad spectrum of black female identity. Ms. Brown is a sharp storyteller, and here she illuminates her theme with infectious spirit by borrowing from the ritual of childhood games (through Sunday, Sept. 27). Starting on Wednesday, Sept. 23, Jaamil Olawale Kosoko, a Detroit-born Nigerian-American artist based in Brooklyn, brings #negrophobia to Gibney Dance, in which he considers the erotic fear associated with the black male body through a personal and a social lens (through Saturday, Sept. 26). In very different ways, both elevate, celebrate and complicate the black body. (Joyce Theater, 212-242-0800, joyce.org; Gibney Dance Agnes Varis Performing Arts Center, 646-837-6809, gibneydance.org.)

title: Fresh Off the Boat and black-ish Start New Seasons
description: In a new season laden with superhumans, sorority girls and Muppets, two ABC sitcoms still offer some of televisions most piquant viewing. Both deal with the collision of cultures and the angst of assimilation. In Fresh Off the Boat, inspired by the life of the celebrity chef Eddie Huang, an Asian-American family jockeys for position among the lily-white country club set in Orlando, Fla. In black-ish, spun from the experiences of its creator, Kenya Barris, a well-off African-American father refuses to let his kids become homogenized into the bland affluence of Los Angeles.

title: Crescent to Cross by Richard Long Is at Sperone Westwater
description: The British sculptor Richard Long last year walked from the Great Mosque of Crdoba in Andalusia, Spain, to the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela, a sacred destination in Galicia. His new work inspired by this trip is on view at Sperone Westwater in a show called Crescent to Cross, the title of his text about the journey. A large-scale mud installation, Red Gravity, is one of several works Mr. Long has made since the 1960s that originated in planned walks inscribing physical or metaphorical marks into the landscape, often recording his observations as text.

title: Big Beer Deals
description: The deal between Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller is the latest merger of mass-market beer brands.

title: Cheap Chic, Manifesto of a Fashion Revolution, Is Back
description: It was an imperfect, yet memorable, title for what would be the handbook to a revolution.

title: The Death of the Party
description: In his 1992 song Parties in the U.S.A., Jonathan Richman lamented what he perceived as a decline in informal social gatherings since his 1960s adolescence.

title: Answering Your Questions About Aspirin, Heart Attack and Colon Cancer
description: Earlier this week, an influential medical panel issued new draft recommendations about taking aspirin to prevent heart disease and colon cancer. It was the first time a major medical organization has recommended using low-dose aspirin to ward off a type of cancer, but the guidelines from the United States Preventive Services Task Force arent for everyone. Here are answers to some of the questions people are asking.

title: Few U.S.-Trained Syrians Still Fight ISIS, Senators Are Told
description: WASHINGTON  Only four or five Syrian individuals trained by the United States military to confront the Islamic State remain in the fight, the head of the United States Central Command told a Senate panel on Wednesday, a bleak acknowledgment that the Defense Departments $500 million program to raise an army of Syrian fighters has gone nowhere.

title: Mediterranean Diet Linked to Reduced Breast Cancer Risk
description: The Mediterranean diet  rich in vegetables, fruits, whole grains and olive oil, and low in dairy products and red meat  is linked to a reduced risk for breast cancer, according to a randomized trial.

title: The Met Considers Naming Rights, and Other Ways Forward
description: A bigger glass lobby stretching into Lincoln Centers plaza. Operas on Sunday. And perhaps, following the lead of its neighboring theaters recently renamed for David Geffen and David H. Koch, slapping another wealthy donors name on the storied Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Creditors Loom Over Elections in Greece
description: ATHENS  Inside campaign tents pitched by various political parties seeking to win over Greek voters here, including an immense one set up near Korai Square by the leftist Syriza party of the former Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras, the chairs and tables were empty the other day.

title: Bush, Bush, Baker and Others Join Advisory Panel for Eisenhower Memorial
description: The commission in charge of building a $142 million memorial to Dwight D. Eisenhower is enlisting some big guns to help realize a project that has been plagued by controversy and delays.

title: More Migrants Arrive on Greek Island
description: Migrants fleeing Syria and Iraq continued to arrive on the Greek island of Lesbos on Wednesday, as European countries struggle to cope with the high numbers of refugees.

title: Cuomo Agency Lawyer Dies a Week After Being Shot
description: A Cuomo administration lawyer who was shot in the head during a predawn celebration before the West Indian American Day Parade last week died on Wednesday evening, according to a family friend.

title: Suno: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The labels spring showing.

title: Assad Calls on Syrian Rebels to Join Him in Fight Against ISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  President Bashar al-Assad of Syria called on insurgents fighting his government to join with his forces instead, and do battle against the Islamic State. Only after that group is defeated can there be a political solution to the war that has devastated the country, Mr. Assad said in an interview broadcast on Wednesday.

title: Christopher Houlihan, Organ Virtuoso, Tackles Doleful Vierne
description: The young organist Christopher Houlihan has made something of a specialty of the works of Louis Vierne, the organ virtuoso whose sad life, full of illness and disappointment, was at least in part an influence on his six brooding symphonies for the instrument. On Sunday, Sept. 20, at the grand Co-Cathedral of St. Joseph in Brooklyn, Mr. Houlihan plays Viernes Fourth Symphony, with its aching Romance movement, on a program that also includes Bach, Saint-Sans and the New York premiere of Patrick Greenes Steel Symphony, inspired by metal sculptures at a Massachusetts museum. (3 p.m., Prospect Heights.)

title: Kate Maras Elegant (and Edgy) Marc Jacobs Look
description: The Star: Kate Mara

title: The Coney Island Film Festival Begins
description: A knife-throwing accident  or is it an accident?  is the bloody beginning of The Cruel Tale of the Medicine Man, one of the highlights on Sunday, Sept. 20, as the always eclectic Coney Island Film Festival concludes.

title: Festival of New Trumpet Music Embraces a Range of Sounds
description: The Festival of New Trumpet Music, which folds an enormous range of original music into its embrace, was founded in 2002 by Dave Douglas, whose music tends to get sorted under jazz. Increasingly, Mr. Douglas has engaged a brain trust of fellow trumpeters to help program the event. This years kickoff, on Thursday, Sept. 24, at Rockwood Music Hall Stage 3, was organized by C. J. Camerieri of yMusic and Stephanie Richards of Asphalt Orchestra, and it will feature both of those style-hopping ensembles.

title: More Evidence for Coming Black Hole Collision
description: The apocalypse is still on, apparently  at least in a galaxy about 3.5 billion light-years from here.

title: Meticulously Spare Timepieces
description: These elegant dress watches show the art of simplicity.

title: Michael Kors: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Korss spring 2016 collection.

title: These N.F.L. Leaders Started Fast, but Can They Stay on Top?
description: When a player has a big game in Week 1, it is easy to get carried away. For some, the big week will indeed be a sign of big weeks ahead. But for many others, it will turn out to be a flash in the pan.

title: Yasuko Yokoshis Dance Zero One Is a Study of Performers Lives
description: The choreographer Yasuko Yokoshi was working on a project with high school students in Fukushima, Japan, the site of the devastating earthquake and tsunami in 2011, when an idea for a dance was born. Manami Fukuoka, a dancer and former student who was assisting her, said casually over dinner one night, I have a twin sister.

title: John Harwood Interviews Carly Fiorina
description: Mr. Harwood, of The New York Times and CNBC, spoke with Mrs. Fiorina, a Republican presidential candidate, about her firing, her ideas and her challenges.

title: Small-Scale Grandeur
description: Fully fixed and furnished moments from bygone days.

title: Obama Calls Out Republicans on Planned Parenthood
description: It has become a disturbing ritual: Nearly every year since he took office and the Republicans in Congress announced that their only agenda was to block his agenda, President Obama has faced another threat to shut down the government from the right wing.

title: Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Center Announces Fall Arts Lineup
description: The Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Corporation has announced its slate of arts and cultural events for the fall, under the lens of Project Protest: The Art of Revolution. The lineup includes a talk with the actor Wendell Pierce, a concert by the hip-hop artist Rakim, and a premiere production of 12 Angry Men, directed by the Tony Award winner George Faison.

title: Richard Glossip Execution Is Halted by Oklahoma Court
description: Three and a half hours before he was scheduled to die by lethal injection, Richard Glossip won a two-week reprieve on Wednesday from an Oklahoma appeals court, which said it wanted time to study new evidence filed by his lawyers the day before.

title: Video Feature: Pitch-Perfect Ways to Read Music Better
description: Like many students this time of year, my 7-year-old son has started learning a new musical instrument. His piano lessons emphasize confidence and noisemaking right now, but soon he will learn phrases like Elephants get big dirty feet for the notes on a musical stave and move on to more theory and instrument skills. For all the stages of his music education, there are many apps that can help.

title: App Smart | Gamify Music Lessons
description: Learning music can be fun with the help of new apps that take the routine out of practice.

title: Obama Warns Against Government Shutdown
description: President Obama said on Wednesday that Congress should not play chicken with an $18 trillion economy over funding for Planned Parenthood.

title: Paid Leave for Moms and Dads: Reporters Notebook
description: A vast majority of companies do not provide paid parental leave to mothers or fathers, but that is rapidly changing. In 2014, only 12 percent of the companies surveyed by the Society of Human Resource Management offered paid maternity and paternity leave. This year, as the labor market tightens, those numbers are up to 21 percent and 17 percent, respectively. Its not just at Netflix, it turns out; benefits are expanding in much of the United States economy.

title: Breaking Down a Look at Delpozo
description: When he set out to create his spring/summer 2016 collection, Delpozos creative director Josep Font had two distinct inspirations in mind: the Gypsy Ballads, by the Spanish writer Federico Garca Lorca  and Emilie Flge, the bohemian partner of Gustav Klimt who, Font says, was ahead of her time. That translated into voluminous ruffled pants, floor-skimming dresses with tiers of tulle and large structural tops  or, as he puts it, clothes for a modern yet passionate woman.

title: Styling Wildly Patterned Rugs
description: Graphic canvases rock the floor when paired with curvy chairs and geometric tables.

title: News Corporation to Buy Unruly for Up to $176 Million
description: News Corporation announced Wednesday that it was buying Unruly, a video ad technology company, in a deal worth up to $176 million that underscores the publishing companys continued push to remake itself for the digital age.

title: Delpozo: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The Spanish-based label showed its spring collection in New York.

title: Givenchys Riccardo Tisci Is the King of Fashion Week
description: Last Friday evening, a pier overlooking ground zero turned into the modern-day equivalent of La Dolce Vita when the Givenchy creative director Riccardo Tisci made his New York Fashion Week debut.

title: An Ad Blitz for Fantasy Sports Games, but Some See Plain Old Gambling
description: The average amount of actual game action over the course of a three-hour broadcast of an N.F.L. game is about 11 minutes. Fans watching the first week of this seasons games might have been struck by how much of the rest of the broadcast was filled by advertisements for the hottest product in the sports industry: daily fantasy sports games.

title: Netanyahu to Visit Moscow Over Concerns About Russian Moves in Syria
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel plans to travel to Russia next week for talks with President Vladimir V. Putin about the stationing of Russian forces in Syria, Mr. Netanyahus office said in a statement on Wednesday.

title: Bowe Bergdahls Lawyer Pushes Army to Release Report on Disappearance
description: Army prosecutors seeking to court-martial Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl for desertion and for endangering the soldiers ordered to search for him have disclosed that they will not try to prove at a coming court hearing that any service members were wounded or killed looking for him, or that he had sought to desert to the Taliban, according to a legal filing by the soldiers defense team.

title: Detroit Institute of Arts Names New Director: Salvador Salort-Pons
description: The Detroit Institute of Arts, which survived a near-death experience last year after creditors demanded the sale of pieces to help satisfy debts in the citys federal bankruptcy case, announced Wednesday that it had chosen a new director from within its ranks, Salvador Salort-Pons, a curator who runs the museums European art department and oversees collection strategies.

title: Delpozos Voluminous, Architectural Collection
description: Creative director Josep Font debuted structural silhouettes on his spring/summer 2016 runway  and unveiled a new collection of handbags.

title: The Fashion News to Know Today
description: Swoll s/s 2016

title: Four Ways Obamacare Has Affected Health Insurance
description: Beyond the headline numbers showing a substantial decline in the number of Americans without health insurance, todays Census Bureau report contained some important details, including:

title: Why the Popes Spanish Speeches Matter
description: Now comes the news that Pope Francis, making his first visit to the United States later this month, intends to deliver 14 of his 18 speeches in Spanish.

title: Obama to Host Netanyahu in First Meeting Since Nuclear Deal With Iran
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will host Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel at the White House on Nov. 9 in their first face-to-face meeting since their rupture over the international nuclear agreement with Iran, the White House said Wednesday.

title: S.E.C. Judge May Have Weakened Justice Dept. Stance in Insider Trading Case
description: The appeals court decision in United States v. Newman that reversed the convictions of two hedge fund managers caused the Justice Department to take the rare step of asking the Supreme Court to overturn what it called the stark and overt departure from this courts definition of insider trading. But an opinion issued on Monday by one of the Securities and Exchange Commissions internal judges might have undercut that argument when it found that the Newman case did not work much of a change in the law.

title: The Daily Do: Tory Burch
description: Each day during fashion week, T plucks the best beauty moments right off the runway.

title: Picking Up CCS Where Foot Locker Left Off
description: Theres a natural order to how small-business acquisitions typically work: Big companies buy smaller ones. But in one recent takeover, things ran in reverse  the guppy swallowed the whale.

title: Model-Morphosis: Ola Munik at Delpozo
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in New York.

title: Protecting Homes Elsewhere, California Firefighters Find Their Own Burned Down
description: MIDDLETOWN, Calif.  Justin Galvan was out on the fire line trying to hem in a ravenous mountain blaze on the western flank of the Sierra Nevada when he got a distress call from home, 150 miles away. A wildfire had exploded in the mountains above his hometown. It had swallowed his parents house, and was barreling toward his own.

title: Lineup Announced for Havana Concert
description: A major concert in Havana being planned for next month will open with an American conductor, Marin Alsop, leading the National Symphony Orchestra of Cuba in the Cuban Overture by that most American of composers, George Gershwin. It will go on to feature the star pianists Lang Lang and Chucho Valds playing together in works by the Cuban composers Ernesto Lecuona and Antonio Mara Romeu and the American composer James P. Johnson.

title: 36 Hours in Boston
description: Boston has emerged from its brainy, introverted shell to offer a livelier mix of cultural offerings, not to mention an exploding food scene.

title: Reliving the 90s With the Decades Stars
description: At 90s Fest, a one-day festival of nostalgia in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, fashion and music rule.

title: 36 Hours in Boston
description: Thanks to the areas 50-some colleges, Boston has a reputation for hitting the books first, goofing off second. To be sure, venerable institutions like Symphony Hall, the Museum of Fine Arts and Faneuil Hall still anchor the citys hold on music, art and history. But in recent years, this little big town has emerged from its brainy, introverted shell to offer a livelier mix of cultural offerings, plus an exploding food scene. The Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy Greenway parkland extends from the North End to Chinatown, connecting a new frontier of glass and steel construction known as the Seaport District to downtown. Of course, this is also a sports- and craft beer-obsessed city, meaning youre never far from a Celtics, Bruins, Patriots or Red Sox fan hoisting a pint for the home team in one of the Hubs zillion pubs. Go Boston.

title: Lyft Announces Deal With Didi Kuaidi, the Chinese Ride-Hailing Company
description: The pink mustache is coming to China. And it will receive a warm welcome  not a snub  from its new hosts.

title: Reliving the 90s With Pauly Shore, Lisa Loeb and Naughty by Nature
description: Wearing floral-print shorts and a matching shirt, Pauly Shore took to a stage along the Williamsburg, Brooklyn, waterfront last Saturday and surveyed the crowd. How many of you remember the 1990s? he asked.

title: Can Young Picky Eaters Reform? 10 Rules, and a Plan
description: Can 10- and 7-year-old picky eaters, accustomed to being served the easy meals they prefer, change their ways?

title: Russia Proposes Talks With U.S. Over Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry said on Wednesday that Moscow had proposed talks between the United States and Russian militaries on the situation in Syria and the buildup of Russian forces there.

title: Obama Hints at Sanctions Against China Over Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama warned on Wednesday that his administration was ready to take action against China over online attacks carried out by Beijing or its proxies, publicly raising the specter of sanctions a week before President Xi Jinping arrives in the United States for a state visit.

title: Kanye Wests Second Collection Featured Monochromes, Kardashians
description: After months of anticipation and a few raised eyebrows about the ethics of its eleventh-hour scheduling, Kanye Wests second fashion collection, Yeezy Season 2, bowed this afternoon at Skylight Modern in Chelsea. In a presentation choreographed by the performance artist Vanessa Beecroft, models emerged in phalanxes, four to 12 at a time, directed by a drill sergeant. Each group was coordinated by color (or lack thereof: the collection, based in black and tan, was highly monochromatic). Kylie Jenner and Bella Hadid modeled; King of the Youth Ian Connor did, too  smoking, natch  and the front row was packed with a diverse array of pals, including the rest of the Kardashian girls (North included), Common, Lorde, Courtney Love, Drake, Riccardo Tisci, Michael Strahan and Seth Meyers. And who better to score the show than Kanyes best friend, Kanye? He debuted a new song alongside the new collection, featuring Ty Dolla Sign and Post Malone.

title: Student Contest | Make an Editorial Cartoon
description: Updated, Sept. 13, 2016 | We have now announced our 2016 Editorial Cartoon Contest. Your can see the winners from our 2015 contest here.

title: Disgraced Will Be Most-Produced Play This Season
description: Disgraced, a Pulitzer Prize-winning play about a New York lawyer whose life is jolted by tensions associated with his Muslim heritage, will be the most-produced play around the country this theatrical season, according to a survey by American Theater magazine.

title: Copa Amricas Fate Uncertain as U.S. Soccer Skips Meeting
description: After four months of doubt and speculation, all signs now point to U.S. Soccer withdrawing as host of the 2016 Copa Amrica Centenario tournament over unresolved concerns about legal liability that emerged after several top soccer and marketing officials connected to the tournament were arrested in May.

title: The Real Danger of Donald Trump
description: The caller to Brian Lehrers WNYC radio show on Wednesday morning was pining for a strongman, a president who would do what was necessary to get rid of immigrants, whom she blamed for taking jobs and money away from real Americans.

title: Indian Police Arrest Suspect in Shooting of Maharashtra Communist Leader
description: NEW DELHI  A Hindu right-wing activist was arrested Wednesday in the killing of Govind Pansare, a veteran Communist leader, in February.

title: Congress Questions General on Syria
description: Gen. Lloyd J. Austin III, the head of the United States Central Command, told a Senate panel that only a very small number of Syrian fighters trained by the United States remained in the fight.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 6
description: Jeremy Scott parties at Provacateur, and Business of Fashion celebrates its 500 list.

title: Review: Heroes Reborn Finds Its Superhumans Again Fighting to Save the World and Themselves
description: TORONTO  Tim Kring has only himself to blame. When he created Heroes for NBC in 2006, it was something new and fresh and, for a season or two, invigorating. It opened the doors of television to comics-style storytelling and superpowered saviors, and theyve run rampant since.

title: Sayra Alanis
description: For The New York Timess Schools for Tomorrow conference, we talked to students in LEDA, a program helping low-income students succeed at top colleges. Here, Sayra Alanis relates a pivotal moment.

title: BlaBlaCar, a French Ride-Sharing Start-Up, Is Valued at $1.6 Billion
description: The on-demand economy just got another $1 billion company.

title: Casey Hammond
description: Casey Hammond, a high school senior, describes growing up in a rural area with a mother who was in high school herself when he was born.

title: Moses Malone Was Easy to Overlook but Undeniably Great
description: Buried on Page 178 of The Breaks of the Game, David Halberstams illuminating 1981 book about professional basketball, is a telling and amusing passage underscoring the dumbfounding disposability of Moses Malone early in his Hall of Fame career.

title: Sleep Aids to Get You Through the Night
description: Like diet and exercise, sleep is a necessary ingredient for a healthy life. But keeping yourself rested is often easier said than done. Whether you seek 40 winks or a full nights slumber, here are some noteworthy gadgets that may help you get more out of your sleep.

title: Madison Ramirez Mazaheri
description: Madison Ramirez Mazaheri talks about what it was like being placed in remedial classes because she was an immigrant.

title: Thomas Hiura
description: Thomas Hiura explains the struggle of telling his working-class high school classmates why it is worth $62,000 a year for a liberal arts degree.

title: From South Park to the Space Station, Randy Olson Sees an And, But, Therefore Story Solution
description: If youve read Dot Earth a lot, you know Im a fan of the ultimate science-as-story coach, Randy Olson, who left a tenured job teaching marine biology to make provocative films on science controversies and then write, and write, and write about connecting science to society through storytelling.

title: Puerto Ricos Debt Rescue Plan Called Into Question
description: A week after the governor of Puerto Rico laid out a plan for attacking the islands heavy debt, analysts are beginning to publicly question the proposals and even the financial assumptions on which they are based.

title: This Is It: The California Fire, Up Close
description: Lots of natural disasters keep journalists on their periphery. Police barricades go up, neighborhoods get cordoned off and telling the story of the lives affected by a tornado, flood or fire becomes immeasurably trickier.

title: Deadly Flood in Utah Blurs Towns Religious Divisions, Even as Grief Highlights Them
description: HILDALE, Utah  When a flash flood turned the creek into a deadly torrent here on Monday night  carrying off two vehicles full of family members and killing at least 12  residents quickly ran to help, shoveling through the muck and debris in search of survivors.

title: Rutgers Suspends Football Coach for Three Games
description: Rutgers suspended its football coach, Kyle Flood, for three games and fined him $50,000 on Wednesday after a university investigation confirmed that he had improperly contacted a faculty member in an effort to preserve a key players eligibility.

title: Texas Officer on Homemade Clock Arrest
description: Larry Boyd, the Irving police chief, discussed the arrest of the Texas teenager who brought a homemade clock to school. A teacher thought it was possibly the infrastructure for a bomb, Boyd said.

title: Jindal Criticizes Trump as Narcissist
description: Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana came out to the spin room at the presidential debate early to answer questions from reporters and criticized his Republican rival Donald J. Trump.

title: Classical Playlist: Bach, Biber, Gottschalk and More
description: BACH: Keyboard Concertos No. 1 to 7 (BWV 1052-59) Andreas Staier, harpsichord; Freiburg Baroque Orchestra(Harmonia Mundi)Listening to Bachs concertos in big gulps may not be the best way to savor their myriad delights, but unless youre a stronger person than I, youll have a hard time turning off the first disc of this double set after the opening D-minor Concerto (BWV 1052), with the propulsive flights of its outer movements. Or the second disc, after the opening D-major Concerto (BWV 1054), with its all-too-brief, teeming finale. Better known these days as a fortepianist, Mr. Staier draws endlessly glinting, shifting colors from his harpsichord, a beautiful-sounding 2011 copy of a 17th-century Flemish original. He delineates structure and suggests mood subtly through embellishments, agogic (rhythmic) accents and in several instances an added cadenza. Brilliant and captivating. (James R. Oestreich)

title: Car Repairs From Deer Collisions Will Cost More
description: The latest insurance data show that the risk of hitting a deer with your car has not changed much from a year ago. But the cost of repairing your car if youre unlucky enough to strike one is on the rise.

title: Boss Women: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The spring 2016 collection from Jason Wu, the fashion houses designer.

title: Jade Helm Military Exercise Ends, With Little Fanfare and Less Paranoia
description: HOUSTON  In the end, the soldiers rumored to be going after peoples guns handed out plaques and offered handshakes. Conspiracy theories of a military invasion, with trains to transport shackled political prisoners and Blue Bell ice cream trucks doubling as portable refrigerated morgues, fizzled as the most controversial Special Forces activity eyewitnesses saw was some service members, on a lake, on Jet Skis.

title: Harlan Levy, Schneiderman Deputy, Is Leaving Attorney Generals Office
description: Harlan Levy, a top deputy to Eric T. Schneiderman, the New York attorney general, is leaving state government to return to the prominent litigation firm where he previously worked.

title: Jon Stewart Joins 9/11 Workers in Pressing Congress to Extend Benefits
description: Jon Stewart, the recently retired host of The Daily Show, exhorted Congress on Wednesday to permanently extend a law providing treatment and compensation to rescue workers who were injured or sickened by the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

title: From Michael Kors, Both Buttoned-up Looks and Beachy Attire
description: The designers spring/summer 2016 offerings ran the gamut.

title: Review: Tired Moonlight Quietly Paints a Picture of Small-Town Life
description: A voice-over sporadically chimes in with verse during Tired Moonlight  the words, by the poet Paul Dickinson, are gritty, stark, aching. But images supply even finer poetry in this bleakly beautiful film.

title: Designer Louis Leeman Puts a Swagger in His Shoes
description: Back in 2004, Camron moved beyond boasting in numerical terms: Whips on my fists, houses on my wrists, your budget on my neck, he rapped on Get Em Girls.

title: Rutgers Report on Football Coach
description: The report on the university's investigation that Kyle Flood had improperly contacted a faculty member in an effort to preserve a key players eligibility.

title: FEMA Extends Deadline to Refile Hurricane Sandy Insurance Claims
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency said on Wednesday that it would extend by another month the deadline for homeowners to request a reopening of their flood insurance claims from Hurricane Sandy.

title: In Illness, a Play Emerges
description: The playwright Christopher Shinn talks about the inspirations for his new play, An Opening in Time, at Hartford Stage.

title: Pictures of the Day: Croatia and Elsewhere
description: Croatia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: September 16, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Croatia, Turkey, China and the United States.

title: For Christopher Shinn, Confronting Death Brings a New Play to Life
description: HARTFORD  Christopher Shinn tilts back in a metal folding chair until it reaches a precarious, 45-degree angle against a wall of the Hartford Stage rehearsal room. He watches silently as the first scene of his new play, An Opening in Time, begins with a bam. A baseball hits the house of the main character, Anne, who steps outside, startled. She regards the ball intently. And so does Mr. Shinn. His chair looks like it may slip and crash at any moment, but he never loses focus and never goes down.

title: Public Library Hires Dutch Firm for Renovations
description: One year after abandoning its much-disputed Norman Foster-designed renovation, the New York Public Library has selected architects for the $300 million project, which will include creating a new interior for the Mid-Manhattan branch and opening more public space in its flagship Stephen A. Schwarzman Building on Fifth Avenue.

title: Assembly in Nepal Approves New Constitution
description: KATHMANDU  Nepals Constituent Assembly overwhelmingly approved a new Constitution on Wednesday night after years of delay because of disagreements among major political parties.

title: Trumps Approach Is More Like Reagans Than You Might Think
description: Wednesday nights presidential debate is at the Reagan Presidential Library, which means that candidates are going to feel obliged to mention Ronald Reagan  a lot. In 2011, candidates running for the G.O.P. nomination gathered at the same library, in Simi Valley, Calif., for the fourth debate in that contest. The eight candidates mentioned Mr. Reagan 24 times  roughly once every five minutes over all.

title: An Installation  and a Collaboration  for the Pattern-Obsessed
description: Patternity, the London design studio of Anna Murray and Grace Winteringham, has created eye-dazzling print designs for everyone from Apple to Oscar de la Renta; their online pattern-spotting research archive is a popular, Pinterest-worthy wonder of a blog. Now, the duos signature vibrant geometric shapes are available to anyone hosting a fall soire, thanks to a new collaboration with the custom-card company Paperless Post. The 11 black-and-white card designs are both arrestingly graphic and quite celebratory, Murray says. In tandem with the launch and London Design Week, Paperless Post and Patternity have also created an immersive installation featuring versions of the patterns  made interactive through textures, mirrors and experiments with scale  on view next week at Somerset House in London.

title: Through Music, Jen Shyu Explores the Unknown, Including Herself
description: A lot of jazz musicians are concerned with output. They have a sound or a band; a way of composing, performing or recording; they use what they already know to stay on the scene.

title: Patternity x Paperless Post
description: The design studio and the e-invitation company are collaborating on an installation and a series of cards.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening in New York
description: On Thursday, Tomorrowland, based in Tokyo, will open its first United States boutique in SoHo. There youll find minimalist bits from the mens and womens collections, along with a curated selection of niche apparel, accessories and lifestyle brands from Japan, including Kimoto Glass barware and sculptural jewelry from Shihari. At 476 Broome Street.  Many other imports cropped up during this New York Fashion Week. Slowear, a family-owned Venetian fashion group specializing in craft-minded luxury mens wear, has opened a SoHo outpost where you can outfit yourself from head to toe with items from its four labels, Incotex trousers, Glanshirt shirting, Zanone knitwear and Montedoro outerwear and accessories. At 116 Prince Street.  Ports 1961 debuted its first stand-alone mens wear store, in the meatpacking district, where youll find the new mens wear creative director Milan Vukmirovics tweaked classics like a red peacoat ($1,895) and a star camo weekender ($1,595) from his first collection shown in Milan. At 3 Ninth Avenue.  The Neapolitan tailoring specialist Isaia has a new shop with an impressive range of 112 made-to-measure garments, including a camel overcoat ($4,405) and a double-breasted wool sports jacket ($3,000). At 819 Madison Avenue.  And the Indian jeweler Nirav Modi has opened a boutique where youll find stunners like a Mughal flower choker and bracelet that includes 54 carats of diamonds set in 18-karat white gold and can be worn on either the wrist or neck. (Price upon request.) At 727 Madison Avenue.  On the homegrown front, the Diamond District veterans Rob Ronen and Michael Herman have opened a concept store in SoHo called Material Good. There youll find pieces from buzzy fine-jewelry labels like a Spinelli Kilcollin set of three linked rings in 18-karat yellow and rose gold, and pav cognac, champagne and white diamonds ($8,000) and a Hoorsenbuhs 18-karat rose gold phantom cuff ($23,500) alongside 20th-century design objects from the likes of Jean Prouv and Charlotte Perriand. At 120 Wooster Street.

title: Review: Keith Richards: Under the Influence, in His Own Gravelly Words
description: Is there such a thing as a mumblecore documentary? There is now, thanks to Keith Richards: Under the Influence, a frustrating film that has its premiere on Friday on Netflix.

title: Merger of Beer Giants Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller Faces Obstacles
description: It would be the biggest beer merger in history, one long discussed by analysts and executives in the beverage industry.

title: Fantasy Football Week 2: Rankings and Matchup Analysis
description: If we learned anything from Week 1 of fantasy football, its that Peyton Manning is finished, Adrian Peterson is a bust and Odell Beckham Jr. is a flash in the pan.

title: Review: The Art of Memoir, by Mary Karr, Is a Veterans Guide
description: Theres a textbook lurking at the heart of Mary Karrs new book about how memoirs have and should be written. But its a chaotic one: Ms. Karr is, by her own admission, a passionate, messy teacher.

title: Lesbos Turns From Vacation Island to Main Point of Entry for Migrants
description: MYTILENE, Greece  On this vacation island ringed by the clear Aegean Sea, it is now the tourists who are the rarity.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Stephen Falk on Youre the Worst and Why He Believes in Romantic Comedies
description: Three years ago, Stephen Falk, a TV writer and producer, created a comedy called Next Caller. NBC picked up the show and ordered six episodes, but canceled it before it ever aired. When he got the word, Mr. Falk took to Tumblr and wrote that the sudden notice felt like a 10.0 earthquake, explaining that there is a larger discussion that has to do with network expectations versus the Creatives expectations; the wisdom of holding to what you deem good vs. What They Want; making yourself laugh first.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Matthew Barneys Most Punishing Tour: River of Fundament
description: The studio of the artist Matthew Barney in Long Island City, Queens, sits amid a collection of cookie-cutter warehouses where the most infernal sight is usually a chained guard dog, no Cerberus he. But at various times over the last several years, the studio was transformed into a version of a netherworld so hellish that even Mr. Barney, who has a stomach for such things, approached his limits. There were, for example, the dead pigs being devoured by maggots. And the eviscerated cow carcass, lying in a shallow pool. That water was really pretty nasty by the end, Mr. Barney recalled recently.

title: Kanye Wests Line Yeezy Causes a Stir
description: Guests arriving at Kanye Wests presentation during New York Fashion Week  those, that is, who had successfully elbowed through the camera-wielding crowd  were told that actually, the door they were looking for was several yards to their right. The door they had arrived at was exclusively for celebrities.

title: New Art Galleries Enjoy a Los Angeles Advantage: Space
description: LOS ANGELES  Michele Maccarone, in a flowy black jumpsuit, was striding across the cement floor of her cavernous new gallery here last week, debating where brightly colored abstract paintings by Alex Hubbard should go. Theres just, like, this endless amount of really incredible space, she said, as Mr. Hubbard and assistants moved the weighty frames for his solo show.

title: Kim Suozzi, the Woman Whose Brain Was Frozen
description: To the Editor:

title: Henry Gosebruch, Rising Star at JPMorgan, Is Departing for AbbVie
description: One of JPMorgan Chases two co-heads of North American mergers is leaving the firm to join a longtime client, only months after being promoted to the position.

title: DKNY: Spring 2016 RTW
description: See the first DKNY collection from the designers behind Public School

title: G.O.P. Debate: Best Bets to Win (and Lose)
description: Expect Carly Fiorina to win tonights Republican presidential debate and Ben Carson to be the biggest loser  at least if you believe the political prediction markets.

title: China Tries to Extract Pledge of Compliance From U.S. Tech Firms
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese government, which has long used its countrys vast market as leverage over American technology companies, is now asking some of those firms to directly pledge their commitment to contentious policies that could require them to turn user data and intellectual property over to the government.

title: Antidepressant Paxil Is Unsafe for Teenagers, New Analysis Says
description: Fourteen years ago, a leading drug maker published a study showing that the antidepressant Paxil was safe and effective for teenagers. On Wednesday, a major medical journal posted a new analysis of the same data concluding that the opposite is true.

title: The Pledge China Wants Tech Companies to Sign
description: The Chinese government is asking some tech firms to directly pledge their commitment to contentious policies that could require them to turn user data and intellectual property over to the government.

title: Off The Runway: Day 7
description: Scenes from the seventh day of New York Fashion Week

title: Tailoring and Cheerful Florals at Boss
description: Flowing dresses with nipped waists came down the spring/summer 2016 runway.

title: Street Style: Making Your Outfit Work
description: A day packed with fashion shows requires the perfect Outfit Of The Day.

title: Top Colleges Doing the Most for Low-Income Students
description: To measure top colleges efforts on economic diversity, The Upshot created the College Access Index.

title: College Access Index, 2015: The Details
description: We made two significant changes to this years version of the College Access Index  a measure of economic diversity at top colleges that The Upshot created last year.

title: Californias Upward-Mobility Machine
description: The University of California is struggling with budget woes that have deeply affected campus life. Yet the systems nine colleges still lead the nation in providing top-flight college education to the masses.

title: Tory Burch: In the Studio
description: In the second episode of our video series that goes behind closed doors and into the usually unseen working lives of designers, Tory Burch reveals the secret behind her desk, why she struggles with asymmetry and how her father influenced her collections. And those are just the conversational bits left on the cutting-room floor. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Mets Offense Is Silent, and East Lead Shrinks
description: Yoenis Cespedes dug into the box in the sixth inning facing the type of situation he had thrived in over the previous six weeks: a 3-2 count against a rookie pitcher with a runner on base. Adam Conley, the Miami Marlins starter, fired a slider, and Cespedes took a big swing  and missed badly.

title: Review: Ashley Bathgate Wraps Kate Moores Music Around Noguchis Stone
description: The sculptures by the Japanese-American artist Isamu Noguchi on display at the Noguchi Museum in Queens, which he designed, highlight his interest in textural contrast. Polished surfaces and shapes chiseled in stone are juxtaposed with rough, uneven elements, these asymmetrical parts creating a balanced whole.

title: Review: Brian Stokes Mitchell Blends Songs and Theater in Plays With Music
description: In Plays With Music, the title of Brian Stokes Mitchells theatrically far-reaching show at Caf Carlyle in Manhattan, the operative word is plays. When not inhabiting a role onstage, this most traditionally heroic of Broadway leading men reimagines songs as one-act plays performed with a childlike enthusiasm.

title: Desperation and Conflict in the Migrant Crisis
description: Hungarian police officers used water cannons, tear gas and pepper spray to hold off migrants at a border crossing in Horgos, Syria.

title: Review: Mac Miller Releases His First Major-Label Album, GO:OD AM
description: Mac Miller

title: Review: On La Di Da Di, the Latest From Battles, Momentum Is a Driving Force
description: Battles

title: Review: Luciana Souzas Instrument, Her Voice
description: Luciana Souza

title: Audra McDonald Will Miss Three Months of Coming Broadway Show
description: Audra McDonald, the star of one of this theatrical seasons most-anticipated musicals, will miss three of the first six months of performances, the production said this week.

title: Carson Talks to Reporters in Simi Valley
description: Ben Carson, surging in the polls, was asked about topics ranging from his position in the Republican presidential race, how he would handle Donald Trump and his thoughts on climate change.

title: Kicking Off the Republican Presidential Debate
description: The second G.O.P. debate took place at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, Calif.

title: U.S. Said to Have Settled With G.M. Over Deadly Defect
description: Federal prosecutors are poised to settle a criminal investigation into General Motors, according to people briefed on the matter, accusing the automaker of failing to disclose a safety defect tied to at least 124 deaths. The case, which the prosecutors plan to unveil on Thursday, would cap a wide-ranging investigation that tainted the automakers reputation for quality and safety and damaged its bottom line.

title: Meeting of Anglican Leaders Could Lead to a Looser Federation
description: LONDON  Sharply divided over issues including same-sex marriage, Anglican leaders from around the world were called on Wednesday to a meeting, planned for next year, that could lead to the transformation of the fractious global church into a much looser grouping.

title: Dr. Deborah Asnis, Who Sounded Alert on West Nile Virus Outbreak, Dies at 59
description: Dr. Deborah Asnis, whose suspicions about two Queens hospital patients suffering from sudden paralysis led to the discovery of the first outbreak of West Nile virus in the Western Hemisphere, died on Saturday in Manhattan. She was 59.

title: Altice in Deal to Take Over Cablevision
description: Cablevision has agreed to sell itself to Altice, an acquisitive European telecommunications giant, for about $17.7 billion, including debt, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday. It is the latest deal to reshape the broadband and cable television landscape.

title: A Meditation on Race, in Shades of White
description: Marion Palfi set out to document racism and segregation in Georgia in the 1940s. Her unpublished manuscript that followed reveals racial attitudes that were neither uniform nor without ambivalence.

title: Antitrust Nod for Expedia to Buy Orbitz
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department will not try to block the acquisition of the travel booking site Orbitz by its larger rival Expedia, clearing the way for the companies to complete the $1.3 billion merger announced earlier this year.

title: Yankees Earn Tense Win After Sending Nova to Bullpen
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  In the heat of a playoff chase, the Yankees are finding that victories come as easily these days as running the bases does for 38-year-old Carlos Beltran, as lunging to catch a pop-up does for the not-quite-svelte Brian McCann and as managing another high-tension escape of his own mess does for Dellin Betances.

title: Bombers, Shearling Shoes and Cool New Totes for Fall
description: This season add textures and bold colors to your look with fur-trimmed bombers, comfortable cozy shoes, and beautifully understated bags.

title: Chat Between Elton John and Vladimir Putin Was a Hoax
description: When word emerged this week  via Elton John on Instagram  that Russias president, Vladimir V. Putin, had called Mr. John to discuss gay rights, the possibility of some sort of accord between a leader who has gained a reputation for supporting anti-gay policies and the singer, a strong supporter of gay rights, seemed to some too good to be true.

title: Broadways Amazing Grace Will Close in October
description: Amazing Grace, the first musical to open on Broadway this season, will also be the first to close: its producers announced Wednesday night that they would shutter the production next month.

title: Syrian Refugee Tripped in Hungary Is Welcomed in Spain
description: A Syrian refugee who was tripped last week by a Hungarian journalist, prompting a wave of outrage at the reporter, arrived late Wednesday in Spain, where he has been offered accommodations and a job by a soccer school in Madrid.

title: Anti-Union Bill Fails in Missouri as G.O.P. Loses Override Vote
description: In a major victory for organized labor in Missouri, Republicans failed Wednesday to override the Democratic governors veto of a bill that would have allowed workers who chose not to join unions to avoid paying fees.

title: Dewey & LeBoeuf Accounting Fraud Case Goes to Jury
description: The jury deliberating whether three former executives of Dewey & LeBoeuf schemed to manipulate the finances of the once-prominent law firm to defraud investors and bank lenders did not take long getting down to work.

title: Bank of Americas Fight to Keep Brian Moynihans Dual Roles
description: Forget the Iowa caucuses or the New Hampshire primary. One of the more intense and dogged campaigns is currently being waged by Bank of America to convince shareholders that Brian T. Moynihan should keep his job as both chairman and chief executive.

title: At Michael Kors and Oscar de la Renta, Dressing Up the Dresses
description: How do you stand out in a crowded field?

title: Special Zones Proposed to Limit Toplessness in Times Square
description: The City of New York should set aside areas in Times Square exclusively for the topless painted women, costumed characters and other cash solicitors who have proliferated among the hundreds of thousands of tourists and office workers who ply the neighborhood every day, according to a report by a coalition of elected officials, property owners and business leaders.

title: Guards Seize Interim Leaders of Burkina Faso, and Gunfire Is Heard
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  Guards seized Burkina Fasos interim president, prime minister and two cabinet ministers Wednesday, in what appeared to be a military coup attempt less than a year after the last abrupt power shift in this poor African country.

title: Mike Lupicas Future at The Daily News Is Unclear After Layoffs
description: Mike Lupicas future as the high-profile sports columnist of The Daily News was in doubt Wednesday when the tabloid laid off several sportswriters and its managing editor for sports.

title: Fabulous Parties of New York Fashion Week
description: The celebrities walked the red carpet. The models sipped champagne. The designer was ushered into the V.I.P. area.

title: Putin Sees Path to Diplomacy Through Syria
description: LVIV, Ukraine  To much of the world, Syria is a scene of unending tragedy, but to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia it is a golden opportunity, a way out of the isolation he and Russia have endured since the West imposed sanctions over Ukraine  with the added bonus of wagging an I told you so finger at the White House.

title: Al Bagnoli Is Building From the Bottom at Columbia
description: Peter Pilling is Columbias new athletic director, but before that he was just a guy with an idea. It was a zany idea, as far as these things go. A confidant told him of a rumor, down in Philadelphia, that a just-retired football coach was already getting restless. So Pilling made a phone call.

title: New York Will Trim Common Core Exams After Many Students Skipped Them
description: New York States standardized tests for third through eighth graders will be shortened this year, the education commissioner said on Wednesday, the latest retooling of a group of exams that have grown so unpopular that 20 percent of eligible children sat them out this past spring.

title: Anna Sui: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Suis spring designs

title: Irans Ayatollah Suggests He May Not Be Around in 10 Years
description: Irans supreme leader has long fulminated against perceived plots by the Americans. More recently he has warned of the dangers of foreign enemy subversions in the era after he is gone. But on Wednesday he suggested that era could be 10 years away, or less.

title: Republican Candidates Debate Again
description: The second G.O.P. debate took place at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, Calif.

title: Jets Antonio Cromartie Hopeful He Can Play Against Colts
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Cornerback Antonio Cromartie felt a pop in his left knee.

title: Review: ICE Features Levy Lorenzo on Teacups and Rebekah Heller on Bassoon
description: The hall dims, leaving a small table bathed in the glare of a desk lamp. On the table is a black box. A pair of teacups sit, upside down, on top of it. The performer, with sincere ceremony, takes a cup in each hand. Bending his wrists, he tilts the cups on their rims, allowing light into the shadows beneath. As it strikes the lid of the box, it turns into sounds.

title: De Blasios Plan to Lift Poor Schools Comes With High Costs and Big Political Risks
description: There was $75 million a year for second-grade reading specialists. Advanced Placement classes got $51 million. Every eighth grader can take algebra thanks to $19 million. And $15 million was proposed to provide more than 16,000 students with dedicated counselors from sixth through 12th grade.

title: After Trade, Sylvia Fowles Helps Lynx Flourish
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The Minnesota Lynx traditionally break out brightly colored sneakers for the W.N.B.A. playoffs, picked by the six-time All-Star Seimone Augustus. Sylvia Fowles, who joined the Lynx in midseason, was delighted to find a royal blue pair when she arrived at practice this week.

title: Focus on Donald Trump at Undercard Debate Irks Low-Polling Candidates
description: He was not on stage, but Donald J. Trump loomed large over parts of the so-called undercard debate on Wednesday when four candidates appeared at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, Calif., and moderators asked if Mr. Trump should be exempt from Reagans 11th commandment not to criticize fellow Republicans.

title: U.N. Secretary General Criticizes Hungarys Treatment of Migrants

He was 88.

title: Mexico: 2nd Missing Student Identified
description: Experts have identified a bone fragment from the second of 43 missing students from a rural teachers college who disappeared almost a year ago in a case that has rocked Mexico. The government has said that the students were hauled off buses by corrupt local police officers in the southern city of Iguala and handed over to a drug gang, which killed them and cremated the bodies at a nearby dump. But the students have never been found, and only one, Alexander Mora, had been identified from a bone fragment that the authorities said was recovered near the dump. Attorney General Arely Gmez said Wednesday that advanced testing at the Medical University of Innsbruck in Austria had determined that another bone fragment from the site belonged to Jhosivani Guerrero de la Cruz, who was 20 when he disappeared. An outside panel of the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights said recently that the physical evidence at the dump did not support the hypothesis that the students were cremated there.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 9:40 A.M. (Starz Cinema) THE PATIENCE STONE (2013) In this film directed by Atiq Rahimi and adapted from his 2008 novel, a beautiful young Afghan woman (Golshifteh Farahani) confesses her fears, resentments and dreams to her comatose older husband (Hamidrez Javdan), a guerrilla fighter with a bullet in his neck. The film mirrors an Afghan myth that had been told by women as a healthy expression of their stifled feelings in a male-dominated world,  Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times, quoting the folklorist Richard M. Dorson. Mr. Rahimi uses universals (Man and Woman) as proxies in a battle that, as the story progresses, takes on an abstract quality, Ms. Dargis wrote. Yet while there may be truths in some universals, its hard to forget that this tale has its roots in a bitterly real world. (Image: Ms. Farahani and Mr. Javdan.)

title: The Elusive Truth About War on ISIS

Their take on the progress of the troops was frequently at odds with the conclusions of civilian intelligence analysts and reporting by journalists in the field. The opposing views were important because they sometimes forced the Pentagon to face unpleasant truths and change course.

As a prank, his co-worker preps him for his moment by cribbing a speech from a dictator, coaching him to deliver it by pounding the lectern and waving his arms wildly. Dwight does it, and the audience gives a standing ovation to a manic tirade.

I had stolen some time away from work and chores, and I was goofing around with my 6-year-old, who was chasing me on his scooter. Attempting to escape, I leapt onto a log, which wobbled ever so slightly, and down I went.

title: Review: Everest Revisits a Fateful Adventure in 3-D
description: Because its there is a perfectly valid justification for climbing an enormous mountain  a famous one, at any rate  but maybe not a good enough reason to see a movie. Or to make a movie, for that matter. Technically, of course, a film isnt really there until someone makes it, and Everest, a breathless, large-scale 3-D action spectacle (directed by Baltasar Kormakur) about an ill-starred attempt to scale the planets highest peak, was called into being with impressive star power and technical bravura. It definitely exists. But it never seems to get anywhere, taking up space and time without managing to be especially memorable or imposing.

title: Europe Lacks Strategy to Tackle Crisis, but Migrants March On

title: Patrick deWitts Undermajordomo Minor
description: What does it mean to say that a writer has a take on a genre? This question has been popping around my mind since I read Patrick deWitts new novel, Undermajordomo Minor, which is, lets just say this straight out, quick and funny and thoughtful and moving and super. But what else is it? The book feels like a take on a certain genre  and lets figure out what the genre is in a minute  but Im suspicious of that phrasing, a take, which is often used to draw a divisive line. It is said, for instance, that Margaret Atwood does a take on science fiction and therefore is a literary writer instead of a science fiction writer, and then we wonder why there are so few science fiction writers who write as well as Margaret Atwood, while the science fiction writers glare at us and order another round. This is bad. The Handmaids Tale is science fiction and should not be disqualified as such on the grounds that it has good sentences and makes you think, as does the work of Patrick deWitt. Therefore, Undermajordomo Minor is a terrific piece of genre writing, and thats that.

The coup was apparently led by allies of the countrys longtime ruler, who was toppled in October.

title: An Otello Without Blackface Highlights an Enduring Tradition in Opera
description: At a recent dress rehearsal at the Metropolitan Opera, there was something missing when the Latvian tenor Aleksandrs Antonenko sang the title role of Verdis Otello: the stage makeup with names like Indian Red and Otello Brown that opera companies have used for more than a century to darken pale singers playing the part.

title: What the World Got Wrong About Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
description: Inthe sleek, cold lobby of the Langham Place hotel in Midtown Manhattan, one of those thoroughly designed spaces in which one cannot find a right angle, much less a comfortable chair, the 68-year-old, 7-foot-2 former basketball star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar was sitting on a leather bench with his arms draped around his protruding knees. It was a melancholy pose, best suited for the solitude of a beach at night or a rocky summit after a long hike. A U.C.L.A. T-shirt and a pair of jeans hung loosely off his narrow frame. Despite having had quadruple-bypass surgery just a few months earlier, Abdul-Jabbar didnt look all that different than he did during his last days on the Los Angeles Lakers in the late 1980s. The only evidence, really, that he had passed retirement age was a dash of white in his goatee.

title: Dead Forests and Living Memories
description: One dank January day in 1976, I stood on an English hillside with my mother and watched men with chain saws cutting up wrecks of trees and tossing brushwood onto fires. I was 5 years old, amazed by the roaring blades and drifting smoke, and troubled too.

title: Salman Rushdie: By the Book
Patti Smith, Paul Theroux and Others on Places Near and Far
description: Travel memoirs come in many variations, whether it be the unvarnished language of a journal that was never intended to be published, or the fine-tuned reflections of an author on his or her home turf, replete with oddball residents, dicey side streets and shopping suggestions for  if the writer happens to be Truman Capote  an ivory umbrella cane sans umbrella.

title: Letter of Recommendation:The Thorne Miniature Rooms
description: Down a center flight of marble stairs in the front entrance hall of the Art Institute of Chicago, there is a real-life time machine. It bears no resemblance, however, to any such devices from fiction. There are no displacement spheres, quantum-leap accelerators or flux capacitors; it looks nothing like H.G. Wellss gilded time-sleigh with its gleaming dinner platter, crystal-knobbed control lever and plush velvet drivers seat. Indeed, this particular time machine doesnt even have space for passengers, a fact that becomes immediately apparent upon approaching it. There is only a roomful of wide-eyed drifters trying to project themselves, via intensely prolonged gazes, through a series of glass-paned portals, tilting their torsos and craning their necks as if trying to inhabit the miniature worlds beyond.

title: The Most Charmingly Greek of All the Cyclades
description: On a movie set of a Cycladic island surrounded by the teal tint of the Aegean, just beyond Giorgitsi cave, my 5-year-old nephew, Cooper, finally got the hang of swimming.

title: The California Wildfires: Whats Making This Season So Wild?
description: The fires that have scorched large stretches of California continue to burn on Thursday, but with lower wind, cooler temperatures and even a little rain, they are no longer spreading fast, and they pose less of a threat than they did early in the week.

He also enjoyed a cozy relationship with the local office of the F.B.I., which turned a blind eye to his crimes in exchange for information about the activities of his rivals.

1890: Bottle Is Linked to Epidemic
description: The practice of leaving bottled cholera where it may fall into the hands of careless servants cannot be too strongly reprobated. It appears that the present epidemic in Spain is due to bottled cholera. A servant girl found a bottle of cholera, of vintage 1885, and carelessly emptied it into the gutter, with the result that in a short time the whole town swarmed with cholera microbes. At least this is the story told by a Spanish doctor, and it is not absolutely impossible that it may be true.  The New York Herald, European Edition, September 18, 1890
