title: Yuengling Brewery Chiefs Daughters Work to Become His Successors
description: This video is part of a series examining the world of the entrepreneurial family. Click here to view more.

title: A 13-Year-Old Founder, and His C.E.O. Mom
description: This video is part of a series examining the world of the entrepreneurial family. Click here to view more.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Social Media Defends Ahmed Mohamed
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the industry.

title: F.D.A. Nominee Califfs Ties to Drug Makers Worry Some
description: WASHINGTON  At a DoubleTree Hotel in Durham, N.C., in May 2014, Dr. Robert M. Califf gave a presentation to a group of biomedical researchers, lawyers and industry experts. He spoke about ways to quicken the pace of biomedical innovation by transforming research. Toward the end he showed a slide that noted one barrier: regulation.

title: After the Grateful Dead, Phil Lesh Shows He Has a Head for Business
description: A few times a month, Sam Satenstein lines up outside Terrapin Crossroads, a music hall and restaurant in San Rafael, Calif., for performances by the band Phil Lesh and Friends. The hall is owned by Mr. Lesh, the 75-year-old Grateful Dead bassist, and his wife, Jill. Mr. Satenstein is almost always first in line; when the doors open he rushes in to secure a spot on the side of the stage favored by Mr. Lesh. He plops down on the floor to protect the space.

title: Hunter Original: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Designs from Hunters spring show.

title: Loving the Job, but Loathing the Boss
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Abandoning Afghan War Zone in a Perilous Quest for Europe
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Najim Rahim says that when he looks around his neighborhood in the northern city of Kunduz now, I feel lonely.

title: Farooq Kathwari: Classic American Design and a Classic American Success Story
description: We have 18 acres off Interstate 84 in Danbury, Conn. Years ago this was a farm. The company bought the farmland in the 1970s and moved the headquarters here from New York.

title: Russian Buildup in Syria Raises Questions on Role
description: LONDON  Russias military buildup in Syria now includes surface-to-air missiles as well as combat aircraft with air-to-air capability, deployments that raise serious questions about Moscows role in the region, Secretary of State John Kerry said Saturday.

title: Earrings with Fringe Appeal
description: Decadent accessories that dangle and sway with the vivacity of the Roaring Twenties.

title: Variety: A Tipsy Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Ali Wentworth had a politically blueblood upbringing (her mother served as President Ronald Reagans White House social secretary), but that hasnt stopped her from forging her own somewhat rebellious path: shes a comedienne, author, actress and producer. You are most likely to remember her as Jerry Seinfelds girlfriend on the Schmoopie/Soup Nazi episode, but shes come a long way since then. Shes like a more socially acceptable version of Chelsea Handler.

title: Faustine Steinmetzs Fine Line(s) and Poetic Presentation
description: The designer showed pleats, fringe and gauzy grids for spring/summer 2016.

title: U.S. and China Seek Arms Deal for Cyberspace
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and China are negotiating what could become the first arms control accord for cyberspace, embracing a commitment by each country that it will not be the first to use cyberweapons to cripple the others critical infrastructure during peacetime, according to officials involved in the talks.

title: Minnesotas Mascot Turns Heads With Head Spins
description: MINNEAPOLIS  It usually happens spontaneously, by request, without any fanfare or cue.

title: Party Rules to Streamline Race May Backfire for G.O.P.
description: LOS ANGELES  When gloomy Republican Party leaders regrouped after President Obamas 2012 re-election, they were intent on enhancing the partys chances of winning back the White House. The result: new rules to head off a prolonged and divisive nomination fight, and to make certain the Republican standard-bearer is not pulled too far to the right before Election Day.

title: Top 10 Moments from New York Fashion Week
Welcome to the Age of the Unfunny Joke
description: THE first half of Tig Notaros new comedy special, which was released in August on HBO, included jokes about swimming with gastrointestinal distress and a confused airport security worker. The crowd laughed with delight. Then, more than halfway through the show, Ms. Notaro removed her blazer and shirt and completed her performance naked to the waist, displaying the scars from her double mastectomy.

title: Abstract New York
description: Collaborating with the elements, a citys expressions of anger and anxiety turn into painterly abstractions.

title: Bernie Sanders Lightens Up With Stephen Colbert
description: As the Late Show With Stephen Colbert began, the host joked at a potential awkwardness from having Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont on as his guest.

title: What Solange Knowles Wore to New York Fashion Week
description: The singer attended numerous shows and parties  in a series of outfit changes. A rundown of what she wore.

title: White Only Signs in Art Project at SUNY Buffalo Draw Concern
description: A graduate student at the State University of New York at Buffalo hung black only and white only signs around campus this week as part of an art project, which she said was intended to provoke a searing conversation.

title: Emilia Wickstead: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The latest looks from Emilia Wicksteads spring show.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Going Gaga for Ohad Naharin
description: DANCE, ESPECIALLY BALLET, is often seen as a quest for perfection in human form. Not so for Ohad Naharin, the artistic director of the Tel Aviv-based Batsheva Dance Company. Rather than watch an hour of accomplished performance, Naharin would prefer to see five seconds of something sublime  that indefinable quality described by the thinker Edmund Burke as delightful horror. This is where I wish to be, as a spectator and a creator, Naharin says  and, judging from his inimitable oeuvre from the past 35 years, the choreographer, widely hailed as one of the most influential luminaries of contemporary dance, has succeeded in this desire.

title: J.W. Anderson: Spring 2016 RTW
description: J.W. Andersons spring 2016 show.

title: Rate Rage
description: OK, I should have seen that one coming, but didnt: the banking industry has responded to the Feds decision not to hike rates with a primal cry of rage. And that, I think, tells us what we need to know about the political economy of permahawkery.

title: Pope Francis Departs Rome for Cuba
description: Pope Francis boarded a flight at Romes Fiumicino airport on his way to Cuba, where he is expected on Saturday evening.

title: Warily Eyeing China, Philippines May Invite U.S. Back to Subic Bay
description: SUBIC BAY, Philippines  In a flash of anticolonialist fervor nearly a quarter-century ago, lawmakers in the Philippines expelled the United States from an enormous naval base here, then the largest overseas outpost of the American military. Promising to break free from the shackles of dictatorship, they declared that foreign troops would never return.

title: A Hockey Life Full of Turns in the Minors
description: TROUT CREEK, Mont.  There are several ways to get to Trout Creek. Roy Sommer, a hockey coach who knows the back ways of the professional game as well as anyone, likes the dirt road.

title: When Purloined Letters Make News
description: With the pro football season in full swing, the discussion of Sony Pictures coming film, Concussion, could hardly be timelier.

title: How Federer Thrives in an Age of Disruption
description: SUPPORT for Roger Federer out in Flushing last week at the United States Opens mens final was mob-loud and unruly. There was raucous cheering every time Novak Djokovic netted a first serve, and calculated yelling when he was in his service motion. This owed something to the three-hour rain delay, which, to judge from the lines snaking from the alcohol concessions at Arthur Ashe Stadium, led many fans to tailgate, albeit with pink drinks.

title: The (Fake) Meat Revolution
description: IF only meat werent so delicious!

title: Justice Falls Short in G.M. Case
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  WITH tough talk that its actions belie, the Justice Department announced last week that it was bringing criminal charges against General Motors for concealing a potentially deadly safety defect from regulators and misleading consumers regarding the safety of G.M. vehicles, which caused or contributed to at least 124 deaths in accidents when airbags failed to deploy.

title: Evangelicals and the Carson Illusion
How to Close Guantnamo
description: For almost 14 years, the United States military prison camp in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, has sat festering on the edge of the Caribbean and the Constitution. Opened by President George W. Bush in the panicky months after the Sept. 11 attacks, the detention center has had a powerful radicalizing effect, has severely tarnished Americas standing as a nation of laws and has cost taxpayers more than $5.2 billion.

title: Making Government Logical
description: THERE wasnt a lot of fanfare, but last week may turn out to be among the most consequential of President Obamas second term. By executive order, Mr. Obama directed federal agencies to incorporate behavioral science  insights into how people actually make decisions  into their programs.

title: Grading More Fairly
description: Readers discuss a letter by Elizabeth Wissner-Gross asserting that some college students who excel are not being given the As they deserve to avoid charges of grade inflation.

title: Googling for God
description: IT has been a bad decade for God, at least so far. Despite the rising popularity of Pope Francis, who was elected in 2013, Google searches for churches are 15 percent lower in the first half of this decade than they were during the last half of the previous one. Searches questioning Gods existence are up. Many behaviors that he supposedly abhors have skyrocketed. Porn searches are up 83 percent. For heroin, its 32 percent.

title: My Father, the Priest
description: WHEN anyone asks what my father does, I say hes a retired teacher. He did, after all, teach high school science and Latin, so Im not lying. Im just not telling the whole story: My father, married to my mother for 45 years, is a Catholic priest. Not a former priest, but a member of the clergy in good standing in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Bridgeport, Conn. Especially on a date, thats a conversation stopper.

title: Why I Use Trigger Warnings
description: TRIGGER warnings have been getting a lot of pushback lately. Professors who have adopted the practice of alerting their students to potentially disturbing content in a text or class are being accused of coddling millennials. And the students who request them are being called infantile, or worse. In a recent story in The Atlantic, the authors Greg Lukianoff and Jonathan Haidt describe them as part of a movement, undirected and driven largely by students, to scrub campuses clean of words, ideas, and subjects that might cause discomfort or give offense.

title: Elizabeth Engelhardt
description: Elizabeth Engelhardt is a professor of Southern studies at the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill. Her research focuses on the interplay of food, race, gender, sports, ecology and culture in the South.

title: Arab Coalition Bombs Yemens Capital, Killing Dozens
description: SANA, Yemen  A Saudi-led military coalition bombarded government buildings and residential neighborhoods in Sana, the Yemeni capital, overnight on Saturday, killing more than two dozen people, officials and witnesses said, and destroying homes in Sanas Old City, a Unesco World Heritage site.

title: Facebook Groups Push for Safe Land Passage for Migrants Founders
description: EDIRNE, Turkey  Doaa, a 25-year old Syrian, was lying in the shade one day last week, trying to shelter herself from the scorching sun in a makeshift camp near this northwestern border city. A pile of blankets next to her quivered, and a tiny hand emerged. Her son, Nassim, was just a week old.

title: Cubans Have Mixed Opinions on Effect of Visit by Pope Francis
description: HAVANA  In a dilapidated eatery in Old Havana, Josef Fonseca, 92, sat in a worn plastic chair Saturday evening watching the arrival of Pope Francis in Cuba on a television with a snowy screen.

title: In Long Run, Cardinals Hope That a Breather Helps
description: The St. Louis Cardinals, to nobodys surprise, became the first team to reach 90 victories when they won in Milwaukee on Tuesday. The Cardinals could climb to 100 wins in the regular season, a feat unmatched since the Philadelphia Phillies did it in 2011. Naturally, the Cardinals beat those Phillies in the playoffs and went on to win the World Series.

title: The Latest Jewels: Like Found Family Heirlooms
description: Warm metals, intricate designs and colored stones mimic make new designs seem timeless.

title: Giants Defense Off to a Slow Start in Steve Spagnuolos Return Engagement
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Coach Tom Coughlin, trying to address failures that contributed to his teams missing the playoffs each of the last three seasons, returned to a glorious chapter in the franchises past when he hired Steve Spagnuolo as defensive coordinator in January.

title: Pope Francis, Arriving in Cuba, Seeks to Revive Church
description: HAVANA  In brokering the historic thaw between Cuba and the United States, Pope Francis stepped squarely into the thorny realm of geopolitics, sending letters to the presidents of both nations, playing host to secret meetings in the halls of the Vatican and nudging the Cold War enemies to put a half-century of vitriol and mistrust behind them.

title: This Rugby Player Creates Rhymes and Rhythm
description: BRIGHTON AND HOVE, England  Just before Thanksgiving in 2013, Mike Petri and his wife, Lauren, were browsing in a bookstore in Bethlehem, Pa. Lauren was due to give birth to the couples first child in a few weeks, and so the couple were looking to fill out their collection of childrens books. They grabbed plenty of standards  The Very Hungry Caterpillar, some Dr. Seuss titles  but Petri was looking for something specific.

Hillary Rodham Clinton turned to New Hampshire Democratic officials and county leaders on Saturday for help in fighting the surging campaign of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, who holds a steady lead over her in state opinion polls in the 2016 presidential primary race.

title: At 88, Tom Benson Conducts Business as Usual for New Orleans Teams

In 2005, he temporarily moved the team to Texas after Hurricane Katrina swamped New Orleans. Five years later, the Saints basked in the glow of their only Super Bowl victory. Then, in 2012, the N.F.L. penalized the team for rewarding players who hurt opponents.

title: 1915: German Armies Occupy Vilna
description: Vilna, capital of the Government of that name and the biggest city of Lithuania, has been occupied by the Germans. Details of the citys fall have not yet been made known, but there is every reason to suppose that the Russian army of occupation has withdrawn intact. For the last few days, as the HERALD indicated yesterday, the fate of Vilna had been in the balance. The enemy occupying Molodetchno and Vidsy, Vilna was practically cut off from all railway communication, and its evacuation, generally regarded as imminent, had doubtless been fully prepared for by the Russian high command. The fall of Vilna, says the Times Petrograd correspondent, will facilitate a further German advance along the northern routes and will increase Russias difficulties in the matter of transport, both of men and munitions. No official Russian statement has yet been issued, but even the German newspapers do not suggest that the army defending Vilna has been captured. Its escape may therefore be taken for granted, but its position is still a somewhat dangerous one, for an important enemy force threatens its flank from the east.  The New York Herald, European Edition, September 21, 1915

title: 1940: Rumania Wants Axis Help to Gain Province
description: BUCHAREST One week after the formation of a National Legionary (Iron Guard) state, political order and totalitarian unity have been achieved in Rumania, and the government of Premier Gen. Ion Antonescu is ready to face the tremendous task of adjusting the countrys strained economic condition. The future of the regime and of Rumania depends upon the success of this effort, which also will determine the aid that Rumania can give Germany in its war effort. The Rumanian leaders hope to obtain axis help in re-creating a greater Rumania, which was partitioned this summer after the Nazis had said that the changes were necessary for peace in southeastern Europe. New York Herald Tribune, September 21, 1940

title: 7 Killed in Shootings Across New York City
description: A few minutes before 2 a.m. on Sunday, residents of the Ingersoll Houses in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, said they were jolted by a series of pops that were the unmistakable but, as of late, less familiar sounds of gunfire.

title: Simone Rochas Ethereal Elegance
description: Semitransparency and romantic cutouts flirted with billowy volume and architectural shapes in the designers spring/summer 2016 collection.

title: Pope Celebrates First Mass in Cuba
description: Thousands of people attended the outdoor Mass at Revolution Plaza in Havana.

title: The Detainees Still at Guantnamo
description: Of the roughly 780 people who have been detained at the United States military prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, 91 remain.

title: Temperley London: Spring 2016 RTW
description: The labels latest collection.

title: Whats on TV Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (Fox) THE 67TH PRIMETIME EMMY AWARDS Andy Samberg hosts this ceremony honoring the best in television, broadcast live from the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. Taraji P. Henson, Terrence Howard, Jimmy Kimmel, Amy Poehler, Jaimie Alexander, Anthony Anderson, Tracee Ellis Ross, James Corden, Jamie Lee Curtis, Will Forte, Rob Lowe, Gina Rodriguez, Liev Schreiber, Maggie Gyllenhall and LL Cool J are among the presenters. Countdown to the Red Carpet, with Giuliana Rancic and Brad Goreski, begins at 4:30 on E!, followed by Live From the Red Carpet, with Ryan Seacrest and Ms. Rancic, at 6. (Image: Mr. Samberg)

title: Versus Versace Spring/Summer 2016
description: Plunging necklines and natural prints collide in the designers dark yet light collection.

title: At Versus Versace, Long Live No-Makeup Makeup
description: Theres no better way to create dewy skin without any product, said the makeup artist Tom Pecheaux backstage, as he languorously massaged the familiar contours of the model Erin Wassons face. Its not only about the physical benefits for the girls skin  reducing puffiness and promoting radiance  its a moment to let go. This product-less, skin-on-skin procedure was the building block for the luminous beauty look at the Versus Versace spring/summer 2016 show, where nude tones (and undone, tousled hair) softened the black and navy tailoring that was the mainstay of the collection.

title: Drug Goes From $13.50 a Tablet to $750, Overnight
description: Specialists in infectious disease are protesting a gigantic overnight increase in the price of a 62-year-old drug that is the standard of care for treating a life-threatening parasitic infection.

title: A Name Change for Avery Fisher Hall, 61 Times Over
description: The changing over to David, as Johnny Rivera describes it, has kept him busy, and he is appreciative. I have to thank him personally for giving me more work, Mr. Rivera, who is on a first-name basis with the David in question, said.

title: Sebastian Vettel Dominates in Singapore Grand Prix Despite Track Distractions
description: SINGAPORE  Two safety cars and a virtual safety car period, a fan on the track, three or four cars losing power mysteriously and some great, fast racing through the streets of Singapore, it was all a lot more than had been imagined for race day on Sunday, even at the seasons longest, most grueling event.

title: Phoebe Englishs Asymmetric Appeal for Spring
description: The designer showed uneven lengths, casual cutouts and the power of an artfully placed line in her spring 2016 collection.

title: U.S. Soldiers Told to Ignore Sexual Abuse of Boys by Afghan Allies
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In his last phone call home, Lance Cpl. Gregory Buckley Jr. told his father what was troubling him: From his bunk in southern Afghanistan, he could hear Afghan police officers sexually abusing boys they had brought to the base.

title: Metropolitan Opera Showcases Portraits for Otello Opening
description: These are portents; but yet I hope, I hope/They do not point on me, says Desdemona in Shakespeares Othello, before her voice is stifled forever. The drawings and paintings of the British artist Celia Paul  dark, caustic self-portraits and portraits of women in her family  are nothing if not portentous. And 14 of her works will help kick off the Metropolitan Operas new season, in Desdemona for Celia by Hilton, a collaborative exhibition by Ms. Paul and the critic Hilton Als at Gallery Met, in conjunction with the operas new production of Verdis Otello, which opens Monday.

title: 2 Americans Among 6 Hostages Freed in Yemen After Months of Captivity
description: WASHINGTON  Two Americans held hostage for months by rebels in Yemen were freed on Sunday and quickly flown to safety in nearby Oman, which helped the United States secure the release of the men, American officials said.

title: Volkswagen to Stop Sales of Diesel Cars Involved in Recall
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen said on Sunday that it would halt sales of cars in the United States equipped with the kind of diesel motors that had led regulators to accuse the German company of illegally installing software to evade standards for reducing smog.

title: Drunk Girl Pretty at Topshop Unique
description: Its Princess Margaret meets Courtney Love, and theyre at a really debauched garden party, is how the makeup artist Hannah Murray explained the irreverent beauty look backstage at Topshop Uniques spring 2016 show today. Leaving the skin super fresh, Murray worked with Topshops Kohl Pencil to loosely frame the upper and lower lids, adding Glow Pot gloss over the top to create a wet, petrol-hued finish. This girl cares, but not too much, she added.

title: The Rugby World Cup, London Fashions Outside Competition
description: Fashion isnt the only game in town this week in London. Literally.

title: Hillary Clinton Calls for the U.S. to Accept More Syrian Refugees
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton urged the United States to take in 65,000 Syrian and Iraqi refugees who have flooded European shores fleeing violence, accused Donald J. Trump of fueling a level of paranoia in his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination, and vowed that she had no interest in running negative ads against Senator Bernie Sanders who has topped her in some recent polls in Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: Arizona Cardinals David Johnson Starts N.F.L. Career 3-for-3
description: Touching the ball in an N.F.L. game for just the third time in his career, David Johnson of the Arizona Cardinals scored the longest touchdown in his teams 96-season history.

title: Jonathan Saunderss Powerful Prints for Spring 2016
description: In a warm, sun-filled venue the designer presented his boldly hued and patterned collection.

title: Paul Smith: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Looks from Paul Smiths latest collection.

title: Warner Bros. Announces Deal to Make Chinese-Language Films
description: Warner Bros. will start making films in Chinese. The company announced Sunday that it has partnered with China Media Capital, a private equity firm, to make Chinese-language films for a rapidly expanding market. Warner Bros. will own 49 percent of the venture, called Flagship Entertainment Group, and China Media Capital will own the rest.

title: Vivienne Westwood Red Label: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Looks from Ms. Westwoods Red label.

title: A Fancy Melon Set, Reissued
description: A wedge of cantaloupe, its sweetness intensified by savory paper-thin prosciutto, is a sophisticated dish worthy of its own superlative utensils. The legendary Danish design house Georg Jensen rises to the challenge with this exquisite melon set made of radiant silver with a softly hammered surface  part graceful scalpel, part elegant spork. With furled leaves, tapered endpoints and handles like Ionic columns, the pattern represents the bridge between the houses Art Nouveau roots and its embrace of Modernism. Out of production for decades, this set is part of a limited edition of reissued pieces, each crafted for luxuriously specialized tasks, from the Acorn collection created in 1915 by the designer Johan Rohde. Also on offer are a dainty grapefruit spoon and a new champagne saber, a Napoleonic-era tool that opens a bottle with one sharp blow to the neck.

title: Republicans Ensnared in Questions of Identity Politics
description: As presidential candidates wrapped up busy weekends in South Carolina, Michigan, Iowa and other states, several took to the Sunday talk shows to clarify points and weigh in on new controversies. Identity politics have resurfaced on the Republican side and a new CNN/ORC poll shows that less than a week after the partys second debate Donald J. Trump is clinging to his lead, while Carly Fiorina has surged into second place ahead of Ben Carson. Senator Marco Rubio of Florida is also showing signs of gaining traction, while Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin has fallen to the back of the pack. Here are the highlights.

title: More On The Political Economy Of Permahawkery
description: To be honest, Im feeling rather stupid about not understanding until now how to make sense of the ever-changing rationales for the ever-changing demand for higher interest rates. As someone who started in international trade, I more than anyone should have known that specific factors, not Stolper-Samuelson, is usually the way to go.

title: Software Is Smart Enough for SAT, but Still Far From Intelligent
description: SEATTLE  An artificial intelligence software program capable of seeing and reading has for the first time answered geometry questions from the SAT at the level of an average 11th grader.

title: Mary Katrantzou: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mary Katrantzous latest collection.

title: Review: From Twyla Tharp, 2 New Pieces for Her Anniversary Tour
description: DALLAS  After making dances for half a century, Twyla Tharp could have celebrated with a victory lap, assembling an elite crew of dancers to tour a greatest-hits program sampling some of the dazzling works that long ago earned her a ranking among the greatest and most influential of American choreographers. Instead, for the 50th-anniversary tour that opened at the Winspear Opera House here on Friday and will conclude in New York in November, Ms. Tharp has fashioned a pair of new pieces: Preludes and Fugues and Yowzie.

title: Giants Collapse Again, This Time at Home Against the Atlanta Falcons
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  For a second straight week, the Giants were storming toward an opponents goal line, yards from taking a commanding second-half lead. After a sluggish start, the Giants had turned dominant, and all the momentum was theirs.

title: Xi Jinpings U.S. Visit
description: Re-inflating the Chinese economy.

title: Apollo Announces Season Lineup, Starts Comedy Club
description: The Apollo Theater has hosted plenty of notable comedians over the years, including Richard Pryor and Redd Foxx. Now, it is starting the Apollo Comedy Club as part of its fall-winter lineup.

title: Patriots Brady Passes and Passes and Passes, and the Bills Are Thrown
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  With the Bills relying on a new coach, Rex Ryan, and a new quarterback, Tyrod Taylor, there were some expectations that this meeting between Buffalo and the New England Patriots might finally have a different result.

title: Maze Runner Sequel Races to No. 1 at Box Office
description: Although Maze Runner: Scorch Trials easily topped the weekend box office in its debut, selling a sturdy $30.3 million in tickets, that total fell short of the take for The Maze Runner last fall, reinforcing a movie business axiom: Sequels do best when filmmakers dont fiddle too much with the formula.

title: Boat on East River Capsizes; Fire Department Rescues 19
description: It was a seemingly lovely afternoon to go out on the East River and do something memorable. For the group that left the marina in College Point, Queens, on Sunday in a dragon boat, the authorities said, that was exactly the plan.

title: Review: New York Philharmonic Accompanies On the Waterfront and The Godfather
description: The idea behind the Art of the Score series, one of the most popular innovations of the New York Philharmonic in recent years, could not be simpler: classic films are screened at Avery Fisher Hall with the Philharmonic playing the score live. But the execution of these projects is anything but simple.

title: Review: Scott Shanes Objective Troy, on Killing the American Jihadist Anwar al-Awlaki
description: In September 2011, in northern Yemen, C.I.A. Predator drones killed Anwar al-Awlaki, an American citizen who was then 40 years old. He was a skinny, charismatic preacher educated at Colorado State University. As a younger man he had displayed a weakness for prostitutes and had devoured books about leadership like The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People, by Stephen R. Covey. At the time of his death, Mr. Awlaki advocated killing fellow Americans in the name of jihad. He had embraced Al Qaedas branch in Yemen and had participated in plots to blow up American airplanes.

title: Review: A Resurrection in Tune With the Atlanta Symphonys Renewal
description: ATLANTA  Prescient as Mahlerians like to think their hero was, Mahler could not have imagined how useful his Resurrection Symphony would become in 21st-century America, with orchestra after orchestra emerging from a near-death crisis of one sort or another.

title: Review: Whistleblower, a Dance-Theater Take on Chelsea Manning
description: When the Army private Chelsea Manning, known at the time as Bradley Manning, leaked more than 700,000 sensitive documents, the possibility of a trial and sentence in a military prison may have been foreseeable. Less easy to predict was that the privates situation would inspire Whistleblower, a piece of dance theater by the writer, director and choreographer Mark Dendy.

title: Review: Banda de los Muertos Brings the Party for Its Album Debut
description: Banda de los Muertos locked into a boisterous churn almost from the start of its show on Friday night at Pioneer Works in Red Hook, Brooklyn. Playing El Sinaloense, a Mexican brass band standard, the group sputtered and blared, rolling hard with tumbling polyrhythm, filling the room with sound. As if on cue, dancing broke out in the audience, starting with a handful of couples near the foot of the stage.

title: Review: In Blindspot, an Amnesiacs Tattoos Are the Clues
description: From its opening scene, a spine-tingling if-you-see-something-say-something moment, NBCs Blindspot is an attention getter. Who knows whether its somewhat lurid central gimmick is sturdy enough to carry it for the long haul, but the show, which has its premiere Monday night, certainly gets off to an intriguing start.

title: Review: In Age & Beauty, Miguel Gutierrez Ponders the Personal and the Professional
description: If part of watching dance is piecing together afterimages, what is the effect of seeing a trilogy out of order? Enlightening. Miguel Gutierrezs Age & Beauty, Parts 1 and 2, were reprised over the weekend in a co-presentation of New York Live Arts, where the works were performed, and Crossing the Line 2015.

title: Review: Traditional Dance From Okinawa at Japan Society
description: For a dancegoer in New York, fall can feel like an onrush of the new, of premieres and untested experiments, by turns exciting and overwhelming. In the midst of all that, it was refreshing to spend time with something ancient on Friday, when the Japan Society offered Traditional Dance From Okinawa With Live Music, a rare and exquisite program showcasing the performing arts of Japans southwestern islands.

title: Review: Life in Pieces, a CBS Comedy, Told in Vignettes
description: Life in Pieces, which begins Monday on CBS, may be the ultimate antidote for those who find the supposed new golden age of television to be exhausting and time-eating. If that golden age is characterized by intricate, character-rich dramas that have to be watched from Season 1, Episode 1, heres a half-hour comedy you can consume in six-minute bites, as many or as few as you want.

title: Masaan and Other Indian Films Steer Away From Bollywood Escapism
description: MUMBAI  At the beginning of Masaan, the most acclaimed Indian movie of the year, two lovers meet at a ramshackle motel in the holy northern city of Varanasi. In the middle of their clandestine sexual encounter, police officers barge into the room and threaten the couple, setting off a chain of events with devastating consequences. Composed of parallel yet interconnected tales, Masaan explores Indias forces of caste and social conservatism, which continue to hold sway as the country makes a dizzying passage into the modern world.

title: Mary Katrantzous Cosmic Chaos
description: The designer focused on the theme of exploration for her spring/summer 2016 collection.

title: Review: Argento Chamber Ensembles Scelsi Rediscovered
description: Scelsi Rediscovered was the title given to the Argento Chamber Ensembles simmering concert Friday evening at the Czech Center New York. But it hasnt been all that long since this enigmatic, reclusive Italian master was discovered in the first place. Not until the years before Scelsis death in 1988 did his works  some more than 50 years old at that point  become widely known.

title: Here Comes Trouble
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  A succinct scrutiny of the puzzle today: This one by Bruce Haight looks relatively non-challenging on the surface, but offers a one-two punch when you realize that, yes, this theme is merely a bunch of two-word S-S phrases, but theyre all either abutting each other or  even better  interlocking. Thats a neat surprise on a Monday.

title: Alabama Church Shooting Wounds Infant and 2 Adults
description: A man walked into a church service in East Selma, Ala., on Sunday morning and opened fire with a handgun, shooting his 24-year-old girlfriend and their infant son and then the pastor before being disarmed by congregants, according to the police.

title: Bipartisan Effort Fights Health Law Rule That Could Raise Premiums
description: WASHINGTON  Members of Congress from both parties, as well as some employers, insurers and state insurance commissioners, are calling for changes in the Affordable Care Act to prevent premium increases that are expected to affect workers at many small and midsize companies next year.

title: Cowboys Search for Answers After Tony Romo Injury
description: Dealing a major blow to the Dallas Cowboys, their star quarterback Tony Romo left Sundays 20-10 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles with a broken left clavicle. He did not return and may be out for an extended amount of time.

title: Clever, a Software Service, Gives Schools a Way to Manage Data Flow to Apps
description: For years, Mark Racine, the technology director of the Boston Public Schools, and his team plodded through a cumbersome exercise at the start of each school year: transferring student roster information from school databases to the various learning apps that teachers wanted to use in the classroom.

title: Emmy Red Carpet Fashion
description: Looks from Taraji P. Henson, Kerry Washington, Laverne Cox and more at the 67th Emmy Awards.

title: President Heartbroken Over Death of Adviser
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Sunday that he was heartbroken at the death of a technology policy adviser, Jake Brewer, who was killed in a cycling accident on Saturday while participating in a charity ride to raise money for cancer research.

title: ISIS Defectors Reveal Disillusionment
description: LONDON  A small but growing number of defectors from the Islamic State are risking reprisals and imprisonment to speak out about their disillusionment with the extremist group, according to a research organization that tracks former and current militants.

title: Amid Protests, Nepal Adopts Constitution
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  After nearly a decade of delay marked by haggling and political infighting, Nepal formally adopted a constitution on Sunday, with President Ram Baran Yadav calling the moment a realization of the continuous democratic movements initiated by Nepalese people after he signed the document.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Sept. 21
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: A Rookie Brings Her Skills to the Super Bowl of Social Planning
description: WASHINGTON  Imagine a week in which you arrange the halftime show for the Super Bowl, organize the trophy ceremony for the World Cup and then, for good measure, plan your daughters wedding.

title: C. K. Williams, Poet, Dies at 78; Pulitzer Winner Tackled Politics and Morality
description: C. K. Williams, whose morally impassioned poems addressing war, poverty and climate change, as well as the imponderable mysteries of the psyche, won him a Pulitzer Prize and a National Book Award, died on Sunday at his home in Hopewell. N.J. He was 78.

title: G.O.P. Field Wrestles With Questions on Islam and the Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  Faith and politics intersected on Sunday when discussions of how Donald J. Trump handled a question about President Obamas religion evolved into an awkward debate over whether a Muslim could ever be commander in chief.

title: Lawmakers Seek National Park in Honor of Stonewall
description: Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand of New York and Representative Jerrold Nadler of Manhattan unveiled a campaign on Sunday to create a national park honoring the Stonewall uprising, vowing that they would mount a petition drive urging President Obama to grant protected status to the site of a pivotal early clash in the movement for gay equality.

title: In Courting Chinese Companies, Britain to Help Fund Planned Nuclear Plant
description: LONDON  The British government said on Monday that it would provide 2 billion pounds, or about $3.1 billion, in state aid for a nuclear power station planned for Hinkley Point in southwest England.

title: Running Afoul of the Thai Monarchy
description: Thailands strict lse-majest laws make it a crime to insult the monarchy, an offense that includes a surprising number of activities.

title: With King in Declining Health, Future of Monarchy in Thailand Is Uncertain
description: BANGKOK  After nearly seven decades on the throne, King Bhumibol Adulyadej, 87, the keystone of Thailands identity and a major unifying force for the country, is in declining health. With increasing frequency, the palace has issued medical bulletins detailing his ailments, and in recent days his youngest daughter has led prayer sessions following a Buddhist rite normally used for terminally ill patients.

title: Kickstarter Focuses Its Mission on Altruism Over Profit
description: Many technology start-ups aim to become unicorns, the companies that get valued at $1 billion or more on their way to probable vast riches. Yancey Strickler and Perry Chen have no interest in that.

title: Russian Project Honors Stalins Victims and Stirs Talk on Brutal Past
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  In a society stewing in nationalist sentiment, a little project called Last Address seems almost seditious.

title: Tireless Star and Unorthodox Coach Help Lead Britain to Davis Cup Final
description: GLASGOW  Leon Smith was a curious choice when he was appointed captain of Britains Davis Cup team in April 2010. The team was on the verge of being relegated to the lowest levels of the competition, a tennis underworld populated by nations like San Marino and Liechtenstein and their squads of part-timers.

title: Emmy Awards Red Carpet Fashion
description: The 67th prime time Emmy Awards on Sunday night in Los Angeles, brought televisions top performers, technicians and creators together for a night of self-congratulation and ceremony.

title: Only Thing inLeonard Fournettes Way: N.F.L. Rule Book
description: There was a rare moment of stillness at the beginning of Louisiana States 45-21 rout of visiting Auburn on Saturday. The Tigers  purple version  handed off to Leonard Fournette, and he stalled with some careful stutter-steps, letting L.S.U.s offensive linemen clear his path.

title: New York Military Academys Sudden Closing, After 126 Years
description: CORNWALL-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  Among its thousands of alumni, the 126-year-old New York Military Academy counts the unlikely grouping of Donald J. Trump, Stephen Sondheim and John A. Gotti. Yet all three have this in common: They remember their time at the prep school with deep affection.

title: Apple Confirms Discovery of Malicious Code in Some App Store Products
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Hackers have found their way into Apples App Store.

title: Mediators in Burkino Faso Issue Proposals to End Strife
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  Mediators proposed ways to end a political crisis stemming from last weeks coup in Burkina Faso, just hours after the hotel where they were meeting on Sunday was stormed by supporters of the military.

title: After Battling Safety Agency, Recaro Changes Course on Car Seat Recall
description: The recall seemed to be straightforward enough: Recaro Child Safety needed to fix some of its car seats so that they would not break free during a crash.

title: The Refugee Crisis Has Produced One Winner: Organized Crime
description: IN the midst of the refugee crisis, the European Union has for the first time ever been considering deploying naval assets against organized crime. People smuggling, chiefly from Syria and the Horn of Africa, is now a multibillion-dollar business that is as profitable, if not more so, than the trade in illegal narcotics.

title: Oregons Legal Sale of Marijuana Comes With Reprieve
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  About 15 years ago, when she was in her 20s, Erika Walton handed a bong to someone who turned out be a police officer, and was cited for marijuana possession. She paid the fine, she said, but the violation lingered on, haunting her record.

title: On Instagram and Other Social Media, Redefining User Engagement
description: Shereen Way did not think twice about posting a photo on Instagram of her 4-year-old daughter wearing a green dress and pink Crocs sandals.

title: Muscle Strain Will Keep Masahiro Tanaka From Making a Key Start in Toronto
description: Yankees Manager Joe Girardi opened his pregame news conference Sunday afternoon by saying he would start the proceedings. Normally, Girardi begins by fielding questions from reporters, so it was clear some kind of announcement was coming, and very likely it was bad news.

title: A Game Changer for the Giants, for Better or Worse
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Fans tend to treat the N.F.L. season like an H. G. Wells science fiction story: Every week is Armageddon.

title: Farewell to a Street Tree
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Firing at The Los Angeles Times Focuses Discontent
description: LOS ANGELES  In January, Jack Griffin, the chief executive of Tribune Publishing Company, took his senior management team to visit The Los Angeles Times, the jewel in his companys portfolio of newspapers.

title: Talented Pass Catcher Plays Defense for Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Four of the five starters on the 2008-9 Hopkins High School boys basketball team, that seasons Minnesota state champion, received Division I scholarships. The exception was the 5-foot-11 point guard, who shot a little, passed a lot and relished his responsibility as a defensive stopper.

title: Pope Francis Visits: Day 2 in Cuba
description: The latest from Pope Francis visit to Cuba and the United States.

title: New York City to Add Housing for Domestic Violence Victims
description: New York City is planning to add more housing for homeless adults and children fleeing domestic violence, the latest effort by Mayor Bill de Blasios administration to deal with a homelessness problem that has persisted as housing costs in the city have continued to soar.

title: Jason Day Holds On to Win, and Grabs Top Ranking
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill.  Jason Day stood behind his second shot on the 465-yard 16th hole and took a moment to close his eyes to visualize his third.

title: And the Emmy Goes to ...
description: Viola Davis made history as best lead actress in a drama series at Sunday nights ceremony in Los Angeles.

title: Government Declassifies Additional Portions of Once-Secret Report on Post-9/11 Surveillance
description: In response to a Freedom of Information Act lawsuit by The New York Times, the government has declassified additional portions of a 2009 report by five agencies inspectors general about the Stellarwind program, the group of N.S.A. warrantless wiretapping and bulk phone and e-mail records collection activities initiated by President George W. Bush after the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001. In 2009, the government released a 43-page unclassified version which omitted discussion of many key facts that then remained secret. In April, the government released an earlier version of this report. The newly declassified portions largely consist of references to and descriptions of the text of Mr. Bushs periodic authorizations to the N.S.A, which evolved over time  especially after a March 2004 confrontation with the Justice Department.

title: Charter and Time Warner Vote, and Chinese Tech Meeting in Seattle
description: Shareholders of both Charter Communications and Time Warner Cable will vote on Monday on their proposed $56.7 billion merger. Announced in May, Charters takeover of Time Warner Cable, along with a deal for Bright House Networks, would create the countrys second-largest broadband Internet provider and third-largest video provider.

title: Review: A Midsummer Nights Dream Tailored for Multitaskers
description: Everybodys a Bottom in Eric Tuckers riotous production of A Midsummer Nights Dream, in which a cast of five divides and multiplies like a troupe of stage-struck amoebas. Bottom the Weaver, you may recall, is the overeager amateur actor in this Shakespeare comedy of crazy mixed-up love  the one who wants to play all the parts, be they heroes, lions or ladies.

title: Fear the Walking Dead Recap: Wake Up, Travis
description: Season 1, Episode 4, Not Fade Away

title: George W. Bush Made Retroactive N.S.A. Fix After Hospital Room Showdown
description: WASHINGTON  President George W. Bush sought to retroactively authorize portions of the National Security Agencys post-9/11 surveillance and data collection program after a now-famous incident in 2004 in which his attorney general refused to certify the program as lawful from his hospital bed, according to newly declassified portions of a government investigation.

title: Years Ago, Mets Had Starters Who Finished With a Flourish
description: As the Mets try to win their first division title since 2006, their pitchers appear to be struggling physically down the stretch. A starting rotation that once seemed overpowering is looking a little gassed.

title: Bike-Sharing Programs Gain a Toehold in New Jersey
description: JERSEY CITY  Last Wednesday, Steven M. Fulop, the mayor of Jersey City, got ready for one of his regular morning bike rides. He had his helmet on, but rather than his usual spandex jersey, he wore khakis, an oxford shirt and a light down vest. And instead of his $3,000 Kuota carbon-fiber racing bike, which Mr. Fulop, a former Marine, rides in triathlons, he mounted a hefty, bright blue Citi Bike.

title: Mamdouha Bobst, Philanthropist and Public Health Advocate, Dies at 90
description: Mamdouha Bobst, a philanthropist and public health advocate whose donations benefited universities, hospitals and clinics for animals, died on Sept. 10 in Manhattan. She was 90.

title: Red Carpet Trend at the 2015 Emmys? Trying to Stay Cool
description: It was hot, about 100 degrees hot, on some of the processional stops on the Emmys red carpet. To watch the two hours of coverage on E!  as grueling to observe as it must have been to sweat through  was to come away not with any single trend or theme, no runaway winner of the red-carpet lottery, but one simple message: Its brutal out here.

title: Masters of Sex Recap: The Romantic Moment Thats Not
description: Season 3, Episode 11: Party of Four

title: Emmys 2015: Firsts for Viola Davis and Jon Hamm, and a Victory Lap for HBO
description: LOS ANGELES  It was a night of firsts, and a night for establishment cable at the 67th Primetime Emmy Awards on Sunday.

title: The 2015 Emmy Awards
Word of the Day + Quiz | swerve
description: swerve  \swrv\ verb and noun

title: Devils Lose Preseason Opener
description: Matt Irwin scored two power-play goals, leading the Boston Bruins to a 2-0 victory over the Devils in Providence, R.I., in the preseason opener for both teams.

title: Jack Larson, a TV Jimmy Olsen Turned Playwright, Dies at 87
description: Jack Larson, the playwright and librettist who, as he often predicted with good-natured resignation, will be remembered best as the actor who played the cub reporter Jimmy Olsen on the television series Adventures of Superman, died on Sunday at his home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 9 P.M. (Fox) MINORITY REPORT This new series, based on the 2002 Steven Spielberg film starring Tom Cruise, travels ahead to 2065, by which time Pre-Crime  the ability to know in advance that a crime will be committed through foreknowledge gathered by psychics  has long been abolished and a young precog named Dash (Stark Sands) is trying to lead a civilian life despite continuing visions of bloodshed. Meanwhile in Washington, a police detective (Meagan Good) and a mayoral candidate (Peter Van Eyck) are struggling with the return of murder. Minority Report, the TV series, appears to come from an alternative universe: one in which Minority Report, the movie, was never made, James Poniewozik wrote in The New York Times. Taken on its own terms, then, Minority Report is ... still not good, he added. Though the future promises holographic phone calls, subway advertisements for marijuana goodies and the 75th season of The Simpsons, he wrote, psychic powers make for dull detective work. Season 2 of Gotham, which finds Detective Gordon (Ben McKenzie) seeking help from the Penguin after a shift in power at the Gotham City Police Department, leads in at 8. (Image: from left, Wilmer Valderrama, Li Jun Li and Ms. Good.)

title: A Limit on Matt Harveys Innings Has New Fans: The Yankees
description: Matt Harvey walked into the dugout after the fifth inning, his head down, his face flushed from a hard days work. His teammates greeted him with high-fives and pats on the back for his performance. He stopped and chatted with Manager Terry Collins, found a water bottle and then found a seat where he could watch the rest of the game, because his day was evidently done.

title: Aaron Rodgers and Packers Take Advantage of Seahawks Turnovers
description: For the second straight week, the Seattle Seahawks were left wondering what went wrong. The two-time defending N.F.C. champions lost to the Green Bay Packers, 27-17, on Sunday night, dropping to 0-2 for the season.

description: Two college students died on Sunday afternoon when the plane they were flying in crashed into a field in upstate New York shortly after takeoff, authorities said.

description: Coming off a game in which he turned two touches into 98 yards, the rookie David Johnson continued to shine for the Cardinals, returning the opening kickoff a club-record 108 yards for a touchdown to start a victory over the Bears. Johnson also ran for 42 yards on five carries with a touchdown. The rushing attack opened up things for Carson Palmer, who threw for four touchdowns.

title: OxyContin Is Not for Kids
description: Montpelier, Vt.  A YEAR and a half ago, I stood up before Vermonters and devoted my State of the State address to speaking about the opiate and heroin crisis affecting my state. Despite our best efforts since, this is not a battle we are winning. Now the Food and Drug Administration is recklessly making the problem worse with its decision to approve OxyContin for use by children as young as 11 years old.

title: Lets Not Move to Mars
description: IN the early years of the 20th century, zeppelins filled with flammable and explosive hydrogen were all the rage in Germany, a reckless infatuation that ended with the eruption and crash of the Hindenburg in 1937. Sometimes, technology is a triumph of wild-eyed enthusiasm over the unpleasant facts of the real world.

title: The Pope and the Birth Control Ban
description: Pope Francis has taken a softer line than some of his predecessors on sexual and reproductive issues. He has said that the church should concentrate less on same-sex marriage, contraception and abortion, and this month he announced that during the churchs coming Holy Year of Mercy, all priests would be able to grant absolution for abortion.

title: Mr. Putins Mixed Messages on Syria
description: President Vladimir Putin of Russia is trying to have it both ways in Syria. He is dangerously building up Russias military presence there, while positioning himself as the worlds savior against Islamic extremists and holding high-level military-to-military talks with the United States. President Obama should go one step further and be prepared to meet Mr. Putin later this month when the two are at the United Nations. If there is to be a solution to the Islamic States advance and to Syrias war, both Russia and America will have to be involved.

title: The Rage of the Bankers
description: Last week the Federal Reserve chose not to raise interest rates. It was the right decision. In fact, Im among the economists wondering why were even thinking about raising rates right now.

title: Dont Coronate Carly Fiorina Just Yet
description: The media has a new darling in the Republican presidential disaster pageant: Carly Fiorina.

title: Use Medicares Muscle to Lower Drug Prices
description: A poll last month by Consumer Reports found that a third of the patients who take prescription drugs are paying significantly more this year, forcing many to cut back on other necessities or load up on credit card debt. Another poll in August by the Kaiser Family Foundation found that about a quarter of those surveyed said they had trouble paying for prescription drugs.

title: Volkswagen Stock Falls as Automaker Tries to Contain Fallout
description: FRANKFURT  Martin Winterkorn was uncharacteristically subdued last week when, on the eve of the Frankfurt auto show, he stepped into a beam of blue light to show off the latest products from the Volkswagen empire.

title: Pope Francis U.S. Visit Could Benefit Both Left and Right
description: WASHINGTON  Pope Francis will arrive at a military base outside the capital on Tuesday afternoon to open his first visit to the United States, and President Obama will be there to welcome him. It is a gesture the president has extended to virtually no other foreign visitor.

description: Note: Every Monday during the 2015-16 school year, we present a special post for English Language Learners. Each focuses on one topic, and offers an interactive quiz and a writing prompt.

Zurich Insurance Ends Pursuit of RSA of Britain
description: LONDON  Zurich Insurance Group said on Monday that it was abandoning its pursuit of RSA Insurance Group, a smaller British rival, after a deterioration in its business performance, particularly in Zurichs general insurance unit.

title: Xi Jinping of China Arriving in U.S. at Moment of Vulnerability
description: BEIJING  President Xi Jinping of China looked regal as he stood in a limousine moving past Tiananmen Square this month, wearing a traditional suit of the kind favored by Mao and waving at parade troops assembled at attention. But the luster of Mr. Xis imperial presidency has dulled lately.

title: Trading Meat for Tires as Bartering Economy Grows in Greece
description: ATHENS  Thodoris Roussos stood in his butchers shop and pointed to a large white delivery truck at the curb. For months, he had put off replacing the tires, because Greeces financial crisis had cut into business. But recently, he upgraded the van with a set of good wheels at a price that could not be beat.

title: France Rejects Googles Efforts to Limit Application of Privacy Ruling
description: Frances privacy watchdog just will not take no for an answer.

title: Foster Parenting: When to Explain, When to Let It Pass
description: Is this your sons first year of preschool?

title: David Brocks Killing the Messenger
description: Ive always wondered about the details of the reconciliation between Hillary Clinton and David Brock. As an investigative reporter for The American Spectator in the 1990s, Brock published whatever the Arkansas state troopers told him about Bill Clinton and his women and put the rumor about Vince Foster and Hillary into print. His tone and loose reporting ethics arguably unleashed two decades of cheap tabloid right-wing best sellers that still dog Hillary and Bill today. Is that really something the Clintons ever got past?

title: Black Silent Majority, by Michael Javen Fortner
description: For as long as I can remember, certain relatives of mine were always dismayed and often enraged by the daily headlines and nightly news stories of crime. As a kid I heard countless tales of the terrible outrages visited on black people by other black people: burglarizing homes, pulling guns and shooting at one another, too often claiming innocent bystanders in the crossfire. Some of these stories were personal testimonies of victimization. In my 70s childhood on Chicagos South Side, I was taught that some black people behaved despicably.

title: Hillary Clinton Rates Unfavorably in New York State Poll
description: A rough political summer has left Hillary Rodham Clinton with negative favorability ratings in a New York State poll for the first time, a low mark in the state she represented as a senator for eight years.

title: Morning Agenda: Second Chance for Tsipras
description: SECOND CHANCE FOR TSIPRAS | Greek voters returned Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece to power on Sunday, even though he had abandoned the anti-austerity platform he was elected on, Suzanne Daley reports in The New York Times. Many of them said he had fought hard to get a better deal for the country and deserved a second chance.

title: A Quarter of the Countrys Green Sea Turtles Call Florida Refuge Home
description: Green sea turtles have had their ups and downs. They were so plentiful that they were commercially harvested for hundreds of years in the Atlantic, but are now listed as threatened or endangered under the Endangered Species Act, depending on the location.

title: Indonesias Mud Volcano and Nine Years of Debate About Its Muck
description: Nine years ago, a rice paddy in eastern Java suddenly cleaved open and began spewing steaming mud. Before long, it covered an area twice the size of Central Park; roads, factories and homes disappeared under a tide of reeking muck. Twenty lives were lost and nearly 40,000 people displaced, with damages topping $2.7 billion.

title: As Fires Grow, a New Landscape Appears in the West
description: NEAR COCHITI CANYON, N.M.  The hills here are beautiful, a rolling, green landscape of grasses and shrubs under a late-summer sky. But it is starkly different from what was here before: vast forests of ponderosa pine. The repeated blazes that devastated the trees were caused by simple things: an improperly extinguished campfire in 1996, a tree falling on a power line in 2011.

description: Updated 9:37 a.m.

description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: A Saudi-American Reset
description: WASHINGTON  After more than two years of perceived slights and supposed snubs, the new contours of a revitalized but evolving partnership between the United States and Saudi Arabia are beginning to take shape. This months visit to Washington by King Salman solidified the defense and security aspects of this new version of an old relationship. The Saudis are also strongly pushing an economic agenda as the centerpiece of what King Salman identified as a new strategic alliance for the 21st century.

title: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love A.I.
description: The distinction between man and machine is under siege. The technology wizard Ray Kurzweil speaks with casual confidence of achieving electromagnetic immortality with our once-human selves eternally etched onto universal servers. For me, the possibility that machines will acquire the equivalent of human feelings and emotions is pure fantasy. And yet, as a neurologist, I cannot ignore advancing machine intelligences implications about the human mind.

title: Trapped in the System: A Sick Doctors Story
description: We spend a lot of time talking about various metrics of quality or access in the American health care system. The problem with many of them is that they rarely seem to capture the issues that people face in dealing with care. Although many metrics are improving, problems remain that still seem insurmountable.

description: Jets (1-0) at Colts (0-1)

title: Today in Politics: Republicans Comments Put Them on Other Side of Popes Message
description: Good Monday morning. Pope Francis has delivered an encyclical calling for increased action against climate change, denounced the role of global capitalism in increasing poverty, and enthusiastically supported the new nuclear accord withIran, positions thathave caused tensions in the Republican Party. Now the pope, whom American Catholics overwhelmingly support, arrives in the United States as Republicans wrestle with these issues and with perceptions of intolerance.

title: Explaining the Flight News and Rules on Travel to Cuba
description: Nearly a year after the United States announced it would be loosening travel restrictions to Cuba, the two countries have reached an agreement on regularly scheduled commercial flights to the island, the Associated Press has reported. Coupled with the previous rule changes for travelers, commercial flights to the island from the United States would make it possible for practically anyone who wishes to visit Cuba to do so. Here is what you need to know before you go:

To his dismay, the word was repeated twice more as he kept reading.

title: Esmail Kiram II, Self-Proclaimed Sultan of Sulu, Dies at 75
description: MANILA  Esmail Kiram II, the self-proclaimed sultan of Sulu who in 2013 encouraged a last-ditch, violent effort to regain what is now the Malaysian state of Sabah on the island of Borneo for the Philippines, died on Saturday at a hospital in Zamboanga City in the southern Philippines. He was 75.

title: Alexis Tsiprass Election Victory, and Greeces Looming Challenges
description: Alexis Tsipras won an unexpectedly decisive victory in elections in Greece on Sunday, renewing his mandate to lead the austerity-weary nation, this time as a prime minister committed to supporting a bailout rather than to fighting one. Defying many experts predictions of a tight race, his leftist party, Syriza, received just over 35 percent of the vote, beating the main right-leaning opposition party by more than seven percentage points.

description: A simplified financial-aid calculator  much easier to use than the federally mandated calculators that most colleges create  has begun spreading beyond Wellesley College, where it began two years ago.

title: Starwood Waypoint Residential Trust to Acquire a Rival
description: Starwood Waypoint Residential Trust, an investment vehicle that owns thousands of single-family rental homes in the United States, said on Monday that it would buy its rival Colony American Homes in an all-stock deal that values Colony American at $1.5 billion.

description: Best moments from the 67th Primetime Emmy Awards at the Microsoft Theatre in downtown Los Angeles, California.

title: Daily Report: Kickstarter Becomes a Public Benefit Corporation
description: It is a common criticism of tech companies these days: They say they want to change the world, but what they really want to change is how much money they have in the bank. Or the horsepower of the car in the driveway. Or maybe the exotic locale of the third vacation home.

title: 1940: Legionnaires Take Over Fair
description: With 75,000 members of the American Legion and their families attending, the New York Worlds Fair had its biggest Saturday of 1940 yesterday, the paid admissions total mounting to 234,121 at midnight. The Legionnaires attended the fair as a prelude to the national convention which opens in Boston tomorrow. Congregated in the huge court were 15,000 legionnaires and members of their auxiliary organizations, most of them in uniform. There were so many flags in the parade that Legion members in uniform stood at attention and saluted for nearly an hour.  New York Herald Tribune, September 22, 1940

description: Users of Skype, Microsofts Internet calling unit, faced a lengthy blackout on Monday after people worldwide were not able to make calls or sign into the service.

title: Threes a Trend: Ruffles
description: Ladylike ruffles have spruced up neutral colors and conservative silhouettes in designers spring/summer 2016 collections. At Proenza Schouler, architectural bends grounded a light, gauzy layer that swished and swayed as the model walked. And Simone Rochas asymmetrical and artfully arranged ruffles defined womanly curves while the voluminous folds on a J. W. Anderson dress were just sweet  as a peach.

description: If the Internet is the Wild West, you could call 4chan The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.

title: Chancellors Absence and 0-2 Start Weigh on Seahawks
description: The Seattle Seahawks, the N.F.L.s reigning N.F.C. champions, have started the season 0-2, and their vaunted defense is struggling, especially against the pass. An All-Pro strong safety who would help them a lot is sitting at home, embroiled in a contract dispute.

title: Parents, Not Schools, Should Decide What to Pack for Lunch
description: Last year, when a teacher confiscated Oreos from a Colorado preschoolers lunch, both The Daily News in New York and USA Today covered the story that set the Internet buzzing. The teachers note, sent home with the preschooler, asserted that Oreos were not healthy  those same Oreos that many of us enjoyed with a glass of milk in the 1970s and 80s.

description: Drama Series:  Game of Thrones (HBO)

title: Hillary Clinton, in Louisiana, Gets a Health Care Challenge From Bobby Jindal
description: Gov. Bobby Jindal, looking for traction in the Republican presidential nomination contest, is welcoming Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday to his home state of Louisiana, where she plans to hold an event stressing the positive effects of President Obamas health care law.

title: When Dinner Proves Divisive: One Strategy, Many Dishes
description: Back when I cooked only to please myself and one or two other consenting adults, choosing recipes was a breeze. Nothing was off limits. Dishes with olives, stinky cheeses, bitter greens and mushrooms  sometimes all of the above  were on regular rotation. Then I began cooking for kids (picky, omnivorous and otherwise). With them came their nut-allergic friends, vegan guitar teachers and chile-fearing in-laws. Forced to adapt my NC-17 cooking style to a G-rated audience, I paged through cookbooks in search of crowd pleasers that proved elusive.

title: A Beneficial Evolutionary Step for Chameleons
description: Chameleons have five digits, but in each hand and foot, these digits are split into two bundles. The arrangement permits them to grasp branches and climb with ease, excellent adaptations for life in the trees. A new study reports that the angle between the bundles in the tree-dwelling species depends on a large number of previously unknown skeletal elements in the wrist and ankle that fuse together as the embryonic chameleon develops. The fusion produces a ball-and-socket joint that chameleons can use to rotate their bodies while reaching for branches. The study appears in the journal BMC Evolutionary Biology.

title: Earth Blamed for Cracks in Moon
description: The moon is shrinking, and Earth is to blame for how the moons crust has cracked.

description: Burberry Prorsums spring 2016 collection.

title: Devoted to Simplicity, Pope Francis Creates Knotty Logistics With Visit
description: In New York, Roman Catholic officials have walked Pope Francis expected path through the National September 11 Memorial and timed it at five to seven minutes.

title: VWs Recall Troubles May Have Little Effect on China, Its Largest Market
description: HONG KONG  China is Volkswagens single-largest market, and the company vies with General Motors as the countrys biggest automaker. But Volkswagens diesel scandal is unlikely to have many repercussions in China.

title: A Magna Carta Exhibition at New-York Historical Society
description: A 1217 version of the Magna Carta, on loan from Hereford Cathedral in England, will be exhibited for the first time at the New-York Historical Society for one week, from Sept. 23 to 30. The show will include the only known surviving copy of the Kings Writ of 1215, the instructions that King John issued at Runnymede to local sheriffs on how to carry out the new charter.

title: Atomic Agency Defends How Iran Collected Evidence at Secret Base
description: TEHRAN  The director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency said Monday that Iran had turned over samples from a suspected site of nuclear experimentation, but confirmed that they had been collected by Iranians under the watchful eye of surveillance devices, rather than by outside nuclear inspectors.

title: Patrizia Tenti Brings a Playful Energy to Milanese Design
description: She might be an architect by trade  but its her nomadic spirit that infuses her talent for making collectible design look like it belongs anywhere.

title: How to Get Burberry Prorsums Lived-In Lipstick Look
description: Shes an honest British girl, whos not worried about what other people think, said the makeup artist Wendy Rowe of the beauty inspiration backstage at Burberrys spring/summer 2016 runway. The clean look  finished at times with a supermatte, gothic lip  complemented the heavily embellished, monochromatic mood of the collection (which by the way was debuted, before the show, on Snapchat).

title: A Gypsy in Milan
description: The architect Patrizia Tenti brings T into her apartment and gallery.

title: Many Messages in the G.M. Settlement
description: One of the biggest product defects in recent American manufacturing history, linked to at least 124 deaths and numerous injuries, was traceable to a mundane automobile part, the ignition switch. For General Motors, the debacle over how it handled that defect scarred the organization as it had to admit to repeated failures in simply identifying the problem that reflected a corporate culture that seemed to prize inaction and deflection.

title: Ice-Pop Molds That Contained Walter Youngbloods Enthusiasm
description: I call it the cut-and-paste apartment, Walter Youngblood, an artist and ice-cream man, said of the fourth-floor walk-up in East Harlem where hes lived for 20 years.

title: 1965: Thant Urges an Inclusive U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Secretary-General U Thant told the UN General Assembly as it opened its 20th session here today [Sept. 21] that the military conflicts in Asia and the disarmament deadlock have reinforced his view that all countries  including Communist China  should be represented at UN headquarters. In his annual report, Mr. Thant declared that the war in Vietnam had cruelly set back the trend toward East-West cooperation and revived the cold war. He added that the international situation has again been disturbed by the conflict between India and Pakistan.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 22, 1965

title: New Poll Offers Hillary Clinton Some Comforting News
description: After months of seeing her polling advantage narrow, Hillary Rodham Clinton has widened her lead against Senator Bernie Sanders, according to a CNN/ORC International poll released on Monday.

title: Tsipras Speaks After Winning Election
description: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece vowed to continue fighting for his country and to form a coalition government after his left-wing Syriza party on Sunday won the third national vote this year.

title: Mets Math: The Six-Game Lead That Really Isnt
description: With 13 games to go in the regular season, the Mets (84-65) hold a shrunken, but still sturdy, six-game lead over the Washington Nationals in the National League East. That would seem safe enough, except for one small problem: The Mets lead is, in some respects, just three games, not six.

title: Who Is Xi Jinping?
description: President Xi Jinping of China arrived in the United States on Tuesday for a state visit at a crucial crossroads in the Sino-American relationship.

title: Details Emergein Massachusetts Baby Doe Case as Couple Are Arraigned
description: BOSTON  For months, a computer-generated image of a toddlers face, with big eyes, long hair and chubby cheeks, appeared on billboards and fliers here and beyond. Her body had been found, clad in black and white leggings, in a trash bag on a rocky beach on Deer Island, along Boston Harbor. But for almost three months, despite an exhaustive search, investigators knew little more than that until last week.

title: 1966 | Pynchons Bleak Survey of Race Relations

title: Facts & Figures: American Republicans May Be Alone on Climate Change
description: A study has found that the Republican Party in the United States lags behind conservative parties worldwide when it comes to accepting the reality of climate change, Tom Jacobs of Pacific Standard reports. The studys author examined the platforms of the top conservative parties in each of nine countries  the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, Germany, Spain, Sweden, Norway, Canada and New Zealand  and found that the Republican Party here was the only one to deny the existence of human-caused climate change.

title: Volkswagens Scandal Similar to One Involving Libor
description: Volkswagen has found itself in a situation not unlike the interest-rate scandal involving Libor.

title: Matzo Fried Chicken Served to Go
description: Become a restaurant known for your matzo-meal fried chicken, and people will want to take some home. So, Richard Kimmel is opening a food shop, Kittys-a-Go-Go, next door to Kittys Canteen, his red-curtained bote that serves the chicken. Jewish food with a Southern drawl is the specialty, inspired by the recipes of Kitty Kimmel, Mr. Kimmels grandmother who worked for a talent agency in New York. Jazz musicians taught her how to cook soul food. Kathy Johannes and Stephanie Teekaram, the chefs at Kittys, now make the chicken, hush kitties (hush puppies filled with pastrami), matzo-ball soup with mustard greens, and biscuits shaped like bagels, which are called bisgels, a name trademarked by Mr. Kimmel, whose business partner is Snoop Dogg: 11 Stanton Street (Chrystie Street), 212-477-7047, kittysagogo.com.

title: Pope Francis Celebrates Mass in Cuba
description: Pope Francis celebrated Mass on Monday in Holguin, Cuba, as part of his trip to North and Central America.

title: A New Design Shop That Aims to Elevate the Smoke-Filled Room
description: Tetra, a new online shop and lifestyle brand dedicated to elevating the aesthetics of the smoking experience, was first dreamed up by three friends at El Matador beach in Los Angeles. The project, launching today, was co-created by Monica Khemsurov, a design curator and writer and cofounder of the Sight Unseen design blog; Su Wu, an arts writer and founder of the inspiration blog Im Revolting; and Eviana Hartman, a style and design writer and founder of the fashion line Bodkin. (All three happen to be regular T contributors, too.) It was born of the realization, Khemsurov explains, that even as a particular form of recreational smoking has rapidly gained mainstream acceptance (cough), there hasnt been a store dedicated to selling beautifully designed objects for smokers.

title: Christopher Kane: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Designs from Christopher Kanes spring 2016 collection.

title: Apple Improves the Watch, Slightly
description: The Apple Watch has been on sale since the spring, and like all Apple products, it has been the subject of intense speculation, criticism, fawning and doomsaying. Expect all of it to accelerate, because on Monday Apple is releasing the first major upgrade of the watchs operating system. The new software had been scheduled for release last week, but Apple postponed the rollout at the last minute because of an unspecified bug. That bug has now been fixed.

title: Pesticides Tied to Childhood Cancers
description: Childhood exposure to indoor insecticides is associated with an increased risk for certain childhood cancers, a new study has found.

title: Young Quarterbacks Produce Rare Win-Win-Win-Win Situation
description: On Nov. 25, 2007, the Cleveland Browns, the Jacksonville Jaguars, the Oakland Raiders and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers all won. They were quarterbacked by Derek Anderson, David Garrard, Daunte Culpepper and Jeff Garcia. Until Sunday, that was the last time those four teams all won in the same week.
