description: Viola Davis, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, the cast of Game of Thrones and others attend the HBO Emmy Awards after-party.

title: An Unexpected Partner Helps Preserve a Manhattan Synagogue
description: The rolldown gate of the Garment Center Congregation has not risen in months, the lights are out, the menorahs and Torahs are gone, the vestibule is full of refuse.

title: In London, Mary Katrantzou Star Gazes and Vivienne Westwood Makes a Political Statement
description: LONDON  Pay no attention to the men behind the curtain!

title: Cant Swallow a Pill? Theres Help for That
description: Ever since she was a child, Karen Quinn has had a terrible time swallowing pills. It doesnt matter if it is a vitamin or an aspirin. The pill inevitably lodges in her throat, and she panics.

title: Evercore Partners Hires Senior Banker From Lazard
description: Evercore Partners has poached yet another senior banker from a rival firm, as the investment bank continues to build its practices.

title: Review: In The Muppets on ABC, Kermit Is in a Mundane Midlife Crisis
description: Last spring, when Paul Lee, the president of ABC Entertainment, announced that the networks new version of the Muppet franchise would be more adult, my inner Statler and Waldorf stirred in the balcony. There are certain things I dont want to know, and where Muppet babies come from is among them.

title: Use Life Hacks to Minimize Bad Decisions
description: A few years ago, a friend of mine who happens to be a really well-known journalist had a conversation with a really well-known academic. Because the conversation was private, Im not mentioning names. But I did want to share one fascinating part of their discussion.

title: Thomas Tait: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Looks from Thomas Taits spring 2016 show.

title: Court Orders Versailles to Cover  Vandalism on Kapoors Work
description: A French court ordered the Palace of Versailles to cover anti-Semitic graffiti from the artist Anish Kapoors installation there this weekend, after a local politician, Fabien Bougl, filed a complaint that Mr. Kapoor and the palace were inciting racial hatred by leaving the vandalism intact.

title: Trumps Minor Fall, Fiorinas Major Lift
description: I didnt have time to comment on the Republican debate last week, but in a way its better to offer an assessment a few days later, since we now have polls that helpconfirm the commentariats basic reaction: It was a great night for Carly Fiorina, a good night for Marco Rubio, a not-so-great night for the Donald, a meh night for most of the pack, and another lost evening for the plummetingScott Walker. And now, a few observations on what it all might mean:

title: Don Henley and Billy Joel, at 92nd Street Y, Trade Stories About a Lifetime of Songwriting
description: Billy Joel first met Don Henley in the early 1970s, when the two men were rising musicians based in Southern California. I opened up for Don at the University of California at Berkeley, Mr. Joel told the crowd Sunday night at the 92nd Street Y. These were the days when the Eagles were all wearing Hawaiian shirts.

title: The Benefits of Allowing Bitcoin to Flourish
Hes Not Slowing Down
description: At the San Diego Senior Olympics on Sunday, Don Pellmann broke five records for men in the 100-and-over age group and tried to become the oldest man to record a height in the pole vault.

title: 100 Years Old. 5 World Records.
description: SAN DIEGO  Don Pellmann had been at the San Diego Mesa College track for less than an hour Sunday morning and had already moved his lawn chair twice to remain in the shade, which was receding fast. By the time Pellmann set his fifth age-group world record, in the early afternoon, the temperature on the track was creeping toward 100, which also happens to be the birthday Pellmann recently celebrated.

title: Condiments as Weapon Against Malnutrition
description: Condiments are becoming weapons in the fight to save malnourished children.

title: Lincoln Center Theater to Offer War by Branden Jacobs-Jenkins
description: War, a family drama by the young playwright Branden Jacobs-Jenkins, will receive a New York premiere next spring as part of the new season at Lincoln Center Theater.

title: An Apology and a Vow to End Burkina Faso Coup
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  With troops converging on the capital on Monday and angry protests in the streets, the general who seized power last week in Burkina Faso apologized to the nation and promised to hand power back to the civilian authorities.

title: Donald Trump Holds Q. and A. in Video Twitter Chat
description: How would you help the homeless? What would you do about student debt? And how good of a quarterback is Joe Flacco?

title: Should You Watch NBCs Blindspot?
description: SERIES: Blindspot, which premieres Monday on NBC. It was created by the writer Martin Gero of The L.A. Complex and produced by Greg Berlanti of Arrow and The Flash fame. (Its a busy fall for the uber producer  his Supergirl lands on CBS next month and the superhero spinoff series Legends of Tomorrow is a midseason premiere.)

title: Michel Faulkner, Harlem Minister, Announces G.O.P. Bid to Unseat Mayor de Blasio
description: With Mayor Bill de Blasios poll numbers in a prolonged slump, Republican leaders have vowed to put up a strong challenger in 2017. But to compete in strongly liberal New York City, Republicans would most likely need either a candidate of some political celebrity to challenge the Democratic mayor, or at least someone with vast personal wealth to spend on a campaign.

title: Prescription Drug Costs Are Rising as a Campaign Issue
description: Both Bernie Sanders and Hillary Rodham Clinton are trying to make the rising cost of prescription drugs an issue in the presidential campaign.

title: Oldest Find of Salmon Remains in North America
description: Salmon fishing in North America dates from the end of the last ice age, a new study reports.

title: Getty Museum and Armenian Church Reach Agreement Over 13th-Century Manuscript
description: The J. Paul Getty Museum, after years of legal wrangling over eight pieces of colorful medieval parchment in its collection, announced on Monday that it has recognized a different rightful owner: the Western Prelacy of the Armenian Apostolic Church of America. The pages, which the illuminator Toros Roslin painted in the 13th century, were somehow separated a century ago from the rest of a religious manuscript, the Zeytun Gospels, which has been preserved at the Matenadaran institute in Armenia.

title: Emmy Awards Audience Drops to New Low
description: This years Emmy Awards were the least-watched in the shows history, drawing just 11.9 million viewers on Sunday night, according to Nielsen.

title: Albert Maysles Will Get a Tribute at the New York Film Festival
description: Albert Maysles, the pioneering documentary filmmaker who died in March, will receive a tribute hosted by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Maysles family, organizers announced Monday.

title: How Much Junk Food Do Teenagers Eat?
description: American teenagers receive 16.9 percent of their calories from fast food, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported last week.

title: Greeces Leader Starts Big Economic Overhaul
description: ATHENS  Alexis Tsipras moved swiftly to form a new Greek government on Monday after his convincing victory in the national election a day earlier, with some officials close to him suggesting that he would create a new ministry solely dedicated to carrying out the tough bailout package he reluctantly agreed to last summer.

title: Kathleen Kane, Pennsylvania Attorney General, Is Suspended From Practicing Law
description: PHILADELPHIA  The ability of Pennsylvanias embattled attorney general to carry out her job was thrown into question Monday as the State Supreme Court issued a temporary suspension of her law license.

title: Big Price Increase for Tuberculosis Drug Is Rescinded
description: A huge overnight price increase for an important tuberculosis drug has been rescinded after the company that acquired the drug gave it back to its previous owner under pressure, it was announced on Monday.

title: Thousands Ricochet Across Europe: Inside the Migrant Crisis
Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The London Design Medals Winners on Their Working Philosophy
description: The British design duo Edward Barber and Jay Osgerby have won this years Panerai London Design Medal. The award, now in its 10th year, is one of the design industrys highest accolades and celebrates excellence in design, plus contribution to the industry and to London. We werent expecting it at all, Barber says. Its not something that you ever anticipate.

title: Ignoring Sexual Abuse in Afghanistan
description: The incidents of sexual assault on children described by American service members who served in Afghanistan are sickening. Boys screaming in the night as Afghan police officers attacked them. Three or four Afghan men found lying on the floor of a room at a military base with children between them, presumably for sex play.

title: More than 100 Killed by Boko Haram Bombings in Nigeria
description: ABUJA, Nigeria  More than 100 people were killed Sunday evening in northern Nigeria in a quick succession of what appeared to be carefully coordinated bombings by Boko Haram, the Islamist extremist group.

title: Readers React to Afghan Allies Sexual Abuse of Boys
description: Again and again, American soldiers discovered that their Afghan counterparts were sexually abusing boys, sometimes on American military bases. But after reporting the crimes, they were told by their superiors to ignore them or punished for taking matters into their own hands.

title: Ben Carsons Comments Stir Anger Among Muslims
description: Emotions in the Muslim community remained roiled on Monday by Ben Carsons assertion that followers of Islam are not fit to serve as president of the United States.

title: The Pop-Up Pope
description: A self-styled joyful band of Catholics took a life-size likeness of Pope Francis to Philadelphia to promote Catholicism and the real pontiffs United States visit.

title: Scott Walker Ends His 2016 Presidential Run
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, whose early glow as a Republican presidential contender was snuffed out with the rise of anti-establishment rivals, announced Monday that he was quitting the race and urged some of his 15 rivals to do the same so the party could unite against the leading candidate, Donald J. Trump.

title: Let the Voters Decide? Nah, Not in the Bronx
description: In one of the sleaziest maneuvers in a notoriously sleazy political world, the Democratic Party cabal in the Bronx is ready to hand-pick the boroughs next district attorney. Normally, that would be an elected position, but the party bigwigs do their best to keep voters in their borough from getting overly involved. As a result, as Dick Dadey of Citizens Union told The Times, Corruption will continue in the Bronx.

title: A Discussion of E.L. Doctorows Homer & Langley
description: The Collyer Brothers, American historys best known hoarders and the subject of E.L. Doctorows 2009 novel, Homer & Langley, lived and died surrounded by more than 120 tons of rubbish and memorabilia in a Harlem brownstone at 128th Street and Fifth Avenue. The site is now empty, a pocket park where New Yorkers might sit and think on the horrors of overeager acquisition.

title: When Radiation Isnt the Real Risk
description: This spring, four years after the nuclear accident at Fukushima, a small group of scientists met in Tokyo to evaluate the deadly aftermath.

title: Should You Watch Foxs Minority Report?
description: SERIES: Minority Report, a crime drama premiering Monday on Fox. It was written and developed by Max Borenstein, who wrote the latest Godzilla movie.

title: The Weeknd Dominates Billboard Chart, and Streaming Is Surging
description: This week on the music charts, the Weeknds Beauty Behind the Madness (XO/Republic) is taking a third victory lap at No. 1, and new industry statistics show that streaming now contributes about one-third of the revenue for the American record business.

title: Not-So-Simple Shapes at Peter Pilotto
description: For spring/summer 2016, Pilotto and Christopher de Vos mixed zigzag lines, circles and triangles with mesh.

title: A Little Floral, a Little Military at Burberry
description: Christopher Baileys spring/summer collection mixed hard-edged pieces with fluid silhouettes.

title: New York Citys Cultural Affairs Commissioner Takes Leave Because of Illness
description: Tom Finkelpearl, the citys Commissioner of Cultural Affairs, will take a leave of absence to treat a health issue, the de Blasio administration announced on Monday. In his absence, Mr. Finkelpearls deputy, Edwin Torres, will serve as acting commissioner.

title: 1 in 4 Women Experience Sex Assault on Campus
description: In four years of college, more than one-fourth of undergraduate women at a large group of leading universities said they had been sexually assaulted by force or when they were incapacitated, according to one of the largest studies of its kind, released Monday.

title: Cori Bargmann Puts Her Mind to How the Brain Works
description: Cornelia Bargmann, a neurobiologist at Rockefeller University in New York, studies how genes interact with neurons to create behavior. Two years ago, President Obama named Dr. Bargmann, who is known as Cori, a co-chairwoman of the advisory commission for the Brain Initiative, which he has described as giving scientists the tools they need to get a dynamic picture of the brain in action.

title: Heidi Julavits at Home
description: In her Morningside Heights apartment, the writer and antiques lover shares some of her favorite secondhand objects.

title: Review: Sex of the Baby, a Tale of Desire and Betrayal
description: In Matthew-Lee Erlbachs farcical Sex of the Baby, boy meets girl at a job interview. Daniel, a sculptor, is screening prospective birth mothers for the child that he and his partner, Michael, want to have. Bekah, a bubbly honey-blond teacher with flawless skin and a sterling rsum, seems ideal.

title: At Home  and on the Hunt for Antiques  With Heidi Julavits
description: The first item that the writer Heidi Julavits bought at a yard sale was a black, rayon dress  in Los Angeles, on a college cross-country road trip. The acquisition, she remembers, felt more than a commodity exchange; in a still unknown city, she says, it felt like purchasing citizenship.

title: Russia Expands Fleet in Syria With Jets That Can Attack Targets on Ground
description: WASHINGTON  Russia has sharply increased the number of combat aircraft at an air base near Latakia, Syria, giving its forces a new ability to strike targets on the ground in the war-stricken country.

title: Bird Flu Vaccine Conditionally Approved, but Still Cant Be Sold
description: A vaccine to help protect the nations chickens from avian influenza after more than 48 million birds died during an outbreak this year has cleared a first hurdle, with the Agriculture Department granting its maker a conditional license.

title: Pretty in Pink Mens Wear
description: Masculine tailoring in the dandiest color.

title: Review: Christopher Houlihan Adds Shine to a Restored Organ at Co-Cathedral of St. Joseph
description: For a Roman Catholic church, an organ is much more than an instrument. It has an almost sacramental power, resounding for godly glory. It sings hymns as another member of the congregation, a part of the community. It breathes new life as its community does.

title: Two Finalists Shine, but Davis Cup Is Still in Need of Polish
description: It is a big week for Davis Cup tennis, and not only because Britain is back in the final for the first time in 37 years and Belgium for the first time in 111 years.

title: Review: Scream Queens Spoofs Horror Spoofs
description: If any of the falls new shows works harder to win us over than Scream Queens, I dont want to hear about it  Im exhausted just from watching Tuesday nights two-hour premiere. The industriousness of this Fox horror spoof is reflected in the game performance of its lead, Emma Roberts, who marches through her role as a sorority-house storm trooper with a slightly grim determination, hunting down laughs that arent always there.

title: Malaysias Leader, Najib Razak, Faces U.S. Corruption Inquiry
description: The embattled prime minister of Malaysia, facing mounting political turmoil and a parade of inquiries at home and abroad into a sovereign wealth fund that he oversees, is now coming under the scrutiny of American investigators as well.

title: Airlines Find Travelers Accept Fees Wrapped Up in Bundles
description: As add-on fees make up a growing percentage of airlines profits, more carriers are introducing bundles of features on top of their base fares  and travelers are embracing them.

title: Timeline of Scott Walkers Presidential Campaign
description: Two months after announcing a presidential bid in which he promised to wreak havoc upon Washington, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is ending his run. After a promising start in Iowa, the Harley-Davidson-riding candidate failed to gain traction nationally with his promises of repealing the Affordable Care Act and taking the fight to unions. As happened with former Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, the first Republican to drop out of a crowded field, Mr. Walker was overshadowed by the emergence of Donald J. Trump, making it difficult for his message to break through the political noise.

title: Robert E. Simon Jr., Who Created a Town, Reston, Va., Dies at 101
description: Robert E. Simon Jr., a New York real estate developer who founded Reston, Va., in the early 1960s as Americas first planned alternative to the postwar suburban sprawl of commuter towns with cookie-cutter houses on look-alike streets, died on Monday at his home in Reston. He was 101.

title: Suspects Arraigned in Baby Doe Case
description: Michael Patrick McCarthy and Rachelle Dee Bond both plead not guilty to charges in the death of  3-year-old Bella Bond, whose body was found on a Boston Harbor shoreline in June.

title: Summer in Salento
description: The slow-paced, isolated villages that make up this region of southern Italy boast a stunning landscape, deep-blue seas and centuries of history.

title: The Ancient Allure of Puglia
description: The slow-paced villages that make up Salento boast a stunning landscape, deep-blue seas, centuries of history  and are blissfully isolated from the 21st century.

title: Review: Paradise of the Pacific, the Hard Truths of Hawaiis History
description: In Susanna Moores fiercely observed early novels My Old Sweetheart, The Whiteness of Bones, and Sleeping Beauties, Hawaii emerges as a damaged paradise  a place of violent, magical beauty, and its own social rules and hierarchies; a land haunted by its past and isolated from the real world beyond the waves.

title: Review: Limitless on CBS Stars Jake McDorman as a Brainiac
description: Limitless, which starts Tuesday night on CBS, traffics in two trends that television has already worked pretty hard: characters with heightened observational powers and shows based on movies. But it manages to feel reasonably fresh anyway, thanks to dashes of cheekiness and of Bradley Cooper.

title: Tatars, Foes of Russia in Crimea, Block Shipments of Food
description: MOSCOW  Crimean Tatars, angered by Russias annexation of the Black Sea peninsula, said Monday that a blockade of food deliveries to Crimea from Ukraine would continue indefinitely.

title: S.E.C. and First Eagle Investment Reach $40 Million Settlement
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said on Monday that it had reached a $40 million settlement with a New York-based investment adviser over charges that it had improperly used mutual fund assets to pay brokerage firms for the marketing and distribution of its funds.

title: Rashaad Newsomes King of Arms Ball
description: The artist brought the third iteration of his King of Arms Ball, a vogueing competition, to Brooklyn last night.

title: When Contemporary Art Meets Ballroom Culture
description: Last night in Bushwick, the artist Rashaad Newsome staged the third annual edition of his King of Arms Ball  a proper Paris Is Burning-style vogueing ball, complete with acrobatic and athletic runway walks, plenty of accessories and exactly one peacock perched atop a contestants head.

title: Mating Penguins Take Over Punta Tombo
description: Over a million Magellanic penguins are expected to arrive on the Argentine peninsula of Punta Tombo for their annual breeding season, and for some, its an opportunity to find a new mate.

title: Wicked Reclaims Its Spot as No. 2 on Broadway, Overtaking Hamilton
description: Wicked reclaimed its spot as the second-highest-grossing show on Broadway last week, passing Hamilton during a generally up week for the commercial theater business.

title: Vatican, in Switch, Will Join Palestine in Flying Flag at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS  In a policy reversal that hints at the delicate diplomacy ahead of the visit by Pope Francis, the Vaticans envoy to the United Nations said on Monday that the flag of the Holy See would be hoisted at the gates here for the first time, just before the pope addresses world leaders.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Splendor and Misery: Images of Prostitution, Captures a Profession in Paris Through Artists Eyes
description: PARIS  A skirt lifted above her ankle. A beauty mark painted on her cheek. A direct gaze. Sitting alone over a drink in a cafe.

title: Pictures of the Day: Cuba and Elsewhere
description: Cuba and More  Pictures of the Day

title: September 21, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Cuba, Croatia, India and Spain.

title: Pope Francis to Find a Church in Upheaval
description: MERCED, Calif.  More than 5,000 parishioners packed the pews, the choir loft and the vestibule on a recent weekend at Sacred Heart Church here in Californias Central Valley for five Masses  four of them in Spanish. Young Hispanic families spilled outside onto the steps, straining to hear the homily over the roar of an elevated freeway across the street.

title: Pope Francis on Abortion and Other Issues
description: A look at where Pope Francis stands on issues of particular importance to Americans.

title: Rembrandt Portraits May Come Home, for Record Price, With Government Help
description: AMSTERDAM  The Dutch government on Monday pledged 80 million euros toward the purchase of a pair of Rembrandt portraits, half of the 160 million ($180.6 million) needed to buy the works from the French businessman ric de Rothschild.

title: Daniel Thompson, Whose Bagel Machine Altered the American Diet, Dies at 94
description: Daniel Thompson, who five decades ago automated the arcane art of bagel making, a development  seen variously as saving grace and sacrilege  that has sent billions of mass-produced bagels raining down on the American heartland, died on Sept. 3 in Rancho Mirage, Calif. He was 94.

title: Newest Immigrants Assimilating as Fast as Previous Ones, Report Says
description: The newest generations of immigrants are assimilating into American society as fast and broadly as the previous ones, with their integration increasing over time across all measurable outcomes, according to a report published on Monday by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine.

title: Partisan Divides In Everything
description: Source.

title: Deadly Car Bombing at Somalias Presidential Palace Is Claimed by Shabab
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  A car loaded with explosives was detonated Monday at the gate of the presidential palace in Mogadishu, killing at least four people and wounding a dozen others, witnesses and officials said.

title: Nutcases and Knut Cases
description: Monetary permahawkery takes two forms. One is obviously ridiculous, but nonetheless has a lot of influence on right-wing politicians. The other can sound serious and judicious, which makes it dangerous, because it might gain real traction with policymakers.

title: Rugby World Cup: Japans Shocking Upset Commands Attention
description: When Japan beat South Africa over the weekend, there was no question that it was the biggest upset at a Rugby World Cup. Rather, the debate was whether it was the most shocking result in rugby history, or even in all of sports.

title: Lessons From Scott Walkers Early Exit
description: Whats so striking about this years huge field of Republican candidates is that so few of them appear to be plausible nominees, broadly acceptable across the party. With Scott Walker now out of the race, the short list of such candidates got even shorter.

title: Scott Walker Drops Out
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin withdrew from the 2016 Republican presidential race on Monday, citing a need to clear the field for a positive conservative message.

title: Surge in Homelessness Tests Wisconsin Capitals Welcoming Spirit
description: MADISON, Wis.  As darkness fell on a humid Wisconsin night, some of the several dozen homeless people who sleep outside City Hall began to unfurl their sleeping bags and settle in. But Nancy Griswold, 49, was restless: She sat on a concrete bench next to a black roller bag full of her belongings and surveyed the scene with the crisp confidence of a docent at the state Capitol, only a block away.

title: France Opens Trade Office in Iran
description: TEHRAN  France opened a trade office in Tehran on Monday, leading the charge of European countries angling for a share of the Iranian market after the July nuclear agreement.

title: In Pelosi, Strong Catholic Faith and Abortion Rights Coexist
description: WASHINGTON  For Representative Nancy Pelosi, Democrat of California, the issue of abortion rights has always been ancillary to her unwavering faith and deep approbation for generations of popes. I actually agree with the pope on more issues than many Catholics who agree with him on one issue, Ms. Pelosi said in an interview in her office at the Capitol last week.

title: Empty Floor at Goldman Puts Change on Display
description: When Goldman Sachs moved into its new tower near the Hudson River in 2009, the sprawling trading desks on the fourth, fifth and sixth floors were some of the most active and lucrative in the world.

title: Brooklyn Cherry Business to Plead Guilty Over Pollution and Marijuana
description: Seven months after its owner committed suicide as investigators closed in on the secret marijuana farm he had kept in the basement of his factory, a company based in Brooklyn will plead guilty on Tuesday to possessing marijuana and illegally dumping acidic wastewater into the sewer system, prosecutors said on Monday.

title: Austria Takes Role of Distribution Center for Germany-Bound Migrants
description: NICKELSDORF, Austria  In the absence of a unified plan by the European Union, consistent national policies or any consensus on the best way to end the worst humanitarian crisis on the Continent since World War II, Austria is stepping up to house thousands of migrants from the Middle East and Asia, fast becoming Europes distribution center of people seeking safety and a better life.

title: Carmen Balcells, Agent to Latin Americas Literary Lions, Dies at 85
description: Carmen Balcells, the formidable literary agent who shepherded a generation of Latin American writers, including Gabriel Garca Mrquez and Mario Vargas Llosa, to international prominence, died on Sunday at her home in Barcelona. She was 85.

title: Pope Lures Exiles Back to Cuba, Where a Lifetime Ago Is Yesterday
description: HAVANA  Gloria Arazoza, her step crimped just a touch by age, walked into what was once Cubas most formidable and ornate yacht club on Saturday afternoon and headed straight for the beach. Suddenly, a lifetime ago felt like yesterday.

title: New Jersey Officer Pleads Not Guilty in Fatal Wrong-Way Crash on Staten Island
description: A New Jersey police officer accused of killing two friends while driving drunk in March pleaded not guilty on Monday in State Supreme Court on Staten Island to charges that included vehicular manslaughter and aggravated vehicular homicide.

title: Discovering Beauty and Solidarity in the American West
description: Lucas Foglia set out to photograph the evolving landscape of the American West and the communities most affected by its changes.

title: At Salvadoran Factory, Helping Troubled Youth Makes Business Sense
description: CIUDAD ARCE, El Salvador  The gang tattoo etched sharply on William Amaya Valladares would bar him from a regular job in much of the country.

title: New York Zoning Plan Requires More Affordable Homes
description: Developers who want to build in certain areas of New York City would be required for the first time to set aside at least 25 percent of their units for lower-income residents under proposed zoning rules officially released Monday by the de Blasio administration.

title: Without Calming Voice, G.O.P. Is Letting Divisive Ones Speak on Muslims
description: WASHINGTON  When Ben Carson said on Sunday that he would not want to see a Muslim elected president, he did not just reignite a volatile conversation about the role of Islam in American life  he also exposed another fissure between many Republican leaders and elements of the partys grass roots.

title: HBO, Longtime Emmy Favorite, Reigns Supreme
description: LOS ANGELES  Hours after the Emmy Awards ended, HBO executives, actors and writers were still busy celebrating the premium cable networks dominance at a sweaty after-party at the Pacific Design Center.

title: James Blake Praises Mayor de Blasio After Meeting on Mistaken Arrest
description: After an hourlong meeting on Monday with Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J. Bratton, the retired tennis star James Blake said that the mayor had been broadly sympathetic to his calls for greater police accountability.

title: Fading Coal Industry in China May Offer Chance to Aid Climate
description: DATONG, China  Across Chinas grimy coal heartland, mines have fallen silent, reduced production or shut down. Miners, owners and officials here wonder whether boom times will return for the black gold that has fed the nations craving for cheap but dirty energy.

title: Clinton Defends Obama Health Law
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton said that she would refuse to let Republican lawmakers start the health care debate all over again by repealing the Affordable Care Act.

title: U.S. Outrage and Resignation Over Afghans Rape of Boys
description: WASHINGTON  A report describing how American forces looked the other way as powerful Afghans raped boys with impunity  an issue that long plagued the war effort in Afghanistan  prompted declarations of outrage in Washington on Monday, but officials said the problem was ultimately for Afghans to solve.

title: Driver Is Found Fatally Shot in His Livery Cab in the Bronx
description: In the modest apartment, a fourth-floor walk-up in the Bronx, the women  well over two dozen of them  lined the walls and sat on the floor. They prayed. They cried. And in a back room, more of them packed in around Kadiatou Jolloh, her face damp with tears, as she lay on a bed, grappling with the loss of her husband.

title: Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago Will Seek to Raise Taxes
description: CHICAGO  For years, ominous warnings about this citys finances have come, one after the next. The pensions were vastly underfunded. Far steeper payments were due soon. Credit ratings were sinking.

title: Apple Presses Ahead With Efforts to Create Car, Though Big Issues Remain
description: Apple is continuing its efforts to create a car, though some of the big questions around the project remain undecided.

title: Georgia: 28-Year Sentence in Tainted Peanut Case
description: The former president of a peanut company was sentenced Monday to 28 years in prison for his role in a salmonella outbreak that killed nine people and sickened more than 700 others. The executive, Stewart Parnell, 61, was sentenced about a year after a Federal District Court jury in Albany convicted him of dozens of counts, including introduction of adulterated food into interstate commerce with intent to defraud or mislead. Prosecutors said Mr. Parnells company, Peanut Corporation of America, repeatedly sold contaminated peanut products and misled customers about test results. They also said the company, which was headquartered in Virginia but also had facilities in Texas and Georgia, sometimes shipped products that Mr. Parnell knew were tainted. The company filed for bankruptcy and no longer operates. The prison term fell far short of the 803 years that Mr. Parnell faced under sentencing guidelines. He plans to appeal his convictions.

title: The Wrath of Volkswagens Drivers
description: Volkswagens stunning admission that it sold diesel-powered cars that intentionally faked emissions testing results has left many of their owners  who thought they were buying fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly vehicles  angry and feeling betrayed.

title: Brian Williams Return Is Part of Revamp at MSNBC
description: Brian Williams was eating dinner in early June at the Bronxville, N.Y., house of his new boss, Andrew Lack, discussing his fate at NBC News.

title: Amid Tumult, Giants Uncover Glimpses of Hope
description: There were not many overarching positive vibes coming from the Giants training complex Monday, the day after a second consecutive late-game collapse dropped the teams record to 0-2. Wide receiver Victor Cruz, who has been sidelined by a calf injury since mid-August, did not practice, making him doubtful for Thursdays game against the Washington Redskins at MetLife Stadium.

title: It Took E.P.A. Pressure to Get VW to Admit Fault
description: Volkswagen executives told environmental regulators for more than a year that discrepancies between pollution tests on its diesel cars and the starkly higher levels out on the road were a technical error, not a deliberate attempt to deceive Washington officials.

title: The Influence of Fiorina at Lucent, in Hindsight
description: As Carly Fiorina has risen in the polls over the last week, there is renewed focus on her controversial tenure as chief executive of Hewlett-Packard. Yet her career at Lucent Technologies has been treated as little more than a footnote. It shouldnt be.

title: Review: Thomas Bradshaws Fulfillment, on One Mans Ceiling, and His Frustrations
description: Being a shock artist like Thomas Bradshaw carries its own exacting burden. The knowing theatergoer attends this prolific playwrights work in a state of anxious anticipation, fearing and hoping to be rattled by some fresh violation of the traditionally taboo.

title: Wild and Wonderful
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  At first, I thought the theme of Victor Barocass and Tom Peppers puzzle was going to be occupations that end in -IST. Since I generally solve from top to bottom, themes like this one hit me in waves, with the final revealer acting like a tidal wave, providing the crucial Aha! moment.

title: Mets Recall How to Win After a Night to Forget
description: Manager Terry Collins walked into the Mets clubhouse late Sunday and found his players sitting quietly at their lockers. The Mets had pulled their ace, Matt Harvey, from the game early, on purpose, as part of a plan to keep him healthy in his first season back after Tommy John surgery. The team fell apart from there and lost by nine runs.

title: Muslim Advocacy Group Wants Carson Out
description: The executive director of the Council on American-Islamic Relations called for Ben Carson to withdraw from the presidential race after saying Muslims are not fit to serve as president.

title: Blue Jays Ace Halts Yankees Momentum
description: TORONTO  When the Toronto Blue Jays acquired David Price just before the nonwaiver trading deadline at the end of July, it raised eyebrows not just around baseball but in the Yankees clubhouse.

title: Pope Francis Visits: Day 3 in Cuba
description: The latest from Pope Francis visit to Cuba and the United States.

title: Philippines: Gunmen Abduct Foreigners
description: Four people  two Canadian men, a Norwegian man and a Filipino woman  were abductedon Mondaynight from a resort on the southern Philippine island of Mindanao, the police saidTuesday. The victims were identified as John Ridsdel and Robert Hall, both of Canada, and Kjartan Sekkingstad of Norway. The identity of the Filipino woman has not yet been confirmed.The four were taken from the Oceanview Resort on Samal island, off the southern coast of Mindanao, about11:40 p.m. Mindanao has been a frequent site of kidnappings and violence between government troops and several rebel groups, including Muslim extremists that have pledged allegiance to the Islamic State. But Mondayskidnapping is the first abduction of foreign tourists in Mindanao in more than two years. In 2012, a Swiss national, Lorenzo Vinciguerra, and Ewold Horn, from the Netherlands, were abducted while bird watching off the coast of Mindanao. Mr. Vinciguerra escaped last December. Mr. Horn is still being held.

title: Egypt Destroying Far More Homes Than Buffer-Zone Plan Called For, Report Says
description: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt announced a sweeping plan last fall to tighten his crackdown on Islamist insurgents in the North Sinai: clearing a half-kilometer buffer zone along the length of the border with the Gaza Strip, to block any weapons or support from coming through tunnels from Hamas militants on the other side. The government said it would demolish 800 homes and displace as many as 10,000 people in the process.

title: Baffling Colts, and Maybe Fans, Jets Go to 2-0
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Maybe, just maybe, this is how the Jets resurgence begins.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | swathe
description: swathe  \swth, swoth, swath\  verb and noun

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 1:35 P.M. (Starz) THE HOLIDAY (2006) A British wedding columnist (Kate Winslet) swaps places with a Los Angeles movie-trailer producer (Cameron Diaz) after guy troubles leave them in a tizzy in this romantic comedy about love  for men, for the movies  directed by Nancy Meyers. There is something touching if willfully nave about Ms. Meyerss nostalgia for Hollywoods golden age, when Louis B. Mayer ruled the very lot on which she shot part of this film, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. An old-studio producer would have recognized that there are several films jammed into this one and maybe called in Ben Hecht for a polish, even as he recognized that Ms. Meyers always has something to give. (Image: Ms. Winslet and Jack Black.)

title: China Formally Arrests U.S. Citizen Accused of Spying
description: BEIJING  An American businesswoman accused of spying has been formally arrested in China shortly before President Xi Jinpings trip to the United States, her husband and a family lawyer said on Tuesday, adding to the brew of disputes that have dulled expectations for the visit.

description: In the late fall of 2009, the photographer Lucas Foglia set out on a rural road in Wyoming and got caught up in the vastness of the land.

title: Pope Francis, the Prince of the Personal
description: One of Pope Francis favorite novels is The Betrothed by Alessandro Manzoni. It is about two lovers whose longing to marry is thwarted by a cowardly and morally mediocre priest and a grasping nobleman. A good simple friar shelters the suffering couple. Then a plague hits the country, reminding everyone of their mortality and vulnerability, and also bringing about a moral reckoning.

title: How the U.S. Can Welcome Refugees
description: THE evidence from Europe in recent weeks is that many citizens are ahead of their governments when it comes to responding to the tide of human misery coming from the Middle East. Soccer clubs in Germany are setting up training academies. Austrians have turned out at railway stations. In Iceland, more than 15,000 people joined the Syria is calling Facebook page, many of whom apparently offered to house a refugee.

title: Industry Can Lead on Climate Change
description: A NUMBER of major companies  from PepsiCo to Walmart to U.P.S.  have recognized that corporations have a responsibility to address the causes of climate change before it is too late.

title: Greek Voters Give Alexis Tsipras Another Go as Prime Minister
description: Eight months after electing a left-wing political outlier, Alexis Tsipras, to reject more austerity, Greek voters have resoundingly re-elected the selfsame Alexis Tsipras, only this time with a mandate to manage austerity. That could prove to be a sage choice.

title: Trump and Fiorinas Snake Oil Sales
description: Business wonk that I am, my favorite moment in last weeks Republican debate came when Carly Fiorina and Donald Trump got into a spat over which of them had the lousier track record as business leaders.

title: Californias Right-to-Die Bill
description: Gov. Jerry Brown of California is hearing plenty from opponents and supporters of a bill state lawmakers passed earlier this month that would allow some terminally ill patients to hasten their death. Modeled after the pioneering right-to-die bill Oregon put into effect in 1997, Californias End of Life Option Act would allow people in the advanced stages of a terminal illness to obtain a lethal dose of painkillers from a physician.

title: Depressed? There's an App for That
Dear Parent, Your Child Has Had a Psychotic Break
description: I sit in my small office at the university counseling center, sighing as I pick up the phone to make the call that I always dread. I have worked as a psychiatrist with college students for 20 years, and this part never gets easier. One, two, three rings, and the mother of a student who had been in my office minutes earlier answers the phone.

title: Bible Belt Atheist
description: In this short documentary, a former Pentecostal preacher starts a secular congregation in the heart of the Bible Belt.

title: Bible Belt Atheist
description: Growing up in Los Angeles and Paris, we both were raised secular and embraced atheism early and easily. Its not that we didnt ponder lifes mysteries; its just that after we reasoned away our religious questions, we stopped worrying about them and moved on. When we learned about the former pastor Jerry DeWitts struggles with being an outed atheist in rural Louisiana, we realized for the first time just how difficult being an atheist can be in some communities, where religion is woven deeply into the social fabric.

title: News Qs | A Bolt From the Past: Don Pellmann, at 100, Is Still Breaking Records
description: Before Reading A Bolt From the Past: Don Pellmann, at 100, Is Still Breaking Records

title: Makeup for the Selfie Generation
description: For years CoverGirl has checked the performance of its foundations in different lighting  in bright sun or under the fluorescent bulbs of an office, for example. Recently, the company added another test for its makeup: the iPhone challenge.

title: Larry Kudlow Weighs Run Against Senator Richard Blumenthal in Connecticut
description: Larry Kudlow, a conservative economist and media personality, has begun preparations for a possible campaign against Senator Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut in 2016, raising the prospect of a costly and high-profile political clash in the heavily Democratic state.

title: Senate Democrats Offer Climate Change Bill Aimed Not at Success Now, but in 2016
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democratic leaders on Tuesday introduced a measure intended to signal their support of President Obamas aggressive climate change agenda to 2016 voters and to the rest of the world.

title: As Others Flee to West, Most Syrian Refugees Remain in Region
description: ZAATARI REFUGEE CAMP, Jordan  Bicycles are the new basics for the worlds largest concentration of Syrians who have fled their countrys bloody civil war. Thousands traverse this camps few paved roads and acres of rocky dirt, souped up with extra seats and milk crates to ferry groceries, bulky fans and small children.

title: Pope Francis, Peoples Pope, Is Security Teams Headache
description: WASHINGTON  As one of the lead Secret Service agents for President Obama on Inauguration Day in 2009, Joseph P. Clancy experienced the difficulty of protecting someone surrounded by throngs of supporters who want to get close to a leader they adore.

title: Should Schools Teach Children How to Cook?
description: A recent Times article suggested five reasons parents should teach their children how to cook. But what if parents arent up to the task? Especially with our current obesity epidemic, should schools teach kids how to cook?

title: 5 Selfie Tips From a Makeup Artist
description: Editors note: this article has been slightly updated to help you put your best selfie (sorry) forward.

title: Back-to-School Outfits on Fashion Students
description: Students at Parsons School of Design, a feeder school for the fashion industry, talk about their looks.

title: Plan on Migrants Strains the Limits of Europes Unity
description: LONDON  After weeks of indecision, the European Union voted on Tuesday to distribute 120,000 asylum seekers among member states, a plan meant to display unity in the face of the largest movement of refugees on the Continent since World War II.

title: What Happened to South African Democracy
description: LONDON  Most first-time visitors to Cape Town are mesmerized by the majesty of Table Mountain, and wowed by the vivacity of the Victorian-era waterfront. As a new visitor myself last month, I was captivated by both. But what has lodged most in my memory is something very different.

title: The Visiting Privilege, by Joy Williams
description: If the human race were ever put on trial  for crimes against the planet, animals and one another  it would be hard to think of a more ferocious prosecutor than Joy Williams. Is there a writer whose condemnations are more convincing, whose vision is more godless and bleak? And in case this all sounds too punishing for you, is there a funnier nihilist in the ranks of American writers?

title: Selfish, by Kim Kardashian West, and More
description: During her reign, Kim Kardashian has proved herself to be a person of towering if brittle self-regard. The brittleness is revealed in the floods of tears that attend even minor affronts to her sense of self: if a family member gently teases her; if she feels in any way misunderstood; if she realizes she may give birth to her third fiancs child before her second divorce is final. But the true nature of her self-regard  river deep and mountain high  is revealed in just about all of her other actions, and particularly in her recently published collection of self-portraits, Selfish.

title: 4 Kidnapped From Resort in Southern Philippines
description: MANILA  A group of 11 men posing as tourists kidnapped four people from a Philippine island resort on Monday, a military spokesman said on Tuesday.

title: Deezer, French Music Streaming Service, Plans I.P.O.
description: Deezer, the French music streaming service, said on Tuesday that it had filed for an initial public offering in a bid to raise funds to take on global rivals like Spotify and Apple.

description: Papal greetings for the masters of the universe.

description: Broadway directors count on weeks of preview performances when a show can be tried out, audience reactions gauged and adjustments made. The opera world permits no such luxury. All you get is a dress rehearsal with a small audience, if any.

title: Microsoft Releases Office 2016, With Features Focused on Teamwork
description: Microsoft is giving one of its most successful products, Office, a big update. Consumers who use the software should get used to seeing more of them.

description: Updated 9:37 a.m.

description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

description: SEOUL, South Korea  The plot sounds like something out of a Korean television drama.

title: Today in Politics: Pope Arrives in a Washington Thats Hoping to Hear Only What It Wants
description: Good Tuesday morning. Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin may have followed former Gov.Rick Perry of Texas off the trail to clear the field, but Washington is gaining both a boldface name and hundreds of thousands of members in his entourage. The pope descends on a Capitol ready for complicated logisticsand full of competing voices claiming his message as their own.

title: Volkswagen Says 11 Million Cars Worldwide Are Affected in Diesel Deception
description: FRANKFURT  A scandal that has battered Volkswagens image in the United States spread to the automakers core market in Europe on Tuesday, when the company said that 11 million of its diesel cars were equipped with software that could be used to cheat on emissions tests. That was more than 20 times the number of cars previously disclosed.

title: 10 Things I Learned About Donald Trump in The Art of the Deal
description: When I wrote about The Art of the Deal for this weekends Times issue of Sunday Business, I couldnt fit all the best nuggets from the book into a single article. So, here are some bonus takeaways from Donald Trumps 1987 best-seller, the book he calls the second best in the world after the Bible.

title: Asian Pantry Essentials
description: The basics of the pan-Asian pantry are condiments and starches: sauces and pastes that amplify flavors and rice and noodles to absorb them.

title: Asian Essentials for Easy Weeknight Meals
description: Soy sauce, fish sauce, miso paste. Dale Talde was making a list. Pantry items you need if you want to cook better during the week. Sambal oelek, he continued, referring to the Indonesian chile sauce. Gochujang, the thick, fermented Korean red-pepper sauce. Shrimp paste, a mash of fermented ground shrimp blended with salt.

description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  West African leaders called on Tuesday evening for the reinstatement of Burkina Fasos interim president, who was overthrown in a coup last week.

description: Josh Earnest, the White House press secretary, said the administration was quite concerned about reports that Volkswagen flouted emissions regulations.
