description: T plucks the best bags right off the runway.

title: Fantasy Football Week 3: Waiver Wire Picks
description: The injuries did not stop in Week 2 of the N.F.L. season. Eddie Lacy exited with a high ankle sprain, Tony Romo fractured his collarbone and important players like Lamar Miller, Carlos Hyde and Davante Adams also left the field early with injuries. With some of these fantasy football starters potentially sidelined, that opens the door for other players to make an impact. Week 2 also proved that all of those overreactions from Week 1 were just that  overreactions. Adrian Peterson totaled nearly 200 all-purpose yards, Odell Beckham Jr. had nearly 150 yards and a touchdown, and Calvin Johnson and A.J. Green returned to pay dirt. Whether your teams record is 2-0 or 0-2, the waiver wire can be a path to fantasy gold.

title: Opposition to Refugee Quotas Softens in Europes Old Communist Bloc
description: WARSAW  When asking European Union members to accept a set quota of refugees was first proposed in May, nearly all of the former communist states of Central and Eastern Europe came out strongly against the idea as an attack on their sovereignty.

title: Drones Capture Migrant Influx to Greece
description: Drones show migrants fleeing in dinghies to the Greek island of Lesbos.

title: A Big Bet That Chinas Currency Will Devalue Further
description: When Mark L. Hart III, a hedge fund investor based in Texas, makes an investment bet, he does it in the style of his home state: big time.

title: 36 Hours in Paris, Right Bank
description: Think Left Bank, and the Latin Quarter and the Eiffel Tower spring to mind. The Right Bank, which is twice the size, has no clear identity. There are, in fact, many Right Banks. There is the Old Regime Right Bank, both monumental and orderly, with some of the citys best-known sites  the Louvre, the Tuileries Gardens and the Palais Royal. There is the intimate, disorderly Marais, and the elegant open spaces of the revolutionary Right Bank (with the Bastille and Place de la Concorde, where Louis XVI, Marie Antoinette and Robespierre were guillotined). And there is the 19th-century financial Right Bank with its grand boulevards, covered arcades and department stores. Meanwhile, Right Bank villages like Montmartre, Passy and Belleville that were added to the city only in 1860 have struggled ever since to hold on to their local identities. Below is a selection of places that will let you discover the Right Banks multiple personalities.

title: Yannick Noah Once Again Answers Frances Call
description: Yannick Noah is back for another run as French Davis Cup captain. It will not be dull. It never is where Noah and tennis are concerned.

title: Jumpsuits, 7 Days a Week at Totokaelos SoHo Store
description: Theres something deplorably corny about referring to a website as a destination. Its like calling an advertisement branded content or referring to a person  any person  as a thought leader. But in the case of Totokaelo, the term actually makes sense. For the last five years or so, the website of this retailer really has provided a vantage point for surveying a certain fashion landscape.

title: The Prime Minister Did What With a Pigs Head?
description: IN Oxford in the 1980s, the covered market in the town center was a warren of small shops, selling everything from antiques to fruit and vegetables. There was an upstairs cafe and a butcher shop that displayed its wares in traditional fashion: Rows of carcasses hung above the entrance and across the front, so that in season it was almost comically festooned with dead game birds. Trays of trotters, liver and other kinds of offal completed the carnivorous tableau, usually arranged artfully around an obscenely grinning pigs head.

title: The Montreal Brothers Behind a Jet Set Leather Brand
description: MONTREAL  This is not a typical city to start a global luxury brand, but then again Want Les Essentiels de La Vie specializes in being atypical, beginning with that mouthful of a name and the companys identical twin founders, Byron and Dexter Peart.

title: Ashraf Ghani, Afghan President, Vows to Crack Down on Abuse of Boys
description: Addressing revulsion at the widespread sexual abuse of boys by powerful Afghan commanders, President Ashraf Ghani pledged on Wednesday that his government would do what it could to stamp out a practice that is pervasive among many wealthy and prominent men in his country.

title: Egypt Buys Two French Warships Originally Built for Russia
description: PARIS  Two French warships originally built for Russia, but not delivered because of the crisis in Ukraine, will be sold to Egypt instead, the French government announced Wednesday.

title: How Brian Regan, Connoisseur of Clean Jokes, Became a Comics Comic
description: Brian Regan is a throwback, and not just because he is one of the last headlining comics who refuse to curse onstage.

title: The Art, Drinks, Roads and Poems that Inspire Julia Holter
description: On paper, one could be forgiven for mistaking the music of the experimental pop singer Julia Holter for a particularly eclectic college syllabus. Over the course of Holters four albums, shes taken inspiration from Euripidess Hippolytus (her album Tragedy) and Frank OHaras Having a Coke With You (her song Moni Mon Ami). On her last album, Loud City Song, Holter filtered contemporary celebrity through the lens of Gigi, a 1958 musical set in turn-of-the-century Paris, based on a novella by Colette. On her new record, Have You in My Wilderness (out Sept. 25 on Domino), however, Holters inspirations are less thematically unified  more free form  than in the past. This record is less identifiable with influences, she says. Its not that I dont use a bit from books or legends or whatever, but each song is different; its not like I had loosely based the album on some kind of narrative.

title: How To | Be Italian
description: From throwing back espresso to making time for mamma, the fashion designer Fausto Puglisi demonstrates how to be Italian.

title: 36 Hours on the Right Bank, Paris
description: The many faces of the Right Bank: classic Parisian restaurants, exquisite museums and grand boulevards.

title: Bar Goto, a New Japanese Bar on the Lower East Side
description: After seven years at the Pegu Club in SoHo, Kenta Goto has branched out on his own, opening an upscale cocktail spot farther east, both literally and figuratively.

title: App Smart | Take Advantage of iOS 9
description: When youve got your shiny new, or at least newly iOS 9-enabled device sitting in your hand, what apps should you load up? Weve got some ideas.

title: Journalists Speak After Release in Egypt
description: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt issued a decree pardoning the journalists Mohamed Fahmy and Baher Mohamed from the Al Jazeera English news network and 100 other people.

title: Find Out What Apples New iPhones and iOS Can Do
description: Apples newest iPhones are hitting store shelves this week. Many millions of older iPhones and iPads are also getting an upgrade, as the latest version of Apples mobile operating system, iOS 9, is now available.

title: The Instantly Gratifying Facial
description: Defining the contours of the face was once as easy as applying a bit of blush. Then bronzer became a (really big) thing. Then the duck face came along  as a not so discreet attempt to create the illusion of concave cheeks in selfies. Ultimately, a cheekbone-defining makeup technique called contouring took YouTube tutorials by storm, followed not too distantly by the Kardashian-approved highlighting method called strobing (on Instagram). Aestheticians and skin care companies get it: We will go to great lengths to mask a puffy face. So recently, theyve taken to toning and depuffing skin  for real.

title: The Daily Shoe: Fay
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Fausto Puglisi: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Puglisi presents his spring 2016 collection.

title: Restoring Public Confidence in Government Isnt Getting Any Easier in Ferguson, Mo.
description: In the tumultuous year after the police shooting of an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Mo., the exploitative court system serving the suburban municipalities that ring St. Louis has faced growing public outrage. The Department of Justice has found that this system abuses the rights of citizens  especially African Americans  in scheming to raise revenue. And a recent tone-deaf response from the courts to calls for reform has only worsened the publics fury.

title: Classical Playlist: Gabrieli, Bach, Distant Voices and More
description: GABRIELI National Brass Ensemble(Oberlin Music)Giovanni Gabrielis writing for brass brilliantly captured Renaissance Venice in all its glittering pomp and elegance. Here, the National Brass Ensemble, made up of some of the countrys finest players, does splendid work with selections from Gabrielis Sacrae Symphoniae in an arrangement by Tim Higgins. John Williamss breathless Music for Brass, a new work with more than a hint of Star Wars steel and sparkle, rounds out the program. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: Adeles New Album Will Be Released in November
description: It has been more than four years since Adele released a new album, but it appears that the wait for a follow-up is finally over, with a new record set to come out in November.

title: Record Label Severs Ties With Embattled Pharmaceutical C.E.O. Martin Shkreli
description: In a bizarre collision between the world of punk music and the pharmaceutical industry, Collect Records, a small Brooklyn label, has decided to sever ties with a silent investor, Martin Shkreli, after an uproar over a drug company he founded.

title: Should You Watch Foxs Rosewood?
description: SERIES: Rosewood, a forensic procedural, premieres Wednesday on Fox. It was created by Todd Harthan, here reworking the mismatched crime-solving duo formula of his previous show, Psych.

title: Donald Trump Quits Fox News (Again) After OReilly Appearance Is Canceled
description: Like many Twitter posts by Donald J. Trump, the one Wednesday morning seemed provocative and unprompted: In less than 140-characters, Mr. Trump said he felt that Fox News had been treating him very unfairly and he had therefore decided that I wont be doing any more Fox shows for the foreseeable future.

title: The Daily Jewel: Alberta Ferretti
description: T plucks the best jewelry right off the runway.

title: When High Holy Days and Fashion Clash
description: On Wednesday afternoon, Gucci opened the Milan womens wear season with a show packed with 1970s-infused looks for spring but an old and troublesome problem: The calendar clash between fashion week and Yom Kippur, the most important and spiritual day in the Jewish year, which began Tuesday at sundown, left a number of boldface editors and retailers missing from the front row.

title: As Liberty Seek Title, Tina Charles Can Now Do More Than Dream

title: Serial Podcast to Take Up Bowe Bergdahl Case
description: The next season of the hugely successful podcast Serial will focus on the case of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, the Army soldier who went missing from his base while deployed in Afghanistan in 2009 and held prisoner by the Taliban, a person familiar with the project said. The season will be co-produced by Page One, the journalistic film company owned by the screenwriter Mark Boal (Zero Dark Thirty) and run by Hugo Lindgren, a former editor of the New York Times Magazine, the person added.

title: China Seeks to Promote the Right Western Philosophy: Marxism
description: In an overgrown, 1950s courtyard at Peking University that will soon be knocked down to make way for a building dedicated to the life and works of Karl Marx, Mr. Guo shared his views on Chinas official ideology.

title: Empire and Cookie Are Back, and Grabbing Fashions Eye
description: On the Wednesday premiere of Empire, Season 2, Cookie, the outsize music mogul played by Taraji P. Henson, is lowered to the stage in a cage at a benefit concert for her jailed husband, Lucious, trussed in a gorilla suit.

title: Where Tiny Houses and Big Dreams Grow
description: BARRYVILLE, N.Y.  Five years ago, Zach Klein, a successful tech entrepreneur then in his late 20s, was living in New York City but dreaming of the wilderness. A former Eagle scout, partner at CollegeHumor, and founder of Vimeo, the elegant online video platform, he was in between ventures, teaching entrepreneurship at the School of Visual Arts and spinning cycles, as he put it, while looking for land to buy  a lot of land  upon which he hoped to spend time building things and reconnecting to the scouting skills of his childhood.

description: For spring/summer 2016, the brand showed ruffled separates and socks worn with sandal-sneaker hybrids.

The text of the homily, which the pope gave in Spanish, was prepared for delivery and released by the Vatican:

title: Coldplay Designs T-Shirts and More Shopping Events and Sales Happening in New York
description: Need a look for the Global Citizens Festival on the Great Lawn in Central Park on Saturday? Two of the concerts headliners, Coldplay and Ed Sheeran, have designed a range of organic cotton T-shirts exclusive to H&M ($9.95) with 25 percent of the proceeds supporting the movement to end extreme poverty. At 1472 Broadway.  On Wednesday, the Swedish outerwear company Fjallraven will open a store in the meatpacking district where youll find functional pieces like the Keb Eco-Shell jacket, a three-layer topper that is windproof and waterproof and can be worn year-round. At 450 West 14th Street.  The socially conscious jewelry brand AUrate New York is having a pop-up starting on Friday. For each piece of jewelry you buy, like a collar necklace in 18-karat gold over sterling silver ($550) and a diamond ear cuff in 18k gold and diamonds ($750), a book will be donated to an economically underprivileged child. At 154 Spring Spring.

title: Pope Francis Gets Ecstatic Reception in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  A city accustomed to power, fame and traffic-stopping motorcades offered an ecstatic reception on Wednesday for Pope Francis, who waved to vast crowds from a special open-sided Jeep and kissed babies carried to him by security personnel.

description: Ian Fisher heads The Timess Investigations Department.

title: Review: Black Spirituals, a Duo That Defies Categories
description: The guitarist Zachary James Watkins and the drummer Marshall Trammell work as an improvising duo called Black Spirituals: a name good enough that maybe its best to just let it resound and say nothing about it.

title: Review: Finale by Thomas Mallon Moves Past Watergate and Into the Reagan Era
description: Thomas Mallons latest historical novel, Finale, picks up effortlessly from his last. And Watergate (2012) is a tough act to follow. Its a shockingly glamorous immersion in the Washington of the Nixon years, with a vast array of characters and a beautifully oblique way of maneuvering them. It makes no difference what knowledge of the Nixon presidency you bring to this marvel of a book. Mr. Mallon has found surprising perspectives from which to look at it and a way of siphoning emphasis away from the turf already trampled by historians. Only its deftly manipulative style keeps Watergate from being mistaken for nonfiction.

description: As top world soccer officials gather in Zurich this week to discuss efforts to clean up corruption in the sport, several of their colleagues continue to sit in a Swiss jail, fighting an increasingly difficult battle against efforts to bring them to court in the United States.

title: Guccis 600 Years of Inspiration
description: Know this: I did not see the Gucci spring 2016 collection on the runway. Because of the clash with Yom Kippur, when the collection appeared on the runway (and was live streamed, for that matter), I was in a different place entirely.

description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Celebrations for Kublai Khans Birthday
description: Mongolia celebrated the 800th birthday of Kublai Khan, the longest ruling Khan of the Mongol empire, with festivities in Ulan Bator on Wednesday.

title: Review: Swan Lake Features an Authoritative Sara Mearns
description: Sara Mearns, leading the first of four casts of Swan Lake and opening New York City Ballets four-week fall season at the David H. Koch Theater on Tuesday, has moved light years beyond the melodramatic clichs with which this ballet is usually saddled. The foolish Black Swan notion of this ballet makes Odette the good, passive victim and Odile the actively evil demon, while Prince Siegfried looks like a moron for thinking one could be the other. Ms. Mearns, however, interpreting the double role with completely authoritative individuality, makes both heroines arrestingly multilayered. Her Odette reveals a capacity for voluptuous passion within doomed captivity; her Odile is extraordinarily cool, enigmatic, even poignant, notwithstanding sweeping brilliance.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: Photos from the United States, Greece, South Korea and Kenya.

title: Review: In The Player on NBC, a Shadowy Crime Game Ensues
description: As if there werent already enough reasons to dislike Las Vegas, along comes The Player, a new action series from NBC with a ludicrous plot full of unlikable characters played by not particularly likable actors.

title: Frocks Every Day to Play Up or Down and More
description: Plus: A cult denim label remembers the 80s; hosiery and bodysuits worthy of Beyonc and for a girlie accent with a punk edge.

title: Viva Sophie Cruz!
description: An amazing image from the papal motorcade in Washington today: A little Latina girl in pigtails and sneakers braves the barricades and the black suits to deliver a hug, a T-shirt and a letter to Pope Francis.

title: Viola Davis Speaks About Her Emmy, Diversity and Women on TV
description: When Viola Davis accepted her Emmy Award for best actress in a drama on Sunday night, she was the first African-American woman to ever do so. Feeling the weight of that moment, Ms. Davis quoted Harriet Tubman (But I cant seem to get there no how. I cant seem to get over that line) and put it plainly to the television industry about the lack of opportunities for black women. You cannot win an Emmy for roles that are simply not there, she said.

title: HBOs Red Hot Emmys Party
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  HBO was on fire Sunday night, and not just because it won 14 Emmys, more than any other network. Fire was the theme of its after-party, held outdoors at the Pacific Design Center, which was appropriate given the sauna-like temperatures.

title: A Designer Strikes Out on Her Own  In Work and, Maybe, in Love
description: Its Hanley now, Nicole Hanley Mellon said of her apparel line, which was founded in 2014 with her husband, Matthew Mellon, and named Hanley Mellon. On a Tuesday night in mid-September, she presented the Spring 2016 Hanley collection, her third, at Hudson Mercantile on West 36th Street.

description: In her series Am I What Youre Looking For?, Endia Beal questions what it means to be a young minority woman in the workplace.

title: Scenes From the Canonization Mass
description: Pope Francis at the canonization ceremony for the Rev. Junpero Serra in Washington.

title: Overview on Methodology for Clean Air Study
description: In our article on the connection between cleaner air and longer lives, we calculated the average increase in life expectancy associated with declines in air pollution for United States metropolitan and micropolitan areas (CBSAs) between 1970 and 2014.

title: Amid Fresh Tension Over Syria, Obama and Putin Seek to Meet
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has decided to meet with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia in New York next week, if it can be arranged, for their first face-to-face encounter in nearly a year as tension rises over the civil war in Syria, American officials said on Wednesday.

title: The Billionaire, the Picassos and a $30 Million Gift to Shame a Middleman
description: MONACO  In what appears at first glance to be a simple, magnanimous act, a Russian billionaire is poised this week to return two Picassos, valued at $30 million, to the artists stepdaughter, who says the works, both portraits of her mother  Jacqueline Roque, Picassos second wife  were stolen from her.

title: Chinas President Confident of Growth
description: President Xi Jinping of China said the country was capable of maintaining a medium to high growth rate in the future.

title: The Soft Bigotry of Ben Carson
description: The Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson said Sunday on NBCs Meet the Press, I would not advocate that we put a Muslim in charge of this nation. I absolutely would not agree with that.

title: Pentagon Says Chinese Pilot Flew Too Close to U.S. Spy Plane
description: WASHINGTON  A Chinese fighter jet performed an unsafe maneuver last week while close to a United States spy plane, Defense Department officials said Wednesday. It is the second time in just over a year that the Pentagon has accused Chinese pilots of inflaming tensions.

title: Review: In a New Work, Camille A. Brown Plays With Empowerment
description: The choreographer Camille A. Brown may be tiny, but her latest dance isnt the least bit diminutive. In Black Girl: Linguistic Play, which opened the Joyce Theaters fall season on a high note Tuesday, Ms. Brown explores black female identity by transporting her dancers and audience to the playground. On a multilevel stage of platforms and mirrors, she uses the games of childhood as a source of empowerment.

title: E.U. Leaders Say Common Ground Reached on Migrant Crisis
description: BRUSSELS  European Union leaders ended an emergency summit meeting on Wednesday saying that they had calmed divisions over a migrant crisis and agreed to increase financial support for displaced Syrians in the Middle East.

title: Memories of Berra Well Up for Yankees Young and Old
description: TORONTO  One day in spring training about a decade ago, the Yankees clubhouse manager, Rob Cucuzza, came across Yogi Berra, who had plopped down in a chair. Cucuzza finally mustered the gumption to ask him a question.

description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, CBS and NFL Network

title: Jeremy P. Tarcher, Publisher of Nonfiction Best Sellers, Dies at 83
description: Jeremy P. Tarcher, who four decades ago founded the publishing house that bears his name, specializing in nonfiction books on health, psychology and New Age spirituality, died on Sunday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 83.

title: Colombia Nearsa Peace Deal With FARC Rebels
description: President Juan Manuel Santos of Colombia and the leader of the countrys largest rebel group said Wednesday that they were close to completing a peace deal to end Latin Americas longest-running guerrilla war, announcing that they had reached breakthroughs on some of the most difficult issues dividing the two sides.

title: De Blasio Hopes Popes Message on Inequality Will Magnify His Own
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio believes he has found the perfect messenger to advance his administrations cause: the head of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Syrian Refugee Tripped in Hungary Fights Unfounded Accusations of Extremist Ties
description: A Syrian refugee who benefitted from the power of social networks this month  when he was tripped by a Hungarian journalist while carrying his young son, prompting an outpouring of sympathy and an offer of employment in Spain  is now facing a darker side of the Internet: the viral spread of unfounded rumors.

title: Tribunal May Be Formed for Malaysia Flight 17 Jet Lost Over Ukraine
description: Blocked by Russia at the United Nations, members seeking criminal accountability for the Malaysian jetliner destroyed in eastern Ukraine last year may create their own prosecution tribunal, Australias foreign minister said Wednesday.

title: Giants-Redskins Preview: Giants Must Get the Ball to Odell Beckham Jr.
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, CBS, NFL Network

title: Canada: Two Men Get Life Sentences in Plot to Derail Train From New York
description: Two men were sentenced Wednesday in Toronto to life in prison for plotting to derail a passenger train traveling from New York to Toronto and other terrorism-related charges. Chiheb Esseghaier, 33, and Raed Jaser, 37, were convicted this year largely on the strength of secret recordings made by an F.B.I. agent who posed as an Egyptian-American real estate developer with radical Islamist views. Mr. Esseghaier, who is from Montreal, had repeatedly said he would not participate in the trial because he recognized only the laws of the Quran. Two psychiatrists concluded that Mr. Esseghaier probably has schizophrenia but differed on whether he was fit to stand trial. But Justice Michael Code of the Ontario Superior Court found that the man was not delusional at the time of the plotting. The judge also rejected Mr. Jasers defense that he had been entrapped and played along with the agent only to get money to feed his drug addiction.

title: Pilgrims Gather in Washington to See Pope Francis Canonize Junpero Serra
description: WASHINGTON  They came in sandals and dress shoes, in shorts and in their Sunday best.

title: Where the Refugees Pour Into Germany, a 24-Hour Window
description: DORTMUND, Germany  The ramps and slopes of the skateboard hall are stacked with thousands of donated garments, all sorted into boxes by type and size. The bowling lanes are dormant. The concerts and dance classes are postponed. Nothing ordinary has been happening at the Dietrich Keuning Haus, a community center behind the main railway station, since Sept. 6.

title: A Link in a Chain of Star Yankees Catchers
description: Yogi Berra, who died on Tuesday at 90, was a part of a tradition of outstanding Yankees catchers, who have done as much as any other players to define the teams greatness over the decades.

title: Discovery of Evidence Bag Adds Twist to Kane Case
description: BUFFALO  A lawyer for the woman who has accused the Chicago Blackhawks star Patrick Kane of rape announced at a news conference Wednesday that a rape-kit evidence bag was left on the doorstep of the accusers mother Tuesday afternoon. But police officials quickly dismissed the claim as untrue, even as it raised new questions about the investigation in the increasingly bizarre case.

title: Moments of Strength and Vulnerability
description: The pope made public appearances and shared private moments among the people and the powerful in Washington.

title: Military Analyst Again Raises Red Flags on Progress in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  As the war in Iraq deteriorated, a senior American intelligence analyst went public in 2005 and criticized President George W. Bushs administration for pushing amateurish and unrealistic plans for the invasion two years before.

title: North Carolina: 3-year-old Thrown Into Pond Dies
description: A 3-year-old girl who was thrown into a pond at an apartment complex by her father late Sunday died on Wednesday, the police in Durham, N.C., said. The girl and two siblings were thrown into the pond by Alan Lassiter, 29, of Raleigh, the police said. The girl and her 5-year-old sister were pulled out alive. Their 7-year-old brother escaped on his own and sought help, the police said. The older girl was released from a hospital. Mr. Lassiter is being held in the Durham County jail on three charges of attempted murder, although one of the counts is expected to be upgraded to murder. He told a 911 dispatcher that he tried to drown his children because the child protection authorities were trying to take them away as he was seeking help for sexual feelings toward children, the police said.

title: Washington State Officers Are Cleared in Shooting
description: Three police officers who fatally shot a rock-throwing Hispanic man in Pasco, Wash., did not violate department policies or procedures in the February encounter, according to the findings of an internal investigation released Wednesday.

title: Player of the Year? Someone With the Initial J.
description: ATLANTA  At the conclusion of this weeks Tour Championship, the nominees for player of the year will be finalized, after which the PGA Tour members have until Oct. 1 to cast their votes for what amounts to the sports Most Valuable Player Award.

title: A Car Scandal Shoves Berlin Off High Ground
description: BERLIN  As Germany has emerged as the dominant actor in Europe, it has lectured Greece and other debtor nations on the virtues of thrift and lately wagged its finger at countries that balk at receiving a share of refugees from the killing fields of Syria. Its right to lead, based on a narrative of self-sacrifice and obedience to rules, was generally acknowledged.

title: As Europe Wrangles Over Migrant Relocation, Reality Moves Faster
description: PIRAEUS, Greece  Amid the rancorous bickering this week by European leaders over a relocation plan to spread asylum seekers around the Continent, a Coast Guard officer stood on the dock here at Greeces main port screaming a blunt command at a throng of rain-soaked new arrivals: Hurry up and relocate yourselves.

title: Xi Jinping Hears Tough Complaints of American Business
description: REDMOND, Wash.  On a day that President Xi Jinping wanted to show off the significance of Chinas huge market to American business, the titans of the American tech industry lined up for a 10-minute photo opportunity with Mr. Xi here at Microsofts campus.

title: New Yorks Transportation Command Prepares for the Papal Disruptions
description: Inside New York Citys bustling traffic command center in Queens, a mosaic of screens fills a long wall, broadcasting dozens of live feeds of vehicles moving about the city. Operators sit at monitors, scrolling through incident reports and updating electronic road signs to alert drivers to accidents.

title: Phil Patton, Design Writer Who Scrutinized the Everyday, Dies at 63
description: Phil Patton, a prolific writer on design and technology who saw the deeper cultural messages in subjects as varied as the interstate highway system, Air Jordan sneakers, tire treads and Mountain Dews Mega Mouth Slam Can, died on Tuesday in Wayne, N.J. He was 63.

title: Homeless on East Harlem Street Feel Unwanted Pressure After Drug Raids
description: About a week ago, 125th Street in East Harlem had been the site of a sprawling homeless population that converged between Park and Lexington Avenues to pass the afternoons, often deep in the haze of cheap drugs.

title: Missouri Governor Jay Nixons Legacy Firmly Linked to Ferguson
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo.  On a recent afternoon at the Missouri Capitol, Gov. Jay Nixon noted that he had 481 days remaining in office. He knew that figure because he keeps a running tally on his event memos, the inevitable conclusion informing every policy decision, adding a sense of urgency to every goal.

title: ThinkProgress to Unionize With Writers Guild of America
description: The news website ThinkProgress said on Wednesday that it would unionize with the Writers Guild of America, East, becoming the latest digital media outlet to organize in recent months seeking better pay and working conditions.

description: Tina Charles told Coach Bill Laimbeer that there would be no minutes restrictions for her in Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals on Wednesday.

title: Los Angeles County Rethinks Deportation of Inmates
description: LOS ANGELES  Federal immigration officials, who had been banished from Los Angeles County jails earlier this year at a time when many cities here were working to protect immigrants from deportation, will be invited back in  with some limits  under a new a policy that will allow them to interview and identify some inmates for deportation.

Collinss theme. If you have not been solving crossword puzzles for a long time, here is your chance to pick up a valuable solving tip.

Johnson, the longtime Bronx district attorney, announced on Friday that he was seeking a judgeship, the move benefited not only Bronx Democratic Party leaders, who can now handpick the boroughs next top prosecutor, but also someone much closer to Mr. Johnson  his wife, Justice Dianne T. Renwick.

title: A New Jersey Township Mourns Yogi Berra, Its Civic Treasure
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  People here are quick to point out that Yogis fork in the road really is a fork in the road: where Edgewood Road splits with Edgewood Terrace, and, as legend has him telling his old friend Joe Garagiola, you take it  and either way ends up at the Berras house on Highland Avenue.

description: TORONTO  When Russell Martin swung and belted a no-doubt-about-it drive into the left-field seats, the baseball was not the only thing to which the Yankees could wave goodbye.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (ABC) GREYS ANATOMY In this season premiere, the doctors confront their pasts while trying to save the lives of two girls who are victims of bullying. Meredith (Ellen Pompeo), meanwhile, adjusts to living with new roommates, and Bailey (Chandra Wilson) fights to become the chief of surgery. In Scandal, at 9, Olivia (Kerry Washington) and Fitz (Tony Goldwyn) revel in their relationship until a royal visit turns tragic. And in How to Get Away With Murder, at 10, Annalise (Viola Davis, fresh off an Emmy win for best lead actress in a drama series) and her students must move on as though nothing has happened in the wake of Rebeccas disappearance. But only Annalise and Frank know that she was murdered, and theyre going to find out who did it. (Image: Ms. Pompeo)

title: Young, Black, Female and Envisioning Corporate Life
description: Endia Beal is a North Carolina-based artist who uses photography and video to explore conversations about race and diversity in the corporate setting. Ms. Beal, 30, received her M.F.A. in photography from Yale Art School and currently works as an associate professor of photography at Winston-Salem State University and as director of the universitys Diggs Gallery. Her most notable portrait series, Can I Touch It, presents white women in corporate attire wearing traditionally black hairstyles. Earlier this year, Ms. Beal was one of 11 photographers to present their work at the National Geographic Photography Seminar.

title: A Modest Step for the Refugees
description: The European Union finally did the very least it could do on Tuesday and voted to distribute 120,000 asylum seekers among member nations. That will relieve some of the pressure on the frontline countries flooded by the unending flow of refugees from the Middle East and North Africa. But the long delay in taking even this modest step, and the bitter resistance of four Central European states, offer a graphic display of the grave threat posed by the crisis to the fundamental principles of the union.

title: The Pope and Clark Gable
description: Watching the nation come to a screeching halt over Pope Francis visit, I had a flashback to my childhood in Cincinnati. One day I saw a picture of then-Pope Pius XII on the front page of the evening paper and I was shocked  Shocked! I had no idea that anybody in Ohio outside my immediate neighborhood knew who he was.

description: We all know that Pope Francis cares deeply for the marginalized, but did you realize that his compassion bridges the species barrier? He suggests that animals will go to heaven and that the Virgin Mary grieves for the sufferings even of mistreated livestock.

title: Review: In The Intern, Shes the Boss, but Hes the Star
description: The director Nancy Meyers doesnt just make movies, she makes the kind of lifestyle fantasies you sink into like eiderdown. Her movies are frothy, playful, homogeneous, routinely maddening and generally pretty irresistible even when theyre not all that good. Her most notable visual signature is the immaculate, luxuriously appointed interiors shes known to fuss over personally  they inevitably feature throw pillows that look as if theyve been arranged with a measuring tape. These interiors are fetishized by moviegoers and Architectural Digest alike, ready-made for Pinterest and comment threads peppered with questions like, Where do I get that hat?

title: After Volkswagen Revelation, Auto Emissions Tests Come Under Global Scrutiny
description: In the United States, automakers conduct their own emissions tests and submit the results to the government. In Europe, automakers pick who conducts the tests and where they are done. And these two regulatory systems are considered the worlds gold standards.

title: Combination Drug May Ease the Agitation of Alzheimers
description: Agitation and aggression are common in Alzheimers patients, and there is no known safe and effective treatment. Now researchers report that a combination drug already in use for treating certain neurological problems may be a better remedy.

title: Craft Breweries Multiply in the Finger Lakes
description: The Finger Lakes in western New York State have long been a top destination for wine lovers, but the region is quickly becoming a haven for beer drinkers as well. It is home to 70 breweries, according to Finger Lakes Beer Trail, a local trade group, up from just 24 in 2011. Twelve more are scheduled to open in the next few months.

title: Is the Bar Too Low to Get Into Law School?
The Supreme Courts Secret Power
description: Stanford, Calif.  ON Monday, the Supreme Court will meet in private to perform one of its most consequential  yet least appreciated  functions: choosing the cases it will hear. The courts nine justices hold regular conferences from late September to late June to perform this task. From the roughly 8,000 petitions that arrive at the court each year, the justices select about 75 cases. If four or more justices vote to take a case, it is added to the docket; otherwise, review is denied. Either way, an explanation for the courts decision is almost never given, nor is it customary to indicate how the individual justices voted.

title: A Husbands Serious Illness Strengthens a Marriage
description: Language, for the Philadelphia playwright Ed Shockley, has always been a saving grace, the funnel through which he poured his intellect and emotion and perspective.

title: Empire and black-ish Show Why Diversity Needs to Be Deep, Not Just Broad
description: Last falls TV diversity revolution, in which several of the broadcast networks best new shows featured minority lead characters, was long overdue. It was also just in time. With racial controversies, especially those involving African-Americans, increasingly making headlines over the past year, it would have been that much more glaring if there were only lily-white TV families to answer back.

The pope can cross off some items from his life list in his first visit to Washington: meeting privately with the president of the United States and riding around the National Mall in the popemobile, for instance. But in his main event, he will try to speak across the widening gap between party lines.

title: Six People Killed in Texas as S.U.V. With Immigrants Wrecks While Fleeing Police

Often, the police say, the immigrants, many of whom have crossed the border illegally, try to make a run for it when the vehicle is stopped.

title: 1940: Sipping Aperitif From a Teacup
description: PARIS (via Berlin)  A bootleg and speakeasy industry that flourished in the United States during the dry era has made its appearance in France with the enforcement of partial prohibition. The new law throws a dry blanket on one of the gayest French customs  the aperitif hour. It fixes the alcoholic content of all drinks classed as aperitifs at not more than 16 per cent. The favourite dodge to get a drink of barred liquor is to enter a bar or cafe where you are known and order an infusion, which is the French word for herb tea. The bootleg drink is then served in a teacup.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 25, 1940

title: Pulling Off Fendis Improperly Placed Eyeliner
description: For Fendis spring/summer 2016 collection  inspired as much by the military as by romance  the makeup artist Peter Philips drafted a look based on notes from Karl Lagerfeld: purity, the sunlit branches of a tree, a runaway Mormon girl. Using Dior Star foundation, he evened the models skin tone and left the face mostly clean  no mascara or lipstick, and just a touch of pink blush  so that a graphic line above the eye, centered between the lashes and the eyebrow, stood out. The effect is especially dramatic when it catches the light, like the tree in Lagerfelds vision.

title: 1965: Russia Proposes Treaty to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.  Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko proposed to the UN General Assembly a draft treaty on the nonproliferation of nuclear weapons. If accepted, the treaty would block plans for a NATO multilateral nuclear force. The Russians rejected a similar treaty put forward by the United States and its allies at the recent unsuccessful session of the 17-nation Geneva disarmament talks. The Western proposal allowed for the formation of an allied multinuclear force that would have included West Germany and other nations that do not have nuclear weapons.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 25, 1965

title: Pilgrim Recounts Stampede Near Mecca
description: An Egyptian woman who was making the Islamic pilgrimage to Mecca described how her husband was killed in a stampede in the nearby town of Mina.

title: White House Says President Obama and Vladimir Putin Will Meet Next Week
description: WASHINGTON  In case anyone had doubt, the White House wanted it known on Thursday that it was President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia who asked to meet with President Obama, not the other way around.

title: Goa Taco Takes Liberties on the Lower East Side
description: Goa Taco serves, in theory, tacos.

title: Fantasy Football Week 3: Rankings and Matchup Analysis
description: Week 2 in the N.F.L. was full of surprises (one of them not being the Giants refusal to win no matter how much the opposing team tries to help).

title: Patter of Hooves Heralds New Season in Tuscany and Sustains a Tradition
description: CHIUSDINO, Italy  As the morning dew faded recently, a group of riders in these Tuscan hills polished their boots and groomed their horses, then swung into the saddle, ready to drive their cows to the nearest pasture.

title: Emilio Pucci: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Looks from Emilio Puccis spring collection.

title: Applying for Financial Aid Is About to Get Easier
description: Choosing a college and applying for aid is complicated  so much so that many smart, low-income students dont make it past the initial hurdles. But last week, the federal government streamlined and simplified the Fafsa (the Free Application for Federal Student Aid), which is the gatekeeper for all federal aid for college, including Pell grants and Stafford loans.

title: Sothebys Sale Includes Rare Early English Books (and Early English Dogs)
description: Early editions of Shakespeare and Christopher Marlowe, the personal copy of the King James Bible from Charles I and the first English book about dogs are among the highlights of a leading collection of rare books to be auctioned at Sothebys in New York in early December.

title: Transgender at the Cancer Clinic
description: I was sitting at my desk in our clinic workroom when my fellow walked in to discuss our new patient, whom he had just seen. I grabbed a pen and piece of paper to take notes and pulled up the patients chart on the computer.

title: How Donald Trump Deals With Insults
description: It is hard to know which is more perversely entertaining  watching Donald Trump try to explain away his continuous stream of childish insults, especially those directed at women, or watching him sputter when someone talks trash about him.

title: Moving Cattle and Connecting to Italys Past
description: The transumanza, a ritual carried out today mostly to keep a tradition alive, helps maintain a link to the land and to the rhythm of Tuscanys seasons.

title: Pope Francis Little Fan Club
description: Pope Francis will meet with a group of children from Our Lady Queen of Angels in East Harlem and three other New York schools.

title: How the Hajj Stampede Unfolded
description: Maps showing where more than 700 people were killed in a stampede near Mecca, Saudi Arabia.

title: Pope Francis Skirts Environmental Tussles in Address to Congress
description: In his address to a joint session of Congress, Pope Francis, speaking quietly and carefully, proved that one need not be stentorian or shrill to be memorable. He also proved that he is as adept at navigating political environments as he was impassioned about defending the global environment in his encyclical.

title: F.D.A. Panel Weighs Complaints on Essure Contraceptive Implant
description: SILVER SPRING, Md.  A panel of experts convened by the Food and Drug Administration excoriated the manufacturer of a contraceptive device for not collecting data that they say could have helped predict risks for women. The device has received thousands of complaints from women who say they were harmed by it.

title: Full Disclosure: Howard and Guy Lawrence on the Making of Caracal
description: The English brother-producers Howard and Guy Lawrence of the pop duo Disclosure, who rose to fame three years ago by teaming up with the singer Sam Smith for the single Latch, return this fall with a new album, Caracal, out tomorrow. Rich with familiar voices, it further cements their reputation as eager and willing collaborators. Here, they reflect on what it was like to record with a few famous friends.

title: That Stinky Cheese Is a Result of Evolutionary Overdrive
description: Like many biologists, Ricardo C. Rodriguez de la Vega searches the world for new species. But while other scientists venture into the depths of the ocean or the heart of the jungle, Dr. Rodriguez de la Vega and his colleagues visit cheese shops.

title: Filming in Mecca
description: Scenes from documentary filmmaker Parvez Sharmas arrival in Mecca, where filming is prohibited.

title: The Redstone Discount at CBS
description: Sumner M. Redstone says he plans to live forever. If that doesnt work out, his media empire will be controlled by a trust.

title: Russian Billionaire Returns Two Picassos
description: PARIS  The Russian billionaire Dmitri Rybolovlev carried out his pledgeThursdayto return two Picasso works to their original owner in a brief appearance in Paris that lasted long enough for the businessman to pose alone in front of the gouache portraits valued at $30 million.

title: Only the Pope Can Redeem This Garden
description: Of all the New York City locations considered for Friday evenings papal Mass, the final choice is divine. No place in this metropolis is more in need of healing and forgiveness  of some kind of grace  than a Midtown coliseum that dares call itself a garden.

title: At Fendi, a Mix of Toughness and Romance
description: Pared-down silhouettes and intricate leatherwork were highlights of the spring/summer 2016 collection.

title: A Gay Muslim Filmmaker Goes Inside the Hajj
description: Arranging to meet the filmmaker Parvez Sharma is a little like setting up an appointment with an extremely polite spy. He asks to rendezvous in a public place  a Starbucks in SoHo where the noise level is high, the tables distant and the volume of customers great. His boundaries are clearly drawn: no discussion of his husband, his friends, his Manhattan neighborhood or his family. He arrives a half-hour early.

title: ThePotential Criminal Consequences for Volkswagen
description: It appears automakers have become the latest source of corporate misconduct after Volkswagen admitted installing software to fool emissions tests.

title: Stephen Karams Plays Treat Anguish as a Laughing Matter
description: The playwright Stephen Karam has short dark hair, bright dark eyes and a wide smile that occasionally overpowers the rest of his face like some sudden, bloodless coup. On a recent morning at a cafe near his Chinatown apartment in New York, he was eating a red pepper and spinach omelet, a brave attempt to add more vegetables to his diet. At 35, he still looks boyish, and when he talks about being a grown-up, it takes a few seconds to realize that he is actually talking about himself.

title: Daily Fantasy Sports and the Hidden Cost of Americas Weird Gambling Laws
description: Sports leagues in the United States, and the networks that broadcast their games, prefer to pretend that everyone watching their games does so for the pure love of competition, the occasional nonchalant reference to the gambling point spread by a football announcer notwithstanding.

title: Empire Draws 16.2 Million Viewers for Season 2 Premiere
description: The Fox hit Empire got off to a strong start on Wednesday with 16.2 million people tuning into its second-season premiere, according to data from Nielsen.

title: Sharing With Thy Restaurant Neighbor
description: At the end of lunch at a nice restaurant, one of the two friends I was dining with noticed that the couple at the next table was leaving behind three-quarters of a yummy-looking dessert. She asked them for it, and they gladly handed it over. I laughed. Our other friend told me later that she was appalled. She said it reflected poorly on us, and was angry that I had laughed. I told her if it had been a nice bottle of wine, I may have asked myself. Whats your opinion?

title: From Divorce, a Fractured Beauty (Updated With Podcast)
description: UPDATED: You can now hear this essay read by the actress Molly Ringwald in Modern Love: The Podcast. Look for the play button below or subscribe on iTunes or Google Play Music.

title: Sviatoslav Richter, Enigmatic Pianist, Playing With Contradictions
description: After Stalins death in 1953, the Soviet Union lifted a bit of the Iron Curtain to allow some major midcareer Russian artists to make debuts in America. Among them were the violinist David Oistrakh and the pianist Emil Gilels, both in 1955. Notably missing was the towering pianist Sviatoslav Richter, an artist of, in the best sense, demonic powers, whose performances combined stunning technique, myriad colorings and fierce integrity. Every time Gilels was lavished with praise by musicians in America, he would offer thanks, then add, Wait until you hear Richter!

title: What Britain Wants From European Union Is Not Clear, France Says
description: LONDON  With a referendum on the horizon on whether to remain in the European Union, Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain has toured the Continent, wooing his counterparts to try to win changes to Britains conditions for membership in the 28-nation bloc.

title: Francis Kurkdjian and Fabien Ducher, Changing History in a Bottle
description: Together, a fragrance legend and a horticultural pioneer have cultivated what could be the first new perfume rose in more than a century.

title: Vladimir Putin Calls Elton John, This Time for Real
description: MOSCOW  This time, the Russians said, it really happened.

title: A Fresh Start for Emilio Pucci
description: Massimo Giorgettis debut collection for the house included sea-creature-themed embroidery and colorful prints.

title: Pope Francis in Washington and New York
description: On Thursday, Pope Francis addressed a joint meeting of Congress and visited the homeless in Washington before traveling to New York and delivering vespers at St. Patricks Cathedral.

title: Hemingway Was a Pack Rat. Heres What His Mementos Reveal.
description: Ernest Hemingway was not only a commanding figure in 20th-century literature, but he was also a pack rat. He saved even his old passports and used bullfight tickets, leaving behind one of the longest paper trails of any author.

title: Fendi and Ferretti Find a New Muse
description: MILAN  Theres a new muse in Milan this season, and shes not a rock star or a movie idol; shes Mother Nature. With an unseasonal storm battering the first day of Fashion Week, and Pope Francis acknowledging the reality of climate change  and counseling action  what could one expect?

title: The Kaaba
description: An excerpt from Parvez Sharmas documentary, A Sinner in Mecca, in which he films the Kaaba, a most sacred site.

title: Pope Francis Remarks at St. Patricks Church in Washington
description: Following is the English translation of Pope Francis remarks at St. Patricks Church on Wednesday. His speech, delivered in Spanish, was prepared for delivery and released by the Vatican:

title: A Cult Streetwear Brand Gets a Sleek Update
description: For most kids growing up in the 1980s and 90s, Stssy was a beloved skater brand  the epitome of California cool. For our generation, Stssy, together with other U.S. brands like Nike, Levis and Champion, was the uniform at a certain age, says Hannes Hogeman, who, along with his brother Simon, runs Trs Bien, a Swedish store that sells mens high fashion and streetwear. This Friday, the retailer will launch the Stssy Trs Bien collection, a special collaboration that offers, in the words of Hannes, a more minimalistic take on street- and sportswear. There are boxy T-shirts, oversize shorts and a coach jacket with the towns Laguna and Malm written on the back (the hometowns of Shawn Stssy and the Hogeman brothers in California and Sweden, respectively). The collection feels like Stssy at heart  it features skater-inspired styles with a tinge of Scandinavian refinement thrown in. The designs came effortlessly, to be honest, Hannes says. It was more about removing details, changing the cuts and adding some fabrics that you may not usually get from Stssy.

title: So Paulo and Rio de Janeiro Are Expected to Ban Uber
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Brazils two largest cities may be on the verge of banning Ubers service, adding to the ride-hailing services growing list of regulatory problems.

title: Motherhood, Screened Off
description: My mothers address book is one of the small visual details of my childhood that I can perfectly conjure, although I am sure no photograph of it exists. Fake-leather-bound, filled with her formal, spidery script, it was, to me, barely legible, with addresses crossed out and replaced with new ones as friends lives shifted. I often was dispatched to grab it for her from a kitchen drawer. I knew when she was looking for someones phone number, which seems unremarkable, except that my own children do not know when I am searching for a phone number, because all they see is me, on my iPhone, intently focused on something mysterious and decidedly not them.

title: Trump's Lawsuit on Net Worth
description: In 2006, Donald Trump sued a writer for libel because he had written that Mr. Trumps net worth was far less than the $4 billion to $6 billion he was claiming back then.

title: House Tour | Vincent Darr
description: Inside the quirky, high-voltage Paris apartment of the prodigious decorator and furniture designer.

title: Caterpillar to Cut Up to 10,000 Jobs, Citing Falling Demand
description: The shock waves from the volatility rocking China and emerging markets worldwide rolled through the American heartland on Thursday as Caterpillar, based in Peoria, Ill., announced plans to cut as many as 10,000 workers, reflecting slumping demand.

title: European Emissions Investigations Urged
description: In the wake of the Volkswagen emissions cheating scandal, Lucia Caudet, a European Commission spokeswoman, encouraged member states on Thursday to investigate so-called defeat devices.

title: Cosby Seeks to Keep Private a Deposition; Fordham Withdraws His Honorary Degree
description: Bill Cosby is seeking to keep private his scheduled questioning under oath in a case involving accusations that he sexually assaulted a young woman when she was 15.

description: SERIES: The Player, which premieres Thursday on NBC, was created by John Rogers, who previously created the TNT shows The Librarians and Leverage.

title: N.F.L. Week 3 Previews and Picks
description: Its N.F.L. Week 3, and there are some intriguing matchups on the board. Heres a look at who to watch:

title: Threes a Trend: Crochet Dresses
description: Theres no denying cutouts are shaping up to have another moment come spring 2016. But were curious to see if the new wave of holey fabric  crochet knits that leave little to the imagination  makes its way from the runway to the street.

title: Across Political Divide, Finding Much to Cheer in Popes Speech
description: WASHINGTON  After his emotive address to Congress, Pope Francis headed to the West Front of the Capitol and delivered a greeting that flowed easily from his lips and could be heard and understood by nearly all.

title: Pope Francis at St. Patricks Church
description: Pope Francis addressed the problem of homelessness and stressed the importance of charity at St. Patricks Church in Washington on Thursday.

title: Popes Full Speech to Congress
description: Speaking to a joint meeting of Congress on Thursday, Pope Francis urged compassion for the poor and for immigrants.

title: Donald Trump and Roger Ailes to Meet to Discuss Differences of Opinion
description: The Trump feud with Fox News has entered its dj vu phase.

title: America Is Still Great, and Immigration Is Still Why
description: Of all the falsehoods fouling the public discourse these days, one of the worst is that immigrants are a threat and a burden to the United States.

title: Heroes Reborn: 6 Characters to Remember Before Watching
description: The NBC series Heroes, which aired from 2006-2010, was about a group of characters who slowly come to the realization that they have superpowers. A ratings hit in its first season, the show became increasingly complicated and soon lost its luster. Five years later, the network is premiering a sequel series, titled Heroes Reborn. While its possible to watch the series without having ever seen any episodes from its forerunner, Heroes Reborn assumes that viewers have some familiarity with a number of characters and concepts. Get up to speed by reading this before watching the shows Thursday night premiere:

title: St.-Joseph: The Next Best Wine in the Northern Rhne
description: Some of the worlds greatest wines come from the northern Rhne Valley of France, from appellations like Cte-Rtie, Hermitage and Cornas. These are wines that tell stories of devotion and arduous labor, and of the intimate human relationship over 2,000 years with grapevines and precipitous rocky hillsides, all brought to life with an almost savage expressiveness by the syrah grape.

title: Prada: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Designs from Pradas spring collection.

title: Out of Jail, Still Not Free
description: For Ashley Diamond, imprisonment was traumatic, and her parole plan mandates a return to the conservative Southern hometown where she had repeatedly tangled with the law.

title: Yohimbe Supplement Labels Lack Accurate Information
description: People who use the herbal supplement yohimbe may be getting more, or less, than they bargain for.

title: Pope Francis and the Not-Quite-Secular West
description: About fiveyears ago, after Pope Benedict XVI paid a surprisingly successful visit to not-famously-Catholic England, I wrote a column on the phenomenon of papal visits and why, even in a secularized and dissenting Western atmosphere, they tend to turn out well:

title: The Wild World of Vincent Darr
description: Welcome to the decorator and furniture designers Paris home, where Sputnik chandeliers meet brass grasshoppers, Cubism sits next to Cocteau-ism, and the party never ends.

title: Ashley Diamond, Transgender Inmate, Is Out of Prison but Far From Free
description: ROME, Ga.  Right before her unexpected release from prison, Ashley Diamond, a nonviolent offender who had sued Georgia corrections officials for failing to provide her medical treatment and safekeeping, was locked down for 30 days in a windowless single cell. It was dimly lit and eerily silent, and reeked of excrement.

title: A Look Back at the Smog
description: It has been 45 years since a crucial amendment strengthening the Clean Air Act. Its surprising to realize just how smoggy many cities were.

title: VW Emissions Scandal: Cheating and Outrage
description: To the Editor:

title: The Connection Between Cleaner Air and Longer Lives
description: Back in 1970, Los Angeles was known as the smog capital of the world  a notorious example of industrialization largely unfettered by regard for health or the environment. Heavy pollution drove up respiratory and heart problems and shortened lives.

title: On the Road With F.C. Kansas City
description: People have no idea. They hear professional athlete and think private jets, million-dollar salaries, five-star hotels and the kind of glamour that is simply not the reality for most of us. While we would love one day to attain these fancy perks as a part of our job in the National Womens Soccer League, for the moment we are firmly rooted in what we do have.

title: Taking the Gloves Off, Marco Rubio Punches Back at Donald Trump
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida has done his best to stay above the fray while his Republican rivals attack one another on policy, character and even appearance.

title: Heroes Reborn: Should You Watch It?
description: SERIES: Heroes Reborn, a 13-episode series that premieres Thursday on NBC, is a sequel to Heroes, which ran on the network from 2006 to 2010. It was created by Tim Kring, who also conceived the original.

title: Design Shopping in Milan With Jil Sanders Rodolfo Paglialunga
description: The brands creative director sets out for a day of perusing contemporary and vintage furniture in his hometown.

title: Order Denying Motion to Dismiss Ashley Diamonds Case
description: A federal judge wrote a 57-page order denying the officials motions to dismiss Ashley Diamonds case.

title: Design Shopping With Jil Sanders Creative Director in Milan
description: In the days before the Jil Sander spring/summer runway show, the brands creative director, Rodolfo Paglialunga, found himself with some rare free time. Samples for the collection had been approved, final styles were still in transit  so he decided to escape fashion and spend an afternoon of shopping Milans trove of design stores.

title: Volkswagen Expected to Name C.E.O. as Pressure Mounts on Company
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen is expected to name a new chief executive on Friday to replace Martin Winterkorn, who resigned on Wednesday in the face of a widening emissions scandal that has engulfed the automaker.

title: Readers Turn: Painting With Trump
description: When the head of Donald Trump is your paintbrush, anything is possible.

title: Republican Super PACs Turn to TV Ads for High-Stakes Primaries
description: DES MOINES  The cavalry arrived too late for Gov. Scott Walker, but other candidates struggling in the shadow of Donald J. Trump hope their own backup  in the form of super PACs flush with money for television commercials  will soon be riding to their rescue.

title: The Daily Shoe: Fendi
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: The Art Insiders Guide to Stockholm
description: Stockholm, and what is typically Swedish, is changing, says Saskia Neuman, a native of the city thats lately seemed to churn out even more cultural heavyweights than it does tall, beautiful people. Before her days as Absoluts global art manager, Neuman lived in London, Venice and Berlin  adding to her rsum stints as Hans Ulrich Obrists Girl Friday and Daniel Birnbaums exhibition coordinator for his Venice Biennale run  only to return home, where shes now responsible for scouting worthy talent for the vodka labels own art award. (This years winners, Frances Stark for artwork and Mark Godfrey for art writing, were feted this week.)

title: In a New Group Show, Artists Look to the Sky
description: Since space exploration has only existed for some 60 years, any artist working before 1950 would be unfamiliar with the visual vocabulary of rockets, shuttles and astronauts. So it follows that Space Age, the latest group show at Galerie Thaddaeus Ropac in Pantin, northeast of central Paris, is resolutely contemporary. The shows 30 works, some newly commissioned, span five decades and offer a vast range of depictions, from a standing diptych by Robert Longo in which the Russian astronaut Valentina Tereshkova (the first woman in space) faces a starry abyss, to a duo of James Rosenquist canvases covered in galactic brightly colored geometries. The newer of his fractal works features a rotating mirror bordered with the words an intrinsic existence: selfie or self-reflection, take your pick. Whereas Not Vitals stainless steel moon sucks viewers into its cratered, spherical surface, Lee Bull engulfs her suspended debris in fog.

title: The Daily Bag: Brunello Cucinelli
description: T plucks the best bags right off the runway.

title: Space Age at Galerie Thaddaeus Ropac Pantin
description: A new group show collects 30 works, some newly commissioned, on the topic spanning five decades.

title: The Daily Jewel: Prada
description: T plucks the best jewelry right off the runway.

title: Skills and Strategies | Doodling, Sketching and Mind Mapping as Learning Tools
description: The broad concept of drawing to learn is gaining respect and popularity from classrooms to boardrooms.

title: Twisted Updos and Flowing Locks for Our Spring and Summer Brides
description: The brides featured in the announcements this wedding season chose a chic or relaxed hairstyle in which to say I do.

title: Pope Francis Challenge to America
description: Pope Francis could not have had a more divided and needy audience than Congress to hear his creative, blunt demand to confront the problems of the nation and the world that Congress has made a political art of evading.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | 99 Homes
description: Ramin Bahrani narrates a sequence from 99 Homes featuring Andrew Garfield, Michael Shannon and Laura Dern.

title: Problems at Volkswagen Start in the Boardroom
description: There is a long tradition of scandal and skulduggery in the auto industry, but few schemes appear as premeditated as Volkswagens brazen move to use sophisticated software to circumvent United States emissions standards.

title: 99 Homes (With Movie Trailer): Ramin Bahrani Narrates a Scene
description: The pain and anger generated by the financial crisis is the basis for 99 Homes, a film from Ramin Bahrani that turns the aftermath of the housing collapse into a high-stakes thriller.

title: Review: Martha Armstrongs Nature Scenes at Bowery Gallery
description: Painting from nature is nearly as old as the hills. For years, Alex Katz was the most prominent keeper of its flame, but other devotees have lately come into clearer view  Mr. Katzs contemporary, the great Lois Dodd, for one. In addition, younger painters like Maureen Gallace and the even younger Daniel Heidkamp and Aliza Nisenbaum have wholeheartedly or partly followed suit. Painting from various forms of life has become a thing  as they say  in the hipper reaches of the contemporary art world.

title: Review: In Early Soviet Photography, Early Soviet Film, Artists Edit Reality to Fit an Ideal
description: Revolutions sell utopias; thats their job. Art, if it behaves itself and sticks to the right script, can be an important part of the promotional package. This is the basic tale told by The Power of Pictures: Early Soviet Photography, Early Soviet Film at the Jewish Museum, but with a question added: What happens to art and its makers when the script is drastically revised?

title: Arriving in Manhattan, Pope Tells Clergy to Serve Humbly
description: In his first visit to New York City, the center of global finance and capitalism, Pope Francis used his remarks on Thursday evening to encourage the hundreds of clergy members, brothers and nuns gathered in St. Patricks Cathedral to live humbly and resist the temptation to treat their ministries as businesses, with success measured strictly by the bottom line.

title: In 99 Homes, a Man Buffeted and Then Manipulated in Floridas Foreclosure Disaster
description: Dont get emotional about real estate. That bit of wisdom  among the mantras shared by a predatory broker named Rick Carver  is both upheld and defied by 99 Homes, Ramin Bahranis stunningly effective melodrama of flipped houses and mortgaged souls. While the film hardly endorses Ricks coldblooded, dog-eat-dog view of the world, it is too cleareyed to oppose his ruthlessness with soft, easy appeals to sentiment. The foreclosed properties Rick acquires and resells may be repositories of hopes, dreams and family memories, but theyre also economic units, boxes to be emptied out, refilled and written down on a balance sheet. Thats a fact of life, and also a tragic contradiction.

title: Yale Endowment Returns 11.5%, Eclipsing Harvards 5.8%
description: Yale University reported on Thursday that its endowment generated a healthy 11.5 percent return for its most recent fiscal year, bringing its value to $25.6 billion.

title: Model-Morphosis: Angel Rutledge at Emilio Pucci
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in Milan.

title: Mecca Stampede Shows How Crowds, Usually Calm in Crisis, Can Panic
description: Contrary to common portrayals of the madding crowd, people caught in an unfolding catastrophe usually summon their best selves, keep cool heads and look out for those around them, according to decades of research into crowd reactions during earthquakes, fires, floods, bombings and other threats.

title: Letters: Between the World and Me
description: To the Editor:

title: Moschino: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Jeremy Scott presents Moschinos spring collection.

title: Janet Yellen Says Fed Is Likely to Raise Interest Rates This Year
description: The Federal Reserve still intends to raise its benchmark interest rate this year, barring unpleasant surprises, the Fed chairwoman, Janet L. Yellen, said on Thursday.

description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

description: CADIZ, Calif.  Gazing out of a turboprop high above his companys main asset  34,000 acres in the Mojave Desert with billions of gallons of fresh water locked deep below the sagebrush-dotted land  Scott Slater paints a lush picture that has enticed a hardy band of investors for a quarter-century.

Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Students Prepare for a Special Visitor: Pope Francis
description: Essa Nahshal is a 7-year-old from Harlem with a neatly combed side part and a Pokemon obsession, but this week video games have to compete for his attention with an unlikely visitor: the pope.
