description: To the Editor:

title: Aspirational Couture
description: Maison Kitsun, in the NoMad section of Manhattan, steeps itself in preppy fashions with French and Japanese influences.

title: Browsing to the Beat at Maison Kitsun
description: Maison Kitsun does not merely hang its clothes on pedestrian racks. Rather, its latest collection is carefully arranged on sparely populated rails. The boutique (1170 Broadway, at 28th Street) is an oasis of moneyed calm in a bustling and quickly gentrifying neighborhood, and its offerings manage to be eclectic, youthful and sporty, while at the same time intimidatingly priced pieces of high fashion.

title: Ukraine to Ban Flights by Major Russian Airlines
description: Ukraine will ban major Russian airlines including Aeroflot, the Russian national airline, from flying to its airports starting next month as part of a broad set of trade sanctions imposed on Russia for supporting a separatist revolt in Ukraine.

title: Kim Davis Joining G.O.P.
description: Kim Davis, the county clerk in Kentucky who was jailed for refusing to issue marriage licenses to gay couples, said on Friday that she and her family have switched to the Republican Party.

title: A Day for an Ecology-Minded Pope and Sustainable Development Goals
description: So a few things happened today, not including House Speaker John Boehner announcing he was stepping down and Volkswagen and the Environmental Protection Agency trying to bolster pollution controls.

title: Sweet Smell of Not Today: Press Agents Wait Out This Pope Thing
description: Pope Francis has brought joy to thousands of New Yorkers with his easy grace and common touch.

title: Football, Cheerleading and Hometown Glory
description: After seeing the film Bring It On, the photographer Brian Finke began a project on cheerleading and football, two historically related, but increasingly independent, competitive sports.

title: Wolfgang Tillmans Takes Pictures of Modern Life, Backlit by the Past
description: The photographer Wolfgang Tillmans is a material guy. He has always embraced the physicality of photos. As a boy in Remscheid, a small city in western Germany, he photocopied printed images and bought his first camera so he could obtain more material for the copy machine. Achieving prominence in the early 1990s, when his pictures of Hamburg night life were published in i-D, a British periodical known for its cutting-edge design, he prized his work not as it existed in its original form but as it appeared laid out in the magazine.

title: Prosecutors Struggling to Keep Up With Cases of Violence From Rikers
description: Already struggling to contain surging violence at Rikers Island, New York City officials are now facing further hurdles as they try to prosecute the inmates they say are responsible for it.

title: Kevin McCarthy Expected to Seek Speaker John Boehners Post in House
description: WASHINGTON  When John A. Boehner announced his retirement on Friday, speculation about who would succeed him as speaker immediately centered on the No. 2 House Republican: Kevin McCarthy, a 50-year-old Californian who has had a rapid rise through the party ranks.

title: Patricia Hoffbauer Takes Dance in a Wry, Irreverent Direction
description: Dancing about making dances is nothing new, but Patricia Hoffbauers approach may be singular. In Dances for Intimate Spaces and Friendly People, 14 dancers from many backgrounds and generations take over the studios at Gibney Dances Lower Manhattan outpost, including the postmodern luminaries Yvonne Rainer and Sara Rudner. Isolated duets, trios and quartets, converging at the end, carry the audience from space to space, while a video exhibition in the lobby documents the process of the works creation.

title: Stromae, a European Star With French Songs, Aims for U.S. Acclaim
description: Can a European superstar conquer Madison Square Garden?

title: Truce Struck in 2 Areas of Syria
description: ISTANBUL  In one of the most ambitious deals yet struck between combatants in the multisided war in Syria, supporters and opponents of President Bashar al-Assad will essentially trade territory in two different parts of the country, stop bombing and besieging one anothers civilians and pledge to observe a six-month cease-fire.

title: Harlem Kids Thrilled After Meeting Pope
description: New York City students said that meeting the pope on Friday was a life-changing experience.

title: National Sawdust, a New-Music Space, Opens in Brooklyn
description: An experimental venture could bring a jolt to the new-music scene in New York: the opening of National Sawdust, a nonprofit performance space and recording facility in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The buildings intimate, adaptable main hall has been built from the shell of an old sawdust factory. The goal is to foster the creation of original works. It opens on Thursday, Oct. 1, with a program titled Discover the Space Vol. 1 and Vol. 2, (nationalsawdust.org).

title: Francisco Oller Exhibition Explores Impressionism and the Caribbean
description: In the 19th century, Modernism traveled the world, and one of the places it flourished was in Puerto Rico, where the painter Francisco Oller was born in 1833. He had his initial art training in San Juan, then went abroad for further study in Spain and France. In Paris, he fell in with avant-garde artists who favored Courbet-inspired realism and a brand-new style, Impressionism. He painted side by side with Claude Monet and introduced Camille Pissarro, another Caribbean native, to Paul Czanne. Unlike Pissarro, though, Oller didnt stay in Europe. He returned to Puerto Rico, then still a Spanish colony, and made life there the theme of his art in landscape paintings of sugar plantations and still-lifes of tropical fruit.

title: Costa Rica to Shield Sea Turtles
description: Two weeks after an onslaught of tourists disrupted thousands of olive ridley sea turtles nesting on a Costa Rican beach, the turtles have arrived again to lay their eggs. Absent this time were the selfie-taking tourists who had wandered among them, causing international outrage on social media and leading to stricter security measures.

title: Pope Francis Visits: Day 7
description: The pope toured Manhattan beginning with an address at the the United Nations General Assembly and ending with an evening mass at Madison Square Garden.

title: A Solution for Puerto Rico
description: To the Editor:

title: Immigration Advocates in Philadelphia See Affirmation in Popes Visit
description: PHILADELPHIA  Immigration weighs heavily on the parishioners of Old St. Josephs Church, a centuries-old Jesuit parish that spread Catholicism through colonial America and now flies a Welcome Pope Francis banner over its gate.

title: Refugee Crisis in Syria Raises Fears in South Carolina
description: DUNCAN, S.C.  The worried citizens gathered in the high school cafeteria, about 200 strong. Patriotic songs played on the stereo, a man in a blue blazer from the John Birch Society hovered by a well-stocked literature table, and Lauren L. Martel, a lawyer from Hilton Head, told the crowd that 25 Syrian refugees were already living among them.

title: Governor Cuomo and Ral Castro of Cuba Meet
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York, seeking to expand the states relationship with Cuba, met on Friday with its president, Ral Castro, for the first time, the governors office said.

title: In a Void Created by Religious Violence, Pope Francis Shares Prayers for Peace
description: Pope Francis stood flanked by an imam in a skullcap and a rabbi in a prayer shawl on what amounts to hallowed ground: an underground chamber where the victims of the attacks on the World Trade Center are memorialized.

title: California Board Backs New Limits on Carbon From Gas and Diesel
description: LOS ANGELES  California air regulators on Friday approved a substantial cut to carbon pollution from gasoline and diesel fuels, a move that will force oil producers to reduce the amount of carbon generated by all transportation fuels in the state at least 10 percent by 2020.

title: Evening Hours | Celebrating Music at Lincoln Center
description: The New York Philharmonic and the Metropolitan Opera has season-opening parties.

title: Nigeria: Polio Contained, W.H.O. Says
description: Polio is no longer endemic in Nigeria, which means that it has conquered the disease, the World Health Organization declared Friday. Polio remains endemic in just two countries, Pakistan and Afghanistan, which have never eliminated the virus. As of last month, all of Africa had gone a full year without a case of polio paralysis. The last case anywhere in Africa was detected in Somalia on Aug. 11, 2014; it was caused by a strain of the virus that had originated in Nigeria. The last case in Nigeria was recorded on July 24, 2014. Despite Fridays announcement, Nigeria cannot be declared polio free until two more years have passed with no paralysis cases and no virus detected in sewage. As recently as 2012, Nigeria accounted for more than half of all the worlds polio cases.

title: String of Emails Raises Questions About When Hillary Clinton Began Using Personal Account
description: WASHINGTON  A string of emails that has been provided to the State Department raises new questions about whether Hillary Rodham Clinton has accurately described her use of a personal account when she was secretary of state.

title: John McNeill, Priest Who Pushed Catholic Church to Welcome Gays, Dies at 90
description: The Rev. John McNeill, an openly gay Roman Catholic priest who, from the 1970s onward, publicly pressed the church to welcome gay men and lesbians  and who was expelled from his order as a result  died on Tuesday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 90.

title: No. 1 Ranking Remains a Slippery Spot for Day, Spieth and McIlroy
description: ATLANTA  Jason Day followed Rory McIlroy to the interview room Wednesday at the Tour Championship and, after taking his seat, smiled and slyly observed, Rory warmed the seat for me. Days playful aside summed up the variability at the top in mens golf.

title: Eric Cantor: The G.O.P., After John Boehner
description: Richmond, Va.  LIKE so many others, I was stunned by Speaker John A. Boehners announcement on Friday that he would step down at the end of October. For nearly six years  first as Republican whip and then as majority leader  I met with John on a daily, sometimes hourly, basis as we worked to lead the House Republican Conference. It is no secret that we had different styles and personalities, but he was always selfless, a man who put the nation, his constituents, the House of Representatives and the party before himself.

title: A Day Laborer, on His Way to See Pope Francis
description: This week brought Pope Francis to the South Lawn of the White House, where he spoke to a crowd of thousands and greeted President Obama. It brought Juan Tapia to a house outside Yonkers, where he spent days painting the living room blue  the color of the sky today, he said on Thursday.

title: Bill Cunningham | New York Fashion Week
description: Here, five of the outstanding collections and settings.

title: Bill Cunningham | New York Fashion Week
description: The New York Fashion Week of spring 2016 designs has spoken. Here, five of the outstanding collections and settings. Held on the anniversary of 9/11 with the Financial District as a backdrop, Riccardo Tiscis Givenchy show was reverential of the day. Here are the other shows.

title: State Dinner for Xi Jinping Has High-Tech Flavor
description: WASHINGTON  In a reflection of just how important Washingtons relationship with Beijing has become, President Obama on Friday held his second state dinner for China, the only country to receive such a double honor from him.

title: Donald Trump Sees in Marco Rubio a New Rival to Taunt, but Gets Plenty of Salvos in Return
description: WASHINGTON  After training his fire for much of the summer on former Gov. Jeb Bush, Donald J. Trump has found a new favorite Republican rival to taunt: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida.

title: Finding Common Ground With China
description: Despite growing strains between their countries, President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China made progress on two key issues during their meeting on Friday, offering some reassurance that they may be able to manage the challenges ahead.

title: Limiting Security Breaches May Be Impossible Task for U.S. and China
description: WASHINGTON  When the United States and the Soviet Union made their first tentative steps toward limiting nuclear arms more than 50 years ago, distrust was sky high but they could, at least, count each others missiles and bombers and warheads.

title: The Prospect of Peace in Colombia
description: BARICHARA, Colombia  It was not a heartfelt handshake. It was tentative and awkward. And yet, I watched in stunned silence as President Juan Manuel Santos of Colombia shook hands with Rodrigo Londoo (no relation), the leader of the countrys largest guerrilla group, on Wednesday night after the two announced a major breakthrough in peace talks.

title: Beijing Puts Ball Back in Washingtons Court on Climate Change
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama tried to tackle climate change in his first term, he pushed Congress to limit and put a price on carbon pollution, but the so-called cap-and-trade bill died in the Senate in 2010. Among the chief reasons: Lawmakers from both parties feared that any law to cut greenhouse gas emissions would harm the nations competitiveness compared with China, which was then emerging as the worlds largest polluter.

title: How Surgery Can Fight Global Poverty
description: EARLIER this year in Madagascar, a man in his 60s named Sambany made international news after volunteer surgeons from Mercy Ships removed a 16-pound tumor from his face. For decades, he had sought treatment at 10 hospitals, most of which lacked surgeons. He was ostracized, then physically unable to work. His family had to sell a rice field just to pay for the cost of getting to the hospital (the surgery itself was provided free).

title: Colombias President Says Peace Talks Overcame Late Surprise
description: When President Juan Manuel Santos of Colombia met with the leader of his countrys largest guerrilla group this week to seal the outline of a deal to end more than five decades of war, he received an unsettling shock. At the last minute, he said, the rebel leader, Rodrigo Londoo, tried to back out of a crucial part of the newly negotiated framework.

title: Bye, Bye, John Boehner
description: Farewell, John Boehner, farewell.

title: Faculty Council at Rutgers Says Coachs Punishment Is Too Lenient
description: The New Brunswick Faculty Council, a group of Rutgers professors, said on Friday that punishing Kyle Flood, the head football coach, with a three-game suspension and a $50,000 fine for contacting a players professor to try to make the player eligible was too lenient a penalty.

title: Malawi: U.N. Warns of a Food Crisis
description: The World Food Program, the hunger-fighting agency of the United Nations, warned Friday of an impending crisis in the southeastern African nation of Malawi, saying that more than 2.8 million people there will lack enough to eat over the next several months because of severe floods and a drought that ruined the 2015 harvest. The agency said the floods this year in Malawi were the worst in living memory, flushing away stockpiles of food and ruining fertile land. Crops that survived the floods, the agency said, succumbed later to intense dry spells. The agency, which is financed by voluntary contributions, said its Malawi relief operation was less than 25 percent funded and required more than $80 million.

title: Up-to-the-Minute
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Be careful what you wish for, my friends, because you just might get it.

title: Of Peanuts and Prosecutions
description: Salmonella poisoning is an awful affliction. It is marked by diarrhea, abdominal cramps, dehydration and fever that can last as long as a week. Many people wind up in the hospital. Others develop something called reactive arthritis. And in a small number of cases, the victims die.

title: In Pope Francis Words
description: Pope Francis spoke directly to New Yorkers and the world on Friday, in gatherings large and small.

title: Carly Fiorina Really Was That Bad
description: HER silver tongue honed by decades in corporate marketing, Carly Fiorina has used two debates, and a steely determination on the campaign trail, to climb near the top of the polls for the Republican nomination.

title: Two Weeks After Scare, Jets Rookie Is Set to Return
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Lorenzo Mauldin practiced in full on Friday.

title: New York City Council Initiates Steps to Ban the Manufacture of K2
description: Seeking to curb what city officials are calling a public health crisis, the New York City Council took initial steps on Friday to approve three bills that would ban the manufacturing of a popular synthetic drug, known as K2, and punish business owners for selling it.

title: For Better or Worse, These Knicks Belong to Phil Jackson
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When Phil Jackson agreed to preside over the Knicks in March 2014, he hoped to reshape the team into a championship contender. In the 557 days since, the Knicks have won 27 games  including 17 games last season, when they steamrollered franchise records for futility.

title: Mets Clinch at Least a Tie for the East Title After Thrashing the Reds
description: CINCINNATI  If the Mets are on the verge of clinching the National League East title here this weekend, ballpark employees plan to prepare for the celebration while the Mets-Reds game is still going on. They will remove the furniture from the visiting teams clubhouse, cover the room in plastic, and stock tubs with ice, beer and champagne.

title: U.S. Says Rebel It Trained Surrendered Matriel in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon said Friday that an American-trained rebel commander in Syria had surrendered trucks and ammunition this week to forces affiliated with an offshoot of Al Qaeda.

title: Yankees Get Mixed News on Tanaka and Bad News on the Field
description: Masahiro Tanaka emerged from the back of the clubhouse at Yankee Stadium on Friday with ice packs wrapped tightly around his right shoulder, elbow and thigh. Earlier in the afternoon, Tanaka threw off a mound for the first time since straining a hamstring against the Mets, a noteworthy milepost in the high-pressure stretch run of September.

title: In Return, Mats Zuccarello Plays Well but Plays It Down
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Mats Zuccarello missed the Rangers last 14 playoff games and their first two preseason contests, but he returned to the ice with a flourish Thursday against the Boston Bruins.

title: David Haggerty of U.S. Will Lead International Tennis Federation
description: David Haggerty, a recent president of the United States Tennis Association and a longtime tennis industry executive, was elected president of the International Tennis Federation on Friday in a close vote in Santiago, Chile.

title: The Giants Wait for Victor Cruz Could Be Nearing an End
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  A day after the first Giants victory of the season, there was more good news for the team. Coach Tom Coughlin indicated on Friday that wide receiver Victor Cruz, who has not played in roughly a year, should resume practicing next week, which would put him on schedule to rejoin the team on Oct. 4 for its next game, against the Buffalo Bills.

title: Met Opera Crowd Cheers Ailing Russian Baritone
description: Three months after announcing he had a brain tumor, and still in the midst of treatment, the cherished Russian baritone Dmitri Hvorostovsky returned to the Metropolitan Opera on Friday evening as the Count di Luna in Verdis Il Trovatore.

title: Don Francisco Walks Us Through His Final Day on Sbado Gigante
description: This will be Mario Kreutzbergers first free Saturday in 41 years. The host of Sbado Gigante, which ended its 53-year run last Saturday, he took his last day off in 1974, after the death of his mother. Since then Mr. Kreutzberger, more commonly known by his stage name, Don Francisco, has appeared on that Spanish-language variety show, which aired on Univision in the United States, every weekend without fail. Mr. Kreutzberger recalled his final day on Sbado Gigante in this account, which has been condensed and edited for clarity.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) UNBROKEN (2014) Angelina Jolie descends from the heavens into hell in this tale about Louis Zamperini (Jack OConnell), the Olympic track star turned World War II hero, who survived a plane crash in the Pacific in 1943 and drifted for nearly seven weeks on a life raft before being imprisoned and tortured by the Japanese for two years. Joel Coen, Ethan Coen, Richard LaGravenese and William Nicholson condensed Laura Hillenbrands 2010 best seller, Unbroken: A World War II Story of Survival, Resilience, and Redemption, which covers the first 25 years or so of Mr. Zamperinis life, into a 2-hour-17-minute screenplay. Thats still hardly enough time to cover each chapter in his life, and though Ms. Jolie does fine work throughout, the strain shows. Her tendency to go David Lean in this material works against her, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. What the movie ends up in desperate need of is a sense of life made real and palpable through dreadful, transporting details, not a life embalmed in hagiographic awe.

title: Corrections: September 26, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: In big cities, beneath the roar of traffic, beneath the rapid pace of change, so many faces pass byunnoticed because they have no right to be there, no right to be part of the city.

title: Pope Francis in New York
description: The pope addressed a gathering of world leaders at the United Nations, honored those killed in the Sept. 11 attacks and visited a school in East Harlem.

title: New Yorkers Fast, Jostle, Wait and Cook as Pope Visits
description: Two hours before the security gates opened at Central Park, and eight hours before Pope Francis was set to arrive, the line at one gate stretched two and a half blocks long and a dozen people wide.

title: Review: The Awful Truth, Modern Woman and Not-So-Modern Men
description: The acting isnt great, but the Metropolitan Playhouse production of The Awful Truth provides a rewarding sense of rediscovery, even for those unfamiliar with the work. Its the rediscovery of the truth that our forebears werent as quaint and pristine as we might have thought.

title: Reviving a Traditional Irish Womens Sport in New York
description: When Aisling Daly moved to New York two years ago, she knew she would miss two things from her native Ireland: family and camogie.

title: At Independence Hall, Pope Offers a Broad Vision of Religious Freedom
description: PHILADELPHIA  Standing near Independence Hall, where Americas founding documents were signed, Pope Francis on Saturday called religious freedom a fundamental right and laid out a broad and tolerant vision of what it should be, but also warned about its perversion as a pretext for hatred and brutality.

title: On the Front Line of Campus Sexual Misconduct
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Sarah Daniels stood at the front of an auditorium on the University of Michigan campus and looked out at the 120 or so students before her on an unseasonably cool day in late August.

The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took viewers from the U.S. Capitol to the Los Angeles River.

description: Ive been musing on why Pope Francis has attracted so many secular scientists and others trying to chart a low-impact path for humanity in a crowding, turbulent, fast-forward century?*

description: Roberto Cavallis spring collection.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: No Jokes, Just China
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the industry.

title: On Syria, Putin Is Catering to an Audience at Home

description: Sorry about lack of music. I was traveling while suffering from a cold, and the combination of congestion and pressure changes was really, really unpleasant. OK now, I think.

title: U.N. Summit Meeting on Womens Rights Highlights More Tension Between U.S. and China
description: UNITED NATIONS  After the South China Sea and cyberspace, the rivalry between the United States and China has found a new front: womens rights.

title: At Versace, Individualistic Beauty Reigns
description: For spring, Donatella Versace wants women to show their individuality  and, as a result, heavy makeup was replaced by bare faces. Identity, evidently, is in. With a soundtrack blaring messages of positive female reinforcement, Versace presented a collection that ranged from uniforms of khaki and military green to full-on Versace leopard-heavy camouflage prints in vibrant greens, oranges and neon yellows.

title: Edie Jackson: Signer With the Band
description: Edie Jackson, 43, is a music interpreter for the deaf who lives in Pawleys Island, S.C.

title: Pope Francis Homily During Mass at Cathedral in Philadelphia
description: Following is the English translation of Pope Francis homily during Mass at the Cathedral Basilica of Saints Peter and Paul on Saturday morning. His homily, delivered in Spanish, was prepared for delivery and released by the Vatican:

title: The Fragile Patchwork
description: For New Yorks oldest, having a family member to lean on can make all the difference. But its not not always easy.

title: Empty Promises and Broken Surfboards
description: In the years that the Haggler has been fighting on behalf of aggrieved consumers, he has compiled a win-loss record exceeded only by Floyd Mayweather, the boxer whose undefeated professional career now stands at 49 wins. But this greatly oversells the Hagglers achievements  he has lost far more bouts than readers know. Its just that he rarely writes about the losses.

title: Jil Sander: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Jill Sanders spring collection.

title: Microsoft Leads Movement to Offset Emissions With Internal Carbon Tax
description: When Microsoft business unit managers calculate their profits or losses each quarter, they consider more than just sales and expenses. They also factor in the price of carbon.

title: Long Hidden Away, Columbias Football Program Is Put on Display
description: It was just after 3 p.m. Friday when scores of curious onlookers, mostly wearing backpacks, began to line the yew hedges around Columbias South Lawn, snapping pictures of a sight unfamiliar to these grounds for decades. Before them, only a few feet away, was the football team, long a source of considerable embarrassment for a proud Ivy League fan base. But the team was out in the warm sunshine on this September afternoon.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  So youve made some considerable progress in your solving, youre regularly solving the late-week, trickier puzzles, and you feel ready to climb some new mountains. Why not try a cryptic crossword, like this terrific one by Daniel Raymon?

title: The Post-Boehner Congress and Washingtons Sense of Dread
description: WASHINGTON  At the White House, a stunned President Obama expressed hope for bipartisan progress as turmoil among Republicans ended Representative John A. Boehners speakership.

title: John Boehner Exits, Donald Trump Storms On
description: ON Thursday, when John Boehner grew weepy in the presence of the pope, I assumed that we were seeing the tears of a proud Catholic.

title: Review: The Walk Captures High-Wire Bravado at World Trade Center
description: Now Ive seen everything, an anonymous New Yorker remarks, marveling at the spectacle unfolding more than a hundred stories above street level. Its the morning of Aug. 7, 1974, and Philippe Petit is walking across a steel cable strung between the towers of the World Trade Center. Amid the gasps and murmurs, that line stands out, and invites a bit of pondering. Its an expression of wonder, for sure, but it also carries an implication of jadedness, especially for moviegoers. All the surround-sound bells and whistles and digitally enhanced fireworks in the world cant quite shake us out of the feeling that weve seen it all before.

title: At Versace, Military Silhouettes in Wild Prints
description: Donatella Versace said she designed her spring/summer 2016 collection for a womans many outfit needs  which meant plenty of party dresses.

title: How Not to Be a Networking Leech: Tips for Seeking Professional Advice
description: Businesspeople generally think of networking as a mutually beneficial meeting for both parties. But thats not usually what it is. Far more often, it is one person asking the other for a favor.

title: At Bottega Veneta, Leopard Prints and Woven Leather
description: For spring/summer 2016, looks in vibrant colors and prints were layered with elegant jewels.

title: At Roberto Cavalli, a Little 80s Glam
description: The designer Peter Dundas debuted a collection for Roberto Cavalli today after a 10-year intermission  or, as he called it backstage, a nice homecoming. He said that spring/summer 2016 felt like the right time to ease the Cavalli woman up with styles that could be just thrown on, comfortable pieces in washed fabrics. That included acid-washed denim, leather  and even chain mail for an effect that was a little 80s glam.

title: Smaller, Faster, Cheaper, Over: The Future of Computer Chips
description: At the inaugural International Solid-State Circuits Conference held on the campus of the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia in 1960, a young computer engineer named Douglas Engelbart introduced the electronics industry to the remarkably simple but groundbreaking concept of scaling.

title: To Get a Job in Your 50s, Maintain Friendships in Your 40s
description: We hear it all the time: People who are over 50 take longer to find jobs than younger people. Connie Wanberg, a professor at the Carlson School of Management at the University of Minnesota, had long heard gloom-and-doom stories to that effect, but she wondered how strong the data was to support them.

title: Pope Francis in Philadelphia
description: The pope celebrated a Mass at the Cathedral Basilica of SS. Peter and Paul in Philadelphia and spoke at the Festival of Families on Saturday.

title: As Volkswagen Pushed to Be No. 1, Ambitions Fueled a Scandal
description: Martin Winterkorn, Volkswagens chief executive, took the stage four years ago at the automakers new plant in Chattanooga, Tenn., and outlined a bold strategy. The company, he said, was in the midst of a plan to more than triple its sales in the United States in just a decade  setting it on a course to sweep by Toyota to become the worlds largest automaker.

title: A Pastoral Pope, Slipping Conservatives Grasp
description: PHILADELPHIA  Cardinal Gerhard Ludwig Mller, the Vaticans chief doctrinal watchdog, sat cross-legged in front of a large television on Friday and watched Pope Francis at the United Nations addressing a world that has warmed to the pontiffs merciful message on issues like immigration, the poor and climate change.

description: To the Editor:

description: This interview with Jan Singer, chief executive of Spanx, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

description: MEXICO CITY  As a Catholic, Ezequiel Mora was torn over what kind of Mass to offer for his missing 21-year-old son, who vanished a year ago with 42 other college students in southern Mexico.

title: A Streamlined Jil Sander Summer
description: For spring/summer 2016, the fashion house offered tailored but easy pieces and floppy hats.

title: Pope Celebrates Mass in New York
description: Pope Francis celebrated Mass at Madison Square Garden in New York on Friday.

description: The spring/summer 2016 collection mixed metallic silks with floral motifs.

title: At Cavalli, Ruffles, Acid Wash and Chain Mail
description: Peter Dundas, who returns to the house after 10 years, called the collection a nice homecoming.

description: WASHINGTON  At the Washington Nationals home opener in April, Duane Dargin, 9, stood in the center of the diamond beneath sunny skies waiting to throw out the games ceremonial first pitch.

description: T plucks the best jewelry right off the runway.

description: The federal governments decades-long failure to curb predatory behavior by the for-profit college industry has left untold numbers of Americans with crushing debt while providing useless degrees  or no degrees at all  in return.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Malala Yousafzais Fight Continues
description: WHEN the deputy head mistress pulled Malala Yousafzai out of high school chemistry class one morning a year ago, Malala nervously searched her mind for recent offenses.

title: Springtime for Liberal Christianity
Time for Iran to Correct an Injustice
description: The Iran nuclear agreement is a huge step forward for international security, and certainly President Hassan Rouhani of Iran and his foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, will be well received at the United Nations meetings this week.

title: To Unite the Earth, Connect It
description: SEVENTY years ago, the United Nations was formed as the expression of a simple choice: cooperation instead of war. Humanity would stand as one against conflict, poverty and disease. All the worlds voices would be heard.

title: Protecting Apes Could Backfire
description: Cambridge, England  A NEW listing under the Endangered Species Act effectively bans the use of captive chimpanzees in human biomedical research. This might seem like good news. But this action to protect the welfare of captive chimpanzees by classifying them as endangered could unintentionally deliver a serious blow to wild apes. Efforts to develop and deploy vaccines against Ebola and other infectious diseases ravaging these animals could grind to a halt.

title: Donald Trump, Our Reality TV Candidate
description: Los Angeles  THE first time I met Delores Hughes, known as Mema, she was dressed in a purple muumuu, searching her kitchen for her false teeth. She warned me not to let her dog Tigger inside, because it would attack me. Dogfights were common at Memas house; her daughter had the stitches to prove it. By the end of the day, Mema was leading dozens of moonshine-drunk neighbors in a round of Happy Birthday  it was my birthday  and I thought to myself, not only have I just met my new favorite person, but this person is reality TV gold.

title: The Soaring Price of Political Access
description: Politicians busy soliciting ever-larger donations from eager millionaires epitomize the truth of a 12-year-old Supreme Court ruling on contribution limits: Money, like water, will always find an outlet.

title: Francis, the Perfect 19th-Century Pope
description: Washington  AFTER attending a canonization Mass at Catholic University with the pope who rails against the excesses of capitalism, I walked off campus to a festival of capitalism.

title: A Special Education
description: THE famous little yellow bus stopped at the bottom of my driveway at 8:30 a.m. on the first day of fourth grade. I was the only passenger at first, but we zigzagged here and there, picking up children I had never seen before. We finally stopped at an office building, in a city eight miles from our rural upstate New York town, where a room had been rented for the class. We were special ed.

title: Why Students Hate School Lunches
description: MORE than 30 million children trundle through school cafeteria lines every day in the United States and thanks to the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act, which took effect in 2012, they are no longer served greasy pizza, salty French fries and sauced up chicken wings. Meals must now be lower in fat, calories and sodium and contain lean proteins, more fruits and vegetables and whole grains. And kids from coast to coast are wrinkling their noses.

title: Cassian Folsom
description: Father Cassian Folsom is the prior of the Monastery of St. Benedict in Norcia, Italy, where the monks are known both for brewing the beer that was served to the conclave that elected Pope Francis and a chart-topping album of Marian chant, which was released in June.

title: Putins Credo: Never Let Them See You Sweat
description: LONG ago, at the inception of his rise to power, Vladimir V. Putin recounted a memory of growing up in the late 1950s in a Soviet communal apartment in Leningrad, as St. Petersburg was then known. For kicks, he and his friends would chase rats in the buildings dismal hallways. It was what passed for a game until the time a cornered rat hurled himself at a surprised and frightened young Vladimir, who turned and ran away.

title: Donald Trump and the Rise of the Moral Minority
description: DONALD TRUMPS high poll numbers among evangelicals have preoccupied the media for months. But the most interesting thing about his Christian fans is not their willingness to overlook the sins of a casino playboy. Evangelicals happily voted for a divorced man of uncertain faith once before: Ronald Reagan. What is most striking is that Mr. Trumps campaign has exposed a rift within evangelicalism  a split between those calling for culture war as usual and those who say Christians must adjust to life as a minority in American Babylon.

title: The Curious Politics of the Nudge
description: HOW do we really feel about policy nudges?

title: Stop Googling. Lets Talk.
description: COLLEGE students tell me they know how to look someone in the eye and type on their phones at the same time, their split attention undetected. They say its a skill they mastered in middle school when they wanted to text in class without getting caught. Now they use it when they want to be both with their friends and, as some put it, elsewhere.

title: Barriers for Women in the Workplace
description: Readers discuss work-family balance for women in todays corporate culture.

title: The Daily Bag: Bally
description: T plucks the best bags right off the runway.

title: Broncos Havent Lost, Yet Peyton Manning Is a Lightning Rod
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.  The Denver Broncos and quarterback Peyton Manning are winning, a fall tradition in Colorado as expected as the changing aspen leaves. It is the way they are winning under their new coach, Gary Kubiak, that has agitated their perpetually fevered fan base.

title: Terry Rosenbaum, Teacher Who Was Fired After Defying McCarthy, Dies at 97
description: In 1951, Terry Rosenbaum, a history teacher at Samuel J. Tilden High School in the East Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, finally stepped into one fight too many.

title: Aerial Obstacles
description: The Afghan Air Forces MD-530 scout helicopter cannot operate above an elevation of 7,000 to 8,000 feet, which reduces the area it can patrol in Afghanistans mountainous landscape.

title: As Young Players Surge, Birdie Becomes the New Par
description: ATLANTA  Since the United States Open in mid-June, Jason Days cumulative score in PGA Tour events is 101 under par. With a 61 here and a couple of 63s there, Day has turned what used to be regarded as a four-day marathon into a four-round sprint.

title: Court Conundrum: Offenders Who Cant Pay, or Wont
description: BOWDON, Ga.  A few weeks ago, a courtroom cellphone video came to light in which Richard A. Diment, the longtime Municipal Court judge here, threatened to jail traffic offenders who failed to come up with enough money to apply to their fines. Until you get $300 here tonight, you wont be able to leave, he told one defendant.

title: Hospitals Devastated in Syria, War-Wounded Seek Treatment in Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Mohammad Smarat sat gazing at the few plants sprouting outside the entrance of the white stone hospital here, recalling how he had collapsed in a sea of green fields after getting shot.

title: Obama Addresses U.N. Delegates in 2014
description: President Obama spoke about ways to counter the radical ideologies of groups like Al Qaeda and the Islamic State during a speech at the United Nations General Assembly in September 2014.

title: Bill Clinton Blames G.O.P. and Press for Wifes Email Woes
description: Former President Bill Clinton blamed Republicans who hope to undercut his wifes presidential chances and a voracious political news media uninterested in substance for the furor surrounding Hillary Rodham Clintons use of a private email account and server while she was secretary of state.

title: FIFAs Captain Clings to the Helm of His Sinking Ship
description: When Sepp Blatter was re-elected president of FIFA this spring, he trotted out one of his favorite metaphors. In his 17th year in charge of the organization, and brushing aside a raging corruption scandal, Mr. Blatter boasted that he would navigate FIFAs rocky waters and guide world soccers governing body safely to the shore.

title: Pope Calls to Embrace Laity and Women
description: At the Cathedral Basilica of SS. Peter and Paul in Philadelphia, Pope Francis offered solutions for the problems facing the church in a rapidly changing society.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Announces Project to Connect Refugee Camps to the Internet
description: UNITED NATIONS  Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive of Facebook, promoted access to the Internet as an enabler of human rights and a force for peace on Saturday, as he announced that his company would help the United Nations bring Internet connections to refugee camps.

title: Thousands Enter Syria to Join ISIS Despite Global Efforts
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly 30,000 foreign recruits have now poured into Syria, many to join the Islamic State, a doubling of volunteers in just the past 12 months and stark evidence that an international effort to tighten borders, share intelligence and enforce antiterrorism laws is not diminishing the ranks of new militant fighters.

title: As Indonesia Prospers, Air Pollution Takes Toll
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The young woman sat on a bench at a bus terminal here one recent morning, listening to her iPod beneath a bright blue sky. But despite the sunshine and a light breeze, the woman, Fety Dwiyanti, wore a face mask. She did not have the flu or a cold, though, she was just worried about what was getting into her lungs.

title: Pope Francis Remarks at Independence Hall
description: The following is the English translation of Pope Francis remarks at Independence Hall on Saturday afternoon. His homily was prepared for delivery and released by the Vatican:

title: As the Astros Season Wilts, a Texas Rivalry Blooms
description: HOUSTON  As a quarterback and linebacker for his high school football team in LaMarque, Tex., Jeff Banister sometimes played at the Astrodome. His team would enter through the loading dock, and Banister figured he could sneak in the same way to watch baseball. He would pay to park in the stadium lot, and then make his move.

title: A Goal of Opportunity
description: Hilary Knight, a top star, will be playing in the National Womens Hockey League, the first major professional womens hockey league to offer salaries.

title: Carrying the Puck, and a Fight for Recognition in the National Womens Hockey League
description: BOSTON  Hilary Knight pulled her car into a grocery store parking lot in 2012, called home and began crying. After leading Wisconsin to two national titles in womens hockey, she had packed her belongings and driven to Boston to train full time with the United States national team. But after watching a young employee collecting shopping carts, she felt almost envious  and lost.

title: Money Flows With Refugees, and Life Jackets Fill the Shops
description: IZMIR, Turkey  For months, Ahmed Abdul-Hamid, a Palestinian from the Syrian city of Aleppo, tried and failed to cross the sea to start a new life in Europe. The Turkish police detained him. Smugglers tricked him. Once, his boat stalled and he had to swim back to shore, leaving him stranded and broke.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Berras Cultural Impact: It Aint Over

title: Brewers New G.M. Looks to Change Story Line
description: David Stearns was 16 years old in the summer of 2001, which he spent with his father in Arizona. He loved sports and was already considering his career options. Journalism, perhaps, was worth a try.

title: The Only Similarity Between Yogi Berra and Hitters Today: Doing What Works
description: As the Yankees reminisced about Yogi Berra, a story from the clubhouse manager Rob Cucuzza resonated  not just because it displayed Berras wit.

title: Reacting to Videos, Planned Parenthood Fights to Regain Initiative
description: WASHINGTON  The undercover videos were made over more than two years, yet Planned Parenthood was taken by surprise when the first one was posted online in July. Now one of the biggest crises in the 99-year history of the organization, the nations largest provider of womens reproductive health care, could reach a climax this week as conservatives want to shut down the government rather than help fund the group.

title: Mark My Words
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  An unusual and intriguing idea by Tom McCoy, well carried out for the most part. We have 12 quotation marks in our grid surrounding famous quotes when going Across that double as ditto marks for the Down entries.

title: 4 Youths Held in Death of Israeli Man Whose Car Was Hit by Rocks
description: TEL AVIV  Four Palestinian youths have been detained in the death of an Israeli man who drove his vehicle into a light pole in East Jerusalem two weeks ago after it was hit by rocks, the Israeli police said Saturday.

title: Jets Tight Ends Have a Job to Do, but Few Passes to Catch
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Aside from his Jets teammates and coaches, Kellen Davis said, the only person he talks football with is his wife, Jillian. She loves the sport, knows the sport, and so she has noticed that her husband has been targeted only one time during the first two games. Which is one more than the Jets other tight end, Jeff Cumberland.

title: Eagles at Jets Matchup
description: Eagles (0-2) at Jets (2-0)

title: Politics and Philosophy Clash Where the Pope Urges an Embrace of Refugees
description: Pope Francis challenged Americans last week to accept the stranger in our midst and reject a mind-set of hostility toward newcomers. But his invocation of the millions of Syrian and other Middle East refugees, a relatively small number of whom have been resettled in the United States, has been met with indifference or resistance by many in the 2016 presidential field.

title: Shifting Direction, Kerry Aims to Include Iran in Efforts to End the Conflict in Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS  Secretary of State John Kerry sought on Saturday to draw Iran into the search for a political solution to the Syrian conflict as he began a week of diplomacy over the brutal fighting there.

title: U.S. Is Struggling in Its Effort to Build an Afghan Air Force
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Col. Qalandar Shah Qalandari, Afghanistans most decorated pilot, recently took command of what was meant to be the building blocks of his countrys new air force: a squadron of shiny American-made attack helicopters, intended to solve the chronic lack of close air support for Afghan troops.

title: Canada Revokes Citizenship of Bomb Plot Organizer
description: OTTAWA  The government of Canada used a controversial new law to revoke the citizenship of one of the organizers of a failed 2006 Toronto bombing plot. The National Post, a Toronto newspaper, reported on Saturday that the man, Zakaria Amara, had received a letter telling him about the decision at the prison where he is serving a life term.

title: After Nine-Year Wait, the Mets Are Returning to the Postseason
description: CINCINNATI  Between pitches in the ninth inning, David Wright kept turning and looking around Great American Ball Park, trying to soak up as much as he could. His team had not made the playoffs in nine years, and the last time, he was so young that he had taken it for granted. He wanted to remember the celebration vividly this time.

title: Russia and Estonia Swap Prisoners Accused of Spying
description: TALLINN, Estonia  Russia and Estonia on Saturday exchanged two prisoners who had been convicted of espionage, carrying out the swap on a bridge at a border post between the countries.

title: Yankees Get Just Enough Offense to Beat the White Sox
description: As Alex Rodriguez was standing on first base in the fourth inning Saturday, Chicago White Sox first baseman Jose Abreu stood next to him laughing. Perhaps Abreu was in on the joke.

title: Streets Closed to Cars for Pope Francis Visit Transform Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  The group from Iglesia Catlico de San Jose in Asheboro, N.C., began its trip to Philadelphia at about 8 p.m. on Friday. Riding in a convoy of vans and a bus, the worshipers  about 180 people in all, most of them Mexican immigrants  drove through the night.

title: Review: Kanye West Shines Light on His Darkest Hour
description: LOS ANGELES  We are living in an age of Kanye Wests bliss. It wasnt always clear that wed get here.

title: First Ladies Reveal Name of Precious Panda Cub
description: WASHINGTON  While the presidents of China and the United States held closed-door talks, the first ladies of both nations dealt with another international matter: announcing the National Zoos month-old giant panda cub  Bei Bei.

title: Pope Francis Visits: Day 8
description: On the final leg of his first trip to the United States, Pope Francis called religious freedom a fundamental right and laid out a broad and tolerant vision of what it should be.

title: In Case You Missed It: Top Articles of the Week
description: Catch up with the most-read sports stories in The New York Times from Sept. 18 to 24.

title: Cuomo, Eulogizing Slain Aide, Deplores Violence and Urges Tough Gun Laws
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, during a fiery eulogy on Saturday for a lawyer in his administration who died after being shot in the head, implored New Yorkers to carry on the slain mans mission by reforming schools, fixing public housing and, above all, demanding stronger federal gun laws.

title: Jordan Spieth Is a Round Away From a Fantastic Finish
description: ATLANTA  On one of Jordan Spieths shoulders rests an imaginary people pleaser, whispering into his ear to stay humble, be polite and do right by his team and his burgeoning group of supporters. It is counterbalanced by the fiery competitor that rests on Spieths other shoulder, exhorting him to never back off or down, to go for the jugular.

title: Mets Live Down a Tortured September History
description: On the afternoon of Sept. 23, 1998, with the bases loaded and two outs in the bottom of the ninth inning, a Chicago Cubs outfielder named Brant Brown settled under a lazy fly ball hit by Geoff Jenkins of the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: Partnership Aims to Bolster Local Health Care Providers
description: Supported by one of the worlds leading philanthropies, a new partnership was announced Saturday during a United Nations development meeting aimed at improving health in poor and middle-income countries by helping to strengthen their primary care providers.

title: President Xi Jinping of China Pledges $2 Billion to Fight Poverty
description: President Xi Jinping told the United Nations on Saturday that China would pledge $2 billion as an initial investment for development assistance to the poorest countries.

title: Mets Go From Doldrums of Summer to Dreams of Fall
description: On the 14th pitch of the ninth inning, the Mets closer, Jeurys Familia, dropped a nasty, skidding, mid-90s tailing pitch of that sort that makes mature professional hitters look like helpless Little Leaguers.

title: The Best Moments in College Football This Week
description: DREW BROWN Nebraskas sophomore kicker tied an N.C.A.A. record for field goals in a half, with five, as the host Huskers defeated Southern Mississippi, 36-28. Browns first-half kicks came from 29, 27, 40, 22 and 50 yards.

title: Jamie Stone, Paul Feingold
description: Jamie Brennan Stone and Dr. Paul Lawrence Feingold were married Saturday in Vergennes, Vt. Melissa B. Ross, a friend of the bride, officiated at the Basin Harbor Club, having been authorized by the Vermont secretary of state.

description: Christine Marie Sheahan and Peter Benjamin Kramer were married Saturday at the home of the grooms father in Bay Shore, N.Y. Craig S. Danforth, a friend of the couple and a minister with American Marriage Ministries, officiated.

description: Alyssa Bennett Rosenberg and Matthew Anthony Gertz were married Saturday in Washington. Christopher Ashley, a friend of the couple who received temporary officiant status from the Marriage Bureau of the District of Columbia, officiated at the Josephine Butler Parks Center, a historic house.

description: David Lebowitz Blazar and Clay Matthew Westrope were married Saturday at a harborside house in Falmouth, Mass., that was rented for the occasion. Kevin A. Collins, a friend of the couple who received permission from Massachusetts, officiated.

description: Chondita Samant Chatterjee and Alexander Brandt Dayton were married Saturday by Stephen Cohen, the brides acupuncturist and a Universal Life minister, at the Bridgehampton Tennis and Surf Club in Bridgehampton, N.Y.

description: Jessica Lee, the daughter of Li W. Lee and Jerry H. Lee of Arcadia, Calif., was married Saturday to Michael Yeeling Yau, the son of Peggy C. Yau and Timotheus T. Yau of Milpitas, Calif. The grooms sister, Dr. Nancy Yau, who was appointed a deputy commissioner of civil marriages by Santa Clara County, Calif., officiated at the Resort at Pelican Hill in Newport Coast, Calif.

description: Laura Joy Grasso Fitzpatrick, the daughter of Jean G. Fitzpatrick and Desmond A. Fitzpatrick of Ossining, N.Y., was married Saturday to Charles Leon Rayner, a son of Dr. Ruth J. Crane and Dr. Anthony A. Rayner of Las Vegas. The Rev. Lynn Sanders, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomews Church in New York.

description: Dr. Joelle Erika Getrajdman and Daniel Patrick Fitzgerald were married Saturday in Piermont, N.Y. Michael Coleman, a former village justice of Lynbrook, N.Y., officiated at the View on the Hudson restaurant.

description: Carrie Rebecca Rowe and Eliot Joseph Haws Bostar were married Saturday evening at the Century Association, a private club in New York. Bill Moyers, the journalist and political commentator who is ordained as a Baptist minister, officiated.

title: Shannon Dennis, John Conway
description: Shannon Marie Dennis, a daughter of Eileen F. Dennis and Paul H. Dennis of Barrington, R.I., was married Saturday evening to John Whalen Conway, a son of Dee W. Conway and Kevin J. Conway of Plandome, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Jeffrey W. Larsen, a United Church of Christ minister, officiated at the OceanCliff Hotel in Newport, R.I.

title: Lauren Astry, Mark Sorensen
Elizabeth Sweeny, Philip Taylor
description: Elizabeth Helene Sweeny and Philip Morgan Taylor were married Thursday at the home of the grooms parents in Park Ridge, N.J. Joseph S. Conte, a retired judge of the Superior Court of New Jersey, officiated.

title: Catherine Barnard, Brian Pasquinelli
description: Catherine Elizabeth Barnard and Brian Anthony Pasquinelli were married Saturday. Richard G. Stearns, a judge with the Federal District Court in Massachusetts, for whom the bride was a law clerk from 2010-12, officiated at the Yale Club of New York.

title: Jessica Reuben, Brian Krantz
description: Jessica Emily Reuben and Brian Adam Krantz were married Saturday evening at the Plaza hotel in New York. Rabbi Alan C. Stein officiated.

title: Rebecca Bortman and Bryan Garza: Finding the Person Behind the Persona
description: Rebecca Davina Bortman and Bryan Patrick Garza were married Saturday evening at the Chapel, a nightclub in San Francisco. Michael A. Sui, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the Church of Spiritual Humanism for the event, officiated at a ceremony that included an original rock opera performance written by the couple and performed by their respective bands.

description: Kathryn Blair Friedman, a daughter of Dr. Elissa Gretz Friedman and Robert J. Friedman of New York, was married Saturday evening to Aaron Joseph Flack, a son of Julie A. Flack and Irwin F. Flack of Syracuse. Rabbi Angela Buchdahl officiated at Manursing Island Club in Rye, N.Y.

description: Humera Khursheed and Dr. Aadel Ahmed Chaudhuri were married Saturday in Salt Lake City. Imam Muhammed S. Mehtar officiated at the Utah State Capitol.

description: Dr. Robin Rene Hemphill and Dr. Sally Ann Santen were married Saturday at the Dacor Bacon House, a historic residence in Washington. The officiant was Timothy S. Black, a United States district judge for the Southern District of Ohio, who received authorization from the District of Columbia Marriage Bureau.

description: Chelsea Ann Zimmerman, the daughter of Rebecca A. Palmer and Lloyd B. Zimmerman of Minneapolis, was married Saturday to Nathan Henry Walcker, a son of Mary E. Walcker of Chaska, Minn., and the late Brian D. Walcker. Judge Donovan W. Frank of the Federal District Court of Minnesota officiated at Rice Park in St. Paul, Minn.

title: Sewit Teckie, Beeneet Kothari
description: Dr. Sewit Teckie and Beeneet Kothari were married Monday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau by Angel L. Lopez, a staff member of the New York City clerks office.

title: Mollie Chen, Robert Bonstein III
description: Mollie Hesse Chen and Robert Glenn Bonstein III were married Saturday at East Hill, a private estate in Livingston Manor, N.Y. Nathaniel Rogers, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

description: Brittney Shay Martin, a daughter of Terry L. Martin and Chris J. Martin of Occidental, Calif., was married Saturday to Reeve Terry Schley, the son of Reeve Schley III and Georgia Schley of Whitehouse, N.J. Rose A. Rose, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, led the ceremony at Taylor Maid Organic Farms, which the brides parents own.

title: Carly Callahan, Justin Bristol
description: Caroline Allison Callahan, a daughter of Meg Siegler Callahan and Timothy H. Callahan of Highland Park, Ill., was married Saturday to Justin Richard Bristol, the son of Marcy Levinson Bristol of Farmington Hills, Mich., and the late Dr. William L. Bristol. Rabbi David B. Kudan officiated at Galley Beach, a restaurant and event space in Nantucket, Mass.

title: Christina Watka, Andrew Halchak
description: Christina Marie Watka and Andrew Curran Halchak were married Saturday at Camp Bournedale, a summer camp in Plymouth, Mass., where Eric Bagby, a friend of the couple, received permission to officiate from Massachusetts.

title: Erin McInerney, Ryan Nagle
description: Erin Leigh McInerney and Ryan Thomas Nagle were married Saturday evening at a private home the couple rented on Nantucket, Mass. James Shanahan, a friend of the couple, received permission from Massachusetts to officiate at a ceremony that incorporated Roman Catholic wedding traditions.

title: Meredith Beck, Adolf Haffenreffer
description: Meredith Childress Beck, a daughter of Pamela Witte Beck and Robert C. Beck of New York, was married Saturday to Adolf Frederick Haffenreffer IV, a son of Lisa Balboni Haffenreffer and Mr. Haffenreffer III of Little Compton, R.I. The Rev. Rebecca Floyd Marshall, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at the United Congregational Church in Little Compton.

description: Ruby Victoria Riesenberg, a daughter of Victoria L. Riesenberg and Douglas J. Riesenberg of Corvallis, Ore., was married Saturday evening to Jeremy Michael Winn, a son of Nancy Winn of Portland, Ore., and Michael Winn of Beaverton, Ore. Edwin V. Rajeski, the brides maternal grandfather and a minister with American Marriage Ministries, officiated at the Bridgeport Brewpub in Portland.

Gillibrand, theNew York Democrat, offered a blessing.

title: Devon Morten, Charles McCombs
description: Sarah Devon Morten and Charles Anderson McCombs were married Saturday by the Rev. Richard L. Walton Jr., an Episcopal priest, at the Roaring Gap Club in Roaring Gap, N.C.

title: Jessica Greenbaum, Kyle Fricker
description: Jessica Lynn Greenbaum, a daughter of Laureine Greenbaum and David R. Greenbaum of New York, was married Saturday evening to Kyle Jeffery Fricker, the son of Susie Fricker and Eric Fricker of Cocoa Beach, Fla. Rabbi Ed Klein officiated at Studio 450, an event space in New York.

description: Melissa Jean Ryan and Michel Joseph Keane were married Saturday by Asher Huey, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, at the Eastern Market, a marketplace in Washington.

title: Lucinda Ballard and Theodore May
description: Lucinda Annabella Manly Ballard, the daughter of Lucinda Constable Ballard and Robert F.R. Ballard of New York, was married Saturday to Theodore Anthony May, a son of Karen Thornwell May and M. Anthony May, also of New York. The Rev. Dr. Gale Davis performed the ceremony at St. Pauls Episcopal Church in Nantucket, Mass., where she is the interim rector. The Rev. Dr. Patrick ONeill, a Roman Catholic priest, took part.

title: Brittany LeMonda, Michael Dutt
description: Brittany Catherine LeMonda, the daughter of Catherine Tamis-LeMonda and Richard J. LeMonda of Garden City, N.Y., was married Saturday to Dr. Michael Christopher Dutt, a son of Anita Ruhling Dutt of Riverdale, the Bronx, and the late Mohan C. Dutt. The Rev. Peter J. Garry, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church in Southold, N.Y.

description: Emma Elizabeth Haberman, the daughter of Kathleen M. Jones and Clyde Haberman of New York, was married Saturday to Caleb Justus Powers, the son of Cheryl M. Powers and Richard R. Powers of Lawrence, Kan. Zach Haberman, the brides brother who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated in an outdoor ceremony at The Hill, a farm in Hudson, N.Y.

title: Sally Morgridge, Aaron Izakowitz
description: Sarah Megan Morgridge, the daughter of Sarah E. Morgridge and Kelly D. Tuell of Manhattan, is to be married Sunday to Aaron Richard Hersh Izakowitz, the son of Alison Booth and David Z. Izakowitz of Charlottesville, Va. Shannon Sun-Higginson, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Queens County Farm Museum in Floral Park, Queens.

title: Kate Mandel, Christopher Bruce
description: Kate Safford Mandel and Christopher Michael Bruce were married Saturday at Century Country Club in Purchase, N.Y. Gabriel J. Parisi-Amon, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Rachel Bring, Andrew Underberg
description: Dr. Rachel Ashley Bring, the daughter of Reva E. Bring and Martin R. Bring of New York, is to be married Sunday to Andrew Englander Underberg, a son of Diane Englander and Mark A. Underberg of New York. Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein is to officiate at Tribeca Rooftop, an event space in New York.

title: Lauren Rooney, Ian Belknap
description: Lauren Corte Rooney and Ian Christopher Belknap were married Saturday in New York. The grooms father, the Rev. Dr. Barry A. Belknap, a minister of the Church of the Brethren, officiated at Landmark on the Park, an event space inside the Fourth Universalist Society church.

title: Molly Arkin and Jonathan Axell: A Truly Unscripted Romance
description: Molly Marjorie Arkin, the daughter of Linda M. Arkin of Seattle and Adam Arkin of Los Angeles, was married Saturday to Jonathan Paul Axell, a son of Cheryl A. Axell and Kris D. Axell of Bellevue, Wash. Nicholas W. Edwards, a Universal Life Minister and a friend of the couple, officiated at Axis Pioneer Square, an event space in Seattle.

title: Rangers Beat the Devils
description: Derek Stepan scored two goals in the third period and added two assists in the Rangers 4-3 preseason victory over the host Devils.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If Boehner had stayed through December, youd feel better about this. Now youve really emboldened the right. They feel at least they have a head on the mantel.

title: Corrections: September 27, 2015
description: SPORTS

title: The amfAR Milano Gala 2015
description: Fashion Week paused on Saturday night to raise money for AIDS research  and have some fun.

title: The amfAR Milano Gala: An Annual Fashion Week Break
description: MILAN  The Italian red-carpet photographers were going wild. Woman after woman was preening and posing her way down the step-and-repeat, in dresses composed of crystals, sequins and vast acres of see-through paneling.

title: 1915: Russian Cavalry Entraps Enemy
description: PETROGRAD  Fighting of extraordinary violence continues in the neighborhood of Dvinsk, where the Russian cavalry has just gained an important success, involving the destruction of a strong enemy column which was advancing near Lake Tchighvi. The Germans, who were numerically superior and supported by powerful artillery, were pressing hotly, and the Russians cleverly retreated into the lake region, a veritable labyrinth, with which they alone were familiar.

title: Letting the Last 12-Year-Old in the Whole World Without a Cellphone Make Her Case
description: Mom, Im like the ONLY ONE in the whole world who doesnt have a cellphone.

title: Marni: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Consuelo Castiglioni presents her spring collection.

title: Pope Francis Ends Visit With Mass After Meeting Bishops and Inmates
description: PHILADELPHIA  Pope Francis turned penitent and pastor Sunday on the final day of his visit to the United States, declaring himself overwhelmed by shame at the sexual violation of children by his clergy, embracing inmates at a local jail, urging young people to leave the loneliness of social media and bidding farewell with a huge downtown Mass.

title: In Vicious Fire Season, an Endurance Test for California Crews
description: MIDDLETOWN, Calif.  The firefighters collapse in driveways and fields to steal a moments rest. They sleep in their engines, sprawled across fire hoses or slumped over steering wheels. After they spend days hacking dead brush and setting defensive fires across flaming mountains, their 24-hour rest breaks are cut short when a new fire rears up.

title: 1965: Jesuits Chief Says Atheism Invades Church
description: VATICAN CITY  The head of the Jesuits, the most powerful order in the Roman Catholic Church, today [Sept. 27] said that a new godless society now holds almost complete sway in international organizations, in financial circles and in the field of mass communications: press, cinema, radio, and television. Father Pedro Arrupe, known as the black pope after his black robes and considerable power as the orders superior-general, said that the hidden poison of atheism was operating inside the Catholic Church itself. His remarks, made to the Vatican Ecumenical Council during a debate on atheism, touched off an immediate controversy among his listeners, many of whom said he had gone too far.

title: Guarding the Prison Guards: New York States Troubled Disciplinary System

title: Hillary Clinton Says She Cannot Explain Why Previously Undisclosed Emails Turned Up

But she said she hoped that voters would look past what she called the drip, drip, drip of the furor over her emails.

title: Tom Brady Throws 400th Touchdown for the Patriots
description: Tom Brady joined an exclusive club when he threw his 400th career touchdown pass during the Patriots game against the Jaguars on Sunday. The quick, 3-yard strike to Danny Amendola in the second quarter put the Patriots ahead, 20-3, and caused the New England faithful to chant Bradys name as he walked off the field and acknowledged the crowd.

title: Next Up From Pope Francis? An Album, of Course
description: Usually the tour comes after the album. For Pope Francis, however, its the other way around: He is scheduled to release an album, Wake Up!, on Nov. 27, following his whirlwind United States trip, during which he has been greeted by hundreds of thousands of well-wishers. The album features the popes speeches set to rock, pop, and Gregorian chants, and will raise money for a support fund for refugees.

title: Dallas Cowboys Show Signs of Life With Brandon Weeden at QB
description: Everyone laughed when Jerry Jones, the Cowboys owner, heaped praise upon Brandon Weeden. The backup quarterback was forced into a starting position last week when Tony Romo broke his left clavicle, and many assumed all hope was lost for the season despite a 2-0 record.

title: Versace to Bottega Veneta: Forging New Frontiers
description: Borders and barriers are touchy and omnipresent subjects in Europe these days: difficult for an industry like fashion, which has its own exclusionary issues (price, size, taste) to address, yet impossible to ignore. Even for designers, who know perfectly well that they risk accusations of hypocrisy and dilettantism if they dare to wade into any political arena.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 10 P.M. (ABC) QUANTICO The Bollywood superstar Priyanka Chopra subdues her glamour to play Alex Parrish, an F.B.I. trainee suspected of masterminding the biggest attack on New York since Sept. 11, in this thriller from Josh Safran, an executive producer of CWs Gossip Girl and NBCs Smash. Like those shows, Quantico features an attractive cast with a bit of something for everyone: a tough Southern belle (Johanna Braddy), a compromised Mormon (Brian J. Smith), a complex Muslim (Yasmine Al Massri) and a conservative gay recruit (Tate Ellington). Then theres the no-nonsense mentor (Aunjanue Ellis), who immediately gives them a test: Find out a dark secret about a classmate within 24 hours or get sent packing. With its plot twists, flashbacks and Olivia Pope-like back story, Quantico feels like a Shonda Rhimes creation (Greys Anatomy, Scandal). If great TV takes many hands to make, competently O.K. TV like Quantico takes even more  it doesnt do much to hide its borrowings, James Poniewozik wrote in The New York Times. What remains to be seen is if Quantico is no more than what it appears to be or if theres a distinctive terror story underneath, like a mole with an exceptionally pretty disguise. (Image: Ms. Chopra.)

title: Ben Carson Dodges Question on Muslim President Comment
description: Ben Carson is riding a wave of frustration with politics as usual. But on Sunday he employed a time-honored tactic of those elected officials: dodging direct answers to specific questions.

description: UNITED NATIONS  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia called for a genuinely broad international coalition to fight the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Monday, and dismissed calls for the ouster of the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad.

title: Franois Hollande of France Says Assad Must Go
description: President Franois Hollande of France told the United Nations General Assembly on Monday that his country would shoulder its responsibilities in global efforts to end the fighting in Syria, but that the conflict could be resolved only if President Bashar al-Assad was removed from power.

title: Dilma Rousseff of Brazil Pledges to Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: President Dilma Rousseff of Brazil kicked off the United Nations General Assembly on Monday with an ambitious pledge to reduce her countrys greenhouse gas emissions by 43 percent over the next 15 years.

title: Global Citizen Festival

title: Iranians U.N. Speech Appears to Favor Engagement
description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran suggested on Monday in his United Nations speech that the nuclear agreement with major powers including the United States had helped create the basis for a broader engagement, in what appeared to be a difference  in tone, at least  with his own leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

title: Xi Jinping of China Calls for Cooperation and Partnerships in U.N. Speech
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Xi Jinping of China called for the countries of the world to make a new type of international relations featuring win-win cooperation, and create a community of a shared future for mankind.

title: Highlights of Pope Francis Remarks in the U.S.

title: Eagles Expose the Jets Deficiencies
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The last time the Jets began a season with three consecutive victories, it was six years ago, in Rex Ryans first year as coach. That bunch bragged about its swagger and its talent and its defense, about its everything  comporting itself, then, as the antithesis of the Jets under Todd Bowles today.

title: Review: Il Trovatore and Anna Bolena Showcase Courage and Command at the Met
description: Opera thrives on passion. Fans cherish singers who give their all, those artists who of course understand the techniques and styles of the genre, yet, when it counts, seem to put their lives on the line in their performances.

title: Review: Animals Asks When, and If, the Party Has to End
description: For a moment in Emma Jane Unsworths new book, Animals, it appears weve unwittingly blundered into some sort of millennial version of Bright Lights, Big City. Here is the narrator, using the second person in the first sentence, addressing us as co-conspirators from the depths of an epic hangover.

title: Review: Global Citizen Festival, Including Beyonc and Pearl Jam, Mixes Music and Activism
description: A lot of sensitive-guy earnestness surrounding a burst of female pop precision and dazzle  that was this years Global Citizen Festival on Saturday on the Great Lawn of Central Park. The pop came from Beyonc: singing, dancing, beaming and ending up just as hardheaded and socially conscious as the festivals other headliners  Pearl Jam, Ed Sheeran and Coldplay.

title: Some Players Relax After Mets Party, but Manager Ponders Playoff Strategy
description: CINCINNATI  When the Mets arrived at the visitors clubhouse Sunday morning, the scent of champagne still hung in the air and the carpet was still wet from their celebration the night before, after they had clinched their first postseason berth since 2006. Many players trudged in just after 11 a.m., with bags under their eyes and iced coffees in their hands.

title: Margaret Atwood, Digital Deep-Diver, Writes The Heart Goes Last
description: Like a mad scientist from one of her futuristic novels, Margaret Atwood is an avid tinkerer who seems willing to experiment with almost any digital technology.

title: Luis Severino Pitches Yankees a Step Closer to a Playoff Berth
description: As Dustin Ackley recently contemplated his future with the Yankees, he did not need to examine any tea leaves. Outfielders Brett Gardner, Jacoby Ellsbury and Carlos Beltran are all signed for next season, to the tune of $49.6 million. If Mark Teixeira, who is owed $23.1 million next year, cannot stay healthy at first base, Greg Bird has proved to be a capable replacement.

title: Xi Jinping Vows to Reaffirm Chinas Commitment to Womens Rights
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Xi Jinping of China, under pressure over the jailing of womens rights activists, promised on Sunday to reaffirm our commitment to gender equality and womens development, as Secretary General Ban Ki-moon of the United Nations gently reminded world leaders to protect human rights defenders.

title: Toy Story Boy
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  I first heard the term supervocalics in a Facebook group for word lovers, and have been fascinated by the concept ever since. A supervocalic is a word or phrase that uses all of the vowels  A, E, I, O, and U but not Y  exactly once (note that supervocalic itself is one such word). A eurysupervocalic, as proposed by writer Eric Chaikin, is a word or phrase that uses all of the vowels, including Y, exactly once (although the word eurysupervocalic itself fails the test because of the repeated u).

title: Questions Around Michel Platini Keep FIFAs Future Murky

What happens to Mr. Blatter is, of course, a significant story  the two criminal charges he may face carry the potential for jail time  but his ultimate fate with regard to FIFA is largely unchanged.

After three film screenings and a gala, the New York Philharmonics subscription season finally began on Friday with Mr. Salonens L.A. Variations, part of a brief and underwhelming program conducted by Alan Gilbert at David Geffen Hall.

title: Obama Tackles Poverty and Sexism in U.N. Speech
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Obama told a conclave of world leaders here on Sunday that millions of people should be saved through collective action to end extreme poverty and deadly infections, but he did not announce new initiatives to achieve those ends.
