description: On Monday morning, the Commerce Department will report the latest data on consumer spending and personal income in August. Wall Street is looking for healthy gains for consumers, with income up 0.4 percent and consumption rising 0.3 percent.

title: At U.N., Obama Focuses on Corruption, Inequality and Other Roadblocks to Sustainable Development
description: President Obama today joined the parade of leaders addressing a United Nations sessionhailingthe adoption of 17 Sustainable Development Goals for 2030, which range from extremely lofty (end poverty in all its forms everywhere) to doable but difficult (sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, halt and reverse land degradation, halt biodiversity loss). Explore all of the goals here.

title: Silicon Valley Lawyer, Gary Reback, Takes Antitrust Fight to Europe
description: MENLO PARK, Calif.  In the 1990s, Gary Reback was known as Silicon Valleys dragon slayer, a lawyer who persuaded the Justice Department to sue Microsoft, accusing it of abusing its dominant position in desktop computers. Newspapers and magazines called him an instigator who was Bill Gatess worst nightmare.

title: Marla Krolikowski, Transgender Teacher Fired for Insubordination, Dies at 62
description: Marla Krolikowski, who was fired from her job as a teacher at a Roman Catholic high school in Queens for insubordination after acknowledging in 2011 that she was transgender, died on Sept. 20 in Oceanside, N.Y. She was 62.

title: VWs Pitch to Americans Relied on Fun and Fantasy
description: Volkswagens big push in the United States revolved around making Americans love driving a diesel car again  a challenging task given the poor image diesel had endured since the 1980s.

title: A Smile Came Back to Prince Fielder, and an Award May Follow
description: HOUSTON  A veteran American League slugger was gone from the scene last season. His return, as a force at designated hitter in the middle of his lineup, has lifted his team into playoff position. He is enjoying the game again and has even been a clubhouse leader. He is the best choice for the A.L. Comeback Player of the Year Award.

title: Oregons Loss to Utah Heralds Changing of the Pac-12 Guard
description: It was a classic Saturday night at Oregons home field, Autzen Stadium. The game started slow, then exploded into a rout in the second and third quarters. There was a streak of six unanswered scores, all touchdowns. The victor dominated with more than 500 total yards in a 62-20 thrashing.

title: Brands Woo Millennials With a Wink, an Emoji or Whatever It Takes
description: David Perel spends at least an hour a day on his iPhone 6. He watches live sports on television and tries to catch The Late Show With Stephen Colbert on CBS, but he rarely tunes in to prime-time shows. He does not have a Netflix subscription, but he is thinking hard about getting one.

title: Haunted by Columbine
description: The killing of 12 students and a teacher at Columbine High School in 1999 continues to shape how we view and understand school shootings today.

title: When Columbine Is Invoked, Fears Tend to Overshadow Facts
description: It takes neither a clairvoyant nor a morbid personality to sense that, in time, the nightmare will return. We have already seen it often enough: Someone goes berserk and shoots up a school  typically a young man who turns a gun on himself after taking childrens lives, shattering families and leaving a tormented country to ponder how things went terribly wrong. Once again.

title: The Daily News Layoffs and Digital Shift May Signal the Tabloid Eras End
description: When it was over and the feature page was gone, dozens of reporters had been fired and the morning assignment editor was shown the door only minutes after handing out the mornings first assignments, The Daily News  or what was left of it  was in a state of shock.

title: David Wright, Aching for Glory, Is Finally Returning to the Playoffs
description: When David Wright wakes up, his back usually feels stiff. Cranky, as he says. Just walking around his house or down the street, he feels the crankiness, and the only way to help soothe it, Wright has found, is his elaborate pregame routine.

title: Chinese President Pushes Gender Equality
description: At a United Nations conference of global leaders, President Xi Jinping of China proposed a plan to support womens development worldwide.

title: U.S. Investigating Contract Awards in Buffalo Turnaround Project
description: Federal prosecutors investigating Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos marquee program to revitalize Buffalos economy have been examining how the government-funded projects were awarded, and whether state elected officials played a role in choosing who would benefit from the major infusion of funds.

title: Jeb Bush Readies Fund-Raising Push Ahead of Deadline
description: Jeb Bushs campaign has invited leading donors to its Miamiheadquarters on Monday for a fundraising call-a-thon, part of a finalpush to maximize their haul for this quarter ahead of the end-of-month finance deadline.

title: Katy Perry Steps Up Fight to Buy Los Angeles Convent
description: LOS ANGELES  Stepping up her fight to buy an eight-acre convent and retreat house here, the singer Katy Perry last week sued a rival would-be purchaser, whom she accused of interfering with her contractual and other rights.

title: Marshawn Lynch Injury Forces New Seattle Seahawks to Step Up
description: Marshawn Lynch did not appear on the Seattle Seahawks sideline until midway through the first quarter, and he could not remain healthy enough to stay in the entire game. But his teammates stepped up, helping ease the creeping fears caused by an 0-2 start for the two-time defending N.F.C. champions.

title: Pope Departs, After Showing a Deft Touch
description: PHILADELPHIA  Six days ago, Pope Francis landed in Washington for his first visit to the United States  a country that he did not know and that did not know him. He flew out Sunday night, having wowed Washington and New York, while leaving behind a downtown Philadelphia transformed into a Francisville of pilgrims, families and hawkers selling Francis swag.

title: No Histrionics From Todd Bowles, Just an Even Keel After a Jets Loss
description: After two impressive victories to start the season, I wondered how Todd Bowles, the Jets first-year head coach, would handle his teams first loss of the season.

title: Jordan Spieth Claims It All: Tournament, Cup, $10 Million and Top Ranking
description: ATLANTA  The value of money was driven home to Jordan Spieth at a young age by his parents, who sent him off by himself to play in junior golf tournaments to foster his independence but also as a cost-saving measure. If he returned without his phone charger, as happened multiple times, or lost another item he could not do without, he had to dip into his savings to buy a replacement.

title: Spring Awakening Returns
description: Scenes from Deaf West Theaters Broadway production.

title: Review: In Antigone at BAM, Agony and Despair in Inexorable Motion
description: A merciless sun blazes over Thebes in Ivo van Hoves doom-steeped production of Sophocles Antigone, which opened on Sunday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music with a highly distraught Juliette Binoche in the title role. As conceived by the set and lighting designer Jan Versweyveld, this ferocious orb dominates the back wall of the stage at the Harvey Theater like an all-seeing eye of fire, one that judges and withers everything it surveys.

title: Review: Spring Awakening by Deaf West Theater Brings a New Sensation to Broadway
description: One of the great musicals of the last decade was born anew on Sunday, when the thrillingly inventive Deaf West Theater production of Spring Awakening opened on Broadway at the Brooks Atkinson Theater. Any qualms theater-lovers might have about this being a premature, whiplash-inducing revival  the original  closed in 2009, after all  will vanish like frost in strong sunlight when the young cast of both hearing and deaf actors floods the stage.

title: Fear the Walking Dead Recap: I Saw the Devils Face
description: Season 1, Episode 5, Cobalt

title: Giving Up the Bench in Hopes of Bringing Justice to the Bronx
description: When Darcel D. Clark left a Bronx housing project for Boston College, and later Howard University School of Law, she did not forget the struggles of those she grew up with. She once told her college roommate that if she could do something about the drug deals and the crimes in the Bronx, she would.

title: A Columbine Student Recalls the Attack
description: Retro Report Voices: Sean Graves was told he would never walk again after being shot during the attack at Columbine High School. This is what happened next.

title: Pope Francis Visits: Day 9
description: Pope Francis wrapped up his two-day visit to Philadelphia, where he spoke on the matter of sexual abuse in the Roman Catholic Church before he flew back to Rome.

title: Review: LoftOpera, Finding Glamour Amid the Gritty, Performs Verdi
description: Fresh from attending Verdis Otello at the glittering opening night gala of the Metropolitan Opera last week, the contrasts between that event and a production by an adventurous young company in Brooklyn seemed particularly striking. Indeed, as I walked down a desolate street in Bushwick trying to find the Muse, a warehouse where LoftOpera was presenting an evening of Verdi, I thought perhaps I had taken a wrong turn. But I soon arrived at the graffiti-covered exterior of the building, a circus training school that has become yet another unlikely space for opera in New York.

title: The Best of Week 3 in the N.F.L.
description: Devonta Freeman had the unenviable task of filling in at running back against the Cowboys, who had allowed an N.F.L.-low 106 rushing yards. The test turned out to be not so tough, however: He ran for 141 yards and three scores in place of Tevin Coleman, helping the Falcons overcome three two-touchdown deficits. His final score, in the fourth quarter, gave Atlanta its first lead.

title: Limited Progress Seen Even as More Nations Step Up on Climate
description: The pledges that countries are making to battle climate change would still allow the world to heat up by more than 6 degrees Fahrenheit, a new analysis shows, a level that scientists say is likely to produce catastrophes ranging from food shortages to widespread extinctions of plant and animal life.

title: Richard E. Rainwater, Billionaire Texas Dealmaker, Dies at 71

title: Share of Immigrants in U.S. Nears Highs of Early 20th Century, Report Finds
description: In the 50 years since Congress broadly reconfigured immigration to open the country to newcomers from around the world, 59 million foreign-born people have come to the United States, more than quadrupling the number of immigrants who were in the country in 1965 and bringing their share of the population close to the peak of another great influx a century ago, according to a report published Monday by the Pew Research Center.

title: Whats on TV Monday
description: 6 P.M. (LMN) WINTERS BONE (2010) Jennifer Lawrence, in the breakthrough role that earned her an Oscar nomination, portrays Ree Dolly, a teenager in the Ozarks of Missouri who goes in search of her meth-cooking father after he puts up the family home to cover his bail and disappears. But her efforts to find him place her in a terrible dilemma: either betray the code of silence that keeps her clan proudly on the wrong side of the law or face destitution. The harshness in Debra Graniks regional-realist morality tale, based on Daniel Woodrells novel, is not there to illuminate a sociological condition, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. Something more primal, almost Greek in its archaic power, is at stake in Winters Bone, and its visual and emotional starkness do not feel like simple badges of authenticity. (Image: Ms. Lawrence.)

title: Congress Should Give the Government More Money for Wildfires
description: Wildfires that have burned more than eight million acres and are still raging in the West are draining the budgets of federal agencies and forcing them to divert money from essential environmental and land conservation programs to fight the fires. That is why Congress needs to start budgeting for forest fires in a different way, treating them more like natural disasters rather than a continuing expense. The Agriculture and Interior Departments have been making this case for some time, and its a good one.

title: Close Formula One Cockpits, Save Lives

title: An Ambitious Development Agenda From the U.N.
description: In the last 15 years, the world has made great progress in reducing poverty, in part because of eight targets known as Millennium Development Goals that the United Nations committed to in 2000. Each carried a 2015 deadline. One goal  of cutting extreme poverty by half as measured by the proportion of people living on less than $1.25 a day  was in fact met five years ahead of schedule. Maternal mortality was not cut by three-fourths, as the U.N. wanted, but it was cut nearly in half, no small achievement.

title: The Need for an Accountable Border Patrol

He was shot several times in the back by a United States Border Patrol agent, firing through the fence from Nogales, Ariz. The boy was unarmed; his family said he had been walking home from a basketball game.

But many more still die at the hands of black neighbors instead of the police. Yet today we rarely ask politicians to speak their names or recognize their dignity and worth.

This semester, preparing for a philosophy seminar with first-year honors students at Notre Dame, I reread with fresh eyes one of philosophys best-known arguments for belief in God  Pascals wager.

title: Changing the Subject, by Sven Birkerts
description: Sven Birkerts is an anxious man. By turns he is frightened, terrified, alarmed, filled with dread. On one occasion he shudders in his core; mostly he is just plain worried. What concerns him, a concern he is eager to transmit to us, is the rapid spread of computer, Internet and telephone technologies and more specifically what those technologies are doing to our minds. Forever glued to screens of one kind or another, clicking compulsively on the links others provide for us, we are losing the ability to concentrate, growing more itchy and agitated by the day, allowing our consciousness to be fragmented and dispersed. Our very selfhood is under threat as we are invited to think of achievement as a collective, rather than individual goal, a contribution to Wikipedia rather than a distinctive personal statement. At every step the Internet or GPS navigator puts us at a remove from the world and from our fellow human beings, deprives us of the agency we enjoyed when we had to go out and find things for ourselves rather than have them suggested to us. Rewired, as neuroscientists have now demonstrated, to adapt to the fitful back and forth of the web, our brains are no longer fit for the sustained attention that literature requires. Fewer young people are choosing to study the humanities. Fewer great works of art are being produced. There is a real risk of individuality being submerged in system. To make matters worse, a vast majority of people seem entirely happy with this state of affairs, to the point that anyone questioning the value of the new technologies is immediately deemed a Luddite if not a dinosaur.

title: Sherry Turkles Reclaiming Conversation
description: Sherry Turkle is a singular voice in the discourse about technology. Shes a skeptic who was once a believer, a clinical psychologist among the industry shills and the literary hand-wringers, an empiricist among the cherry-picking anecdotalists, a moderate among the extremists, a realist among the fantasists, a humanist but not a Luddite: a grown-up. She holds an endowed chair at M.I.T. and is on close collegial terms with the roboticists and affective-computing engineers who work there. Unlike Jaron Lanier, who bears the stodgy weight of being a Microsoft guy, or Evgeny Morozov, whose perspective is Belarussian, Turkle is a trusted and respected insider. As such, she serves as a kind of conscience for the tech world.

title: Testing Neurons With Ultrasound
description: Turning certain brain cells on and off with light  a technique called optogenetics  is one of the most important tools in neuroscience. It allows scientists to test basic ideas about how brains work. But because waves of visible light dont penetrate living tissue well, the technique requires the insertion of a conduit for the light into the brain  a very thin fiber optic cable.

title: 1915: Allies Stand Behind Balkans
description: LONDON  Sir Edward Grey made an important statement in the House of Commons this afternoon [Sept. 28] on the Balkan situation. He declared, replying to Sir P. Magnus, that Great Britain had no hostility toward the Bulgarian people, but, on the contrary, entertained a feeling of warm sympathy toward their aspirations. If, however, the mobilization in Bulgaria was not for defensive purposes and if Bulgaria assumed an aggressive attitude on the side of the enemy, Great Britain was prepared to give its Balkan friends all the support in its power, in concert with Britains Allies.  The New York Herald, European Edition, September 29, 1915

title: A Very British Tea Party at the Spotted Pig

The top plate of perfect cake is exciting too. Its rather fitting then that tomorrow, to celebrate the stateside debut of Ptaks The Violet Bakery Cookbook ($30, Ten Speed Press), the California-born baker will import a touch of that Brit tradition to New York, with a tea party at the Spotted Pig.

In August, the government issued an executive order cutting Commonwealth immigration from 20,300 a year to 8,500. The restriction had its heaviest effect on immigration from the West Indies, India and Pakistan.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 29, 1965

title: Putin Addresses U.N. on Syria
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia defended his countrys support of the Syrian government and criticized other western states policies in the Middle East.

title: Gigi Hadid Defends Herself Against Online Critics
description: The model Gigi Hadid, who is possessed of, by her own admission, a more womanly figure than many of the other models working fashions runways, appeared in the Versace show in Milan and has arrived in Paris for the fashion shows here.

title: Trump Plan Is Tax Cut for the Rich, Even Hedge Fund Managers
description: Donald Trumps tax plan, released Monday, does not live up to the populist language he has offered on taxes all summer.

title: Juilliards China Plans Move Forward
description: The Juilliard School announced on Monday that it was moving forward with plans to expand in China, saying that it had received preliminary approval to build, with several Chinese partners, a school in Tianjin that would offer a masters degree program.

title: Review: The Theater of War: Applying Greek Tragedies to Our Own
description: Many roads lead to a career in the healing professions, but the route Bryan Doerries describes in his memoir is as unique as the place it landed him.

title: Trump Announces Tax Plan
description: Donald J. Trump, the Republican presidential candidate, outlined his tax plan on Monday at a news conference in New York.

title: A New View of a Nebula Full of Newborn Stars
description: A dazzling image of Messier 17, a reddish nebula 5,500 light-years from Earth, provides a detailed view of its newborn stars, gas clouds and dust. The gas in the nebula has a mass about 30,000 times that of the sun, astronomers estimate. The center of the nebula is home to more than 800 stars, and more are forming in the outer regions. The nebula is near the plane of the Milky Way, in the constellation Sagittarius, and is named after Charles Messier, who discovered it in 1764. The image was captured by a telescope at La Silla Observatory in Chile.

title: London Cafes Cereal, at $5 a Bowl, Sets Off Wrath
description: The owner of a cereal cafe in rapidly gentrifying East London said his business had been unfairly targeted by demonstrators who attacked it over the weekend with smoke bombs and paint.

title: One Fish Stands Watch While Another Eats
description: Rabbitfish help one another in a way that had been observed only in mammals and highly social birds, according to a new study.

title: Gigi Hadids Fashion Month
description: Ms. Hadid walking various runways this season.

title: Allen Katz Finds Romance in His Food Mill
description: At the age of 16, Allen Katz tried to debone a rabbit in his familys kitchen in Baltimore. He wanted to make rabbit pt for Thanksgiving, though he had no idea what it should taste like.

title: Materials From Banksys Theme Park Going to a Migrant Camp in France
description: LONDON  Coming soon  Dismaland Calais. The graffiti artist Banksy announced on his website on Sunday that timber and other materials from his glum parody theme park Dismaland would be sent to the jungle  a camp for migrants and refugees in Calais, France.

title: Review: For DanceNows 20th Anniversary, an Encore at Joes Pub
description: At Joes Pub on Thursday, a woman at one table was salting her food heavily. In a thick New York accent, she complained about her husband. She tossed salt over her shoulder in great arcs, but no one was hit because she had a tiny bit more space around her than everyone else. She was onstage.

title: Sia and Charli XCX Cover Bleachers on a Women-Led Version of Strange Desire
description: Cover albums are having a big month.

title: President Obamas Speech to the United Nations General Assembly 2015
description: The following speech was delivered by President Obama at the United Nations General Assembly as transcribed and released by the White House.

title: Donald Trump Unveils Plan to Overhaul Tax Code With Broad Cuts
description: Calling it his personal wheelhouse, Donald J. Trump laid out a plan on Monday to revamp the tax code, seeking to reduce taxes for people at most income levels with simplification and by reducing rates, while also eliminating deductions and certain breaks that allow the wealthy and corporations to avoid paying extra.

title: Maxwell Anderson Resigns as Director of Dallas Museum of Art
description: The Dallas Museum of Art announced on Monday that Maxwell L. Anderson  who has served as its director for almost four years and helped increase attendance while expanding the museums scope into areas like Islamic art  had resigned. A statement from the museum did not explain Mr. Andersons unexpected departure, except to say that he had accepted a position as director of grant programs at the New Cities Foundation in New York.

title: Review: Grandfathered and The Grinder, Two New Fox Sitcoms
description: Im a 50-year-old bachelor, says Jimmy Martino (John Stamos), the protagonist of Grandfathered. Were societys most worthless people.

title: Super Blood Moon Photos: The Good and the Bad
description: Those lucky enough to have clear skies on Sunday night were treated to a rare astronomical phenomenon.

title: Armani and Missoni: In the Shadow of the Supermoon
description: MILAN  Milan Fashion Week came to a close just after a total lunar eclipse, the sort that indicates heavenly bodies in perfect alignment. As portents go, it doesnt get much better than that.

title: Nations Rail Service Is Threatened as Deadline for Safety System Looms
description: WASHINGTON  Even after spending nearly $6 billion, the rail industry says it will not be able to meet its year-end government-imposed deadline to install a system known as positive train control, which is intended to prevent collisions or derailments caused by excessive speed.

title: Edith Wharton House Museum Retires Debt
description: The Mount, the former home of Edith Wharton, has announced that it has made final payments to its lenders and no longer carries any debt, bringing to a close a financial saga that might have come from the pages of a novel by its onetime owner.

title: Children With H.I.V. More Likely to Die of Malaria
description: Children infected with H.I.V. appear much more likely than those who are not to die with severe malaria, a new study has found. It may make sense to give these children malaria drugs protectively, the authors said.

title: Espelette Pepper Expands Reach to Butter
description: Lately, it seems as though the French will dust almost anything, even ice cream, with Espelette pepper, which is made from chiles grown in a designated area of the Basque Country. Now, imported Espelette butter has hit the American market, joining mustards, oils, mayonnaise and other items fueled with the ruddy spice. Slice the ingots of cultured, hand-churned, forcefully seasoned butter into pats to top a steak or fish. Or simply spread the butter on toast or crackers for canaps, perhaps crowned with a patch of cured ham: Beurre des Aldudes with Espelette pepper, $6 for 5.3 ounces at Le District, 225 Liberty Street (West Street), 212-981-8588, ledistrict.com.

title: Rouhani Addresses U.N. General Assembly
description: The president of Iran, Hassan Rouhani, said a new chapter had started in his countrys relations with the world in his speech at the United Nations.

title: Nationals Jonathan Papelbon Suspended for Fight With Bryce Harper
description: Washington Nationals closer Jonathan Papelbon will miss the rest of the season after the team suspended him Monday for grabbing Bryce Harper by the throat in the dugout Sunday.

title: Is It Old Age, or A.D.H.D.?
description: The 73-year-old widow came to see Dr. David Goodman, an assistant professor in the psychiatry and behavioral sciences department at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, after her daughter had urged her to see somebody for her increasing forgetfulness. She was often losing her pocketbook and keys and had trouble following conversations, and 15 minutes later couldnt remember much of what was said.

title: As Banks Retreat, Private Equity Rushes to Buy Troubled Home Mortgages
description: Private equity and hedge fund firms have bought more than 100,000 troubled mortgages at a discount from banks and federal housing agencies, emerging as aggressive liquidators for the remains of the mortgage crisis that erupted nearly a decade ago.

title: Lies, Carly Fiorina and Abortion
description: There has been an impressiveamount of angry liberal commentary, which has spilled over into the mainstream press coverage (or do I repeat myself?) of the issue, about how in the last Republican presidential debate Carly Fiorina allegedly citedan entirely imaginary video in order to make a crazy claim about Planned Parenthoods brain-harvesting ghoulishness thats totally unsupported by the facts.Heres Slates Dahlia Lithwick, in a representative rant, attackingFiorinas big fib, the sheer enormity of which has shaken Lithwicks faith in honesty in politics and journalism:

title: Many Conservative Republicans Believe Climate Change Is a Real Threat
description: WASHINGTON  A majority of Republicans  including 54 percent of self-described conservative Republicans  believe the worlds climate is changing and that mankind plays some role in the change, according to a new survey conducted by three prominent Republican pollsters.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch
description: Yes, there are Champions League games this week, and yes, you should probably take a peek at Bayer Leverkusen at Barcelona on Tuesday (2:45 p.m., Eastern time, Fox Sports 1), if only to see how Bara functions without a certain Argentine who will be out the next two months. But outside of that, watching soccer this week is pretty simple.

title: Scientists on Evidence of Water on Mars
description: NASA scientists said Monday that they had found evidence of liquid water on Mars.

title: Hip-Hop and R&B Fans Embrace Streaming Music Services
description: On this weeks music charts, What a Time to Be Alive, a new mix tape by the star rappers Drake and Future, opened at No. 1 by a wide margin, it was announced on Monday  a victory for Apple, which had an exclusive deal to release the album first.

title: The Secret Gardens of New York
description: Six hidden gardens where weary city dwellers and visitors can slip in for a quick sip of nature, or linger through an afternoon.

title: Facts & Figures: Even Republicans Dont Want to Shut Down the Government
description: A majority of Americans  and a smaller majority of Republicans  say they dont support a government shutdown over Planned Parenthood funding, according to a new poll.

title: Toledo Museum to Return Four Antiquities Bought From Dealer Now Accused of Smuggling
description: The Toledo Museum of Art has decided to return four pieces of rare Indian artwork on display there to India after concluding that their provenance had been falsified or could not be verified. All four of the ancient objects had been purchased from Subhash Kapoor, a former New York art dealer who is awaiting trial in India on charges of theft and smuggling.

title: Frances Hollande Addresses U.N.
description: President Franois Hollande of France spoke to the General Assembly on Monday about climate change and the role of Bashar al-Assad in Syria.

title: Giants Victor Cruz Returns to Practice
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Giants wide receiver Victor Cruz returned to practice Monday for the first time in more than a month and ran about 20 pass routes without discomfort in either his surgically rebuilt right knee or his strained left calf muscle. Cruz said after the hourlong workout that he was convinced that he would play when the Giants visit the surging Buffalo Bills on Sunday.

title: Burkina Faso Coup Plotters Refuse to Give Up Arms, Imperiling Deal
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  The troops who staged a failed coup in Burkina Faso have refused to give up their weapons under a political deal negotiated last week by West African leaders, the countrys transitional government said on Monday.

title: Plea Deal for Dennis Hastert Is Being Discussed, Lawyers Say
description: CHICAGO  Lawyers for J. Dennis Hastert, the former speaker of the House of Representatives, have been discussing a possible plea agreement with prosecutors to resolve charges that Mr. Hastert lied to F.B.I. agents and illegally structured bank withdrawals, a federal court hearing revealed on Monday.

title: Who Should Have Access to DNA Evidence?
description: Next week, the West Virginia Supreme Court will hear a case in which 30 former prosecutors from around the country have taken the unusual step of siding with the defense. Its a battle over a DNA test, and whether prosecutors must turn the results over to a defendant when they point to his innocence  even if he has made the decision to plead guilty.

title: 7 New Legionnaires Cases in Bronx Prompt Investigation
description: Seven people in the Morris Park section of the Bronx have Legionnaires disease, officials said on Monday, spurring an investigation into the potential source.

title: New York Film Festivals Past
description: Images from previous iterations of the New York Film Festival.

title: Roger Waters on Reinventing The Wall and Plans for a Final Arena Show
description: Roger Waters keeps returning to The Wall, the 1979 concept album he wrote when he was the leader of Pink Floyd. But he is not simply looking back.

title: TalibanPose for Victory Selfies in Afghan City
description: As some veteran foreign correspondents pointed out, watching Taliban insurgents storm into the northern Afghan city of Kunduz on Monday and declare their intention to govern according to Islamic law seemed to echo the way the city was taken by Western-backed, Islamist mujahedeen in 1988, just days after the withdrawal of Soviet troops.

title: Getting Older After the Apocalypse
description: Every now and then the Internet serves up something perfectly pitched to what you assumed were your own very individual fears.

title: Silent Barn, a Brooklyn Arts Space, Is Damaged in a Fire
description: Silent Barn, the D.I.Y. arts space in Bushwick, Brooklyn, known for its sweaty punk shows and its strong support for performers, is in rebuilding mode after a fire on Friday in its residential area led to significant damage.

title: Planned Parenthood to Offer Free S.T.D. Testing on National Pink Out Day
description: Its not unusual for contenders in political battles to try to win support with giveaways, a candidate offering tax cuts, for instance, or a labor union giving out free coffee and donuts at a rally. But Planned Parenthood, now embroiled in a fierce fight with Congressional Republicans, is taking the concept to a whole new level: free testing for sexually transmitted diseases.

title: Drake and Future Lead a Billboard Chart Featuring Two Versions of 1989
description: In a busy week of new music releases, Drake and Futures mixtape What a Time to Be Alive opened at No. 1 on the Billboard chart, followed by new albums by Lana Del Rey, Mac Miller, David Gilmour and Ryan Adams.

title: Jeff Daniels and Michelle Williams to Star in Blackbird on Broadway
description: Nine years after he played the same role Off Broadway, the actor Jeff Daniels will star in a Broadway production of Blackbird as a man who sexually abused a young girl.

title: Former C.E.O. of VW Under Investigation
description: Prosecutors announced that they are investigating Martin Winterkorn, who resigned as Volkswagens chief executive following revelations of emissions cheating software in the companys cars.

title: A New Effort Has Doctors Turn Patients Into Donors
description: A well-to-do cancer patient is nearing the end of her treatments. During an office visit, she says to her doctor, I cant thank you enough for the care you provided.

title: British Labour Party, Wary of Old Image, Puts Its Focus on Prudence
description: BRIGHTON, England  When the Labour Party chose Jeremy Corbyn, an outsider from the partys hard left, as its new leader this month, critics worried that a turn away from centrist policies would relegate the party to Britains political sidelines, as it was in the 1980s during the Margaret Thatcher years.

title: A Small Step in Changing S.E.C. Administrative Proceedings
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has been pestered with complaints over its move to file more administrative proceedings before in-house judges, including proceedings involving complex matters like insider trading and accounting fraud that used to be brought in federal district courts.

title: Broadway Takes a Hit as a Pope and a Holiday Distract New York
description: The combination of Yom Kippur and a papal visit took a whack out of Broadway grosses last week, when all but a handful of shows experienced declines at the box office.

title: Review: In I Must Be Living Twice and Chelsea Girls, Eileen Myles Ruminates
description: I had always figured if I had a book Id want my face all over it, the narrator of Eileen Myless autobiographical cult novel Chelsea Girls (1994) thinks to herself at a party for one of her early poetry collections.

title: How Many Deaths Did Volkswagens Deception Cause in the U.S.?
description: Volkswagens diesel deception unleashed tons of extra pollutants in the United States, pollutants that can harm human health. So while many commentators have been quick to say that the cheating engines are not a highway safety concern, safety  as in health  is still an issue.

title: Review: TruTVs Adam Ruins Everything Challenges Beliefs About Giving
description: Adam Conovers new television series isnt the first dedicated to the fine art of debunking, but its one of the most entertaining.

title: Xi Jinping Addresses General Assembly
description: President Xi of China spoke to the United Nations General Assembly on Monday and pledged the countrys support for peacekeeping forces and the African Union.

title: Defining Australian Cuisine at the Sydney Opera House
description: I feel a gigantic responsibility to get it right, says the Australian chef Peter Gilmore as he surveys the cathedral-like dining room of Sydney Opera Houses Bennelong restaurant, which he newly helms. It is a highly scrutinized stage; and in the 42 years since the Sydney Opera House first welcomed diners at Bennelong, a succession of high-profile restaurateurs have run the famous kitchen  and ultimately been brought undone by the unique pressures of operating under the iconic white sails.

title: The Raft Economy: Reporters Notebook
description: The smuggler met us at a busy kebab restaurant in Izmir, Turkey, and instead of sitting at an inside table where he could discuss his work privately, he chose seats on the sidewalk, clearly visible to pedestrians, the police and anyone else who happened to be passing by.

title: Michelle Obamas Recent Looks
description: Mrs. Obama has embraced an enviable position at the intersection of pop culture and politics  just because she can.

title: At State Dinner, Michelle Obama Grabs Back the Spotlight
description: Friday night may have been a watershed for Michelle Obama. At the White House dinner for the Chinese president, Xi Jinping, the first lady summoned previously untapped, and perhaps unsuspected, reserves of glamour.

title: Charles Masson Finds a New Home
description: Charles Masson, the restaurateur who left La Grenouille last year as a result of a family spat and was briefly at Chevalier in the Baccarat Hotel & Residences, will be the managing director of a new restaurant on the Upper East Side.

title: First Draft Focus: The Worlds Undivided Attention
Amazon Envisions a New Tech Hub as It Expands Its Detroit Presence
description: Amazon plans to expand its Detroit office, adding more full-time jobs in hopes of creating a technology hub.

title: London Gets in the Halloween Spirit
description: From witches to a Victorian medium and ghost tours, London is ready for Halloween.

title: Inside the Vibrant New Rooms of Pariss Hotel Montana
description: La Montana was a popular Parisian jazz club in the 1950s  just a stones throw from Les Deux Magots, it drew a Left-Bank literary crowd that included James Baldwin and Parisian polymath Boris Vian. In the 60s, the designer Jean-Charles de Castelbajac frequented Montana  and soon it became, as it is today, one of Pariss most exclusive clubs.

title: Pariss Vibrant (And Surrealist) Hotel Montana
description: Each room in the hotel, which was designed by Vincent Darr, is inspired by a different creative person.

title: The Daily Shoe: Arthur Arbesser
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: The Daily Jewel: Giorgio Armani
description: T plucks the best jewelry right off the runway.

title: Hotel Owners Looking to Stay Current Put Money in Properties
description: Investing at record levels, owners of hotels across the United States are doing everything from rewiring their rooms and buying smart TVs, to replacing bathtubs with more easily maintained walk-in showers.

title: Hillary Clinton Calls Jeb Bushs Free Stuff Comment Deeply Insulting
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton unloaded on Jeb Bush on Monday, calling it deeply insulting that he had suggested that Democratic presidential candidates had tried to appeal to black voters by offering free stuff.

title: From Cheap Oil to #ShellNo Protests, a Look at Factors in Shells Arctic Retreat
description: Given the complex array of factors shaping any decision related to energy, its always wise to consider an Agatha Christie everyone didit explanation when something big happens.

title: Driving to Work With Keith Hernandez, the Real Mr. Met
description: You wander down a gravel driveway, past oaks and purple-red Japanese maples toward Keith Hernandezs Sag Harbor, N.Y., pad, a handsome single-floor house.

title: Newborn Is Found Dead After Fall From Bronx Building
description: Detectives are investigating the death of a newborn  her umbilical cord still attached  who fell several stories from a Bronx apartment building into an alleyway on Monday, the authorities said.

title: The Daily Bag: Trussardi
description: T plucks the best bags right off the runway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Volkswagen Faces Harsher Penalties Than a U.S. Company Might
description: Volkswagen picked the wrong market for its emissions trickery. The German carmaker has come up against the United States legal system, which extracts bigger fines and more guilty pleas from overseas companies than from their American counterparts. Differences in the cases may explain the discrepancy. But any prosecutorial bias may attract as much scrutiny as VWs dirty tricks.

title: Coke Spends Lavishly on Pediatricians and Dietitians
description: When the American Academy of Pediatrics needed support for a website it created to promote childrens health, it turned to a surprising partner: Coca-Cola.

title: U.S. Commerce Chief Heading to Cuba for Talks
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will dispatch Penny Pritzker, the commerce secretary, to Cuba next week to discuss a raft of new rules easing American travel and business between the nations, the first such high-level talks since he announced he was normalizing relations with a Cold War adversary.

title: Ridley Scott Learned About Water on Mars Before We Did, but Not in Time to Change Martian
description: NASA surprised the world on Monday with its announcement that it had found water on Mars. This wasnt news, though, to the director Ridley Scott, whose latest film, The Martian, opens on Friday, and revolves around the struggles of a stranded astronaut and botanist, played by Matt Damon, to survive on the red planet by himself for more than a year.

title: Giorgio Armani
description: The life of a legend, in pictures.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Vote Fails to Settle Dispute on Secession by Catalonia
description: BARCELONA, Spain  For three years, Catalonia has been at loggerheads with the central government in Madrid over whether the prosperous northeastern region  a fifth of Spains economy  could secede.

title: Volkswagen Scandal Highlights European Stalling on New Emissions Tests
description: BRUSSELS  European legislators got a jolt this month in their long-running effort to update auto-emissions standards when a German member of the European Parliament suddenly proposed exempting a whole class of vehicles.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Asking for It Uses Wit to Tackle Cultural Norms About Rape
description: At the Creek and the Cave, the club-turned-bar-turned-Mexicali-joint now hosting Adrienne Truscotts Asking for It, there is a two-for-one margarita offer. Go ahead and get your order in. This hourlong show, a performance-art riff on rape performed by a mostly naked woman, is both chirpy and blistering. It rewards and invites a strong drink.

title: Review: In Chambre, Jack Ferver and Marc Swanson Refract a Tale of Murderous Maids
description: The choreographer Jack Ferver specializes in prickly, playful queer dance theater, sometimes inspired by classics (Antony and Cleopatra), sometimes by cult favorites (Poltergeist). In Chambre, an impish if insubstantial piece for the French Institute Alliance Franaises annual Crossing the Line festival, he takes a barbed feather duster to Jean Genets The Maids, inspired by a real-life pair of murderous domestics.

title: 12 Projects to Know from the London Design Festival
description: Moreso than most other design fairs, the London Design Festival  which takes place every September at shops and venues across the city  is known for showcasing the ingenuity of its local talents, rather than international brands or bussed-in superstars. From the 2015 London Design Medal, presented to Barber Osgerby, to the 60-foot-tall Swarovski totem by young up-and-comer Kim Thome that greeted visitors at the Victoria & Albert Museum, last weeks show was no exception. It proved, too, that the London scene is as strong as ever, with RCA grads like Thome, Marcin Rusak and Silo Studio making intriguing innovations in process and materials while brands like SCP (with new pieces by Peter Marigold and Oscar Coakley), Benchmark (with a new collection of spartan wood furniture by Max Lamb) and 1882 Ltd. (with new ceramics by young designer Maria Jeglinska) continue to connect the dots between British designers and British factories. See below for some of the homegrown highlights from this years Festival.

title: Review: In Elements of Oz, Smartphones Enhance a Celebration of The Wizard of Oz Film
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  Next time Ill bring one of my grandsons, cracked a woman behind me at Elements of Oz, a technologically sophisticated new show from the Builders Association that riffs on the celebrated movie The Wizard of Oz.

title: The World of Giorgio Armani
description: In celebration of 40 years in fashion, the opening of a new museum and his first-ever book, a tribute to Giorgio Armani.

title: Q. and A.: Eugenio B. Bito-onon Jr. on Chinas Island Expansion
description: Eugenio B. Bito-onon Jr., the mayor of Pag-asa, a small island off the west coast of the Philippines, is accustomed to worrying about the well-being of the islands 142 chickens, or haranguing fishermen about the dangers of Emperador brandy, a local favorite. But lately, Mr. Bito-onon, 59, has been preoccupied by a different problem.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Most Americans Say Planned Parenthood Fight Isnt Worth a Shutdown, Poll Finds
description: The American public isnt paying much attention as the deadline looms to fund the government and avoid a government shutdown. Yet, there is strong bipartisan agreement that it is unacceptable for members of Congress to threaten a government shutdown as a bargaining tactic, and most Americans think Planned Parenthood should continue to receive government funding, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: September 28, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, India, Italy and the United States.

title: The Deities of Mens Style
description: Though roughly 330 million deities populate the Hindu heavens, there are only a handful most people worship daily and know by name. Similarly, though there are about 330 billion images of celebrity divinities floating around the web empyrean at any given moment, when it comes down to it we seem inevitably to worship the same group of guys. This is meant in terms of style.

title: Treasury Lawyer to Join Paul Weiss Law Firm
description: A top lawyer at the Treasury Department will soon join Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, bolstering the firms litigation practice in Washington.

title: Chip Cards Will Require Users to Dip Rather Than Swipe
description: In the hustle and rush of New York, some diners at the Stage Door Deli in Manhattan may not even notice the extra three or four seconds it takes to buy their lunch.

title: A Breast Cancer Surgeon Who Keeps Challenging the Status Quo
description: Late one afternoon this summer, Dr. Laura J. Esserman, a breast cancer surgeon at the University of California, San Francisco, sat in a darkened room scrutinizing a breast M.R.I. With a clutch of other clinicians at her side, she quickly homed in on a spot smaller than a pencil eraser.

title: Yahoo to Go Forward With Alibaba Stake Spinoff
description: Yahoo signaled on Monday that it was willing to risk a fight with the federal government to spin off its 15 percent stake in the Alibaba Group, the Chinese Internet giant.

title: Elements of Oz
description: Scenes from the Builders Association show at Montclair State University.

title: As Online Data Theft Escalates, Banks Look to Retailers to Bear the Losses
description: On Sept. 1 last year, the website Rescator, known as the Amazon.com of the black market, alerted its customers that huge quantities of stolen debit and credit card data would go on sale the next day.

title: Ral Castro Addresses U.N.
description: The Cuban president spoke out against the militarization of cyberspace.

title: Keurig Aims to Lift Profits With Cold Drinks Machine
description: Keurig Green Mountain, the struggling coffee and coffee maker company, is hoping a pricey new machine for concocting cold drinks will help improve its fortunes.

title: Senate Backs Spending Measure to Avert Shutdown
description: WASHINGTON  After a brief trading of angry recriminations, Senate Republicans and Democrats voted Monday to advance a temporary spending measure that would avert a shutdown of the federal government on Wednesday night but also signals a battle in the weeks ahead.

title: Competing Worldviews
description: President Obama and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia addressed the United Nations General Assembly in September and presented two very different views of world events.

title: Nepal Rations Fuel as Political Crisis With India Worsens
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Nepal began rationing fuel on Monday to cope with a worsening shortage brought on by continuing unrest over the countrys new Constitution and a dispute with neighboring India.

title: Chick Corea and Bla Fleck, Reveling in Their High-Wire Interplay
description: The greatest commonality between the pianist Chick Corea and the banjoist Bla Fleck  an uncorked, virtuoso ebullience that transcends the limits of traditionalism  also poses their only potential stumbling block. The duo probably understood this when they made their first joint album, The Enchantment (Concord), eight years ago. But it took some time to find their conversational rhythm, a high-wire interplay responsive and engaging enough to avoid diminishing returns.

title: Knicks Cast Eyes Ahead, Not Back at Their Wreck
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  For one full week late this summer, the self-described centerpiece of the Knicks tutored the future of the organization (or so the hope goes) by playing game after game of one-on-one. Each contest between Carmelo Anthony and Kristaps Porzingis went to 5 points. Each player was permitted only two dribbles per possession.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Parking Rules Suspended on Tuesday
description: Because of Sukkot, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Tuesday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: The Syria Problem at the United Nations
description: At the 70th annual session of the United Nations General Assembly, world leaders addressed the war in Syria, which has contributed to the rise to ISIS and a global migrant crisis.

title: Seeking the Unexpected During Fashion Week
description: As hundreds of photographers descend on Paris this week to capture the latest fashion trends, Landon Nordeman prefers to turn his camera on his subjects with unexpected angles, patterns and textures.

title: Covert Electronic Surveillance Prompts Calls for Transparency
description: Law enforcement officials across the United States have become enamored of the StingRay, an electronic surveillance device that can covertly track criminal suspects and is being used with little public disclosure and often under uncertain legal authority. Now, though, some states are pushing back, and are requiring the police to get a court order and local consent before turning to the high-tech tool.

title: In Florida, Senator Marco Rubio Talks With Retirees About Age
description: THE VILLAGES, Fla.  Senator Marco Rubio, his presidential campaign enjoying a jolt of sudden popularity, came to this sprawling retirement community on Monday and asked nearly 1,000 people who were old enough to be his parents to take a gamble on a young guy for president.

title: The Music May Stop at a Storied Manhattan Studio
description: Like a Virgin. Born in the U.S.A. Tattoo You. Claptons Unplugged.

title: No, You Dont Need to Post a Facebook Copyright Status
description: In recent days, you might have seen Facebook statuses imploring you to post legalish language that purports to shield your photographs and other information from copyright violations.

title: Yankees Have a High Payroll, Sure, but They Make Smart Moves, Too
description: The Yankees reported for work Monday with a chance to do something they had not done in three years, something that once was easy to take for granted. If they beat the Boston Red Sox, and three other teams lost, the Yankees could clinch a spot in the postseason.

title: Facebook and Google, Two Giants in Digital Ads, Seek More
description: Madison Avenue is still the heart of the advertising business. But on the first day of Advertising Week, a top industry convention in Manhattan, it was clear how much influence resides in Silicon Valley.

title: Colleges Vow to Simplify Application Process
description: Seeking to make college application easier for disadvantaged students, a coalition of selective colleges and universities said Monday that it would design a simplified application and an online program for college planning throughout high school. The coalition of more than 80 public and private schools includes many of the most prestigious in the country. The online tools, which will be unveiled next year, would give students a place to store schoolwork, get advice, and collect information on colleges and financial aid and link it to the new application. If it is adopted by high schools and community groups, coalition members say, it could partly make up for the fact that many low-income students receive little guidance on getting into college. The simplified application would be an alternative to others now in use, like the Common Application, but would not replace them.

title: Some Counts Dismissed in Indictment of Robert Menendez
description: A federal judge on Monday threw out four bribery charges against Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey and a wealthy political benefactor, but kept largely intact the lengthy corruption indictment against Mr. Menendez and his longtime patron.

title: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Failure of Training Syrian Rebels
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton said on Sunday that the inability of the United States military to train Syrian rebels to fight against the Islamic State on the ground had exacerbated the crises in the region.

title: Donald Trump Will Appear on Fox Again After All
description: Less than a week after he said he would not be doing any more Fox shows for the foreseeable future, Donald J. Trump is set to appear Tuesday night on the networks The OReilly Factor, the network confirmed.

title: Oklahoma Court Rejects Death Row Inmates Plea for Hearing
description: The execution of an Oklahoma inmate can proceed on Wednesday, a deeply divided state appellate court ruled Monday, rejecting his lawyers request for a new hearing to present evidence that they say shows he is innocent.

title: Sheri M. Goldhirsch, Who Nurtured Young Playwrights, Dies at 55
description: Sheri M. Goldhirsch, the artistic director of Young Playwrights Inc., an organization that produces the work of dramatists who are no more than 18, died on Sept. 22 in Manhattan. She was 55.

title: Investors Fears on Commodities Add to Pressure on Share Prices
description: Stocks fell sharply on Monday as investors added new fears to the list of concerns that have weighed on global markets in recent weeks.

title: Putin and Obama Have Profound Differences on Syria
description: Speaking at the United Nations on Monday, President Obama and President Vladimir Putin of Russia affirmed the need for international cooperation. But those sentiments are undermined by profound differences on the nature of the Syrian crisis  differences that provide little hope for resolving a conflict that has killed more than 250,000 people.

title: Puerto Rico Officials to Testify on Debt Crisis Before Senate Panel
description: Puerto Rican officials will appear before a skeptical United States Senate panel on Tuesday to explain why the island may need federal assistance by the end of the year and how lawmakers preoccupied with the federal debt might help without setting an unwelcome precedent.

title: Obama and Putin Play Diplomatic Poker Over Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS  After circling each other for the past year, President Obama and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia squared off on Monday at the United Nations in dueling speeches that presented starkly different views on the Syrian crisis and how to bring stability to the Middle East.

title: The Perils of Forcing a Sale of Illiquid Assets
description: Boaz Weinstein, the hedge fund manager famous for betting against the JPMorgan Chase trader known as the London Whale, is being accused of his own accounting chicanery.

title: Rallying Global Support, Obama Pledges Larger U.S. Role in Peacekeeping Missions
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Obama announced Monday that the United States would bolster its support for United Nations peacekeeping missions worldwide, as he rallied more than 50 countries to promise to expand their contributions, amounting to around 40,000 new soldiers and police officers.

title: As Worries Rise and Players Flee, a Missouri School Board Cuts Football
description: MAPLEWOOD, Mo.  Students and families at Maplewood Richmond Heights High School are looking forward to homecoming, the highlight of the autumn school calendar for decades. But for the first time, the centerpiece event will be soccer, not football.

title: Fiat Chrysler Union Contract Faces Hurdles
description: The tentative contract deal between Fiat Chrysler and its autoworkers union is encountering stiff resistance in early voting, with several plants rejecting it outright and endangering an agreement that would serve as a template for talks with General Motors and Ford Motor.

title: Lebanon: TV Executive Is Fined in Case Tied to Hariri Tribunal
description: A judge at an international tribunal on Monday fined Karma al-Khayat, an executive with Al Jadeed TV in Lebanon, 10,000 euros  more than $11,000  for contempt of court. The judge, Nicola Lettieri of Italy, had earlier found Ms. Khayat guilty of ignoring a court order relating to confidential witnesses in the investigation of the 2005 killing of former Prime Minister Rafik Hariri of Lebanon. Interviews in the disputed TV series from 2012 exposed 11 men whom it described as being on a confidential list from the witness protection program of the Special Tribunal for Lebanon. Ms. Khayat, who was deputy head of news at the time, said the broadcasts, in which names were withheld, aimed to show there were leaks from the court. But Judge Lettieri said that the journalistic profession may not be used as an impenetrable shield.

title: Exuberance and Disappointment at Shells About-Face in the Arctic
description: SEATTLE  For many Alaskans,Mondaywas a huge disappointment, a really big disappointment, as Gov. Bill Walker put it, reflecting on the tax revenue, jobs and investments that may be lost as Royal Dutch Shell abandons its plan to drill for oil in the Alaskan Arctic.

title: Search for Speaker to Replace John Boehner Falls to Splintered Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  The right flank of John A. Boehners party may have pushed him out of the House speakers chair, but it will take members of every faction of the House Republicans to choose his successor. As the scramble to replace Mr. Boehner  and fill the leadership posts beneath him  begins in earnest this week, a few dozen members who spent several years tormenting the speaker feel deeply empowered in determining the outcome.

title: Review: Revisiting Gertrude Steins Writings in Reread Another
description: Reread Another, which opened at the Bushwick Starr in January, reopened on Monday at the Brick. Here are excerpts from Ben Brantleys review, which appeared in The New York Times on Jan. 12; the full text is here.

title: Review: Fondly, Collette Richland Offers Open-Eyed Dreaming
description: Lets go dreaming, shall we? Cmon, itll be fun. Nothing will make any sense at all, and everything will make perfect sense. Youll feel that youre in a wild, bright land that you didnt know existed, but one that youre still somehow sure that youve visited before. Whats more, this is a dream  one of the most entertaining youre ever likely to have  that you get to experience while youre wide-awake.

title: A Very Long Time
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  I ran into a few different speed bumps in Kurt Krausss puzzle, which is unusual for me on a Tuesday. EDGAR Lee Masters was EDWIN for a while, and ACE TEN was ACES UP.

title: Staten Island Ferry Riders Helping to Pick New Seats
description: While tourists gather on one side of the Staten Island Ferry to catch a glimpse of the Statue of Liberty, commuters often have another priority in mind: finding a quiet place to sit during the maritime leg of their journey.

title: Lawsuit Filed Against Porsche in Fast & Furious Actors Death
description: Meadow Rain Walker, the daughter of the Fast & Furious star Paul Walker, on Monday filed suit in Los Angeles against Porsche Cars North America and its parent company, among others, claiming the carmaker left crucial safety features off the high-powered Carrera GT in which Mr. Walker died in 2013. The lawsuit, filed in Los Angeles County Superior Court, seeks unspecified damages for the defects that Ms. Walkers lawyers say kept the actor trapped inside the car when it crashed and burst into flames. The lawsuit says the car lacked an electronic stability control system, and had side reinforcement bars that were weaker, for instance, than those on mass-market cars like the Honda Civic. Porsche representatives did not immediately respond to queries. Mr. Walker died while on a break in the filming of Furious 7, the latest in the Universal Pictures franchise.

title: Possible Candidates for a Brokered House Speaker Race
description: With Representative Kevin McCarthys stunning decision to withdraw from the race for speaker on Thursday, the Republican leadership elections were turned upside down. The competitive races were supposed to be those for lower-tier positions. Now the big uncertainty is who the next speaker will be.

title: Owner of Grand Central Sues Developer and City for $1.1 Billion Over Air Rights
description: When he bought Grand Central Terminal nine years ago, Andrew S. Penson figured that the unused development rights, or air rights, over the countrys busiest train station were worth a fortune.

title: U.S. Discloses 2014 Warrantless Surveillance Program Court Documents
description: In response to an ongoing Freedom of Information Act lawsuit by the New York Times, the Obama administration on Monday declassified and provided a set of documents related to the governments annual request for court approval for the warrantless surveillance activities authorized by the FISA Amendments Act.

title: After Defeat, Jets Share Blame, Which Is Plentiful
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Brandon Marshall sleeps eight hours every night  or tries to, anyway. He gets up a few times because of all the water he drinks, although on Sunday he had trouble getting back to bed for an altogether different reason.

title: Blindspot Episode 2 Recap: Drones, Scars and Big Booms
description: Season 1, Episode 2: A Stray Howl

title: Even Before Opening, Training Center Has the Nets Feeling a Weight
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Since moving to a condominium in Brooklyn Heights this summer, Thaddeus Young has been learning things about New York, including that it can take an incredibly long time to drive a shockingly short distance.

title: Navigating Maze to Playoffs, Yanks Seem Lost Against Lowly Rivals
description: The math was almost too complicated to agonize over. With a win on Monday and losses by three other teams chasing them in the American League  including one playing in the Pacific Time Zone  the Yankees could clinch a wild-card berth while curled up in their beds.

title: MacArthur Genius Grant Winners for 2015 Are Announced
description: Lin-Manuel Miranda, the writer and star of the hit Broadway musical Hamilton, thought it was the cable company calling to beg him to reconsider his recent service cancellation.

title: Thumbtack Raises New Funding at a $1.3 Billion Valuation
description: Thumbtack, which handles marketing and job listings for professionals like yoga instructors and electricians, has raised $125 million and is now valued at about $1.3 billion.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | goad
description: goad  \god\  verb and noun

title: Sounding the Islanders Arrival in Brooklyn
description: As the Islanders approach their first regular-season game at Barclays Center on Oct. 9, the arena experience is a work in progress as team and arena officials try to find the right mix of Long Island and Brooklyn.

title: Whats On TV Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (Flix) VENUS (2006) The elderly actor Maurice (Peter OToole, in an Oscar-nominated performance) takes an interest in Jessie (Jodie Whittaker), the great-niece of his friend Ian (Leslie Phillips), who has arrived in London to care for her great-uncle  and perhaps break into modeling. Ian is horrified by Jessies working-class habits. Maurice, on the other hand, sees in her a target for his charm. Their unlikely, uneven friendship provides the movie with a thin, wobbly dramatic peg, but it turns out to be just enough for Mr. OToole to show the younger guys out there  the Leos and the Brads and, for that matter, the Daniel Craigs  how the thing is done properly, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times of this meditation on age and beauty, directed by Roger Michell and based on a screenplay by Hanif Kureishi. In Dirty Pretty Things (2002), at 9:35, Chiwetel Ejiofor portrays a Nigerian doctor on the run who discovers an organ-smuggling ring while working illegally as a hotel porter in London. Audrey Tautou is his Turkish roommate, who pines for him.  Dirty Pretty Things plays it straight and cool, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The Times about this Stephen Frears drama. He added, After watching Mr. Frears ply his refined skills in mainstream studio fare, its enthralling to see him employ that jazziness to spark his ticking impatience with injustice. (Image: Mr. OToole and Ms. Whittaker.)

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We havent been able to answer the question, Does life exist beyond Earth? But following the water is a critical element of that.

title: Corrections: September 29, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Typhoon Dujuan Batters Taiwan With Heavy Rain and Winds
description: Typhoon Dujuan pounded Taiwan with heavy rain and powerful winds on Monday night, killing three people and leaving hundreds injured, according to Taiwans National Fire Agency.

title: Seeking the Unexpected During Fashion Week
description: Great Danes and poodles, not Gucci and Prada, introduced the photographer Landon Nordeman to the fashion world.

title: G.O.P. Attack on Planned Parenthood
description: To the Editor:

title: Unfunny Jokes? Nah
description: To the Editor:

title: Mr. Boehners October Miracle?
description: John Boehners looming departure from the House leadership stems from his frustration at leading his Republican caucus, particularly its implacable obstructionists who refused to be led. Farewell tributes have highlighted Mr. Boehners folksy decency and bought into his self-description as the grown-up in a legislative playpen. By this account, he was undone by Tea Party toddlers who were endlessly willing to be stupid or destructive to get their way or make a point.

title: Disciplining Police Officers: Stronger Penalties
description: To the Editor:

title: Is Donald Trump Serious?
description: As part of his ongoing effort to make a mockery of the American political process, Donald Trump released his tax plan on Monday morning. This is the third official policy position he has laid out in the three and a half months hes been running for president.

title: Pope Francis, Clerical Sex Abuse and Women in the Church
description: To the Editor:

title: Anarchy in the House
description: REPUBLICANS arent big fans of Karl Marx, but perhaps they should ponder his observation that history repeats itself first as tragedy, then as farce. As preposterous presidential candidates dominate the polls and extremists topple congressional leaders, the Republican Party is headed for a replay of the catastrophic Goldwater revolt of the early 1960s. It may be an entertaining spectacle, but its dangerous.

title: Speaker Boehners Decision: What Led to It?
description: To the Editor:

title: The World Needs to Build on Its Success Against Malaria
description: Malaria will kill about 438,000 people this year, most of them in sub-Saharan Africa. That large number is tragic, but it still represents an improvement over earlier decades. The death rate of the mosquito-borne disease has fallen by 60 percent since 2000 and the rate of infection is down 37 percent, according to a recent report by the World Health Organization and Unicef. This progress shows what can be achieved when the world makes a serious attempt to deal with a major public health problem.

title: The Prison Problem
description: Pretty much everybody from Barack Obama to Carly Fiorina seems to agree that far too many Americans are stuck behind bars. And pretty much everybody seems to have the same explanation for how this destructive era of mass incarceration came about.

title: How Dragging Our Feet on Refugees Creates More Terrorists
description: THE Syrian refugee crisis, building in a horrifying crescendo over the past four years, has set in motion a debate in this country: Should America open her arms to the huddled masses yearning to breathe free, or fold them in a defensive posture born out of fear that refugees will harbor terrorists among them?

title: Is Honesty for Suckers?
Would I Accept My Patients Gift?
description: In our first session after I returned from vacation, my patient Tim handed me a box of homemade candy. I wouldnt eat this myself if I were in your place, he said. After all, how do you know this candy hasnt been doctored? I might have put in some bad stuff.

title: Stock Sell-Off Extends to Asia, but Glencore Edges Higher
description: LONDON  Stocks fell in Asia on Tuesday, a day after a sell-off in the United States and Europe, as concerns about global growth and weaknesses in commodity prices continued to rattle investors.

title: News Qs | At U.N., Obama and Putin Trade Blunt Criticisms Over Syria
description: Before Reading At U.N., Obama and Putin Trade Blunt Criticisms Over Syria:

title: Donald Trump Is Not Going Anywhere
description: I dont worry about anything, Donald J. Trump told me aboard his 757 as we were flying to the recent Republican debate at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, Calif. He was dividing his attention between the brick-size slice of red-velvet cake he was annihilating and the CNN commentator on the 57-inch television who at that moment was talking about Trump, as most commentators have been at pretty much every moment for the last three months. The commentator, Dylan Byers, was saying that Trump now ran the risk of jumping the shark because voters were becoming so familiar with his act. Nah, Trump said, smirking at the screen. As the real estate and reality-show tycoon sees things, this is all win-win for him. Peggy Noonan of The Wall Street Journal wrote something to this effect recently, Trump told me, explaining that even if he loses, he goes back to being Donald Trump, but even bigger.

title: Oiselle, Womens Athletic-Apparel Brand, Lines Up With Yale
description: Since it was founded in 2007, the upstart womens athletic-apparel brand Oiselle has collected an eclectic group of women, including national track champions, supermodels and the first female Saudi Olympic runner, while staying mostly out of the mainstream. This fall it adds a new elite squad to its roster, becoming the first solely womens sports brand to outfit a major college running program: the cross-country and track teams of Yale.

title: Molly Ringwald Shares Her Beauty Routine, and Likes Her Freckles
description: A 1980s screen queen, known for her roles in Sixteen Candles, The Breakfast Club and Pretty in Pink, Molly Ringwald, 47, is still thriving in film, theater and music (she is quite the jazz musician). You can see her next as Mrs. Bailey in Jem and the Holograms, out Oct. 23. When she is not filming, Ms. Ringwald, the mother of three, lives in the Hudson Valley in New York, where she is working on her third book  a novel.

title: Is That Cappuccino Youre Drinking Really a Cappuccino?
description: What if the cappuccino you had this morning was not, in fact, a cappuccino? Scary. More worrisome still: What if your flat white was?

title: Generals Sought More Positive Coverage on Head Injuries, Document Shows
description: Two top Army generals recently discussed trying to kill an article in The New York Times on concussions at West Point by withholding information so the Army could encourage competing news organizations to publish a more favorable story, according to an Army document.

title: Concussions in a Required Class: Boxing at Military Academies
description: WEST POINT, N.Y.  A bell clanged and two cadets in boxing gloves surged from their corners in a gym at the United States Military Academy last week, throwing jabs and uppercuts while other cadets yelled, Keep working him! and, Use the hook!

title: Are You Distracted by Your Phone?
description: Do you think you pay full attention to the people you are with? Are you engaged in whats happening around you? Or are you distracted by your phone? And are the people in your life  your family, friends, even teachers  distracted by theirs?

title: Inside the Southern Tier
description: Years ago, the New York region was a manufacturing powerhouse, a place where business thrived, but over time the companies have downsized or left.

title: New Yorks Southern Tier, Once a Home for Big Business, Is Struggling
description: CONKLIN, N.Y.  The main grocery store here was replaced by a Family Dollar store, already faded. The historic front of the town hall, a castle no less, is crumbling, and donations are being solicited. The funds earmarked to strip off the lead paint from the castles exterior went instead to clear mold from the basement.

title: Dressing Up at the Toronto Film Festival
description: The film festivals rising stars reveal their wardrobe choices.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Sloane Crosleys The Clasp
description: How strange life is, how fickle! How little is needed to ruin or to save! These lines come late in Guy de Maupassants The Necklace, a story that serves as both the inspiration for and central prop to Sloane Crosleys first novel, a shrewd exploration of the modern-day late-quarter-life crisis, disguised as a caper.

title: Afghan Crisis Grows as Push to Retake Kunduz From Taliban Fails
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghanistan was plunged deeper into crisis a day after the Taliban seized the northern city of Kunduz, as the insurgents on Tuesday kept assaulting the reeling Afghan security forces and the government struggled to mount a credible response.
