title: Tontines Explained
description: Trying to drag myself back to the real world  although my head still feels stuffed full of cotton. But I did want to weigh in on a Wonkblog piece from a couple of days ago about the possible virtues of tontines  retirement schemes in which the payouts go only to surviving members of a group. The article does reference a Simpsons episode; but surely we cant tackle this subject without mentioning the movie The Wrong Box, with a plot that hinges on two brothers who are the sole survivors of a tontine. Heres how the rest of the group went:

title: Changing Face of California Agriculture
description: Mark Bittman visits the Central Valley to learn how Hmong farmers can sustain and expand their businesses in the face of huge cultural changes.

title: Commodities and Cranks
description: Does anyone remember the heyday of the inflationistas, when they were berating Ben Bernanke for debasing the dollar? One of their key arguments was that commodity prices were rising, and that this was a harbinger of soaring overall inflation.

title: Jeb Goes Galt
description: This is amazing:

title: The Changing Face of California Agriculture
description: This is the ninth in a series of videos about sustainable agriculture and healthy eating. The series was produced in collaboration with the Global Food Initiative at the University of California.

title: House Hunting in ... the Italian Alps
description: A DUPLEX APARTMENT IN CORTINA DAMPEZZO

title: Yang Li: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Yang Lis spring 2016 collection.

title: Video Review: A New Mazda MX-5, but Still the Old Driving Joy
description: MAZDA has produced nearly a million MX-5s since the car arrived on the market in 1989, making it the most popular roadster of all time (the MG MGB is a distant second at 386,961, according to Hemmings).

title: Driven | 2016 Mazda MX-5 Miata
description: Mazda stays true to the original Miata formula of maximum fun and minimal bloat.

title: When Prominent Catholics Opposed Dorothy Day
description: When he invoked Dorothy Day in his speech to Congress, Pope Francis gave hope to thousands of cooks, servers, salespeople and janitors in Washington, D.C. who work for private-sector contractors at federal venues, including the Smithsonian, Union Station, the Pentagon and the Capitol.

title: A Fervor to Glimpse Chinas Mona Lisa
description: BEIJING  An hour before the Forbidden City opened to visitors one recent morning, the stone courtyard just south of the ancient imperial palace was abuzz. Within the vermilion walls, the usual mix of uniformed palace workers, tour guides and tourists milled about beneath a pale blue sky. Loudspeakers blared a recording about ticketing policies.

title: Courrgess Youthful, Pants-Optional Collection
description: The reinvigorated fashion house showed long-sleeve, white bodysuits as the foundation of many spring/summer 2016 looks.

title: 1940: Canada War Machine Gears Up
description: Canadians may have been a little slow about getting started but there is no question now that they are going ahead at full speed and with extraordinary efficiency. A year ago the army consisted of 4,500 men; now there are 162,000. The Navy had a personnel of 1,700 and thirteen ships. It now has 11,000 men and ten times the number of ships. There is a united effort which has brought all parts of the country together. They dont expect a quick victory but are preparing for a long war and mean to win the last battle as the British generally do.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, October 1, 1940

title: Tesla Delivers Model X, Its First Sport Utility Vehicle
description: Tesla Motors is delivering its first sport utility vehicles, adding a second model to its lineup as it seeks to attract more buyers to its electric vehicles.

title: Another Injury for Derrick Rose, More Waiting by the Bulls
description: It is familiar and disheartening news for Bulls fans. Derrick Rose is hurt. Again.

title: Heroes andHot Dogs in a Changing Bronx
description: Change has come quickly for the Bronx neighborhood in the shadows of the elevated 6 train tracks near the Castle Hill stop. In 1978, when Frank Fiorentino was 21, he opened his Italian delicatessen, Domand Deli and Caterers, in the community where he grew up, whose streets were dotted with Italian-owned stores that served the predominantly Italian residents. Today, that community is mostly Hispanic and black, but at Domand its still business as it used to be.

title: Lemaires Long Silhouettes and High Hems for Spring
description: Christophe Lemaire and Sara-Linh Tran balanced maximum volume with a minimal palette.

title: Alexander Fehling: A Wild Ride From Inglourious Basterds to Homeland
description: Talk about fast work. Alexander Fehling went from meeting Claire Danes to moving in with her in just 10 days.

title: The Gatekeeper in Xi Jinpings Inner Circle
description: He was on the guest list for the state dinner that President Obama hosted for President Xi Jinping of China on Friday. He was also one of four officials that Mr. Xi took with him to meet Mr. Obama and an American policy delegation in Beijing in November.

title: Spending Bill Passes, Averting a Shutdown
description: WASHINGTON  With only hours to spare on the last day of the fiscal year, Congress averted a government shutdown on Wednesday by approving a temporary spending measure to keep federal agencies operating through Dec. 11.

title: Uber Executives Trial in Paris Is Postponed
description: PARIS  A court on Wednesday postponed the trial of two French executives from Uber who are facing criminal charges of illegally organizing taxi services through the companys low-cost UberPop service.

title: New Music From Tim Berne, Emilie & Ogden and Rey Pila
description: SPARE

title: Aparna Ramaswamy Will Dance a Solo Honoring the Wisdom of Women
description: In the classical South Indian dance form of Bharatanatyam, the body is material  an interlocking puzzle of pieces assembled to create otherworldly grace. The fingers splay and stretch apart, the heels flex as a dancer hops from side to side, and the eyes flicker with lively vitality. Aparna Ramaswamy, an artistic director (with her mother, Ranee) of the much-respected Ragamala Dance Company in Minneapolis, is a vision of sculptural lucidity whose dancing brings a full-bodied awareness to complex rhythms and shifts of dynamics. All the while, the strength of her purity is second nature  both explicit and seemingly casual.

title: Jim Shaws Odd Career to Unfold at New Museum
description: On Wednesday, Oct. 7, when Jim Shaw: The End Is Here opens at the New Museum, one of the oddest careers in post-Pop, post-Conceptual, latter-day Surrealist art will finally receive a comprehensive museum exhibition in New York. The least known of a Los Angeles triumvirate, along with Paul McCarthy and Mike Kelley, Mr. Shaw has used an implicitly hallucinatory imagination, chameleon drawing skills and a morbid fascination with the detritus of popular culture to construct a daunting view of the nations psyche. His drawing style boomerangs between hyper-real wizardry and an uninflected navet that helps defuse his most shocking images.

title: John Luther Adams, a Sonic Nod to Nature in New York Premieres
description: The composer John Luther Adamss shimmering sonic landscapes are inspired by nature, including the panoramas of Alaska, where he lived for decades before recently moving to New York. Mr. Adams, who won a Pulitzer Prize last year, recently received Columbia Universitys $50,000 William Schuman Award. He will present a three-concert retrospective at the Miller Theater at Columbia this week, featuring large-scale works in their New York premieres.

title: Rio Tinto Agrees to Sell Coal Mine Stake for $606 Million
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The mining giant Rio Tinto said Wednesday that it had agreed to sell its 40 percent stake in an Australian coal mine for $606 million as it seeks to reduce debt by selling assets as commodity prices are mired in a global slump.

title: BigBang, Smooth K-Pop Criminals, Bring Made to Newark
description: In the elaborate, stylish video trailer for BigBangs new tour, this K-pop megastar boy band appears in its own highly stylized Tarantino flick, full of screeching cars, curvaceous women dancing in dimly lit spaces and threats of imminent violence. Its safe to say that wont be replicated onstage when the tour comes to the Prudential Center in Newark on Oct. 10 and 11. Partly thats because onstage, BigBang is more theatrical than moody, and partly because several of the groups recent singles  songs like We Like 2 Party and Loser  are notably more mellow than its hyperkinetic early work.

title: Showtimes The Affair Adds New Perspectives
description: To his and hers, The Affair adds theirs.

title: A Lost African Civilization, and a Sculpture That Tells Its Story
description: Kongo chiefs commissioned artworks like this one to fight back against 19th-century colonialism.

title: Carly Fiorinas Super PAC Aids Her Campaign, in Plain Sight
description: LEXINGTON, S.C.  The table festooned with red Carly for America placards arrived hours before the candidate. Political operatives took up positions outside the front door to catch supporters of Carly Fiorina, the corporate executive turned Republican presidential contender, and gather their contact information before steering them inside to the room where she would speak.

title: Millions More Need H.I.V. Treatment, W.H.O. Says
description: The World Health Organization issued sweeping new guidelines on Wednesday that could put millions more people on H.I.V. drugs than are now getting them. The recommendations could go a long way toward halting the epidemic, health officials say, but would cost untold billions of dollars not yet committed.

title: E.U. Sets Course for U.S.-Style Lending to Stimulate Growth
description: European Union financial officials on Wednesday laid out plans for making more sources of investment available to European business, as a way to encourage American-style venture capital and fund-raising in the region.

title: Can Kevin McCarthy, House Speaker Favorite, Go From Buddy to Boss?
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Kevin McCarthy of California has built a loyal following among House Republicans by calling them up just to gab, giving them special jackets when they joined his vote-whipping team and telling them their ideas are fantastic, even after telling the last guy who left his office that his (completely opposite) idea was great, too.

title: Court Strikes Down Payments to College Athletes
description: The N.C.A.A. may restrict colleges from compensating athletes beyond the cost of attendance, a three-judge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit ruled Wednesday in an apparent victory for the college sports establishment as it fights efforts to expand athletes rights.

title: Senator Elizabeth Warren to Join Call to Alter Sales of Distressed Loans
description: Housing advocates have attracted a prominent ally in their push to change the federal governments policy of selling distressed mortgages at a discount to private equity firms and hedge funds.

title: The Adaptable Trench
description: This season the major mens wear brands, from Herms to Salvatore Ferragamo, offer fresh takes on a garment with a terrific heritage.

title: A New Life for the Classic Trench Coat
description: Though the trench coat was originally designed to protect military officers against rain and wind, nowadays it is as varied as the diverse cast of characters known to wear it, on screen and off.

title: Study Says Faster Medical Evacuation Was Lifesaver for U.S. Troops
description: WASHINGTON  As the Pentagon prepared to send tens of thousands of additional American forces to Afghanistan in 2009, Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates became concerned that the rugged terrain and vast distances of the war zone were keeping wounded troops from reaching hospital care within 60 minutes. This is the so-called golden hour, which combat medical experts deem vital to survival.

title: Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals O'Bannon Case Ruling
description: A three-judge panel upheld a federal judges finding last year that the N.C.A.A. is not above antitrust laws, but the panel also threw out the judges proposal that N.C.A.A. members should pay athletes $5,000 per year in deferred compensation.

title: Why Narendra Modi Should Be Thanking Indian Politics
description: NEW DELHI  Prime Minister Narendra Modi choked, his voice trembled and his speech acquired the tone of a self-made man looking back at his difficult childhood. He was at Facebooks headquarters this week in Menlo Park, Calif., recounting how his mother had worked as a domestic helper to raise him.

title: 1965: Alabama Shooter Is Acquitted
description: HAYNEVILLE, Ala.  An all-white Lowndes County jury today [Sept. 30] acquitted Thomas Coleman of the shotgun slaying of white civil rights worker Jonathan Daniels. The jurors, most of them friends or neighbors of Mr. Coleman, deliberated a total of 1 hour 43 minutes before returning the verdict. Mr. Coleman, a Lowndes County special deputy, had been charged with first-degree manslaughter for the Aug. 20 slaying of Mr. Daniels, a 26-year-old Episcopal seminarian from Keene, N.H., and assault in the wounding of Father Richard Morrisroe, a Roman Catholic priest from Chicago.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, October 1, 1965

title: Kim Davis and Pope Franciss Grand Strategy
description: It appears we have a backhanded, non-denialversion ofVatican confirmation of the story that Kim Davis, the Kentucky clerk briefly jailed for her refusal to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, was received by Pope Francis privately during his visit to the United States. (For the story to be false, the Davises would have needed to be pathological liars and someone in Romewould need to have baldly lied to the well-sourcedRobert Moynihan of Inside the Vatican, so it was already reasonable to treat the news as basically confirmed.) This is a fairly surprising bit of news; it also lends some credence to Philip Lawlers interpretation of this popes approach to the American culture war, which he offered after Franciss address in Washington last week:

title: A Duplex in Cortina dAmpezzo
description: Occupying the top two floors of a four-story chalet just outside the resort town in the Dolomites, the apartment is on the market for $5.6 million.

title: Donald Trump Unleashes Ire at Marco Rubio
description: Donald J. Trump has shown a penchant for dragging his Republican rivals into the mud with him in the name of self-defense. Jeb Bush, Carly Fiorina, Rick Perry and Scott Walker have all felt the brunt.

title: The Other Victims of the Volkswagen Scandal: Dealers
description: The recent Volkswagen scandal has not only angered many of its customers, it is also threatening the prospects of hundreds of dealerships around the country that are anxious to learn how to fix diesel cars that intentionally thwart emissions tests.

title: At Maison Margiela, Beehive Hair and Fishnets
description: John Galliano sent out a varied (and vibrant) collection for spring/summer 2016.

title: Jay Z Bringing Beyonc and Prince to Barclays Center for Charity Concert
description: The rapper Jay Z will have friends, family and business associates on hand at Barclays Center in Brooklyn on Oct. 20 for Tidal X: 1020, a charity concert to celebrate his underdog streaming music service. In addition to Jay Z, the nights performers include his wife, Beyonc, and a handful of Tidals high-profile partners: Prince, Usher, Nicki Minaj, Lil Wayne and more.

title: Oklahoma Governor Grants Richard Glossip a Stay of Execution
description: McALESTER, Okla.  Richard E. Glossip, a death row inmate who challenged the constitutionality of Oklahomas lethal injection protocol before the Supreme Court, was granted a stay of execution shortly before he was scheduled to be put to death here Wednesday, the latest twist in a case that has attracted widespread support from celebrities and death-penalty opponents who say he is innocent.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu, at U.N., Continues to Condemn Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel doubled down Thursday in his harsh condemnations of the Iranian nuclear deal, describing the widespread international praise for it as a grave misjudgment.

title: Milan Fashion Week in 60 Seconds | Spring/Summer 2016
description: T magazines market director Malina Joseph Gilchrist recaps the spring/summer 2016 collections.

title: Vegans Go Glam: Reporters Notebook
description: As all reporters know (but, hey, it never hurts to be reminded), sometimes good stories  including todays story about Vegans Going Glam  are hiding in plain sight.

title: Putin on Intervention in Syria
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said that he believes the only way to deal with terrorists in Syria is to act preemptively.

title: One of the Worlds Most Powerful Central Bankers Is Worried About Climate Change
description: A new speech about climate change is fascinating both for what it says and who said it.

title: George W. Bush Makes Fund-Raising Appeal for Jeb Bush
description: George W. Bush has been raising money in private for Jeb Bushs White House campaign for months, but on Tuesday the former president took a small step into a more public role for his younger brother: He sent out a fund-raising email.

title: Reynold Levy Takes His Fund-Raising Skills to the Robin Hood Foundation
description: When Reynold Levy stepped down from Lincoln Center in 2013 after 11 years as president of the performing arts center, he said he would not pursue another full-time position, and that his one solid plan for the future involved beaches and books.

title: Residents Flee Fighting in Kunduz
description: Residents of Kunduz in northern Afghanistan fled Wednesday after the Taliban took over the city on Monday. Afghan security forces are trying to regain control.

title: Dries Van Noten: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Dries Van Notens spring 2016 collection.

title: Reactions to Senate Spending Measure
description: The Republican majority leader, Mitch McConnell, and the Democratic minority leader, Harry Reid, commented on the approval of a temporary spending measure to avoid a government shutdown.

title: Recent History
description: Middle-grade readers today are part of whats becoming known as Generation Z, born between 1996 and 2011 (give or take a year or so on either end). As this newspaper has noted, they have by now their own generational sensibility: more Lorde than Lady Gaga, more Snapchat than Facebook. Growing up entirely in a digital era, they are more private, sensible and cautious than their Millennial elders. Perhaps thats because they are being raised not by high-flying boomers but by Generation X, which one Times article calls a relatively small, jaded generation that came of age in the post-Watergate, post-Vietnam funk of the 1970s, when horizons seemed limited. Much of the current helicopter-parenting phenomenon, it has been speculated, is a result of these Gen-Xers overcorrecting with their offspring for the strange and often jarring empty spaces that characterized their own 1970s childhoods. Back then, I think it is safe to say, parenting as a verb  a life-defining, life-consuming activity  had not been invented, even as the world had become more treacherous for children to navigate. It seems appropriate, then, that one of the best books I have yet read about growing up in the 1970s is a graphic novel for middle-grade readers: Sunny Side Up, by Jennifer L. Holm and Matthew Holm.

title: The Essence of New Hampshire, Distilled
description: At Tamworth Distilling & Mercantile, which opened earlier this year on the grounds of a dilapidated New Hampshire inn, high-proof grain alcohol embodies the anachronistic, utilitarian charm of something you might have once found at a general store  or today, at the Vermont Country Store. According to its label  printed with, according to the products illustrator and namesake, Reverend Michael Alan, a mixture of English and Latin, the Theban, and Adamic alphabets, and various magickal sigils for peace and love and prosperity  the potent stuff can wipe away mascara and refresh stained furniture. The Alcohol, Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau has deemed it the most complicated label they have ever approved.

title: At Rochas, Natural Beauty With a 90s Touch
description: Nineties fresh-faced gorgeous cool girl, was how the makeup artist Lucia Pieroni described the pared-back look at the Rochas show today  a nice balance with the designer Alessandro DellAcquas exquisitely detailed designs. We used a very light foundation and lots of highlighters from Cl de Peau to get that really radiant skin, Pieroni said backstage before the show. Next, a light eyeshadow was applied to the eyelid followed by eyeliner, just along the waterline  like you had mascara on a few days ago and forgot to take it off, she said. Lips were merely a shade of the softest pink, smudged on just so with the fingertips.

title: At Dries Van Noten, Artful Layering
description: For spring/summer 2016, the designer beautifully combined a range of colorful prints, lush fabrics and off-kilter silhouettes.

title: France Opens Criminal Investigation of Torture in Syria Under Assad
description: PARIS  France has opened the worlds first criminal inquiry into torture under President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, officials and rights advocates said Wednesday, an indirect rebuke to Russia and its efforts to rehabilitate Mr. Assad as part of an international anti-Islamist coalition.

title: Mob in India Kills Muslim Man Over Rumors of Cow Slaughter
description: NEW DELHI  A 52-year-old Muslim man died this week after he was beaten with bricks and sticks by a mob in a village outside New Delhi in response to rumors that he had slaughtered a cow and eaten beef.

title: Hurricane Joaquin Drifting to the Bahamas, but Path Remains Uncertain
description: A tropical storm that has been churning the Atlantic Ocean this week strengthened into a hurricane on Wednesday, and meteorologists are now trying to determine whether its path will take it to the East Coast.

title: Jeremy Corbyn, Labour Party Leader, Says Hed Never Use Nuclear Weapons
description: LONDON  The desire of Jeremy Corbyn, the new leader of the Labour Party, to scrap Britains nuclear arsenal is well known, but when he said on Wednesday that he would order the military not to use nuclear weapons if he were prime minister, it created a firestorm of criticism.

title: Abbas Addresses U.N. General Assembly
description: President Mahmoud Abbas declared on Wednesday that the Palestinian Authority would no longer be bound by the Oslo Peace Accords that formed the two-state solution with Israel.

title: Poll Shows Donald Trump Still Ahead, With Some Warning Signs
description: Donald J. Trump is maintaining a solid lead atop the crowded Republican field of presidential candidates despite what some analysts described as a subpar debate performance this month, according to a new Suffolk University/USA Today poll.

title: Fever Follow Tamika Catchingss Lead, Right Into W.N.B.A. Finals
description: In a perfect world, the Liberty would have returned home to a rocking Madison Square Garden after a dismal loss to the Indiana Fever in Game 2 and won.

title: Michelin Announces Its New York Stars
description: Michelin, the Paris-based purveyor of gastronomic guides, has released its annual list of starred ratings for New York City restaurants. While much anticipated, it is short on surprises.

title: A Lifesaving Smartphone App Inspired by a Brush With Tragedy
description: During a 2014 winter storm, Charles Martin climbed onto the roof of his rural Rockport, Ind., home to clear off a foot of heavy, wet snow. With his wife at work, Mr. Martin, a family counselor, slipped and fell off the roof, breaking his wrist and shattering his hip. Lying on his icy driveway in severe pain, he tried to call 911 on his cellphone, but the call would not go through. He lay in 20-degree cold for two hours until his wife arrived and dialed the emergency number from the landline inside the house.

title: From Marc Jacobs to Ralph Lauren, the Best Mentors in Fashion
description: Here are a few established names who appear to be particularly adept at talent-spotting in the early stages, and the stars they have nurtured.

title: Achieving Liftoff at Margiela and Courrges
description: PARIS  Might there be life on Mars? Well, there are definitely signs of life in the revived space-age brand Courrges. Ah, the cosmic coincidence. Welcome to Paris.

title: U.S. Base Seen as Monument to Futility as Afghans Watch Kunduz Fall
description: The base was not much to behold when the American soldiers arrived in Kunduz in 2010. Nestled atop a vast plateau, it was little more than a collection of stucco buildings with chipping paint, a small airstrip on one side, a graveyard of rusting Soviet vehicles on the other. And everywhere was the Afghan dust, so fine it would puff like dry mountain snow with every step.

title: Limn Dance Thrives, Decades After Its Founders Death
description: The future of American modern dance  and the issue of who will carry on the torch  is very much an open question, particularly since the death of Merce Cunningham in 2009 and the closing of his company. What happens when the founding genius, the original voice, is gone? Martha Graham died in 1991, but her troupe survives, thanks to contextual presentations and new works by living choreographers; Paul Taylor, still actively producing work, is 85. His company, too, is making moves to widen its repertory.

title: Refugee Crisis in Europe Prompts Western Engagement in Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS  Over the last four years, as four million Syrian refugees poured into neighboring countries and slipped inexorably into poverty, Antnio Guterres, the United Nations high commissioner for refugees, said he had pleaded in vain with world leaders to take their plight more seriously.

title: Rochas: Spring 2016 RTW
description: Rochas spring 2016 collection.

title: Classical Duets of a Singular Nature
description: To him for whom it was written Johannes Brahms inscribed on the manuscript of his 1887 Double Concerto for violin, cello and orchestra. At first, the gesture appears perfunctory: concertos are often dedicated to their performers. But why, for a work for two soloists, him and not them?

title: Fantasy Football Week 4: Waiver Wire Picks
description: Welcome to Week 4!

title: David Cameron Grapples With Issue of Slavery Reparations in Jamaica
description: LONDON  As Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain visits Jamaica this week, he has been confronted with an old and awkward moral conundrum resonating in Europe and the United States: Should a country pay reparations for slavery?

title: Melania Trump Over the Years
description: A look at Mrs. Trump, from her modeling days in the 90s to the present day.

title: Now Trending: The Artist Robert Loughlin
description: Like many art stories, this one begins not with a birth but a death  that of Robert Loughlin, whose demise was wild enough to give Vincent van Gogh a run for his money.

title: A Not-So-Stealthy Leopard
description: Indian villagers found a leopard that had been searching for water stuck with unusual headgear; humans stepped in to help.

title: The Great Outdoors Begins in Brooklyn Heights
description: Im not in love with the lumberjack thing, said Jed Lubin, the 29-year-old manager of Hatchet Outdoor Supply Company, a store in Brooklyn Heights. The lumberjack thing Mr. Lubin referred to is a certain look common to the city streets (Iron Ranger boots, neoprene shell jackets) sometimes favored by those whose idea of adventure may be an Uber ride to Greenpoint. But Hatchet caters to those who immerse themselves in the great outdoors. In addition to classic clothing brands like Filson, the store stocks portable stoves, backpack tents and, yes, hatchets.

title: 36 Hours in Bologna
description: Bologna is a culinary travelers delight, but there is plenty worth checking out in the culture and nightlife arenas.

title: Effectiveness of Talk Therapy Is Overstated, a Study Says
description: Medical literature has overstated the benefits of talk therapy for depression, in part because studies with poor results have rarely made it into journals, researchers reported Wednesday.

title: Vittorio De Sica Retrospective at Film Forum Will End on a High
description: Film Forum concludes its monthlong retrospective of Vittorio De Sica (1901-1974) with a week of high points. On Monday, Oct. 5, theres A Farewell to Arms, David O. Selznicks 1957 production of Ernest Hemingways World War I novel. Much panned, it still earned De Sica, playing Major Rinaldi, his only Oscar nomination for acting.

title: For VW, Costs of Emissions-Test Cheating Will Outweigh Gains
description: Cheating on emissions tests has left Volkswagen with criminal investigations, potentially enormous fines and a corporate governance crisis. One might think the rewards for behaving badly must have been high indeed. Not so.

title: End Boxing at West Point, a Former Army Secretary Says
description: To the Editor:

title: Loan Servicers Faulted for Some Student Loan Problems
description: Poor management by student loan servicing companies may be helping to drive borrowers into default, a new federal report says.

title: France and the Netherlands Chip In to Buy Rembrandt Portraits
description: France and the Netherlands have agreed to jointly buy two Rembrandt portraits from the French executive Eric de Rothschild for 160 million euros, or $179 million, the culture ministries of both countries said on Wednesday.

title: 36 Hours in Bologna, Italy
description: Scrappy, scruffy Bologna could easily coast on its history, if not just on its culinary history. Home to one of the worlds oldest universities, this northern Italian city has contributed dozens of classic recipes and foods to the repertory of Italian cooking, including tortellini, tagliatelle and mortadella  the cold cut whose imitation is known as Bologna  as well as rag Bolognese. As the capital of the region of Emilia-Romagna, Bologna is one of the best places to sample the cheeses, cured hams and vinegars that originate in the area, many of which have been famous for centuries. But modern Bologna is not just about the past. Dozens of cool new attractions have changed the face of the city, from new ways of eating to new museums and new bars. And although several of the citys brightest attractions have appeared only within the last two or three years, many more are yet to come, including Eataly World, a huge culinary theme park scheduled to open here sometime in the next few months.

title: Melania Trump, the Silent Partner
description: Lying prone on a rug adorned with the Great Seal of the United States, the woman who might someday be first lady is wearing high-heeled sandals and a crimson bikini.

title: Jeb Bush Turns Personal in Confronting Heroins Toll in New Hampshire
description: Alluding to his personal experience grappling with addiction in his family, Jeb Bush on Wednesday held forth at a round-table discussion on substance abuse in New Hampshire, a state devastated by heroins toll.

title: Lemony Snicket, the Author, and His Wife Donate $1 Million to Planned Parenthood
description: Daniel Handler, the author of children's books under the pen name Lemony Snicket, announced with his wife, Lisa Brown, an author and illustrator, that they are donating $1 million to Planned Parenthood.

title: Republican Hypocrisy on Planned Parenthood
description: House Republicans called for an investigation of Planned Parenthood this summer, after a series of deceptively edited videos issued by an anti-abortion group, the Center for Medical Progress, alleged that Planned Parenthood profits from the sale of tissue from fetuses. But at a hearing on Tuesday, members of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee deluged Cecile Richards, Planned Parenthoods president, with a variety of questions entirely unrelated to that issue.

title: Merger Boom Extends Its Run
description: Merger volume has surged so far in 2015, reaching levels just shy of a record for this century.

title: Dodgers Clayton Kershaw and Zack Greinke Form 1-2 Punch Not Seen in Decades
description: When the Dodgers face the Mets in their divisional series starting Oct. 9, they will have the benefit of a 1-2 pitching combination that is not merely the best in baseball this year, but, by some measures, the best in decades.

title: Volkswagen Names New Porsche Chief, Promoting From Within
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen moved on Wednesday to fill a key management gap created last week by repercussions from the diesel emissions scandal.

title: Fashion Brands in Investors Headlights
description: Fashion trends may change with seasons, but one that has never gone out of style is the appetite for brand acquisition by groups both in and out of the 230 billion euro luxury sector.

title: Possible Contenders for the Next Big Fashion Jobs
description: A roundup of fashion designers who are seen as having top-job potential.

title: App Smart | Best Apps for Apple Watch
description: A look at the Citymapper, Carrot Weather and Rules apps and how to optimize them in the second generation operating system for the Apple Watch.

title: A Grab Bag of Software for the Apple Watch Upgrade
description: The Apple Watch that I wear generates a constant stream of questions from friends and strangers alike. One thing they always ask is whether the device is actually useful. I always answer yes  and thats even more so now that Apple has released the first major upgrade of the watchs operating system.

title: N.F.L. Thursday Matchup: Ravens(0-3) at Steelers (2-1)
description: 8:25 p.m., CBS, NFL Network

title: 3 Hillary Clinton Emails Deemed Secret in State Dept. Review of 6,300 Pages
description: WASHINGTON  Three emails sent to Hillary Rodham Clinton in 2011 when she was secretary of state contained information that should have been considered secret, the governments second-highest classification, according to a State Department review of about 6,300 pages of her emails made public on Wednesday.

title: Rothschild & Sons, a Reimagined Show From a Beloved Songwriting Team
description: Whats this? A new musical from the beloved songwriting team of Jerry Bock and Sheldon Harnick, whose Fiddler on the Roof returns to Broadway this fall? Mr. Harnick is still with us (huzzah!), but Mr. Bock died in 2010. Strictly speaking, Rothschild & Sons, which begins performances on Tuesday, Oct. 6, at the York Theater Company, is not a thoroughly new show. Its being described as an intimate one-act reimagining of The Rothschilds, the 1970 musical, with a book by Sherman Yellen, about the Jewish dynasty that rose from obscurity and oppression in late 18th-century Germany and became a banking powerhouse. Mr. Yellen is also, happily, still with us. He has restructured his book to focus on the relationships among the patriarch, Mayer Rothschild, played by Robert Cuccioli, his wife and their five sons. The score will include some previously unheard Bock-Harnick songs and others revised by Mr. Harnick. For musical theater lovers, this makes for a must-have ticket. (yorktheatre.org.)

title: Threes a Trend: Slouchy White T-Shirts
description: The best part, perhaps, of one trend popping up on the spring/summer 2016 runways: It can already be found in your closet. A number of designers have show plain  and a little oversized  white T-shirts. Anthony Vaccarello and Tods both styled off-the-shoulder versions with black skirts (the former, slit up to there, and the latter, in embellished and perforated leather). The brand Off-White went for an all-white look, using a neckline cutout, ruffles and frayed edges to break up the monochromatic look.

title: Who Is Fighting Whom in Syria
description: The Syrian civil war, now in its fifth year, involves multiple countries with overlapping and at times conflicting agendas. Competing visions of how to manage the conflict, which has led to a major global refugee crisis as well as the rise of the Islamic State, dominated discussions at the United Nations General Assembly last month. But despite days of meetings and diplomatic maneuvering, the crisis only intensified. Here is where some of the main foreign actors stand.

title: The Gray Man, a Tale of Spooky Disappearances
description: The Gray Man is so ambitious that its faults are worth overlooking. Indeed, for every nit to pick here, theres a moment to admire.

title: As Alexander Wang Exits Balenciaga, Three Potential Successors Emerge
description: In January, when he was appointed creative director of Gucci, Alessandro Michele was barely known to fashions press corps and buying teams, let alone the wider world. After working quietly behind the scenes for years, he had succeeded his former boss, Frida Giannini, who had been ousted from the position. Few had ever heard his name.

title: Pentagon Is Reviewing Russian Airstrikes
description: The White House said it was too early to be sure what targets Russia was hitting inside Syria to support President Bashar al-Assad.

title: DAngelo Cancels Performance at Bill Withers Tribute Show
description: When a tribute to Bill Withers takes over Carnegie Hall on Thursday, it will go on without one of its star attractions, the R&B singer DAngelo.

title: Unisplendour of China Buys 15% Stake in Western Digital
description: HONG KONG  A multibillion-dollar shopping spree continued on Wednesday for the Chinese hardware manufacturer and vendor Unisplendour, as it agreed to pay $3.78 billion for a 15 percent stake in the American hard disk drive maker Western Digital.

title: Tony Stewarts Plan: Retire After 16 Sprint Cup Season but Stay Active
description: KANNAPOLIS, N.C.  When news leaked late Sunday that Tony Stewart intended to retire from Sprint Cup racing after next season, he began to fume. He had wanted the announcement to come on his terms, with his words, at his chosen time.

title: Easing Screen-Based Eyestrain
description: Q. I have upgraded to Windows 10 and would like to tint the text area when working with Word. I only have one eye and the bright screen is uncomfortable.

title: Jeb Bushs Position on Washington Redskins Offends Some Native Americans
description: Jeb Bush waded into the politics of professional football this week and was hit by Native American groups on Wednesday for saying that the Washington Redskins was not an offensive team name.

title: High Cost of Inmates Phone Calls May End
description: The Federal Communications Commission will decide next month whether to limit rates and service fees for phone calls made by prison and jail inmates, a senior agency official said Wednesday.

title: Robert Curvin, Scholar Who Fought Bias and Poverty in Newark, Dies at 81
description: Robert Curvin, a fiercely loyal advocate for Newark who never gave up on his troubled city and devoted a scholarly career to alleviating urban poverty, died on Tuesday at his home in the Vailsburg section of the city. He was 81.

title: A Celebrity Struggle: Staying Off Twitter, for Good
description: Lena Dunham announced Monday that she was no longer managing her own Twitter account.

title: Julianne Moore and Ellen Page Attend Freeheld Screening
description: Julianne Moore has played characters who are gay (The Kids Are All Right), afflicted (Still Alice) and based on real life (Sarah Palin in Game Change). In her latest film, Freeheld, which had a screening at the Museum of Modern Art on Monday night, she does all of the above.

title: Russia May Not Have Attacked ISIS
description: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said the Russian airstrikes in Syria were probably not in areas with Islamic State forces.

title: Una emergencia dental y, al final, champaa: Don Francisco relata su ltimo Sbado Gigante
description: El 26 de septiembre fue el primer sbado libre de Mario Kreutzberger en 41 aos. El anfitrin de Sbado Gigante  programa que lleg a su fin el pasado 19 de septiembre despus de 53 aos al aire  tom su ultimo da libre en 1974, despus del fallecimiento de su madre. Desde entonces, Kreutzberger, mejor conocido como Don Francisco, se present sin excepcin alguna cada fin de semana en el programa de variedades que transmita la cadena Univisin en Estados Unidos. Kreutzberger record su ltimo da en Sbado Gigante en esta nota.

title: The Pope Sought Out Kim Davis for a Blessing
description: In an intriguing postscript to Pope Franciss whirlwind visit to the United States, a private papal meeting with Kim Davis, the Kentucky county clerk who defied a court order to license the marriage of same-sex couples, remained a well-kept secret until he headed home. The meeting, which occurred last Thursday afternoon at the Vatican Embassy in Washington, was arranged at the behest of the Vatican and not through the American church hierarchy, according to Mathew Staver, the lawyer for Ms. Davis, who said Francis thanked her for her courage, promised to pray for her, and urged her to stay strong.

title: Two Critics Choice Awards Shows to Merge Into One
description: Two prominent seasonal awards shows  the Critics Choice Movie Awards and the Critics Choice Television Awards  are about to become one.

title: Next Republican Debate Is Likely to Have a Smaller Field
description: The next Republican presidential debate will have stricter polling criteria for candidates to make the main stage, potentially winnowing the field, the debates sponsor said Wednesday.

title: Giants Victor Cruz Leaves Practice After Calf Injury Setback
description: The star wide receiver Victor Cruz, who was expected to return to the Giants lineup on Sunday for the first time in nearly a year, aggravated a strained left calf muscle that had been bothering him since mid-August and left practice Wednesday.

title: Text to Text | The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks and The Sequel
description: How private should your genetic information be? Can scientific researchers and pharmaceutical companies use your cells for the sake of scientific advancement? These are not just hypothetical questions. For the descendants of Henrietta Lacks, and for more and more patients and their families, these are pressing ethical questions that need answers and clear policies.

title: Tulsa Sheriff to Resign Over Killing by Deputy
description: TULSA, Okla.  A grand jury here indicted the sheriff of Tulsa County on misconduct charges on Wednesday, and the sheriffs lawyer said he will step down, six months after a volunteer reserve deputy accidentally shot and killed an unarmed man during an arrest.

title: 12 Sentenced in 2006 Bombings of Mumbai Commuter Trains
description: NEW DELHI  An Indian court has sentenced five people to death and seven to life imprisonment for their roles in a series of bombings of Mumbais commuter trains in 2006, which killed at least 180 people and wounded 800 others. The seven nearly simultaneous blasts took place during the evening rush hours.

title: The Pre-Aged Genius of Bill Withers
description: Im not going to let anybody con me out of being an old guy, Bill Withers told The Times in an interview earlier this month. Now 77, the recent Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee was referring to the fact that he didnt feel under any pressure to make new music. But even at the peak of his career, Withers was, in a sense, old. He was already 33 when his first hit, Aint No Sunshine, quietly strode out of radios in the late summer of 1971, a time when 30 was still at least nominally the expiration date for the relevancy of anything pop-cultural.

title: A New Track From a Saint Laurent and Alexander Wang-Approved Funk Rebel
description: Inspired by those who dont blend in, the British disco-punk musician Ebony Bones has played musical muse to Saint Laurent, who chose her music for the Guess Well Always Have NY campaign, and Alexander Wang, who featured it on the New York Fashion Week runway for his spring 2014 collection. And sauntering through the lobby of Berlins Park Inn Hotel, its clear that Bones, born Ebony Thomas, has the personality to match her bona fides. Im going through a yeti stage, she says of what shes wearing  a synthetic hair outfit by Franziska Michael  as she sits down on a plush couch. Fashion for me is something you read in a magazine, but style is always a reflection of personality.

title: Verbatim: Ben Carson on Avoiding the Police as a Child
description: Ben Carson, after describing how as a child he could hop fences to get away from police officers after playfully throwing rocks at cars, before quickly saying that he was kidding and that he had a tremendous amount of respect for police because they put their lives on the line every day. He made the remarks at an event in Durham, N.H.

title: Classical Playlist: Ornstein, Foss, Divine Redeemer and More
description: ORNSTEIN: Piano Quintet; String Quartet No. 2Marc-Andr Hamelin, piano; Pacifica Quartet(Hyperion)So gorgeous I want to inject it into my veins. Those were the words I blurted out to a fellow critic about the slow movement of Leo Ornsteins stunning Piano Quintet after I first heard it performed by this first-rate group of musicians two years ago at Carnegie Hall. Here, finally, is a recording of this epically proportioned forgotten treasure, written in 1927 in Philadelphia by Ornstein, a Ukrainian-born piano virtuoso and composer who died in 2002 at the age of 108. Ornstein goes for the jugular in the febrile outer movements, shot through with Russian folk material and rhythmic fire, but offers respite in the achingly tender Andante Lamentoso. His nervous, simmering String Quartet No. 2, written around 1929, is another interesting document of Ornsteins late Romantic style, but its the Quintet that now ought to be picked up by intrepid performers and presenters and given its due in the chamber music canon. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

description: Will New Yorkers eat mor chikin?

title: Picholine to Find a New Home
description: After 22 years, the chef Terrance Brennan has decided to close Picholine, his elegant restaurant on West 64th Street near Lincoln Center.

title: The Fed Puzzle
description: OK, maybe its the ear infection, but Im having a very hard time understanding what Peter Gourevitch is saying in this article name-checking me. Stuff is complicated? What?

title: The Mini Show
description: A first look at a tiny show of miniature artworks in L.A.

title: A Tiny Show of Very Miniature Works by Big Artists
description: The Mini Show has all of the trappings of a very big exhibition: big-name artists (Ed Ruscha, Geoff McFetridge, Tierney Gearon); a big, broad theme (memory); and an address (L.A.s the Lodge) frequented by big Hollywood types (Sia, Rose Byrne, Jacqui Getty).

description: T plucks the best bags right off the runway.

title: Murder Case Against Mother Spurs Review of 08 Death of Another Child
description: Prosecutors in Westchester County said on Wednesday that they would review the 2008 death of a baby born to the woman accused of throwing her newborn girl from the seventh-floor window of a Bronx apartment this week.

title: What the Oslo Accords Accomplished
description: When President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority told the United Nations on Wednesday that the Palestinian people cannot continue to be bound by agreements with Israel, what was he repudiating?

title: Letters: What She Tells Us
description: To the Editor:

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and More  Pictures of the Day

title: A Reason to Keep Coming Back to Tomorrowland
description: The only thing sadder than an empty closet is a full one. The empty one symbolizes lack, but also potential: It is a space of ones own, to be filled as circumstance, taste and resources allow. Look at it the right way, and an empty closet means hope, a platform for the life you may lead.

title: Viacom Names Sean Atkins Head of MTV
description: Viacom announced Wednesday that it had hired Sean Atkins as the new president of its MTV division, the ratings-challenged network group that has struggled to shift its business as younger viewers abandon traditional television.

title: Model-Morphosis: Willow at Rochas
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in Paris.

title: Model-Morphosis: Irina Djuranovic at Vionnet
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2016 Fashion Week in Paris.

title: One Dead in New Bronx Outbreak of Legionnaires Disease
description: One person who contracted Legionnaires disease amid a cluster of cases in the Morris Park section of the Bronx has died, the authorities said on Wednesday, as health officials ordered cooling towers infected with the bacteria to be cleaned.

title: Review: In Dr. Ken on ABC, Ken Jeong Is a Physician With Jokes
description: Its one thing to tempt fate. It was another order of hubris entirely to write this exchange into the first episode of the new ABC comedy Dr. Ken:

title: Review: Benders Features Hip Checks and Humiliations
description: As a producer and writer, Denis Leary is steadily building a library of shows about 21st-century manhood, and they dont present a pretty picture.

title: The New York Film Festival Contrasts the Human Pulse and the Digital
description: Can a single movie haunt an entire film festival? Steve Jobs, Danny Boyles scathing, scary, biographical portrait starring Michael Fassbender, may leave you with the creepy sensation that its subject has crawled inside your head and hijacked your mind. As I watched the movie  the New York Film Festivals centerpiece, to be shown Saturday at Lincoln Center  I thought of a cult leader wheedling his worshipful flock to follow him and drink the Kool-Aid. The alternative was expulsion from Jobss inner circle, which for those in his orbit was the equivalent of banishment to Siberia.

title: Review: A Little Life, Hanya Yanagiharas Traumatic Tale of Male Friendship
description: Hanya Yanagiharas A Little Life, published in March, turned out to be one of the most talked-about novels of the summer. Its a big, emotional, trauma-packed read with a voluptuous prose style that wavers between the exquisite and the overdone. A potboiler about very intense male friendship, its a sui generis phenomenon that became a runaway hit. And it is now a shortlisted contender for the Man Booker Prize, which will be awarded on Oct. 13.

title: All 15 Republican Candidates File for South Carolina Primary
description: All 15 Republican presidential candidates have paid the $40,000 required to run in the South Carolina Republican primary next year, the first ballot-access test in the G.O.P. race.

title: September 30, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Kenya, Germany and the United States.

title: For Amy Schumer, Multimillion-Dollar Book Deal Is All in the Timing
description: When news broke last week that the comedian Amy Schumer had sold a memoir  to Simon & Schuster in a high-seven-figure deal, some publishing executives experienced a sense of dj vu. Hadnt Ms. Schumer already sold a book of autobiographical essays for seven figures two years ago?

title: A New and Improved Look for Kenzos Milan Store
description: Humberto Leon and Carol Lim revamp the Kenzo store in the heart of a Milan.

title: Debating Otello, Blackface and Casting Trends
description: When the Metropolitan Opera announced it would forgo the traditional darkening makeup for the title character in its new production of Verdis Otello, it set off the latest in an ongoing series of debates about the depiction of race in theatrical settings. In an email exchange, two critics for The New York Times  Ben Brantley, whose specialty is theater, and Anthony Tommasini, whose area is classical music  discussed the Otello staging, the uses of blackface, casting trends and more. Here are excerpts from their conversation.

title: The Daily Shoe: Rochas
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Review: Janet Jacksons Unbreakable Focuses on Love Outside the Bedroom
description: Meet a sweeter, more chaste Janet Jackson. Unbreakable, her first album in seven years, arrives after two major events: the 2009 death of her brother Michael and her 2012 marriage to a Qatari businessman, Wissam Al Mana. Through 17 songs, Ms. Jackson sings about love, loyalty and compassion, and about memories as well as anticipation. The word sex never appears in the lyrics.

title: Review: Wavves Celebrates the Joys of Bad Decisions on V
description: Wavves

title: Kenzos Milan Store: Under New Management
description: For years, Kenzo has kept quarters on the Via Alessandro Manzoni, one of a cluster of several streets in the touristy thick of central Milan where fashion brands vie to set up shop. The location has not changed, but much else has.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Press Enter, From the Pianist and Composer Romain Collin
description: Romain Collin

title: Chvrches Offer Hymns From the Altar of 80s New Wave at SummerStage
description: On its 2013 debut album, The Bones of What You Believe, the Scottish band Chvrches knelt at the altar of new wave romanticism. The singer Lauren Mayberry has an almost metallic voice, plaintive but precise, and she used it primarily to convey ache. Her band mates, Iain Cook and Martin Doherty, are adept multi-instrumentalists, fluent in the whole range of 1980s sparkle. The album was something of a revelation, a revisiting of a distant time that didnt feel studied.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Batsheva Dance Companys Young Ensemble Embodies a Signature Litheness
description: It helps to be young, or at least youthful in body, to perform the work of Ohad Naharin, the Israeli choreographer and artistic director of Batsheva Dance Company. His oozy style, grounded in Gaga, his trademarked and globally disseminated movement method, calls for a special litheness and resilience, the kind that facilitates, say, a precipitous backbend and its swift reversal, or a knock-kneed crumpling to the floor, or a deliberately high-impact collision with a partner.

title: Review: Yarn/Wire Provides Two Flavors of Thrill
description: Yarn/Wires concert on Tuesday ended without Yarn/Wire. It speaks to this unusual, insightful ensembles self-effacing focus on composers and their music that after playing Mark Fells core, self, oscillation, the four members  two pianists and two percussionists, celebrating the start of their 10th season together  left the stage and listened along with the audience to an electronic version of the same piece.

title: Toxic Algae Outbreak Overwhelms a Polluted Ohio River
description: The Ohio River, transformed by mining and industrial waste and sewage overflows into the nations most polluted major waterway, has a new and unexpected tormentor this fall: carpets of poisonous algae.

title: Review: Ensemble Signals Musicians Do Solo Turns in Theatricals
description: There was only one possible criticism of the trombonist Steven Parkers wonderful performance of Luciano Berios Sequenza V (1966) on Tuesday evening, part of a Pop-Up concert at Miller Theater: a sorry lack of clown shoes.

title: Carole Little, Fashion Designer for Working Women, Dies at 80
description: Carole Little, a Los Angeles fashion designer whose sportswear found an eager audience among working women looking for affordable style, died on Sept. 19 at her home in San Diego. She was 80.

title: The Daily Jewel: Lemaire
description: T picks the best jewels right off the runway.

title: Microsoft and Google Call an End to Patent Battles
description: Peace has broken out between Google and Microsoft, which agreed to dismiss all of their pending patent lawsuits against each other.

title: Where Is the Vegan Julia Child? Readers React to Vegan Glam
description: Readers were quick to respond to Jeff Gordiniers article about the movement to bring the vegan lifestyle to the masses. While many discussed the merits of a plant-based diet, others talked about the need to make vegan choices accessible to more than just the wealthy. Selections from those comments are below; some have been edited for space.

title: Military Deaths in ISIS Operations
description: The Department of Defense has identified seven American service members who have died supporting the operation to eliminate the Islamic State militant group. It confirmed the death of the following American recently.

title: Syrian Rebels Say Russia Is Targeting Them Rather Than ISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  They are the most violent strikes, says a man filming the grim aftermath of what he asserts was a Russian air attack on the town of Talbiseh, in the Homs Province of Syria. This is the Russian criminal regime. The voice then trails off into laments and prayers: Oh God, oh God, oh God. God is all we need.

title: Saudi Objections Halt U.N. Inquiry of Yemen War
description: GENEVA  In a U-turn at the United Nations Human Rights Council, Western governments dropped plans Wednesday for an international inquiry into human rights violations by all parties in the war in Yemen that has killed thousands of civilians in the last six months.

title: Fiat Chrysler Workers Appear to Reject Contract Proposal
description: DETROIT  Hourly workers at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles appear to have soundly rejected a proposed new union contract that set no limit on the number of lower-paid workers and that contained no mechanism to move them up to top-wage status.

title: Hillary Clinton Calls Kevin McCarthys Remarks on Benghazi Inquiry Deeply Distressing
description: Remarks by Representative Kevin McCarthy linking Hillary Rodham Clintons sinking poll numbers to a House committees investigation into the 2012 attacks in Benghazi, Libya, were deeply distressing, Mrs. Clinton said in an interview to be shown this weekend.

title: Judge Blocks Obama Administration Rules on Fracking
description: A federal judge on Wednesday blocked the Obama administrations first major regulations on hydraulic fracturing, a technique for oil and gas drilling that has led to a boom in American energy production but has also raised concerns about health and safety risks.

title: Parsing YouTube Evidence of Russian Strikes in Syria
description: The start of the Russian air campaign against Syrian rebels on Wednesday unfolded in territory largely off limits to journalists, but at least some of the bombing runs appear to have been well documented on YouTube. Within hours of the first sorties, Russias Air Force released aerial views of some strikes, and footage recorded by militants and activists on the ground appeared to show the impact of the bombing.

title: How to Wear Burgundy, the Hot Color for Fall
description: The color is everywhere and can be worn with much more than you think.

title: How to Wear Burgundy, the Hot Color for Fall
description: If the front row at fashion week and the fall goods now arriving in stores are any indication, burgundy is officially the new navy. The shade, called oxblood in fall 2012 when it broke out as that seasons signature color, is everywhere, a moody tone signifying that summer has come to an end (although its showing on spring 2016 runways, too). The appeal is much like navy: It can be worn with much more than you would think. Heres how.

title: Rick Owens and the Leather Jacket That Changed His Career
description: Years ago, watching Rick Owens and his wife, Michele Lamy, beavering away in Los Angeles in a garret-like space at the Chateau Marmont, which was then crumbling, few fashion insiders would have bet on Mr. Owenss staying power.

title: Pioneering Female Photographers in Mexico
description: A new show in New York offers a 90-year survey of women who helped shape the visual narrative of Mexico starting in the decades after its revolution.

title: Mets Must Deal With Injuries to Yoenis Cespedes, Steven Matz and Wilmer Flores
description: PHILADELPHIA  During the third inning of a lazy game Wednesday, an 89-mile-per-hour fastball drifted high and tight toward Yoenis Cespedes and struck him on his left hand, pinching his middle finger between the ball and the bat.

title: The SoHo Block Party and More Shopping Events and Sales Happening in New York
description: On Saturday, the Canadian label Mackage is opening a pop-up shop where youll find cozy outerwear for the cooler months, like a pebble leather moto jacket ($1,050) and a wool coat with fur collar ($790). At 1122 Madison Avenue.

title: Bernie Sanders Raises $26 Million, Powered by Online Donations Exceeding Obamas 2008 Pace
description: Update: The campaign of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont has since revised their numbers: It had raised about $26 million since July and has more than $26 million in cash on hand.

title: Border Havoc as Nepalis Accuse India of Payback
description: NEW DELHI  Days after Nepal adopted a constitution in a way that appeared to infuriate India, Kuldiep Singh, an official with Indias border security force, received his orders: Thoroughly search every single truck trying to cross into Nepal.
